1.
lineæ AD & AI, item anguli EAD & EAI &longs;unt æquales.

Præterea in triangulis CHA, CLA rectangulis ad H & L,
latus CA e&longs;t commune, & anguli ad A &longs;unt æquales; igitur,
per 26. lib.
1. lineæ AL & AH &longs;unt æquales, igitur & re&longs;i­
duæ LD & HI &longs;unt æquales.

Quapropter ut AH ad HI, ita
AL ad LD: quia igitur Ratio AH ad HI o&longs;ten&longs;a e&longs;t &longs;uperiùs
minor Ratione AC ad CE, etiam minor e&longs;t Ratio AL ad LD,
quàm AC ad CE.

Sed ut AC ad CE, ita AO ad OD, per
2. lib.
6. propter paralleli&longs;mum linearum CO & ED; ergo mi­
nor e&longs;t Ratio AL ad LD, quàm AO ad OD.

Atqui cùm AD
parallela e&longs;t horizonti, pondus D impo&longs;itum vecti ad poten­
tiam A &longs;u&longs;tinentem e&longs;t ut AL ad LD, in po&longs;itione verò obli­
quâ AD e&longs;t idem pondus ad potentiam &longs;u&longs;tinentem ut AO
ad OD; ergo in priori po&longs;itione horizontali pondus ad poten­
tiam habet minorem Rationem, quàm in po&longs;teriori po&longs;itione
obliqua: ergo per 8. lib.
5. in priori e&longs;t major potentia, quàm
in po&longs;teriori.

Quamvis autem, cùm vectis e&longs;t horizonti parallelus, pon­
dus &longs;ive illi impo&longs;itum, &longs;ive &longs;uppo&longs;itum fuerit, ii&longs;dem momen­
tis reluctetur potentiæ &longs;u&longs;tinenti, non ita tamen &longs;e res habet,
&longs;i idem vectis
AB, fulcrum
habens in C,
elevetur &longs;upra
lineam hori­
zontalem RT:
plurimum enim
intere&longs;t, utrum
ponderi &longs;ub­
jectus &longs;it ve­
ctis, an vecti pondus.

Sint, ut prius, gravitatis ponderis cen­
tra D &longs;uperius, & I inferius, ex quibus in vectem perpendi­
culares cadunt DE & IE, quæ, ex 14. lib.
1. &longs;unt una recta li­
nea DI.

Jungantur centra potentiæ & ponderis rectâ AD,
quæ &longs;ecat rectam tran&longs;euntem per fulcrum C & terræ centrum
in puncto M.

Quare ex dictis de librâ curva, &longs;i &longs;int æqualia
momenta ponderis atque potentiæ, erit ut AM ad MD, ita
pondus D ad potentiam A.

Ducatur ex D linea directionis
DN parallela perpendiculari MC; & per 2. lib.
6; e&longs;t ut AM
ad MD, ita AC ad CN: e&longs;t autem CN minor quàm CE,
ergo, ex 8. lib.
5. major e&longs;t Ratio AC ad CN, quàm AC ad
CE.

Atqui in vecte horizontali potentia ad pondus e&longs;t ut EC
ad CA; hic autem ut NC ad CA; igitur minor e&longs;t potentia
&longs;u&longs;tinens pondus impo&longs;itum vecti obliquo &longs;upra horizontem,
quàm potentia &longs;u&longs;tinens pondus idem vecte parallelo hori­
zonti.

At &longs;i pondus vecti &longs;ubjiciatur, & &longs;it ejus gravitatis centrum
I, ducatur recta AI &longs;ecans perpendiculum ex C ductum ad
centrum terræ in V.

Igitur &longs;i æqualia &longs;unt momenta ponde­
ris I & potentiæ A, e&longs;t pondus ad potentiam ut AV ad VI.

Ex I centro gravitatis linea directionis IB parallela lineæ CV
occurrat vecti in B; igitur, ex 2. lib.6. ut AV ad VI, ita AC
ad CB: e&longs;t autem CB major quàm CE; ergo AC ad CB ha­
bet, ex 8. lib.
5. minorem Rationem, quàm AC ad CE.

Cum
itaque in vecte horizontali potentia ad pondus e&longs;&longs;et ut EC ad
CA, hic autem in vecte obliquo &longs;it ut BC ad eandem CA,
major potentia &longs;u&longs;tinens hîc requiritur.

Quare tantumdem
cre&longs;cit &longs;u&longs;tinendi difficultas in pondere infra vectem adjuncto,
quantum decre&longs;cit in &longs;u&longs;tinendo pondere &longs;upra vectem po&longs;ito.

Cum enim triangula BEI, DEN &longs;int æquiangula (quia BI
& DN, per 30. lib.
1. &longs;unt parallelæ, adeóque per 29. lib.
1.
alterni anguli ad B & N, & alterni ad I & D &longs;unt æquales, &
reliquus reliquo, per 32. lib.1.) e&longs;t, per 4. lib.
6. ut IE ad ED,
ita BE ad EN: &longs;unt autem ex hypothe&longs;i DE & IE æquales,
igitur & BE æqualis e&longs;t ip&longs;i EN, illa refert incrementum po­
tentiæ, hæc decrementum; ergo æqualiter ibi cre&longs;cit, hic de­
cre&longs;cit difficultas &longs;u&longs;tinendi pondus.

Contraria &longs;unt momenta, quæ ponderibus accidunt, vecte
cum pondere infra horizontalem lineam inclinato: concipe
enim hoc idem &longs;chema ita conver&longs;um, ut potentia A &longs;it in &longs;u­
periore loco, pondera autem I & D &longs;int infra horizontalem
RT.

Jam pondus I incumbit vecti, pondus verò D illi &longs;ub­
jectum adnectitur.

Igitur pondus I vecti impo&longs;itum majora mo­
menta habet vecte cum pondere infra horizontem inclinato,
quàm vecte horizonti parallelo: in hoc autem eodem &longs;itu in­
clinato pondus &longs;ubjectum D minora habet momenta, nam pon­
dus I ad potentiam A &longs;u&longs;tinentem e&longs;t ut AC ad CB majorem,
quæ e&longs;t minor Ratio quàm AC ad CE minorem, ex 8. lib.
5:
è contrario D pondus ad potentiam A &longs;u&longs;tinentem e&longs;t ut AC
ad CN minorem, quæ e&longs;t major Ratio, quàm AC ad CE ma­
jorem.

Hinc e&longs;t momenta ponderis vecti ex primo genere im­
po&longs;iti infra horizontem majora e&longs;&longs;e, &longs;upra horizontem minora;
contrà autem ponderis vecti &longs;ubjecti infra horizontem minora
e&longs;&longs;e, &longs;upra horizontem majora.

Et hæc quidem eatenus dicta intelligantur, quatenus concipitur
Potentia vi &longs;uæ gravitatis rectâ deor&longs;um connitens, adeò ut Di-
rectione, Potentiæ atque Ponderis &longs;int parallelæ, propterea enim
con&longs;iderata e&longs;t linea per centrum motûs, hoc e&longs;t punctum fulcri,
ducta ad centrum terræ utrique Directioni parallela.

At &longs;i linea Di­
rectionis Potentiæ non e&longs;&longs;et parallela Directioni gravitatis Pon­
deris &longs;i res &longs;crupulo&longs;ius agatur, paulo aliter con&longs;ideranda vide­
tur linea per punctum fulcri tran&longs;iens, quæ determinet partes li­
neæ jungentis Potentiam & Centrum gravitatis ponderis, linea
videlicet per fulcrum ducta ex puncto, in quo concurrunt di­
rectiones Potentiæ atque
Ponderis.

Sit Vectis AB
in&longs;i&longs;tens fulcro C depre&longs;­
&longs;us in A infra horizontem,
ut &longs;u&longs;tineat pondus D in­
cumbens vecti, à quo di&longs;tat
per lineam DE.

Directio
gravitatis ponderis e&longs;t per­
pendicularis DR, at di­
rectio Potentiæ non &longs;it per­
pendicularis AT, verùm
obliqua AR faciens cum
vecte angulum BAR.

Concurrunt itaque di­
rectiones Ponderis, & Potentiæ in R.

Quare &longs;icuti quando
&longs;unt directiones DR & AT parallelæ, premunt fulcrum C
juxta perpendicularem CV, quæ rectam AD &longs;ecat in M, ita
directiones DR & AR videntur premere fulcrum C juxta
rectam CR, quæ producta &longs;ecat rectam AD in S: ac propterea
Ratio Potentiæ &longs;u&longs;tinentis ad Pondus non e&longs;t ut DM ad MA,
&longs;ed ut DS ad SA.

Hinc e&longs;t lineam directionis Potentiæ, quò majorem angu­
lum con&longs;tituit cum vecte in A, eò minorem angulum efficere
cum perpendiculari lineâ directionis ponderis DR productâ,
atque proinde cum illa concurrere multo remotiùs quàm in R,
& lineam ex puncto concursûs directionum ductam ad C, &
ulterius productam &longs;ecare lineam AD inter M & S, adeò ut
aliquando facilè citra notabilem errorem a&longs;&longs;umi po&longs;&longs;it punctum
M: Cum enim DR & MV &longs;int parallelæ, angulus DRC in­
ternus æqualis e&longs;t externo MCS, ex 29. lib.
1. idémque di-
cendum de quolibet angulo con&longs;tituto cum perpendiculari
DR à lineâ ex puncto concur&longs;us directionum ducta per C
punctum fulcri: ideò quo minor fit angulus ad B, minor quo­
que e&longs;t ad C, & punctum in lineâ AD notatum magis acce­
dit ad M.

Hinc pro determinanda Ratione momentorum potentiæ ad
momenta ponderis pro diversâ vectis inclinatione duplici me­
thodo uti poteris.

Prima e&longs;t, fi ex centro gravitatis ponderis
lineam directionis ducas, punctum enim, in quo hæc occurrit
vecti, illud e&longs;t, quod definit locum ponderis, in quo &longs;ua exer­
cet momenta.

Secunda e&longs;t, &longs;i tam ex Potentiæ quàm ex Pon­
deris centro gravitatis lineam ducas ad perpendiculum in li­
neam horizontalem, quæ tran&longs;it per C punctum fulcri; nam
partes hujus lineæ horizontalis interceptæ inter puncta, in quæ
cadunt perpendiculares, & punctum C, illæ &longs;unt, quæ reci­
procè &longs;umptæ o&longs;tendunt Rationem ponderis ad potentiam.

In
&longs;itu namque horizontali vectis punctum E congruit puncto S,
& potentia A congruit puncto X: e&longs;t igitur ut AC ad CE ita
XC ad CS: in po&longs;itione autem obliquá ex A in horizontalem
perpendicularis cadit in Z, ex D cadit in K, ex I verò in O.

Quia igitur triangula AZC & NKC &longs;unt æquiangula, vide­
licet rectangula ad Z & K, angulos ad verticem C, ex 15.lib.1;
æquales habent, &, ex 32 lib.
1. reliquum reliquo, e&longs;t per 4.
lib.
6. ut AC ad CN ita ZC ad CK.

Similiter triangula
BOC & AZC rectangula ad O & Z angulos ad verticem C
æquales habent, & reliquum reliquo, adeóque &longs;unt &longs;imilia, &
ut AC ad CB, ita ZC ad CO, Quare in hac obliquâ vectis
po&longs;itione momentum ponderis D ad momentum potentiæ &longs;u&longs;ti­
nentis e&longs;t ut ZC ad CK, & momentum ponderis I ad momen­
tum potentiæ &longs;u&longs;tinentis e&longs;t ut ZC ad CO.

Ex his, quæ de potentia &longs;u&longs;tentante dicta &longs;unt, &longs;atis apparet
potentiam paulo validiorem &longs;atis e&longs;&longs;e ad pondus movendum.

Verùm licèt in vecte primi generis ad pondus &longs;u&longs;tentandum
opportunè animum adverterimus ad libram curvam, hæc ta­
men in vecte &longs;ecundi generis locum habere non po&longs;&longs;unt;
propterea ad aliam explicandi rationem confugiendum e&longs;t,
quæ utrique generi communis &longs;it; nec difficile erit ea, quæ &longs;ta­
tim capite &longs;equenti &longs;ubjiciam pro &longs;ecundo vectis genere ad pri-
mum traducere.

Con&longs;ideratur nimirum motus ponderis com­
paratus cum eodem motu potentiæ: &longs;i enim potentia &longs;it &longs;uâ
gravitate de&longs;cendens, ejus de&longs;cen&longs;um metitur ZA: pondus
vecti impo&longs;itum a&longs;cendit, ut &longs;it &longs;upra horizontalem altitudine
KD; &longs;ed ex hac demenda e&longs;t centri gravitatis di&longs;tantia DE,
qua eminebat &longs;upra horizontalem, ut habeatur ejus motus
DK minùs DE, hoc e&longs;t GK.

Contra verò pondus vecti &longs;ub­
jectum erat infra horizontalem di&longs;tantiâ IE, quæ &longs;i addatur al­
titudini OI, dabit OH motum ip&longs;ius ponderis.

Major e&longs;t au­
tem motus OI plus IE, hoc e&longs;t plus DE, quàm &longs;it motus KD
minùs DE; nam po&longs;ita obliquitate lineæ DI, facto centro D,
intervallo DE circulus de&longs;criptus tran&longs;it per G punctum de­
pre&longs;&longs;ius quàm E, & ex I intervallo IE de&longs;criptus tran&longs;it per H
punctum altius quàm E: ergo motus ZA ad minorem motum
habet majorem Rationem, quàm ad majorem motum, atque
adeò major e&longs;t movendi facilitas.
CAPUT IV.

Momenta ponderis in Vecte &longs;ecundi generis
con&longs;iderantur.

IN Vecte &longs;ecundi generis circa extremitatem, ubi e&longs;t ful­
crum, de&longs;cribuntur à pondere proximo & à potentiâ remotâ
duo circulorum arcus tanquam circa commune centrum.

Et
quidem &longs;i in eadem rectâ lineâ &longs;int punctum fulcri, centrum
gravitatis ponderis, & ip&longs;a virtus potentiæ &longs;ur&longs;um a&longs;cendentis,
motus potentiæ & ponderis &longs;unt in eadem Ratione, in qua &longs;unt
di&longs;tantiæ ab hypomochlio, &longs;ive pondus &longs;upra horizontalem
tran&longs;euntem per fulcrum, &longs;ive à loco inferiore ad horizontalem
elevetur; quia videlicet tam pondus quàm potentia per &longs;imi­
les arcus ab horizontali æqualiter remotos moventur; ac pro­
inde eorum arcuum Sinus, qui metiuntur elevationem, ha­
bent inter &longs;e Rationem eandem, quæ e&longs;t radiorum, &longs;ive di­
&longs;tantiarum.

At verò &longs;i centrum gravitatis ponderis &longs;it extra lineam
rectam jungentem punctum fulcri cum puncto virtutis poten­
tiæ exi&longs;tentis in alterâ vectis extremitate, &longs;ive &longs;upra vectem,
&longs;ive infra illum &longs;it, non manet eadem Ratio motuum, quæ e&longs;t
di&longs;tantiarum potentiæ & ponderis (quatenus ponderis di&longs;tan­
tia &longs;umitur à puncto, in quod à centro gravitatis cadit in
vectem perpendicularis) quia a&longs;cen&longs;us & elevationes non &longs;er­
vant eandem Rationem; ex eo quod, licèt in vectis conver&longs;io­
ne tam centrum gravitatis ponderis quàm centrum potentiæ
de&longs;cribant in motu arcus &longs;imiles, hi tamen arcus non &longs;unt &longs;i­
militer po&longs;iti, hoc e&longs;t &longs;imili modo ab horizontali di&longs;tantes: ac
propterea (ut patet ex doctrina Sinuum) differentiæ Sinuum,
qui conveniunt arcubus &longs;upra vel infra horizontem, ubi incipit
quadrans circuli, æqualiter cre&longs;centibus, non &longs;unt æquales: hæ
autem differentiæ metiuntur motum elevationis, qui maximè
attenditur, quatenus opponitur innatæ propen&longs;ioni gravitatis.
Sit in C fulcrum vectis CA, & in A &longs;it potentia movens.

Si centrum gravitatis ponderis &longs;it in eadem rectâ CBA, &longs;em­
per motus ponderis &
potentiæ &longs;unt omnino
&longs;imiles, & ut CB ad
ad CA; illud enim de&longs;­
cribit arcum BG, hæc
verò arcum AS, & ele­
vatio ponderis ex B in
G e&longs;t BR, a&longs;cen&longs;us po­
tentiæ e&longs;t AP; & prop­
ter triangulorum rectan­
gulorum CRB & CPA &longs;imilitudinem e&longs;t ut CB ad CA,
ita BR ad AP.

Et quamvis, divi&longs;o arcu BG in partes ali­
quot æquales, & in totidem æquales partes divi&longs;o arcu
&longs;imili AS, non &longs;int in &longs;ingulis eju&longs;dem arcûs partibus æquales
a&longs;cen&longs;us) nam BH minor e&longs;t quàm HI, hic minor quàm IK,
& hic minor quàm KR, &longs;imiliterque AL minor quàm LM,
hic minor quàm MN, & hic minor quàm NP) comparatis ta­
men &longs;ingulis a&longs;cen&longs;ibus in minore arcu BG, cum &longs;ingulis
a&longs;cen&longs;ibus in arcu majore AS &longs;ibi invicem re&longs;pondentibus, ma­
net eadem Ratio, & ut BH ad AL, ita HI ad LM, & &longs;ic de
reliquis (ut ex Sinuum doctrinâ manife&longs;tum e&longs;t, nec opus e&longs;t
hic o&longs;tendere) &longs;unt enim omnes in Ratione Radij CB ad Ra­
dium CA.

Longè aliter &longs;e res habet, quando extra rectam lineam jun­
gentem punctum fulcri cum potentiâ e&longs;t centrum gravitatis
ponderis.

Nam &longs;i Vecti CBA impo&longs;itum &longs;it pondus, cujus
centrum gravitatis &longs;it D, potentiâ A de&longs;cribente arcum AQ
centrum gravitatis ponderis de&longs;cribit arcum DE, qui licèt
æqualis &longs;it arcui BD; habet tamen a&longs;cen&longs;um HI majorem
quàm BH: igitur a&longs;cen&longs;us AL ad HI majorem, habet mino­
rem Rationem quàm ad BH minorem, ex 8.lib.5. igitur in hoc
motu Potentia ad Ponderis motum habet minorem Rationem,
quàm &longs;i centrum gravitatis ponderis e&longs;&longs;et in B; ergo majorem
experitur in movendo difficultatem.

Contrà verò &longs;i pondus &longs;it vecti CBA &longs;ubjectum, ejú&longs;que
centrum gravitatis &longs;it O; dum potentia A de&longs;cribit arcum AQ,
centrum gravitatis O de&longs;cribit arcum OB, eju&longs;que a&longs;cen&longs;us
e&longs;t OV; atqui OV minor e&longs;t quàm BH; ergo AL a&longs;cen&longs;us
potentiæ ad OV minorem e&longs;t in majori Ratione quàm ad BH
majorem; e&longs;t autem HI major quàm BH; ergo AL ad OV
multo majorem Rationem habet quàm ad HI.

Ergo datâ eâ­
dem vectis po&longs;itione, eodemque motu, major facilitas erit in
elevando pondere habente centrum gravitatis infra vectem in
O, quàm &longs;i illud habeat &longs;upra vectem in D.

Eadem erit demon&longs;trandi methodus in cæteris a&longs;cen&longs;ibus:
nam potentia percurrens arcum AT habet a&longs;cen&longs;um AM,
centrum D percurrit arcum DF, cujus a&longs;censûs men&longs;ura e&longs;t
HK; centrum autem O percurrens arcum OD habet a&longs;cen­
&longs;um OX: cùm igitur OX minor &longs;it quàm BI, & hic minor
quàm HK, etiam AM ad OX minorem e&longs;t in majore Ratione
quàm ad HK majorem.

Et hæc quidem hactenus dicta intelliguntur de vecte infra
lineam horizonti parallelam depre&longs;&longs;o; nam vecte &longs;upra hori­
zontalem lineam elevato, contraria pror&longs;us accidere ex dictis
demon&longs;tratur.

Concipe vectem AC elevatum &longs;upra horizon­
tem, pondus OB e&longs;t illi impo&longs;itum, pondus DB e&longs;t &longs;ubjectum:
quando potentia a&longs;cendens per arcum QA habet a&longs;cen&longs;um
LA, centrum gravitatis O de&longs;cribit arcum BO, & a&longs;censûs
men&longs;ura e&longs;t VO; at centrum gravitatis D de&longs;cribens arcum
ED habet a&longs;cen&longs;um IH.

Cum igitur o&longs;ten&longs;um &longs;it majorem
Rationem e&longs;&longs;e LA ad VO, quàm ad IH, ctiam &longs;upra horizon­
tem elevato vecte major erit facilitas in movendo pondere vecti
impo&longs;ito, quàm in elevando pondus habens centrum gravita­
tis infra vectem.

Ut autem innote&longs;cat, qua Ratione in progre&longs;&longs;u motûs cre&longs;­
cat difficultas, aut minuatur, ob&longs;erva ex Canone in arcubus
æqualiter cre&longs;centibus Sinuum differentias ab initio quadran­
tis progrediendo u&longs;que ad finem Quadrantis &longs;emper decre&longs;ce­
re, harum verò differentiarum differentias, hoc e&longs;t differen­
tias &longs;ecundas, &longs;emper augeri.

Hinc e&longs;t ita RK Sinum arcûs
GF majorem e&longs;&longs;e quàm differentiam KI, & KI majorem quàm
IH, & IH majorem quàm HB, ut differentia inter Sinum
RK & differentiam KI minor &longs;it quàm differentia inter KI
& IH, hæc verò differentia minor &longs;it quàm differentia inter
IH & HB.

Idem dicendum de &longs;imilibus differentiis inter Si­
num PN, & differentias NM, & ML, & LA.

In ii&longs;dem li­
neis PA & RB particulas a&longs;&longs;umptas donavi vocabulo Sinuum
aut differentiarum, non qua&longs;i ignorans illas particulas non e&longs;&longs;e
Sinus aut differentias Sinuum arcubus æqualiter cre&longs;centibus
re&longs;pondentium, &longs;ed claritatis gratia abutens vocabulo; quan­
doquidem illis æquales &longs;unt, cum a&longs;&longs;umantur per lineas Radio
CS parallelas.

His po&longs;itis intelligatur vectis totus CA cum pondere B intrà
aquam, potentia verò &longs;it cortex &longs;uberis, aut uter inflatus, &longs;eu
ve&longs;ica, aut quid huju&longs;modi levitans.

Potentiæ motum metiri
oportet ex naturalibus a&longs;cen&longs;ibus AL, LM, & reliquis.

Quia
autem e&longs;t ut AL ad LM, ita BH ad HI; etiam vici&longs;&longs;im, per
16. lib.
5. ut AL ad BH, ita LM ad HI, & &longs;ic de cæteris, &longs;ive
infra, &longs;ive &longs;upra horizontalem: propterea eadem &longs;emper manet
facilitas aut difficultas elevandi pondus in aquâ gravitans, cu­
jus gravitatis centrum congruat vecti CA.

Idem dic &longs;i Poten­
tia S in aqua gravitans deprimeret per vim pondus G, quod in
aquâ levitaret: nam PN de&longs;cen&longs;us naturalis potentiæ ad RK
depre&longs;&longs;ionem ponderis, eandem Rationem haberet, quam
de&longs;cen&longs;us NM ad depre&longs;&longs;ionem KI.

Si vectis &longs;it CA, cui pondus incumbat habens centrum gra-
vitatis D, atque tam pondus quàm potentia &longs;int in medio, in
quo alterum levitet, alterum gravitet, utriu&longs;que motum qua­
tenus naturalis e&longs;t auz violentus, metitur linea perpendicularis
in horizontalem cadens: & ut particulæ ip&longs;æ invicem compa­
rentur, Sinuum differentiæ AL, LM &c.
BH, HI &c.

con­
&longs;iderandæ &longs;unt.

Cum itaque differentia inter BH, & HI ma­
jor &longs;it quàm differentia inter HI, & IK, utique BH magis de­
ficit ab æqualitate cum HI, quàm HI cum IK; ideóque mi­
nor e&longs;t Ratio BH ad HI, quàm HI ad IK: Atqui eadem e&longs;t
Ratio BH ad HI, quæ e&longs;t AL ad LM; igitur minor e&longs;t etiam
Ratio AL ad LM, quàm HI ad IK, & vici&longs;&longs;im, per 27. lib.
5.
minor e&longs;t Ratio AL ad HI, quàm &longs;it LM ad IK.

Igitur &longs;i po­
tentia A levitet, & pondus, cujus centrum gravitatis D, gravi­
tet, a&longs;cendendo ad horizontalem, quæ per fulcrum C tran&longs;it,
acquirit movendi facilitatem.

Jam figuram inverte, ut vectis moveatur &longs;upra horizontalem:
vecte congruente lineæ horizontali CS, ponderis impo&longs;iti cen­
trum gravitatis erit in F, & a&longs;cendet juxta men&longs;uram KI & IH,
cum potentiæ a&longs;cen&longs;us erit PN & NM.

Quia igitur differentia
inter Sinum RK & differentiam KI minor e&longs;t, quàm differentia
inter KI & IH, utique RK minùs excedit æqualitatem cum
KI, quàm KI cum IH: ideóque minor e&longs;t Ratio RK ad KI,
quàm KI ad IH.

E&longs;t autem eadem Ratio RK ad KI, quæ e&longs;t
PN ad NM; igitur minor e&longs;t Ratio PN ad NM, quàm KI
ad IH, & vici&longs;&longs;im minor e&longs;t Ratio PN ad KI, quàm NM ad
IH: Igitur a&longs;cendendo magis & recedendo ab horizontali
cre&longs;cit movendi facilitas.

Demum &longs;i vecti CA &longs;ubjectum &longs;it pondus, cujus centrum
gravitatis O, & potentiæ motum metiatur perpendicularis AP
a&longs;cendendo versùs horizontalem; quia differentia inter OV, &
VX major e&longs;t quàm differentia inter VX & HI, adeóque OV
magis deficit ab æqualitate cum VX, quàm VX cum HI, prop­
terea OV ad VX habet minorem Rationem quàm VX ad HI:
&longs;ed ut VX, hoc e&longs;t BH, ad HI, ita AL ad LM; ergo minor e&longs;t
Ratio OV ad VX quàm AL ad LM; & vici&longs;&longs;im minor e&longs;t Ra­
tio OV ad AL quàm VX ad LM; ideóque faciliùs elevatur ex
O in B, quàm ex B in D.

Factâ autem figuræ conver&longs;ione, ut
a&longs;cen&longs;us Potentiæ &longs;it PA, & a&longs;cen&longs;us Ponderis &longs;it RB, &longs;i poten-
tia &longs;it in Z, centrum gravitatis ponderis &longs;ubjecti e&longs;t in G, &
dum potentia a&longs;cendit per NM & ML de&longs;cribens arcum ZQ,
pondus a&longs;cendit per RK & KI.

Atqui RK ad KI habet mi­
norem Rationem quàm KI ad IH, ut &longs;uperiùs o&longs;ten&longs;um e&longs;t, &
ut KI ad IH, ita NM ad ML; ergo minor e&longs;t Ratio RK ad
KI, quàm NM ad ML, & vici&longs;&longs;im minor e&longs;t Ratio RK ad
NM quàm KI ad ML; ergo faciliùs movetur per RK a&longs;cen­
dendo, quàm per KI, adeóque cre&longs;cit difficultas elevandi
pondus &longs;ubjectum vecti &longs;uprà horizontalem, &longs;i comparentur
inter &longs;e partes elevationis.

Quare, ut in &longs;ummam ea, quæ dicta &longs;unt, referantur, &longs;i pon­
dus &longs;it infra vectem &longs;ecundi generis, faciliùs elevatur eodem
vectis motu versùs horizontalem, quàm &longs;i fuerit &longs;upra vectem:
Contrà verò &longs;upra horizontalem faciliùs eodem vectis motu
elevatur pondus vecti impo&longs;itum, quàm vecti &longs;ubjectum.

Con­
&longs;ideratis autem particulatim &longs;ingulis elevationibus, divi&longs;o &longs;cili­
cet in æquales particulas univer&longs;o motu eju&longs;dem ponderis, &longs;i
pondus &longs;it in eâdem rectâ lineâ cum fulcro & potentia, eadem
&longs;emper e&longs;t movendi facilitas aut difficultas: Si pondus &longs;it &longs;upra
vectem, & motus infra horizontalem incipiat, &longs;emper cre&longs;cit
movendi facilitas non &longs;olùm u&longs;que ad horizontalem, verùm
etiam &longs;upra illam: At &longs;i pondus &longs;it infra vectem, motú&longs;que in­
fra horizontalem incipiat, augetur &longs;emper difficultas movendi
tùm u&longs;que ad horizontalem, tùm &longs;upra illam.

Hæc omnia confirmari po&longs;&longs;unt, &longs;i lineam directionis per cen­
trum gravitatis ponderis ductam produci intelligamus u&longs;que ad
horizontalem lineam, quæ per fulcrum tran&longs;it; Secabit enim
vectem, & in &longs;ectionis puncto quodammodo con&longs;titutum pon­
dus concipere po&longs;&longs;umus.

Sit enim
infra horizontalem CR, vectis
CA, & ad punctum B illi in&longs;i&longs;tat
perpendiculariter linea à centro
gravitatis ducta, &longs;cilicet DB &longs;u­
pra, & OB infra.

Quando vectis
CA congruet lineæ CR, & erit
horizonti parallelus, pondus con­
cipietur niti in B contra vectem:
at infra horizontalem centrum D nititur in S, & centrum O
in T, juxta lineas directionis DS & OT.

Quia igitur punctum
S magis di&longs;tat à fulcro C quàm punctum T, pondus infra
vectem faciliùs &longs;u&longs;tinetur &longs;ub horizontali, quàm pondus &longs;upra
vectem.

Contra autem &longs;upra horizontalem centrum O nititur
in I remotiùs à fulcro C, & centrum D in H propiùs; ergo
&longs;upra horizontalem faciliùs &longs;u&longs;tinetur pondus vecti impo&longs;itum,
quàm illi &longs;ubjectum.

Quoniam verò triangula rectangula CNT, & OBT, an­
gulos ad verticem T æquales habent, & reliquum reliquo
æqualem, erit, ex 4. lib.
6. ut CT ad TN, ita OT ad TB.

Igitur prout ex elevatione vectis minuitur angulus ACN,
etiam minuitur angulus TOB, ac propterea T recedit à ful­
cro C ver&longs;us B, & augetur &longs;u&longs;tinendi atque movendi difficul­
tas.

I&longs;ti autem acce&longs;&longs;us versùs B &longs;unt inæquales, etiam &longs;i æqua­
lia &longs;int anguli TOB decrementa, prout decre&longs;cunt angulo­
rum ad O factorum Tangentes, po&longs;ito Radio OB.

Porrò ex
Canone Tangentium con&longs;tat illarum differentias &longs;emper ma­
jores fieri, &longs;i augeatur angulus, minores fieri, &longs;i minuatur an­
gulus.

Igitur recedente lineâ directionis Centri gravitatis O à
fulcro C, augetur difficultas &longs;u&longs;tinendi & elevandi pondus
vecti &longs;ubjectum: & quia &longs;upra horizontalem &longs;emper magis re­
cedit ab eodem fulcro C ultrà punctum B versùs A potentiam,
puta, ut &longs;it OI, multo adhuc major e&longs;t &longs;u&longs;tinendi atque mo­
vendi difficultas.

Con&longs;ideratis autem particulatim motibus,
quia infra horizontalem differentiæ rece&longs;&longs;uum à puncto C fiunt
&longs;emper minores; propterea cre&longs;cit quidem difficultas, &longs;ed inæ­
qualibus & minoribus incrementis; quia verò &longs;upra horizon­
talem differentiæ rece&longs;&longs;uum à fulcro C fiunt &longs;emper majores,
cre&longs;cit adhuc difficultas, & quidem &longs;emper majoribus incre­
mentis.

At &longs;i pondus &longs;it D vecti impo&longs;itum, linea directionis
DS accedit versùs B u&longs;que ad horizontalem, &longs;upra quam re­
cedit à B versùs C, ut &longs;it ex.

gr. DH: &longs;emper igitur faciliùs
movetur, quamquam non æqualibus facilitatis incrementis;
fiunt enim incrementa infra horizontalem &longs;en&longs;im minora, &longs;u­
pra autem fiunt &longs;emper majora.

Sed hic unum explicandum
e&longs;t, quod forta&longs;&longs;e alicui animum minùs attentè advertenti dif­
ficultatem pariat adversùs ea, quæ &longs;uperiùs dicta &longs;unt: videlicet
o&longs;ten&longs;um e&longs;t pondus vecti impo&longs;itum, &longs;i motus incipiat infra
horizontalem, majori difficultate moveri, quàm pondus vecti
&longs;ubjectum.

Si enim, inquis, linea Directionis DS magis ac
magis accedit ad B, utique cre&longs;cit movendi facilitas; contra
verò lineâ directionis OT accedente ad B cre&longs;cit movendi
difficultas.

Ut nodum hunc &longs;olvas, ob&longs;erva triangula SBD, & TBO
rectangula ad B, quia DS & TO &longs;unt parallelæ, e&longs;&longs;e æquian­
gula & &longs;imilia, immò æqualia, quia ut DB ad OB &longs;ibi ex hy­
pothe&longs;i æqualem, ita SB ad TB.

Igitur qua Ratione minuitur
angulus ACR, etiam minuitur anguius SDB, & angulus
TOB: igitur Tangentium differentiæ fiunt &longs;emper minores.

Quare in primo motu tam linea directionis DS, quàm linea
directionis OT, magis accedit ad B quàm in &longs;ecundo motu,
& magis in &longs;ecundo, quàm in tertio; acce&longs;&longs;us tamen utriu&longs;­
que lineæ directionis ex eodem vectis motu &longs;unt æquales; &
qua men&longs;urâ augetur rece&longs;&longs;us ponderis D vecti impo&longs;iti, à Po­
tentia A, eâdem pariter men&longs;ura augetur rece&longs;&longs;us ponderis O
vecti &longs;ubjecti, à fulcro C.

Itaque cre&longs;cit quidem illius facili­
tas, hujus difficultas, &longs;i ponderum &longs;ingulorum motus particu­
latim accipiantur, eju&longs;démque ponderi, motûs pars cum par­
te conferatur: at verò &longs;i utriu&longs;que ponderis motus invicem
comparentur, utique pondus D difficiliùs movetur, cùm ejus
linea directionis e&longs;t citra punctum B versùs potentiam, quàm
moveatur pondus O, quamdiu ejus linea directionis e&longs;t ultra
idem punctum B.

Ex his, quæ de vecte &longs;ecundi generis dicta &longs;unt, quid de
vecte tertij generis dicendum &longs;it, faciliùs innote&longs;cit, quàm ut
illud pluribus explicari oporteat; potentia &longs;i quidem & pondus
invicem loca commutant, &longs;ed motuum Ratio eadem e&longs;t, & quæ
in vecte &longs;ecundi generis e&longs;t Ratio motûs Potentiæ ad motum
Ponderis, vice versâ in vecte tertij generis e&longs;t Ratio motûs
Ponderis ad motum Potentiæ.

Hoc te monitum velim, Amice Lector, con&longs;ideratum hacte­
nus vectem ad movenda &longs;ur&longs;um pondera gravia, aut deprimen­
da deor&longs;um levia, & quidem à Potentia, quæ vi &longs;uæ gravitatis
aut levitatis moveatur, cujus propterea a&longs;cen&longs;um aut de&longs;cen­
&longs;um con&longs;ideravimus.

Nam &longs;i in plano horizontali à Potentia
vivente movendum &longs;it pondus, utique Potentiæ motus circu-
laris ob&longs;ervatur, & attendendum e&longs;t vectis punctum, in quod
cadit linea, quæ à centro gravitatis ponderis in vectem per­
pendicularis ducitur, ut ponderis locus &longs;tatuatur, & momen­
ta definiantur.

Naturâ quippe comparatum e&longs;t, ut &longs;i vectis non
occurrat huic perpendiculari, non moveatur totum pondus,
&longs;ed fiat ponderis conver&longs;io vel circa gravitatis centrum, vel
circa aliud punctum quod maneat immotum, aut &longs;altem mino­
re motu moveatur.
CAPUT V.

Quæ &longs;it Ratio Vectis Hypomochlium mobile
habentis.

NOn hîc hypomochlium mobile illud intelligo, quod &longs;imul
cum pondere à potentiâ &longs;u&longs;tentato ad ea&longs;dem partes pro­
movetur; cuju&longs;modi &longs;unt manualia bajulorum vehicula, quæ
unicâ rotâ in&longs;truuntur, & habentia rationem vectis &longs;ecundi ge­
neris; nam fulcrum habent in axe rotæ, & potentiam in extre­
mitate manubriorum, quibus illa &longs;u&longs;tinet pondus transferen­
dum: cui propterea addita e&longs;t rota illa ver&longs;atilis, ut etiam hy­
pomochlium citra difficultatem, quin atterat &longs;ubjectam plani­
tiem, &longs;imul cum pondere jam elevato, atque &longs;u&longs;tentato pro­
moveatur.

Huju&longs;modi pariter e&longs;t novitium vehiculi genus, cui Sellæ
Rotatæ nomen fecerunt, hoc uno à lecticâ viatoriâ di&longs;crepans,
quòd loco po&longs;terioris jumenti &longs;u&longs;tinentis additus e&longs;t axis dua­
bus rotis infixus, cui innituntur vectes ab anteriore equo
&longs;u&longs;tentanti unâ cum pondere intermedio.

Hic e&longs;t vectis &longs;ecun­
di generis, cujus hypomochlium &longs;equitur potentiam trahen­
tem pariter ac &longs;u&longs;tentantem impo&longs;itum pondus, non mutatâ
Ratione momenti potentiæ &longs;u&longs;tinentis, &longs;ive hypomochlium
moveatur, &longs;ive &longs;tabile &longs;it ac fixum.

Cæterùm quò pondus ma­
gis à rotis di&longs;tat, magis equum gravat, minùs autem &longs;ub&longs;ilit,
cùm rotæ in offendiculum incurrunt.

Nomine igitur hypomochlij mobilis illud intelligo, quod
movente potentiâ atque conante adversùs pondus, re&longs;i&longs;tit qui­
dem vecti, &longs;ed & &longs;imul loco cedit ita, ut pondus & hypomo­
chlium in oppo&longs;itas partes immi&longs;&longs;o inter illa vecte moveantur.

Sic contingere pote&longs;t fulcrum deprimi, dum pondus elevatur,
aut fulcrum elevari, dum pondus deprimitur, aut &longs;i utrumque
in plano horizontali moveatur, in oppo&longs;itas plagas recedere.

Loquor autem de vecte primi & &longs;ecundi generis, quibus com­
muniter utimur; nam in vecte tertij generis, &longs;i hypomochlium
cedat, movetur ad ea&longs;dem partes cum pondere & potentia, &longs;ed
tardiùs.

Hinc &longs;i vecte inter duo pondera non immodicè inæ­
qualia interjecto alterutrum movere coneris, reliquum etiam
movetur; ita tamen ut neutrum tantum motûs perficiat, quan­
tum haberent &longs;ingula, &longs;i &longs;olitariè moverentur, reliquo manen­
te immoto.

Sit vectis AB inter duos lapides C & D interjectus, qui la­
pidem C non dimovebit, ni&longs;i eum tangat in puncto cui occur­
rit linea ex C gravitatis centro
ducta (aut potiùs planum per
idem gravitatis centrum C
tran&longs;iens) ad perpendiculum
in vectem, & &longs;it linea CE; ni&longs;i
enim in E lapis à vecte tanga­
tur, movebitur quidem lapis circa centrum C, donec congruat
vecti, &longs;ed non propelletur totus lapis.

Idem dic de lapide D,
ni&longs;i tangatur in F occurrente lineæ perpendiculari DF.

Qua­
re pondera intelligantur in E & F: & quoniam F re&longs;i&longs;tit vecti,
ut E propellatur versùs C, & vici&longs;&longs;im E re&longs;i&longs;tit vecti, ut F
propellatur versùs D, propterea ad movendum pondus C,
vectis AE e&longs;t primi generis, & ad movendum pondus D,
vectis AE e&longs;t &longs;ecundi generis; atque pondera illa vici&longs;&longs;im ha­
bent rationem hypomochlij, quia vectis alteri innititur, ut al­
terum moveat.

Cæterùm &longs;ingulorum lapidum ab&longs;oluta & &longs;impliciter &longs;umpta
re&longs;i&longs;tentia tum ex eorum ingenitâ gravitate, tum ex &longs;uperfi­
cierum &longs;e tangentium a&longs;peritate atque conflictu definitur:
Comparatè verò ad vectem non &longs;ic accipienda e&longs;t &longs;ingulorum
re&longs;i&longs;tentia, qua&longs;i motûs centra e&longs;&longs;ent E aut F: experimento
enim manife&longs;to deprehenditur motum potentiæ A ad motum
ponderis C non e&longs;&longs;e ut AF ad FE, neque eju&longs;dem potentiæ A
æqualem motum e&longs;&longs;e ad motum ponderis D ut AE ad FE.

Nam &longs;i punctum E vectis fixum e&longs;&longs;et, & potentiæ motus e&longs;&longs;et
AL, motus ponderis F e&longs;&longs;et FH: Si verò punctum F mane
ret immotum, & potentiæ
motus e&longs;&longs;et AI æqualis ip&longs;i
AL, motus ponderis e&longs;&longs;et
EG.

Tunc autem motus AI
æqualis e&longs;t motui AL, quan­
do ut AF ad AE, ita vici&longs;&longs;im
angulus AEL ad angulum
AFI: æqualium &longs;i quidem
angulorum in circulis inæ­
qualibus arcus &longs;unt ut Radij;
ergo &longs;i fuerint anguli reciprocè ut Radij, &longs;cilicet minor in ma­
jore circulo, & major angulus in minore, erunt æquales arcus
illis oppo&longs;iti: Sic anguli AFR æqualis angulo AEL arcus AR
e&longs;t ad AL, ut Radius FA ad Radium EA; &longs;ed ut FA ad EA,
ita arcus AR ad arcum AI ex con&longs;tructione; ergo ut AR ad
AL ita AR ad AI: ergo per 9.lib.5. AI & AL &longs;unt æquales.

Quoniam igitur tam E quàm F ex hypothe&longs;i in oppo&longs;itas
partes moventur circumacto vecte, punctum aliquod e&longs;t inter E
& F, quod e&longs;t veluti centrum motuum tam potentiæ quàm pon­
derum, in quo centro quodammodo divi&longs;a intelligitur re­
&longs;i&longs;tentia, quæ componitur tùm ex eorum innatâ gravitate,
tùm ex eorum motu, &longs;pectatâ po&longs;itione ad vectem.

Hinc ma­
nife&longs;tum e&longs;t &longs;ingula pondera minùs moveri, quàm &longs;i &longs;ingula
moverentur reliquo manente immoto; quia videlicet &longs;ingula
minùs di&longs;tant à centro, circa quod moventur.

Sic ponderum
E & F gravitas ponatur æqualis: &longs;i intelligatur centrum mo­
tûs ab utroque æqualiter di&longs;tare, ut &longs;it KE æqualis ip&longs;i KF,
motus potentiæ factus intervallo AK æqualem habet Ratio­
nem ad motum, qui fit à &longs;ingulis ponderibus.

Quare potentiæ momentum perinde &longs;e habet, atque &longs;i utrum­
que pondus e&longs;&longs;et in E, aut utrumque in F, hypomochlium verò
in K.

Ponamus enim EF e&longs;&longs;e partium 6, quarum partium 7 e&longs;t
FA: igitur EK e&longs;t 3, & KA 10; & potentia &longs;ine vecte movens
lib.3, vecte AKE movebit lib.10 in E.

Similiter KF e&longs;t 3, &
KA e&longs;t 10; igitur potentia ut 3 in A, movebit in F pondus ut
10: igitur etiam in A potentia ut 6, facto motûs centro K, mo­
vebit vel utrumque pondus ut 10 in E & F, vel unicum pondus
ut 20 &longs;ive in E, &longs;ive in F.

Con&longs;tituatur itaque potentiæ virtus
ut 6, &longs;i hypomochlium e&longs;&longs;et F immotum, non moveret ni&longs;i pon­
dus grave ut 7 po&longs;itum in E; & facto hypomochlio &longs;tabili E
moveret pondus grave 13 po&longs;itum in F; adeóque univer&longs;um
pondus e&longs;&longs;et librarum 20. Quare idem pondus lib.
20 movetur
ab eâdem potentia, &longs;ed non eodem motu: Nam hîc amborum
&longs;imul ponderum motus circa centrum K e&longs;t ut 6; at &longs;i potentiæ
motus AI &longs;it 10 (quemadmodum motus potentiæ circa cen­
trum K e&longs;t 10) circa F centrum, motus EG e&longs;t 8 4/7; & &longs;i po­
tentiæ motus AL &longs;it pariter 10 circa centrum E motus FH
e&longs;t (4 8/13).

Hinc patet &longs;ingulorum ponderum motum, quando utrum­
que &longs;imul movetur, minorem e&longs;&longs;e, quàm &longs;i &longs;ingula &longs;olitariè
moverentur, adeóque totum motum, qui ex duobus motibus
coale&longs;cit, minorem e&longs;&longs;e &longs;ummâ, quæ conflatur ex motu EG
& motu FH.

Præterea manife&longs;tum e&longs;t cæteris paribus move­
ri faciliùs pondus F, quod e&longs;t Potentiæ A proximum, quàm
pondus E ab eádem remotum; minor enim differentia e&longs;t in­
ter (4 8/13) & 3, quàm inter 8 4/7 & 3.

Quod &longs;i duorum ponderum E & F ab&longs;oluta re&longs;i&longs;tentia, quæ
ex gravitate oritur, inæqualis fuerit, inæqualem pariter e&longs;&longs;e
oportet re&longs;i&longs;tentiam ex motûs velocitate, quæ unicuique pon­
deri conveniat, &longs;ed reciprocè, ut fiat totius re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ æquali­
tas.

Cum enim utrumque pondus movendum &longs;it, par e&longs;t ita re­
&longs;i&longs;tentiam dividi, ut æqualibus momentis adver&longs;entur poten­
tiæ contranitenti; quod &longs;cilicet gravius e&longs;t, difficiliùs movetur,
quod minus grave, faciliùs: igitur illius motus minor e&longs;t, hu­
jus major.

Propterea centrum motuum iis intervallis ab utro­
que pondere aberit, ut quæ Ratio e&longs;t gravioris ponderis ad mi­
nus grave, ea &longs;it Ratio di&longs;tantiæ centri motûs à minùs gravi ad
di&longs;tantiam eju&longs;dem centri à graviore.
Sit ex.

gr. pondus E lib.8.
& pondus F lib.12; di&longs;tantia EF eadem quæ priùs, hoc e&longs;t, 6; &
FA 7. Cum igitur pondera &longs;int ut 2 ad 3, dividatur EF in quin­
que partes, & propè gravius F a&longs;&longs;umantur duæ FM, reliquæ
tres ME &longs;pectent ad minus grave E.

Si itaque circa centrum
M moveantur pondera E & F, habent æqualia re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ mo­
menta; nam lib.
12 moventur ut 2, & lib.
8 moventur ut 3.
Quare AM e&longs;t ad ME ut 9 2/5 ad 3 3/5, & AM ad MF e&longs;t ut 9 2/5
ad 2 2/5. Fiat igitur ut AM ad ME, ita reciprocè pondus E
lib.
8 ad virtutem potentiæ A movendi &longs;ine vecte libras (3 3/47): &
ut AM ad MF, ita reciprocè pondus F lib.12 ad eju&longs;dem po­
tentiæ A virtutem movendi &longs;inè vecte libras (3 3/47). In hac ita­
que ponderum inæqualium di&longs;po&longs;itione paulo plus virium re­
quiritur in potentia (hoc e&longs;t vis movendi lib. (6 6/47)) quàm &longs;i e&longs;­
&longs;ent æqualia, eandemque gravitatis &longs;ummam lib.
20 con&longs;ti­
tuerent.

At &longs;i vice versâ pondus E e&longs;&longs;et lib.
12, & F lib.
8, centrum
motuum e&longs;&longs;et N, atque AN e&longs;&longs;et 10 3/5: ac propterea ut AN
10 3/5 ad NE 2 2/5, ita pondus E lib.
12 ad virtutem potentiæ &longs;i­
ne vecte moventis libras (2 38/53); & ut AN 10 3/5 ad NF 3 3/5, ita
pondus F lib.
8 ad virtutem potentiæ A moventis &longs;ine vecte li­
bras (2 38/53). Tota igitur virtus potentiæ in hac eorumdem pon­
derum inæqualium collocatione &longs;ufficiet, &longs;i fuerit vis movendi
lib. (5 23/53), quæ minor e&longs;t eâ, quæ requiritur; quando pondera
&longs;unt æqualia, & differt à virtute, quæ requiritur, quando F
gravius e&longs;t quàm E, vi movendi ferè uncias 8 1/3.

Simili argumentatione ratiocinando deprehendes, quo mi­
nus fuerit intervallum inter E & F, etiam faciliùs duo illa pon­
dera eodem vecte moveri.

Nam &longs;i idem vectis AE 13 adhi­
beatur, atque pondera E & F æqualia fuerint, intervallum ve­
rò EF &longs;it 4, centrum motuum di&longs;tabit ab A intervallo 11, &
à &longs;ingulis ponderibus intervallo 2: Quare potentia ut 4 move­
bit pondera &longs;ingula ut 11: vel &longs;i ponantur ut prius &longs;ingula
lib.
10, fiat ut 11 ad 2, ita lib.
10 ad potentiam &longs;ine vecte mo­
ventem lib. (1 9/11); atque ideò tota potentia &longs;ufficiens ad movenda
duo pondera æqualia &longs;imul &longs;umpta lib.
20, erit vis movendi &longs;ine
vecte lib. (3 7/11). Quod &longs;i E fuerit lib.
8, & F lib.12, E di&longs;tabit à
à centro motuum partibus 2 2/5, F verò part.

1 3/5, & potentia A
di&longs;tabit part.

10 3/5: Ex quo fit &longs;ingula moveri po&longs;&longs;e à potentia
habente virtutem movendi &longs;ine vecte lib. (1 43/53), & ambo &longs;imul à
potentia habente vim movendi lib. (3 33/53). At verò &longs;i vici&longs;&longs;im E
fuerit lib.
12, & F lib.
8, di&longs;tantia potentiæ à centro motuum
erit part.

11 2/5, ac propterea &longs;ingula pondera exigent virtutem
movendi lib. (1 39/57), & tota potentia ad utrumque &longs;imul moven­
dum &longs;ufficiens erit vis movendi &longs;ine vecte lib. (3 21/57), quæ deficit
à vi movendi lib. (3 33/53), ea virtute, quæ requireretur ad moven­
dum uncias (3 1/20), atque à vi movendi lib. (3 7/11) deficit per uncias
3 1/5 ferè.

Que de corpore gravi dimovendo dicta &longs;unt, intelligantur
pariter, &longs;i vectis inter duo corpora flectenda, aut divellenda,
interjiceretur; quemadmodum objectos caveæ &longs;i quæras fran­
gere clathros: quod enim hîc gravitas, ibi ferreæ virgæ aut
lignei tigilli &longs;oliditas impedimentum affert motui.

Porrò in vecte tertij generis, quando potentia inter utrum­
que pondus mobile con&longs;tituitur, aliter res &longs;e habet: adhoc &longs;ci­
licet, ut aliquam vectis Rationem habeat, requiritur aut inæ­
qualitas ponderum, aut &longs;altem inæqualitas di&longs;tantiarum po­
tentiæ à ponderibus in utrâque extremitate con&longs;titutis, ita ta­
men ut hæ di&longs;tantiæ non &longs;int in reciprocâ Ratione ponderum:
nam &longs;i planè æqualiter di&longs;taret potentia ab æqualibus ponderi­
bus, aut inæquales di&longs;tantiæ e&longs;&longs;ent in reciprocâ Ratione inæ­
qualium ponderum, ita utrumque traheretur, aut impellere­
tur, ut pondera &longs;ingula æquè moverentur ac potentia: ad Ra­
tiones autem vectis &longs;pectat inæqualiter moveri potentiam ac
pondus, &longs;i vectis quidem obtineat vim Facultatis Mechanicæ.

Quoniam igitur in huju&longs;modi vecte tertii generis oportet
utrumque pondus opponi motui potentiæ; vel quia utrumque
impellitur, vel quia alterum trahitur, alterum impellitur, &longs;it
vectis AB, in cujus extremitati­
bus pondera re&longs;pondeant punctis
A & B: Si potentia fuerit in C
æquè di&longs;tans ab A & B, pondera
autem fuerint æqualia; potentia
ex C versùs D mota nullum ha­
beret &longs;ui motûs centrum, &longs;ed pariter traheret aut impelleret
ad partes D utrumque pondus; nam æquè utrumque re&longs;i&longs;teret
tùm ratione gravitatis, tùm ratione po&longs;itionis & di&longs;tantiæ, quæ
legem daret motui, ac proinde utrumque æqualiter cederet
virtuti potentiæ.

At &longs;i pondus A minus fuerit, quàm pondus B,
&longs;ed reciprocam Rationem habeant di&longs;tantiæ potentiæ exi&longs;tentis
in E, ut &longs;it EB ad EA, in Ratione ponderis A ad pondus B;
adhuc æquales &longs;unt re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ; &longs;icut enim in plano Verticali
potentiæ in E &longs;u&longs;tineret utrumque pondus in æquilibrio, ita in
plano horizontali trahens aut impellens utrumque æqualiter
moveret.

Sint igitur pondera A & B &longs;ive æqualis gravitatis, &longs;ive inæ­
qualis, & ita potentia &longs;it in E, ut EB ad EA non &longs;it in Ratio­
ne ponderis A ad pondus B: utique &longs;i B moveri non po&longs;&longs;et,
potentia E circa B, tanquam circa centrum, de&longs;criberet ar­
cum EI, & pondus A arcum AF: &longs;imiliter &longs;i pondus A immo­
tum maneret, potentia circa A, tanquam circa centrum, de&longs;­
criberet arcum EH, & pondus B arcum BG, ex hypothe&longs;i
æqualem arcui AF.

Potentia igitur in E faciliùs cæteris pari­
bus moveret pondus B &longs;ibi proximum, quàm pondus A remo­
tum, &longs;i &longs;ingula &longs;ingillatim movenda e&longs;&longs;ent; quia, cum arcus
EH major &longs;it arcu EI, arcus autem BG, & AF &longs;int æquales,
major e&longs;t Ratio EH ad EI quàm BG ad AF; & per 27. lib.5.
vici&longs;&longs;im EH ad BG habet majorem Rationem quàm EI ad
AF.

Cum itaque neutra extremitas immota maneat, &longs;ed ambo
pondera moveantur, minùs movetur A, quod difficiliùs, ma­
gis B, quod faciliùs: ac propterea A &longs;impliciter fungitur mu­
nere hypomochlij ad motum ponderis B: hoc verò vici&longs;&longs;im ad
ponderis A motum, quamvis minorem, &longs;ubit vicem fulcri:
Neque enim hic unum tribus motibus, potentiæ videlicet &
duorum ponderum, commune centrum reperire e&longs;t, quia ad
eandem partem omnium motus dirigitur.

Hinc &longs;i fune alligato
in E trahas vectem cum ponderibus, punctum E neque omni­
no versùs I, neque omnino versùs H dirigetur, quamquam ad
H potiùs, quàm ad I inclinabitur; quia faciliùs A vectis
punctum re&longs;pondens ponderi convertitur circa centrum gravi­
tatis ponderis, quàm propellat aut trahat totum pondus, pro
ut ferunt, & ip&longs;ius gravitas, & eju&longs;dem di&longs;tantia ab E, quæ il­
lius re&longs;i&longs;tentiam componunt.
CAPUT VI.

Quænam &longs;int momenta Vectis pondus fune
connexum trahentis.

COntingere pote&longs;t oblato ponderi &longs;uper planum horizonta­
le, aut inclinatum, trahendo non e&longs;&longs;e parem Potentiam:
hujus imbecillitati opem ferre licebit Vecte poti&longs;&longs;imùm &longs;ecun­
di generis, cujus extremitas altera fixa & &longs;tabilis maneat in pla­
no, in quo pondus jacet, alteram extremitatem Potentia mo­
veat, & loco intermedio alligetur funis cum pondere connexus,
qui dum vecte movetur, &longs;ecum rapiat & pondus.

Verùm non
leviter hallucinaretur, qui&longs;quis momenta vectis ex alligati fu­
nis loco &longs;impliciter & ab&longs;olutè definiret; cum potiùs ponderis
re&longs;i&longs;tentiam ex ip&longs;ius motu computare oporteat.

Quoniam verò
duplex e&longs;&longs;e pote&longs;t vectis motus, nimirum aut in plano Verticali,
aut in Horizontali, propterea uterque &longs;eor&longs;im con&longs;iderandus
e&longs;t; diver&longs;as enim lineas in plano, in quo jacet, pondus percur­
rit; rectam &longs;cilicet, &longs;i vectis in plano Verticali agitatur; curvam
verò, &longs;i in plano horizontali aut inclinato eodem, cui pondus
incumbit etiam vectis moveatur.

Sit in plano, in quo pondus jacet, linea AB, cui vectis con­
gruere intelligatur, & concipiatur pondus in puncto C; vecti
autem in D alligetur funis ita
connectens pondus cum vecte,
ut parti vectis DA æqualis &longs;it
funis DC.

Attollatur in plano
Verticali vectis, ut &longs;it AE
de&longs;cribens arcum BE; etiam
punctum D a&longs;cendit in F, ac
propterea funis e&longs;t FG, &
ponderis motus e&longs;t CG.

Ite­
rum attollatur æqualiter vectis
ex E in H; funis caput venit in I, & pondus in K.

Similiter
vecte in L &longs;ublato, funis venit in M, & pondus in N.

Sunt
igitur tre, ponderis motus, CG, GK, KN, inter &longs;e inæqua­
les, qui &longs;emper majores fiunt; motus autem potentiæ BE, EH,
HL ex hypothe&longs;i &longs;unt æquales; igitur major e&longs;t Ratio motûs
BE ad motum CG, quàm motûs EH ad motum GK, & hæc
Ratio major e&longs;t Ratione motûs HL ad motum KN.

Cum ita­
que motibus BE, EH, HL &longs;imiles &longs;int motus DF, FI, IM,
manife&longs;tum e&longs;t motum ponderis non &longs;ervare Rationem &longs;ecun­
dùm quam dividitur vectis ab alligati funis capite, eadem quip­
pe &longs;emper e&longs;t Ratio EA ad AF, & HA ad AI, & LA
ad AM.

Motus autem illos ponderis CG, GK & KN &longs;emper e&longs;&longs;e
majores hinc con&longs;tat, quia pars vectis inter funem alligatum
atque hypomochlium A ex hypothe&longs;i e&longs;t æqualis ip&longs;i funi con­
nectenti pondus: &longs;unt igitur triangula I&longs;o&longs;celia æqualium &longs;em­
per laterum, &longs;ed quæ majores & majores angulos ad ba&longs;im ha­
bent, ideóque minorem & minorem angulum verticalem con­
tinent.

Atqui angulorum ad centrum in circulis æqualibus,
vel in eodem circulo, &longs;emper æqualiter decre&longs;centium &longs;ubten­
&longs;æ minores fiunt eâ lege, ut decrementa illa, hoc e&longs;t, &longs;ubten&longs;a­
rum diminutarum differentiæ augeantur, ut ex Canone Si­
nuum con&longs;tat.

Cum itaque AG &longs;it &longs;ubten&longs;a anguli AFG, &
AK &longs;it &longs;ubten&longs;a anguli AIK minoris, & AN &longs;it &longs;ubton&longs;a an­
guli AMN adhuc minoris; harum &longs;ubten&longs;arum differentiæ,
videlicet CG (differentia inter diametrum circuli AC & &longs;ub­
ten&longs;am AG) GK & KN motus ponderis &longs;emper augentur.

Id quod ut manife&longs;tum fiat, triangula ip&longs;a ad calculos revo­
cemus &longs;ingulorum ba&longs;im inquirentes: ponamus verò ex.

gr. ar­
cus BE, EH, HL &longs;ingulos grad. 15, & latera &longs;ingula AF &
GF e&longs;&longs;e partium 100. Igitur angulus AFG e&longs;t grad. 150, &
ba&longs;is AG deprehenditur partium (193 18/100). E&longs;t autem AC ex
hypothe&longs;i 200, adeóque CG part. (6 82/100). In triangulo AIK la­
tera &longs;unt eadem, anguli ad ba&longs;im &longs;inguli grad. 30, angulus ver­
ticalis grad. 120; ergo ba&longs;is AK part. (173 20/100): & inter AK at­
que AG differentia GK e&longs;t (19 98/100). Deinde in triangulo AMN
anguli ad ba&longs;im &longs;inguli &longs;unt grad. 45; igitur angulus vertica­
lis grad. 90, & ba&longs;is AN part. (141 42/100), & inter AN & AK dif-
ferentia KN e&longs;t (31 78/100). Et &longs;i vectem elevando pergas, idem in
con&longs;equentibus triangulis deprehendes, augeri &longs;cilicet diffe­
rentia, u&longs;que ad A.

Hinc patet eò faciliorem e&longs;&longs;e, cæteris paribus, motum, quò
majorem angulum funis cum vecte con&longs;tituit, nam ab æquali
potentiæ motu minor ponderis motus efficitur, quam &longs;i major
e&longs;&longs;et angulus elevationis vectis.

Quare faciliùs promovebitur
ad de&longs;tinatum locum pondus quod trahitur, &longs;i po&longs;t aliqualem
vectis elevationem, iterum inclinato, quàm maximè fieri po­
terit, vecte, extremitatem A, hoc e&longs;t hypomochlium &longs;ubinde
promoveas, quantum feret funis longitudo: tunc enim fune
maximè inclinato tractio ponderis minùs obliqua juvabit mo­
tum, qui etiam minor e&longs;t, quàm &longs;i pergeres vectem elevando.

Non e&longs;t tamen nece&longs;&longs;e &longs;ervari hanc, quam claritatis gratiâ
propo&longs;ui, æqualitatem funis FG, & partis vectis FA; &longs;ed a&longs;&longs;u­
mi pote&longs;t vel longior, vel brevior funis, adeò ut ex vectis par­
te, ex fune, & ex di&longs;tantiâ ponderis ab hypomochlio fiat trian­
gulum &longs;calenum: in quo &longs;i funis fuerit longior parte vectis, eo­
dem potentiæ motu minùs accedet pondus ad hypomochlium,
quàm &longs;i funis fuerit brevior eâdem vectis parte; atque quo lon­
gior fuerit funis, etiam minor erit, adeóque facilior, ponderis
motu, cæteris paribus, nam & tractio minùs obliqua erit.
Statue igitur ex.

deris.

Quemadmodum verò elevando vectem à po&longs;itione hori­
zontali u&longs;que ad perpendiculum difficultas trahendi augetur,
quia pondus velociùs movetur, ita ex adver&longs;o, &longs;i vectis hori­
zonti perpendicularis inclinetur ad partem oppo&longs;itam ponderi
(adeò ut vectis &longs;it inter potentiam & pondus) cre&longs;cit trahendi
facilitas, quia pondus &longs;emper tardiùs movetur, quo magis
vectis ad horizontem de­
primitur.

Sit enim pon­
dus in P, vectis perpendi­
cularis CB, funis OP
utique longior parte vectis
OC.

Inclinetur vectis per
Quadrantis trientem, ut O
veniat in S; funis erit ST,
& pondus veniet ex P in T. Æquali inclinatione deprimatur
vectis, ut S veniat in M; funis erit MV, & ponderis motus
TV.

Demum vectis horizonti congruat, ut M veniat in N;
funis erit NI, motú&longs;que ponderis VI.

Cum igitur &longs;emper tar­
diùs moveatur pondus, quia &longs;patia PT, TV, VI &longs;emper de­
cre&longs;cunt, æquales autem potentiæ motus ill's re&longs;pondeant,
etiam cre&longs;cit trahendi facilitas.

Illa autem ba&longs;ium CP, CT, CV decrementa in triangulis
COP, CST, CMV &longs;emper minui con&longs;tabit ex Trigonome­
tria; dantur enim in omnibus eadem duo latera, &longs;cilicet funis

cre&longs;cens angulus funi oppo&longs;itus; quare inveniuntur & ba&longs;es,
quarum differentiæ &longs;emper minores fiunt.

OCP rectangulo &longs;it perpendiculum OC partium 73, & hypo­

Supere&longs;t adhuc tertia quædam ponderis po&longs;itio, vecte agita­

pondus proximum hypomochlio, à quo in motu recedat: hu­
ju&longs;modi &longs;cilicet vecte uti po&longs;&longs;umus, cùm aliquid modicè qui­
dem movendum in plano horizontali proponitur, &longs;ed multa e&longs;t
difficultas.

Similiter &longs;i longiu&longs;cula ferrea bractea e&longs;&longs;et &longs;uis ex­
tremitatibus validè connexa cum aliquo corpore, & circa me­
dium eam flecti oporteret, ut cuneus vel aliquid &longs;imile inter

bracteam apprehendens, qui elevato vecte, &longs;ive depre&longs;&longs;o il­
lam aliquantulum flecteret.

minu&longs;que valida fit tractio, quæ magis obliqua e&longs;t.

Quas hactenus recen&longs;uimus tractiones, fieri per lineam
rectam vel accedendo ad punctum hypomochlij, vel ab eo re­
cedendo, &longs;atis con&longs;tat; quia, dum vectis in plano Verticali
movetur, pondus non recedit ab illo eodem plano Verticali
&longs;emper &longs;uâ gravitate in&longs;i&longs;tens plano horizontali, atque idcirco
motus illius e&longs;t in communi horum planorum &longs;ectione, hoc
e&longs;t, in lineâ rectâ.

Sin autem motus vectis fuerit in eodem
plano horizontali, in quo e&longs;t pondus fune trahendum, quia
vectis circulariter movetur, illum &longs;equitur pondus per lineam
curvam, &longs;ed quo ad ejus fieri po&longs;&longs;it, brevi&longs;&longs;imam, ut quàm mi­
nimam patiatur violentiam.

Certum quippe e&longs;t oportere fu­
nem vecti congruentem citra quamlibet anguli inclinationem,
e&longs;&longs;e breviorem parte illâ vectis, quæ inter hypomochlium, &
locum alligati funis, intercipitur; &longs;i enim æqualis e&longs;&longs;et, cir­
cumducto vecte pondus fulcro proximum non moveretur;
multo minùs, &longs;i longior e&longs;&longs;et funis.

Cum itaque brevior &longs;it,
nece&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t pondus quoque circumduci, &longs;ed non eâ ratione,
qua moveretur, &longs;i funis eundem &longs;emper angulum cum vecte
con&longs;titueret; quemadmodum contingeret, &longs;i vecti loco funis
flexilis rigidum brachium adjaceret, cur pondus adnecteretur.

Verùm quia pondus &longs;uâ gravitate re&longs;i&longs;tit, dum vectis movetur,
recinetur aliquantulum funis à pondere, & angulum &longs;ubinde
majorem cum vecte efficit; trahitur tamen pondus, &longs;ed ita, ut
violentiam &longs;ubeat quàm minimam pro ratione po&longs;itionis; ac
propterea lineam curvam helici &longs;imilem de&longs;cribit, quo ad fu­
nis certum angulum acutum (pro ut funis, aut pars vectis lon­
giores fuerint, &longs;ive breviores) cum vecte con&longs;tituat; quo de­
inde angulo manente pondus in gyrum ducitur per circuli am­
bitum.

Ob&longs;ervabis enim po&longs;itâ eadem vectis parte, quò bre­
vior fuerit funis, eò majorem e&longs;&longs;e angulum illum, ad quem de­
venitur, & in quo con&longs;i&longs;titur nec illum augendo, nec minuendo.

Quod &longs;i in funem eâdem vectis parte longiorem ita di&longs;ponas, ut
non vecti congruat, &longs;ed cum illo angulum efficiat, circumducto
vecte ita pondus per helicem moveri videbis, ut diminuto &longs;ub­
inde angulo, demum funis vecti in eadem rectâ lineâ congruat,
& ponderis ultra hypomochlium manentis tractio de&longs;inat: quia
videlicet ponderis gravitas re&longs;i&longs;tens licèt trahatur, retinet ta­
men funem, & minuitur angulus, u&longs;que dum omnis angulus
pereat.

Huju&longs;modi motûs cau&longs;am deprehendes, &longs;i attentè in&longs;picias
pondus, cum vecti, in gyrum moveri incipit, ita trahi, ut etiam
aliquantulum circa &longs;uum centrum gravitatis, aut circa aliud
punctum (neque enim hic locus e&longs;t punctum illud definiendi)
volvatur; ex qua conver&longs;ione fit minore motu opus e&longs;&longs;e, ut
pondus con&longs;equatur trahentem: ubi verò tanta facta fuerit
ponderis circa &longs;uum centrum conver&longs;io, ut &longs;i in hanc, vel in
illam partem adhuc converteretur, majorem &longs;ubiret in tractio­
ne violentiam, hoc e&longs;t, cogeretur majorem motum perficere,
quàm &longs;it motus eju&longs;dem nulla factâ circa &longs;uum illud centrum
conver&longs;ione, tunc manet angulus funis cum vecte, nec jam au­
getur aut minuitur.

Quia autem, cæteris paribus, quò bre­
vior e&longs;t funis, cò major fit ponderis circa &longs;uum centrum con­
ver&longs;io; propterea ad majorem angulum demum inclinatur fu­
nis in vectem.

Sed in hoc non e&longs;t diutiùs immorandum; rarus
quippe e&longs;t huju&longs;modi tractionis u&longs;us.
CAPUT VII.

Quid conferat Potentiæ moventis applicatio
ad vectem.

QUoniam duplex e&longs;t Potentiæ genus, alia &longs;iquidem inani­
ma e&longs;t, cujus conatus &longs;ecundùm rectam lineam in cen­
trum, vel à centro, dirigitur, prout gravis e&longs;t aut levis, alia
e&longs;t vivens, quæ pro variâ mu&longs;culorum intentione, ac mem­
brorum inflexione in aliam atque aliam partem dirigi pote&longs;t;
idcirco, cuju&longs;modi potentiâ uti liceat, con&longs;iderandum e&longs;t, ut
opportunum vectis genus eligatur.

Nam &longs;i vectis primi gene
ris depre&longs;&longs;ione attollendum &longs;it pondus, & potentia &longs;it vivens,
ut homo, major e&longs;t movendi facilitas, tum quia ip&longs;um vectis
pondus potentiam juvat &longs;uâ gravitate, tum quia in huju&longs;modi
depre&longs;&longs;ione vectis non &longs;olùm brachiorum, &longs;ed etiam quando­
que totius humani corporis vecti incumbentis, vel ex vecte
pendentis gravitas momentum non leve addit contentioni, qua
virtus movendi impetum vecti imprimen connititur.

Sin au­
tem vecte &longs;ecundi, aut tertij generis elevandum &longs;it pondus
idem, ip&longs;a vectis gravitas officit, quam pariter cum ip&longs;o pon­
dere attollere oportet, & majore virium contentione opus e&longs;t,
ut experientiâ docemur.

Verùm illud, quod hîc poti&longs;&longs;imum examinandum proponi­
tur, e&longs;t ip&longs;a potentiæ, quæcumque illa &longs;it, applicatio ad
vectem: neque enim &longs;atis e&longs;t, &longs;i illa extremitati vectis adjun­
gatur, aut certo quodam loco in vecte tertij generis collocata
intelligatur; &longs;ed maximè attendendum e&longs;t, &longs;ecundùm quam
lineam potentiæ motus dirigatur; diver&longs;a quippe &longs;unt poten­
tiæ momenta pro alia atque aliâ huju&longs;modi motûs directione,
quatenus cum vecte comparatur.

Quemadmodum enim &longs;i po­
tentia vectem urgeat, aut trahat, juxta eju&longs;dem vectis in hy­
pomochlij puncto firmati longitudinem, nihil prorsùs in pon­
dere efficit; ita quoquè &longs;i in vectis longitudinem obliquè inci-
dat impetûs a potentiâ concepti directio, pro ratione obliqui­
tatis minuitur potentiæ momentum; quod integrum manet, &longs;i
ad angulos rectos vecti occurrat linea motus, quam init po­
tentia.

Sit vectis primi generis AB habens hypomochlium in C, &longs;i­
ve &longs;ecundi aut tertij generis DE habens hypomochlium in D.

Si potentia con&longs;tituta in B, aut
E aut F, motum &longs;uum dirigat
&longs;ecundùm eandem rectam li­
neam BA aut ED, &longs;ive urgen­
do vectem versùs C aut D, &longs;ive
illum inde retrahendo, mani­
fe&longs;tum e&longs;t, puncto hypomo­
chlij C aut D manente, pondus
in A, aut in F, aut in E con&longs;ti­
tutum nihil pror&longs;us moveri, nam totus potentiæ conatus irri­
tus e&longs;t, nec vectem movet.

Oportet igitur lineam, &longs;ecundùm
quam dirigitur motus potentiæ, con&longs;tituere cum vecti, longi­
tudine angulum aut rectum, aut recto minorem, aut majorem.

Si angulum acutum HBA efficiat, movetur quidem potentia
& vectis, &longs;ed cùm urgeatur vectis versùs hypomochlium C,
impeditur potentia, nec movet vectem pro ratione impetûs,
quem illa concipit.

Similiter &longs;i directio motûs potentiæ &longs;it &longs;e­
cundùm lineam BG, & fiat angulus obtu&longs;us GBA, quamvis
vectem moveat, minùs tamen illum flectit aut deprimit, quàm
requirat impetûs concepti inten&longs;io, quia conatur vectem re­
trahere ab hypomochlio C, & ab illo retinetur.

Cùm autem,
quò acutior aut obtu&longs;ior e&longs;t angulus, eò etiam majus &longs;it impe­
dimentum, hinc e&longs;t pariter plus laboris à potentiâ impendi.

Quare, cùm nullum &longs;it huju&longs;modi impedimentum, quando ad
rectos cum vecte angulos potentiæ motus dirigitur, ut IBA,
propterea tunc &longs;olùm potentia obtinet omnia momenta, quæ
concepto impetui re&longs;pondent: nihil enim impetûs deteritur ab
impedimento, quod vectis inferat, quippe qui nec versùs hy­
pomochlium urgetur, nec ab illo retrahitur.

Porrò ob&longs;erva longè aliam e&longs;&longs;e lineam motûs potentiæ, à li­
neâ &longs;ecundùm quam eju&longs;dem potentiæ motus dirigitur; nam
potentia in B applicata movetur de&longs;cribendo arcum circa C
punctum hypomochlij, &longs;ed pro varià directione modò majo­
rem, modò minorem arcum de&longs;cribit eodem tempore ex vi
eju&longs;dem impetûs concepti.

Hinc e&longs;t, ni&longs;i potentia &longs;uum mo­
tum in gyrum dirigat, fieri non po&longs;&longs;e, ut in motu eadem &longs;er­
vet virium momenta: Nam licèt eandem directionem &longs;ervaret,
quatenus horizontem re&longs;picit, aut certum aliquod punctum,
non e&longs;&longs;et tamen eadem directio comparata cum vecte; alium
quippe atque alium cum vecte angulum con&longs;titueret illa ea­
dem directionis linea: id quod manife&longs;tò con&longs;tat, cùm vectis
à potentiâ gravi deprimitur; linea enim directionis in centrum
gravium directa &longs;emper obliquior incidit in vectem, qui depri­
mitur.

Voco autem Directionem motûs lineam illam, quam potentia
ex vi concepti impetûs &longs;ponte percurreret, ni&longs;i ab illâ deflecte­
re cogeretur, quia cum vecte connectitur.

Sic potentia B li­
neam BH ex.

gr. percurreret, ni&longs;i vectis in C firmati &longs;oliditas
ob&longs;taret, cogerétque arcum BR de&longs;cribere: idem de cæteris
lineis dicendum.

Hinc &longs;i longitudo BH concipiatur &longs;patium,
quod à potentiâ libera vi &longs;ui impetûs certo tempore perficere­
tur, illa utique non recederet à lineâ AB ni&longs;i pro ratione Si­
nûs Recti angulo HBA convenientis po&longs;ito Radio BH, &longs;cili­
cet per HO.

Similiter &longs;i directio motûs &longs;it BG angulum obtu­
&longs;um GBA con&longs;tituens, potentia non recederet ab eâdem lineâ
AB ni&longs;i pro ratione GK &longs;inus Recti eju&longs;dem anguli GBA ob­
tu&longs;i po&longs;ito Radio BG, qui ex hypothe&longs;i æqualis e&longs;t Radio BH,
ponitur enim utrobique æqualis impetus potentiæ.

Quare cùm
idem &longs;it Sinus Rectus anguli acuti, atque obtu&longs;i, quorum &longs;um­
ma æquatur duobus rectis, eadem pariter momenta virium
exercet potentia, &longs;ive ad acutum, &longs;ive ad obtu&longs;um cum vecte
angulum dirigatur.

Hoc tamen intercedit di&longs;crimen, quando
potentia eandem &longs;ervat ad horizontem directionem, quod acu­
tus angulus procedente motu fit major accedens ad Rectum,
augetúrquo ejus Sinus; obtu&longs;us verò angulus fit obtu&longs;ior magis
recedens à Recto, minuitúrque ejus Sinus; ac proinde ibi au­
getur, hîc minuitur movendi facilitas.

Potentia itaque motum &longs;uum dirigens ad acutum angulum
per lineam BH, vi &longs;ui impetûs de&longs;cribit circa centrum C ar­
cum BR; ad angulum rectum per lineam BI de&longs;cribit arcum
BN; ad anguium demum obtu&longs;um per lineam BG de&longs;cribit
arcum BL, qui e&longs;t æqualis arcui BR, &longs;i angulu; obtu&longs;us GBA
&longs;it &longs;upplementum ad duo, recto, anguli acuti HBA, major
autem, aut mino, eodem arcu BR, &longs;i angulus obtu&longs;us &longs;it mi­
nor aut major codem Supplemento ad duos recto.

Hæc tamen
ita dicta intelligas velim, ut huju&longs;modi arcus toti atque integri
non motum ip&longs;um exprimant, qui revera fiat, &longs;ed virium Ra­
tionem pro diversa potentiæ applicatione in minimâ arcû de&longs;­
cripti particula; neque enim &longs;ingulis temporis momentis æqua­
lis pars arcus eidem impetui re&longs;pondet, &longs;ingulis nimirum mo­
mentis mutatur vectis inclinatio, & manet eadem motús di­
rectio, atque varia e&longs;t potentiæ ad vectem applicatio, ni&longs;i il­
la impetum concipiat, quo &longs;ua &longs;ponte in gyrum ageretur,
etiam&longs;i ad motum circularem non determinaretur à vecte.

Sed quoniam arcus eodem Radio CB à potentiâ de&longs;criptus
e&longs;t &longs;imilis arcui eodem Radio CA de&longs;cripto à pondere,
proinde non mutatur Ratio motuum, &longs;ive potentia de&longs;cri­
bat codem impetu minorem, &longs;ive majorem arcum eju&longs;dem
circuli: propterea non mutatur quidem momentum poten­
tiæ cum pondere ab&longs;olutè comparatæ, mutatur tamen &longs;ubinde
momentum potentiæ, quatenus &longs;ecum ip&longs;a comparatur, faci­
liú&longs;que movere pondus tunc dicitur, quando eodem conatu
majorem motum ponderi æquali tempore conciliat; id quod
fit, cùm ad angulum rectum vecti applicatur.

Hæc eadem, quæ in vecte primi generis explicata &longs;unt,
in reliquis pariter duobus generibus locum habent, nec opus
e&longs;t illa iterum inculcare.

Unum in his ob&longs;ervandum vide­
tur, quando potentia movens e&longs;t à vecte &longs;ejuncta, illúm­
que trahendo movet certo in loco firmiter con&longs;tituta, vectem
in motu propiùs accedere ad potentiam trahentem, ac proin­
de diligenter attendendam e&longs;&longs;e ip&longs;ius potentiæ po&longs;itionem, ut
innote&longs;cat, utrùm angulus, quem &longs;ubinde cum vecte funicu­
lus efficit, accedat magis ad rectum, an verò recedat à recto,
quia in motu acutior aut obtu&longs;ior evadat.

Id quod &longs;atis fuerit
&longs;ubindicá&longs;&longs;e; præ&longs;tat &longs;iquidem laborem in motu minui, quàm
augeri.

Sic dato vecte CB &longs;ecundi generis habente hypomo­
chlium in C, &longs;tatue quantum moveri debeat, ex.

gr. per
arcum BD.
Erit igitur vectis po&longs;itio CD.

Excitetur ex D
perpendicularis DE, & in ali­
quo rectæ lineæ DE puncto, pu­
ta in E, &longs;tatuatur potentia, quæ
funiculo EB trahens vectem ita
vecti intelligatur applicata, ut
majorem &longs;ubinde angulum effi­
ciat, donec ad rectum CDE de­
veniat.

Sic facilior erit motus, &
labor minuetur.

Quod &longs;i poten­
tia movendo pergeret adhuc trahens vectem, jam augeretur
labor, quia applicaretur ad angulum obtu&longs;um.

Porrò in recta
DE eligendum e&longs;&longs;e punctum, quoad fieri poterit, proximum
puncto D, ut funiculus EB minùs acutum angulum cum vecte
CB con&longs;tituat, apertius e&longs;t, quàm ut oporteat id pluribus
hic o&longs;tendere.

Eximendus tamen e&longs;t omnis &longs;crupulus, o&longs;ten­
dendo angulum &longs;emper majorem fieri, quando di&longs;tantia po­
tentiæ E ab hypomochlio C major e&longs;t longitudine dati
vectis CB.

Intelligatur de&longs;criptus integer circulus BGIL à vecte CB
circumducto, & producatur BC in I, atque funiculus EB &longs;e­
cet peripheriam in G.

Tum vectis
po&longs;itio fiat CO, & funiculus EO
&longs;ecet peripheriam in H.

Mani­
fe&longs;tum ex 33. lib.
6. angulum
COE majorem e&longs;&longs;e angulo CBE:
nam, productâ OC in L, angulus
CBE in&longs;i&longs;tit arcui GI, angulus
autem COE in&longs;i&longs;tit arcui HL, qui
major e&longs;t arcu GI: omnes autem
acuti &longs;unt, quia in&longs;i&longs;tunt periphe­
riæ minori, quàm &longs;it &longs;emicirculus
(&longs;unt enim, ex 20.lib.3, &longs;ubdupli
&longs;uorum angulorum ad centrum
ii&longs;dem peripheriis in&longs;i&longs;tentium)
donec funiculus ED &longs;it Tangens circuli, & ex 18.lib.3. angu­
lum rectum con&longs;tituat in D.

Quòd &longs;i vectis adhuc trahatur à
potentia E, & veniat in H & in G, con&longs;tat ex 21.lib.1. angu-
lum CDE minorem e&longs;&longs;e angulo CHE, hunc verò minorem
angulo CGE, atque ita deinceps.

Idem contingit, &longs;i di&longs;tantia potentiæ R ab hypomochlio C
omnino æquali &longs;it longitudini vectis CB; nimirum trahendo
vectem ex B in S, angulus RSC major e&longs;t angulo RBC, & &longs;ic
deinceps trahendo ex S versùs R: quamvis enim &longs;emper &longs;it an­
gulus acutus, major tamen &longs;ubinde fit & major; quia manente
eadem di&longs;tantia RC æquali longitudini vectis, tam triangulum
CBR quàm CSR, & reliqua omnia &longs;unt I&longs;o&longs;celia; quò ergo
minor fit angulus ad C, eò major fit angulus ad ba&longs;iin in R,
cui, per 5. lib.
1. æqualis e&longs;t reliquus angulus ad eandem ba­
&longs;im.

At &longs;i di&longs;tantia potentiæ ab hypomochlio minor fuerit lon­
gitudine vectis, utique locus potentiæ e&longs;t intra circulum à
vecte circumducto de&longs;criptum.

Con&longs;ideranda e&longs;t igitur varia
funiculi ad vectem inclinatio: pro qua explicanda hæc præ­
mitto lemmata.
LEMMA I.

Si intra circulum a&longs;&longs;umptum fuerit punctum
E, in quo duæ rectæ lineæ BF & GH æqualiter à cen­
tro di&longs;tantes, ideóque ex 14.lib.3.æquales, &longs;e invicem &longs;e­
cent; & à centro C ducantur Radij CB & CG; anguli
CBF & CGH &longs;unt æquales.

Producatur BC in M, &
GC in N, ducantúrque rectæ
FM & HN.

Quia MB & NG
&longs;unt diametri, anguli in &longs;emicir­
culo BFM & GHN, ex 31.
lib.3. &longs;unt recti: igitur quadra­
ta BF & FM &longs;imul &longs;umpta
&longs;unt æqualia quadratis GH &
HN &longs;imul &longs;umptis, cum, ex
47. lib.
1. æqualia &longs;int qua­
drato diametri.

E&longs;t autem qua­
dratum BF æquale quadrato
GH, nam rectæ BF & GH
ex hypothe&longs;i &longs;unt æquales;
igitur quadrata FM & HN &longs;unt æqualia, ideoque rectæ
FM & HN &longs;unt æquales; ergo ex 28. lib.
3. &longs;ubtendunt
æquales peripherias, FHM & HMN; ergo ex 27.lib.3.
anguli FBM & HGN æqualibus peripheriis in&longs;i&longs;tentes
æquales &longs;unt.

Invenitur autem recta linea tran&longs;iens per E, quæ æqua­
lis &longs;it rectæ BF, &longs;i facto centro E, intervallo EF, de&longs;cri­
batur circulus FRG &longs;ecans datum circulum in G; nam ex
G per E ducitur recta GH quæ&longs;ita: e&longs;t enim, per 35.lib.3,
rectangulum GEH æquale rectangulo FEB; &longs;unt autem GE
& FE æquales Radij eju&longs;dem circuli ex con&longs;tructione; igitur
per 1. lib.
6, etiam EH & EB &longs;unt æquales; ergo tota GH
toti FB e&longs;t æqualis.
LEMMA II.

Si in puncto E intra circulum a&longs;&longs;ump­
to &longs;ecent &longs;e invicem duæ rectæ BF & IO inæquales,
ac proinde ut colligitur ex 15.lib.
3. inæqualiter à cir­
culi centro di&longs;tantes, ducantúrque ex centro Radij
CB, & CI; angulus factus à Radio cum lineâ remo­
tiore major e&longs;t angulo facto à Radio cum lineâ pro­
pinquiore.

Perficiantur triangula BFM & IOS rectangula ad F & O
ex 31.lib.3, quia MB & SI &longs;unt diametri.

Quadrata BF & FM
&longs;imul &longs;umpta, ex 47. lib.
1, &longs;unt æqualia quadratis IO & OS
&longs;imul &longs;umptis: Quia autem ex hypothe&longs;i recta IO remotior e&longs;t
à centro quàm BF, e&longs;t etiam minor, ut con&longs;tat ex 15. lib.
3:
igitur quadratum IO minus e&longs;t quadrato BF, adeóque qua­
dratum reliquum OS majus e&longs;t reliquo quadrato FM, &
linea OS major e&longs;t linea FM.

Quapropter etiam OS &longs;ub­
tendit majorem arcum OMS, & FM &longs;ubtendit minorem
arcum FOM, & angulus SIO factus à Radio cum lineâ re­
motiore major e&longs;t angulo MBF facto à Radio cum lineâ pro­
pinquiore.
LEMMA III.

Si in circulo ab extremitate diametri B
exeat recta linea BC circulum &longs;ecans, in qua a&longs;&longs;umatur
punctum D eam bifariam æqualiter dividens, & per
punctum D alia recta circulum &longs;ecans ducatur, hæc
vicinior e&longs;t centro, & major.

Ducatur ex centro S
recta SD, quæ per 3.lib.3.
facit angulum SDC rec­
tum: Tum per D alia
quædam linea EF tran­
&longs;eat, quæ utique cum rec­
ta SD facit angulum
SDF minorem recto, &
SDE majorem recto:
nam &longs;i angulos faceret
rectos, e&longs;&longs;et SD utrique
lineæ BC, & EF perpendicularis, &longs;ecaret EF bifariam in D
per 3.lib.
3. adeóque duæ rectæ BC & EF &longs;e mutuo bifariam
&longs;ecarent, contra 4. lib.
3. Igitur in rectam EF perpendicu­
laris ducta ex centro S erit SG cadens ad partes anguli acu­
ti.

Quapropter in triangulo SGD rectangulo ad G ma­
jor e&longs;t hypothenu&longs;a SD, quàm perpendiculum SG.

Ma­
gis ergo di&longs;tat linea BC quàm linea EF à centro, ac proinde
per 15.lib.3. illa e&longs;t minor, hæc major.
LEMMA IV.

Si in eâdem rectâ BC a&longs;&longs;umatur punctum
I inter extremitatem B & punctum medium D, atque,
ex centro directâ rectâ SIV, inter V & B alia quæ­
piam per I tran&longs;eat recta HL circulum &longs;ecans, quæ
& &longs;ecet perpendicularem SD, ex.

Angulus KDI e&longs;t rectus, angulus DKI, & qui e&longs;t illi ad
verticem, SKL e&longs;t acutus, igitur perpendicularis ex centro S
in rectam HL ducta cadit inter K & L, puta in M.

In trian­
gulo igitur rectangulo SMK major e&longs;t SK quàm SM, ex
18. lib.
1: ergo multò major e&longs;t SD quàm SM, ac prop­
terea ex 15. lib.
3. HL vicinior e&longs;t centro, & major
quàm BC.
LEMMA V.

Si in rectà BC ducta ab extremitate dia­
metri a&longs;&longs;umatur punctum N
ultra punctum medium D, at­
que ex S centro ductâ per N
lineâ rectâ SO, productâque
perpendiculari SD in P, tran­
&longs;eat per N alia quæpiam recta
QR inter P & B circulum &longs;e­
cans in que hæc pariter &longs;ecat in
T perpendicularem productam,
& e&longs;t à centro S remotior quàm recta BC atque pro­
inde minor.

Quia in Triangulo NDT rectangulo ad D, angulus DTN
e&longs;t acutus, utique in lineâ TS a&longs;&longs;umpto puncto S, ex hoc ca­
det in lineam QR perpendicularis inter puncta T, & R; quam
dico majorem e&longs;&longs;e perpendiculari SD.

Nam &longs;i ip&longs;a recta SN
perpendicularis fuerit ad RQ, e&longs;t triangulum SDN rectan­
gulum, adeóque hypothenu&longs;a SN major e&longs;t quàm latus SD:
Sin autem perpendicularis ad RQ cadat in V &longs;ecans rectam
BC in Z, utique SZ &longs;ubtendens angulum rectum SDZ ma­
jor e&longs;t quàm SD; e&longs;t autem SV major quàm SZ, ergo &
multo maior, quàm SD: ergo linea QR remotior e&longs;t quàm
BC, & minor.

Deinde &longs;i linea per N tran&longs;iens, & circulum &longs;ecans, extre­
mitatem alteram habeat non inter punctum P terminum per­
pendicularis SD productæ, atque B terminum rectæ BC; Vel
dividitur in N bifariam, & linea SN per 3.lib.3. e&longs;t perpendi­
cularis ad illam, quæ major e&longs;t quàm SD, ut pote oppo&longs;ita an­
gulo recto SDN: Vel dividitur inæqualiter.

Si &longs;egmentum
majus &longs;it in parte &longs;uperiori, hoc inter N & arcum OP, utique
perpendicularis ex S centro ducta in illam lineam cadens &longs;eca­
bit lineam BC inter puncta N & D, ac propterea o&longs;tendetur
major quàm SD, ut &longs;upra o&longs;ten&longs;um e&longs;t de linea RQ At &longs;i in
parte &longs;uperiori, hoc e&longs;t inter N & arcum OP &longs;it &longs;egmentam
minus, perpendicularis ex S in lineam ducta cadet in&longs;ra
punctum N, & à &longs;egmento majore ab&longs;cindet particulam in­
ter N & punctum perpendiculi interceptam.

Hæc particula &longs;i
fuerit æqualis particulæ ND, linea BC & linea ducta &longs;unt
æqualiter à centro remotæ; &longs;in illa particula minor fuerit quàm
ND, linea ducta remotior erit quàm BC; &longs;i demùm major fue­
rit quàm ND, linea ducta propinquior centro erit quam BC.

Finge &longs;cilicet ductam e&longs;&longs;e rectam PNX, & &longs;egmentum majus
e&longs;&longs;e NX; utique perpendicularis ex S bifariam &longs;ecans totam
PX cadit inter N & X, puta in Y.

E&longs;t igitur SYN triangu­
lum rectangulum in Y, & per 47. lib.1. quadratum SN æqua­
le e&longs;t quadratis NY & YS; atqui etiam triangulum SDN e&longs;t
rectangulum ex hypothe&longs;i, eandemque habet hypothenu&longs;am
SN; igitur quadrata ND & DS æqualia &longs;unt quadratis NY
& YS.

Quare &longs;i particulæ NY & ND æquales &longs;unt, æqualia
&longs;unt & earum quadrata, ac idcircò etiam æqualia &longs;unt quadra­
ta YS & DS, atque eorum latera æqualia &longs;unt, & lineæ BC
atque PX &longs;unt æqualiter remotæ.

Quod &longs;i particula NY mi­
nor e&longs;t quàm ND, etiam illius quadratum minus e&longs;t quadrato
hujus; ergo reliquum quadratum YS majus e&longs;t reliquo qua­
drato DS, atque adeò linea SY major e&longs;t quàm linea SD, &
linea ducta PX remotior e&longs;t atque minor quàm BC.

Si demum
NY major e&longs;t quàm ND, etiam illius quadratum majus e&longs;t hu­
jus quadrato, & reliquum quadratum YS minus e&longs;t reliquo
quadrato DS: igitur linea YS minor e&longs;t quàm linea DS, ac
propterea linea ducta PX propinquior e&longs;t centro, & major
quàm BC.

His præmi&longs;&longs;is facilis e&longs;t &longs;olutio propo&longs;itæ difficultatis, ut in­
note&longs;cat, utrùm in tractione minuatur labor, an augeatur,
quando potentiæ trahentis di&longs;tantia ab hypomochlio e&longs;t minor
longitudine vectis.

Dato &longs;i quidem loco potentiæ datur eju&longs;­
dem di&longs;tantia tùm ab hypomochlio, tum ab extremitate vectis,
cum qua funiculus connectitur; &longs;ed & datur ip&longs;ius vectis longi­
tudo: quare per Trigonometriam innote&longs;cit quantitas anguli,
cui opponitur vectis.

Nam &longs;i ille rectus e&longs;t, ut SDB, per lem­
ma 3. in tractione funiculus fit pars lineæ centro propinquio­
ris, quàm primò a&longs;&longs;umpta DB: igitur in tractione angulus fu­
niculi cum vecte fit &longs;en&longs;im acutior ex lemm.

2. augeturque
difficultas trahendi.

Si angulus vecti oppo&longs;itus &longs;it obtu&longs;us, ut
SIB, in tractione funiculus evadit pars lineæ propinquioris
centro, quam prima IB ex lemm.
4. & &longs;imiliter ex lemm.

2.
fit angulus magis acutus, atque trahentis labor augetur.

Si de­
mum angulus vecti oppo&longs;itus &longs;it acutus, ut SNB, ex lemm.3.
minuitur labor trahentis u&longs;que ad certum terminum, quandiu
&longs;cilicet vectis non &longs;ecat perpendiculariter primam funiculi po­
&longs;itionem NB, hoc e&longs;t vectis circumductus nondum e&longs;t SP;
tandiu enim funiculus e&longs;t pars lineæ à centro remotioris, & fa­
cit per lemm.
2. cum vecte angulum majorem.

Ubi autem
vectis fuerit SP, tunc ob&longs;ervandum e&longs;t, utrùm angulus SNP
rectus &longs;it, an obtu&longs;us, an acutus; & eadem methodo proce­
dendum e&longs;t, qua&longs;i prima funiculi po&longs;itio e&longs;&longs;et NP, ut innote&longs;­
cat, utrùm funiculus in ulteriori tractione fiat pars lineæ re­
motioris, an verò propinquioris, ac proinde fiat angulus &longs;ub­
inde major, an verò minor.

Quæ de Vecte in alterâ extremitate hypomochlium, in alte­
râ potentiam habente hactenus exempli gratia explicata &longs;unt,
facilè referuntur ad vectem, quando hypomochlium, aut po­
tentia inter extremitates collocantur; &longs;emper enim attendenda
e&longs;t hypomochlij di&longs;tantia à potentia trahente, ut potentiæ obli­
què trahentis momenta innote&longs;cant; angulus &longs;cilicet funiculi
cum vecte pendet ab hypomochlij puncto, circa quod fit vectis
conver&longs;io.

Quoniam autem hujus capitis initio momentorum Rationem
juxta diver&longs;am potentiæ applicationem ex arcubus vi eju&longs;dem
impetùs de&longs;criptis æ&longs;timandam e&longs;&longs;e dictum e&longs;t, & quis forta&longs;&longs;e
&longs;u&longs;picetur arduum e&longs;&longs;e huju&longs;modi arcus inter &longs;e comparare;
animadvertat ex Tabulis Trigonometricis eju&longs;dem arcûs Si­
num & Tangentem ii&longs;dem planè numeris definiri, quando ar­
cus valde exiguus e&longs;t.

Quapropter cum quilibet arcus minor
&longs;it &longs;uâ Tangente, & major Sinu, arcuum minorum Rationem
citra ullum erroris periculum explicare po&longs;&longs;umus per eorum
Sinus.

Cum verò hîc, ubi de potentiæ ad vectem &longs;ecundùm
diver&longs;os angulos applicatæ momentis &longs;ermo e&longs;t, non ni&longs;i mini­
mi arcus a&longs;&longs;umendi &longs;int, eorum Ratio eadem a&longs;&longs;umitur, quæ
Sinuum.

Quare &longs;i vectis &longs;it AB, hypomochlium C, vis potentiæ &
directio motûs potentiæ BH: loco arcûs BK, qui in motu vi
