talis impetús cum hac directione de&longs;cribitur; a&longs;&longs;umi pote&longs;t an­
guli HBO, Radio BH, Sinus HO,
qui e&longs;t æqualis Sinui arcus BK Ra­
dio CB.

E&longs;t autem minimus ar­
cus longe minor quàm arcus BK,
&longs;ed claritatis gratia arcum notabi­
lem & con&longs;picuum a&longs;&longs;umere opor­
tuit.

E&longs;t igitur potentiæ ad an­
gulum rectum in B applicatæ mo­
mentum, ad eju&longs;dem potentiæ ad
angulum HBO acutum applicatæ momentum, ut Radius BH
ad acuti anguli Sinum HO.

Jam intellige vectem AB converti, & lineam BH produci,
donec in D ad angulos rectos occurrat vecti habenti po&longs;itio­
nem EF.

Dico potentiæ ad perpendiculum & obliquè appli­
catæ momenta invicem comparata ita e&longs;&longs;e, ac &longs;i eadem poten­
tia tam in F quàm in D ad angulum rectum applicaretur, quia
ut BH ad HO, ita e&longs;t FC ad CD.

Ducatur enim ex D ad CB
perpendicularis DG, quæ e&longs;t parallela ip&longs;i HO. quare per 4.
lib.
6. ut BH ad HO, ita BD ad DG, & per 8. lib.
6. ut BD
ad DG, ita BC, hoc e&longs;t FC, ad CD: igitur per 11. lib.
5. ut
BH ad HO, ita FC ad CD; hoc e&longs;t ut Radius ad Sinum angu­
li, &longs;ecundùm quem potentia dirigitur, ita momentum poten­
tiæ perpendiculariter applicatæ ad momentum eju&longs;dem obli­
què ad angulum acutum, vel obtu&longs;um applicatæ.

Nam &longs;i po­
tentia in B dirigat &longs;uum motum &longs;ecundum lineam BI, utique
po&longs;ito Radio BI, Sinus anguli ABI obtu&longs;i e&longs;t IL, & Ratio mo­
menti potentiæ in B applicatæ &longs;ecundùm angulum rectum, ad
momentum eju&longs;dem potentiæ in B applicatæ &longs;ecundùm angu­
lum obtu&longs;um ABI, e&longs;t ut BI ad IL.

Producatur IB, donec in
D perpendicularis cadat &longs;upra CF rectam æqualem ip&longs;i CB.

Quia triangula BIL & BCD rectangula ad L & D, & æquales
angulos ad verticem B habentia, &longs;imilia &longs;unt, e&longs;t ut BI ad IL,
ita BC ad CD per 4. lib.
6. Perinde igitur in extremitate B ad
angulum obtu&longs;um ABI applicata potentia operatur, atque &longs;i ad
angulum rectum applicaretur in D puncto vectis EF, qui idem
ponitur e&longs;&longs;e ac vectis AB: & momenta potentiæ &longs;unt ut FC
ad CD.

Dato itaque angulo, &longs;ecundum quem potentia applicatur
ad vectem, &longs;i angulus &longs;it Rectus, momentum e&longs;t ut Radius; &longs;in
autem angulus acutus &longs;it vel obtu&longs;us, momentum e&longs;t ut Sinus
eju&longs;dem anguli; atque adeò comparando inter &longs;e huju&longs;modi
angulos, Ratio illorum erit eadem, quæ e&longs;t Sinuum.

Hinc
datus vectis AB hypomochlium ha­
bens in C, &longs;i fuerit ita inclinatus, ut
po&longs;itionem habeat EF, potentia in E
deor&longs;um premens per rectam EG per­
pendicularem ad CB, momentum ha­
bet ut CG; & &longs;i po&longs;itionem habeat IH,
potentia in I deor&longs;um premens aut tra­
hens juxta rectam IK, quæ producta
incidat perpendicularis ad rectam AB
in L, momentum habet ut CL.

Quare
ex E in B augentur prementis aut trahentis momenta, quæ ex
B in I minuuntur.

Id quod iis etiam, qui campanas pul&longs;ant, manife&longs;tum e&longs;t: &longs;i
enim intelligatur vecti CB adhærere campanam, cujus cen­
trum gravitatis &longs;it O, utique dum B deprimitur, O elevatur,
&longs;ed elevandi difficultas cre&longs;cit, tum quia centrum gravitatis O
arcum de&longs;cribens circa punctum C, æqualibus temporibus in­
quales, atque &longs;emper majores habet a&longs;cen&longs;us juxta incremen­
ta Sinuum Ver&longs;orum, tum quia ex depre&longs;&longs;ione vectis ex B in I
facto angulo funis & vectis &longs;emper obtu&longs;iore, momenta poten­
tiæ minuuntur: & licet in reditu ex I in B cre&longs;cerent, &longs;i quis
vectem &longs;ur&longs;um traheret, hoc nihil juvat potentiam deor&longs;um
trahentem ad elevandam campanam, quæ &longs;ponte &longs;ua de&longs;cen­
dens elevat vectis caput, cui funis adnectitur.

Propterea majo­
ribus gravioribú&longs;que campanis non &longs;implicem vectem CB &longs;ed
rotam, aut rotæ &longs;egmentum adjungunt, cujus excavatæ peri­
metro funis in&longs;eritur; qui dum trahitur, &longs;emper e&longs;t Tangens
circuli; atque ideo ad Radium circuli, qua&longs;i e&longs;&longs;et novus atque
novus vectis, applicatur potentia trahens ad angulum rectum.
CAPUT VIII.
Oneris ex Vecte pendentis momentum inquiritur.

COntingit aliquando pondus vecte elevandum fune con­
necti, & pendulum ex vecte &longs;u&longs;pendi.

Nemo dubitat, an
gravitas ponderis ibi &longs;ua exerceat momenta, ubi cum vecte
connectitur; funis &longs;i quidem intentus congruit lineæ directio­
nis, qua pondus ip&longs;um nititur in centrum gravium: verùm non
eandem percipi in elevando difficultatem experientia te&longs;tatur
pro varia vectis inclinatione.

Si enim ex vecte AB horizontali
hypomochlium in extremitate B ha­
bente, pondus D &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;um ex C
pendeat ad angulos rectos, omnia &longs;ua
momenta exercet pro ratione di&longs;tan­
tiæ CB ab hypomochlio.

At &longs;i ele­
vatus vectis po&longs;itionem habeat EB,
& C venerit in F, pondus verò pen­
dulum D venerit in G, ita ut linea
Directionis in centrum gravium congruat funiculo &longs;u&longs;penden­
ti FG; etiam&longs;i FB æqualis &longs;it ip&longs;i CB, non eadem tamen mo­
menta habet pondus adversùs eandem potentiam ex A tran&longs;latam
in E; quia &longs;cilicet angulus GFB e&longs;t acutus, DCB autem rectus.

Id explicare ex iis, quæ &longs;uperiori capite di&longs;putata &longs;unt, non
erit difficile, &longs;i animadvertamus in vectibus &longs;ecundi & tertij
generis utrumque genus conjungi: quemadmodum enim po­
tentia conatur adversùs gravitatem ponderis, ita pondus cona­
tur adversùs vim potentiæ: & in hoc conatu vici&longs;&longs;im exercent
munus potentiæ & ponderis.

Finge &longs;iquidem duos homines ap­
plicari vecti AB, alterum quidem in A, alterum verò in C, &longs;ed
in adver&longs;a conantes; uterque e&longs;t potentia, uterque e&longs;t pondus,
dum &longs;ibi reluctantur.

Anne ita hæc vocabula intra certos fines
coërceri exi&longs;timas, ut potentiæ nomine illum &longs;olum donandum
putes, qui reliquum vincit?

&longs;ed quid, &longs;i horum hominum co-
natus &longs;int reciprocè ut eorum di&longs;tantiæ ab hypomochlio B, &
A quidem conetur ut CB, C autem conetur ut AB; utique
neuter &longs;uperat; nec tamen negari pote&longs;t ideò contingere mo­
mentorum æqualitatem inter inæquales conatus, quia vecti ap­
plicantur: &longs;unt igitur &longs;ibi vici&longs;&longs;im potentia & pondus.

Si ita­
que A e&longs;t potentia, & C pondus; vectis e&longs;t &longs;ecundi generis:
Si verò C e&longs;t potentia, & A pondus, vectis e&longs;t tertij generis.

Illud igitur quod de hominibus dicitur, de reliquis omnibus
vim movendi habentibus dictum intelligitur: nihil &longs;i quidem
intere&longs;t, utrùm animata &longs;int, an inanima, quæ vecti applican­
tur, & in oppo&longs;ita partes conantur.

Et quamvis non interce­
dat inter ip&longs;os conatus momentorum æqualitas, quam con&longs;e­
quatur quies, &longs;ed efficiatur motus; ita tamen id quod prævalet,
e&longs;t potentia ad motum efficiendum, ut id quod vincitur, & re­
&longs;i&longs;tit, &longs;it potentia ad motum retardandum.

In omni itaque
vecte &longs;ive &longs;ecundi, &longs;ive tertij generi &longs;it, utrumque genus ami­
co, nec &longs;olubili fœdere copulantur.

In vecte autem primi ge­
neris idem genus manet, licèt vici&longs;&longs;im habeant rationem po­
tentiæ & ponderis ad movendum & retardandum, &longs;imiliter
enim potentiæ & ponderi, licet inæqualibus intervallis, inter­
jacet hypomochlium.

Hîc itaque, ubi oneris ex vecte pendentis momentum inqui­
ritur, con&longs;iderandus e&longs;t vectis tertij generis, in quo gravitas in
C, aut in F po&longs;ita exercet munus potentiæ conantis deprimere
vim &longs;ur&longs;um connitentem in A, aut in E.

Quare in po&longs;itione vectis
horizontali, cum &longs;it angulus rectus DCB, neque gravitas illa
vectem versùs hypomochlium B urgeat, aut cum ab illo re­
trahat, omnia &longs;ua momenta obtinet, quæ in hac à fulcro di&longs;tantiâ
gravitati huic convenire po&longs;&longs;unt.

At elevato vecte ita, ut fiat an­
gulus acutus GFB, licet eadem maneat gravitas, eadémque ab
hypomochlio di&longs;tantia, non tamen eadem manent momenta, &longs;ed
decre&longs;cunt pro ratione Sinûs anguli, ut &longs;uperiori capite dictum
e&longs;t.

Producta igitur intelligatur linea directionis FG u&longs;que ad
horizontalem in H: po&longs;ito Radio BF, hoc e&longs;t BC, e&longs;t BH Si­
nus anguli GFB; ac proinde ut BC ad BH, ita momentum
oneris pendentis ex vecte horizontali, ad momentum eju&longs;dem
oneris pendentis ex codem vecte inclinato.

Hinc e&longs;t, inclinato
vecte EB, tantumdem conatûs adhibendum e&longs;&longs;e in E ad &longs;u&longs;ti-
nendum onus G, quanto conatu opus e&longs;&longs;et in vecte horizontali
AB ad &longs;u&longs;tinendum idem onus, &longs;i penderet ex H.

Quoniam igi­
tur di&longs;tantia BH minor e&longs;t quàm BC, major e&longs;t Ratio AB ad
BH, quàm eju&longs;dem AB ad BC, ex 8.lib.5. ideóque faciliùs &longs;u&longs;ti­
netur idem onus vecte inclinato, quàm vecte horizontali.

Quod &longs;i ex G centro gravitatis oneris ductam intelligas ad
vectem EB rectam perpendicularem GI, habes &longs;imiliter mo
mentorum differentiam, quæ &longs;cilicet intercedit inter FG, & GI,
&longs;i FG repræ&longs;entet omnia momenta in vecte horizontali: &longs;unt
enim triangula FIG & FHB rectangula, communem angulum
ad F habentia, adeóque &longs;imilia, & ut FB ad BH, ita FG ad GI.

Cave autem ne putes (ut non pauci hallucinantur) ita ex I ter­
mino rectæ CI perpendicularis de&longs;umendam e&longs;&longs;e men&longs;uram
decrementi momentorum, ut perinde &longs;e habeat, qua&longs;i pondus
e&longs;&longs;et in I: hoc enim à veritate longi&longs;&longs;imè abe&longs;&longs;e deprehendes, &longs;i
manente eadem vectis inclinatione, & eadem oneris gravitate,
funiculo longiore onus &longs;u&longs;penderis; quandoquidem ctiam
punctum I magis accedet ad hypomochlium B, nec tamen adhi­
bito longiore funiculo adeò minuuntur momenta; alioquin
tam longo funiculo &longs;u&longs;pendere po&longs;&longs;es onus, ut recta ex one­
ris centro ducta ad vectem EB perpendicularis caderet in B,
atque ideo nullum e&longs;&longs;et gravitatis momentum, qua&longs;i onus e&longs;&longs;et
in B: id autem omnino fal&longs;um e&longs;t.

Quando autem dicitur faciliùs à potentiâ &longs;u&longs;tineri idem onus
&longs;u&longs;pen&longs;um vecte inclinato, quàm vecte horizontali, ita intelli­
gendum e&longs;t, ut linea directionis motus potentiæ &longs;u&longs;tinentis
eundem &longs;emper faciat cum vecte angulum: nam &longs;i hæc linea
alium atque alium efficiat angulum, etiam potentiæ momenta
variantur, quæ cum oneris momentis comparanda &longs;unt.

Hinc
e&longs;t in vecte primi generis CD,
cujus hypomochlium O, &longs;i po­
tentia & pondus &longs;int gravia M
& N, licèt inclinato vecte, ut
habeat po&longs;itionem RS, receden­
tibus angulis à rectitudine, &longs;in­
gulorum momenta minora fiant,
non tamen mutari momentorum
potentiæ & ponderis invicem
comparatorum Rationem; quia &longs;cilicet &longs;ingulorum momenta
proportionaliter minuuntur.

Cum enim gravia &longs;emper nitan­
tur juxta &longs;uas lineas directionis in centrum gravium, huju&longs;mo­
di lineæ parallelæ cen&longs;entur, & cum vecte duos angulos effi­
ciunt duobus rectis æquales, ac proinde &longs;i alter acutus fuerit,
alter e&longs;t obtu&longs;us &longs;upplementum acuti ad duos rectos.

Sicut au­
tem in eodem circulo idem e&longs;t Sinus anguli acuti, atque obtu&longs;i,
qui compleat duos rectos; ita in diver&longs;is circulis huju&longs;modi an­
gulorum Sinus proportionales &longs;unt &longs;uis Radiis.

Quapropter in­
clinato vecte, ut &longs;it RS, gravia nituntur deor&longs;um juxta lineas
directionis ST & RV parallelas, quæ occurrunt perpendicu­
lares horizontali in Z & V.

Momentum igitur gravis T ad
momentum æqualis, &longs;eu eju&longs;dem gravis N e&longs;t ut OZ ad OD,
& momentum gravis V ad momentum æqualis, &longs;eu eju&longs;dem
gravis M e&longs;t ut OV ad OC.

Quare in vecte RS inclinato
momenta gravium pendentium &longs;unt ut OZ ad OV.

Quia ve­
rò triangula RVO, SZO rectangula, & angulos ad verticem
O æquales habentia, &longs;unt &longs;imilia, per 4. lib.
6. ut OS ad OR,
hoc e&longs;t ut OD ad OC, ita OZ ad OV.

Manet itaque ea­
dem momentorum Ratio invicem comparatorum, &longs;ive integra
in vecte horizontali, &longs;ive diminuta in vecte inclinato &longs;int &longs;ingu­
lorum momenta.

At in vecte &longs;ecundi aut tertij generis, &longs;i potentia non fuerit
vivens, fieri non pote&longs;t ut eadem &longs;ervetur momentorum Ratio
inter potentiam & pondus, ni&longs;i fortè in eodem medio ho­
rum alterutrum grave e&longs;&longs;et, alterum leve; ut &longs;i vectis AK
intra aquam con&longs;titutus adnexum
haberet in K inflatum ut rem V,
in L verò pendulus e&longs;&longs;et lapis:
tunc enim, &longs;i uter a&longs;cendens trahat
vectem in B, elevabit lapidem
pendulum, ut &longs;it angulus ICA
acutus, & angulus ABF obtu­
&longs;us; qui cum æqualis &longs;it alterno
BCI (&longs;unt enim FBE & CI paral­
lelæ, quia utraque ad horizontem
perpendicularis e&longs;t) &longs;imilem habet Sinum Sinui acuti ICA &longs;e­
cundum Rationem Radiorum BA & CA, hoc e&longs;t KA & LA;
atque ut BA ad CA, ita e&longs;t EA ad IA; &longs;imilia quippe &longs;unt
triangula ABE & ACI.

Cæterùm &longs;i rotulæ X in&longs;i&longs;tens funi­
culus jungeret vectis extremitatem K & pondus aliquod ad­
nexum in fungens munere potentiæ elevantis; hoc de&longs;cen­
dens ex S in M elevaret vectem in B, & lapidem, qui penderet
ex C: &longs;ed angulus ABX e&longs;&longs;et multò obtu&longs;ior quàm Supple­
mentum acuti ICA ad duos rectos, ac proinde Sinus anguli
ABX e&longs;&longs;et multo minor quàm EA Sinus anguli obtu&longs;i ABF:
igitur multo minor e&longs;&longs;et Ratio momenti potentiæ applicatæ in
B ad momentum ponderis in C, quàm &longs;it Ratio BA ad CA,
hoc e&longs;t KA ad LA.

Sola igitur potentia vivens pote&longs;t ita &longs;ui
motûs directionem inflectere, ut eundem faciat cum vecte an­
gulum, ideóque elevans vectem acquirat majorem &longs;u&longs;tinendi
facilitatem.

His con&longs;equens e&longs;t, quantò altiùs &longs;upra horizontem eleva­
tur vectis cum pondere pendulo, tantò validiùs a pondere pre­
mi aut urgeri hypomochlium A.

Nam quemadmodum in vecte
horizontali AK pondus in L &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;um magis premit hypomo­
chlium A vicinum quàm potentiam K remotam ex hypothe&longs;i,
ita elevato vecte multo magis premitur hypomochlium, quia
quodammodo propiùs illi admovetur pondus in I quàm in L,
&longs;uáque innatá gravitate in vecte elevato conatur versù hypo­
mochlium qua&longs;i &longs;ecedens à potentia; ut nihil dicam de vecte
ip&longs;o, cujus gravitas, maximam partem, innititur fulcro.
CAPUT IX.
An duo pondus ge&longs;tantes æqualiter premantur.

HActenus di&longs;putatis proximè affinis e&longs;t præ&longs;ens quæ&longs;tio, qua
inquirimus, utrùm æqualis &longs;it labor duorum in codem pon­
dere ge&longs;tando con&longs;entientium.

Et quidem &longs;i movendum &longs;it
pondus atque trahendum, cur duo &longs;imul faciliùs illud mo­
veant, quàm &longs;inguli, omnes intelligunt; quia plus impetûs à
duobus producitur, quàm à &longs;ingulis; & quem impetum mo-
vendo oneri parem &longs;inguli multo conatu producerent, &longs;ingu­
lis in parte impetûs efficiendâ minùs conantibus, totus produ­
citur, totique oneri imprimitur.

At in pondere &longs;u&longs;tentando,
cujus gravitas in partes non dividitur, quomodo hæc &longs;ingulis
levior accidat, &longs;i plures in &longs;u&longs;tentando con&longs;pirent, quàm &longs;i &longs;in­
gulis imponeretur, tunc maximè cùm nullum impetum &longs;ur&longs;um
gravitatis conatui adver&longs;antem producant, non ita explicatu
facile exi&longs;timant aliqui.

Verum ex rationibus vectis &longs;atis ma­
nife&longs;ta &longs;olutio eruitur.

Claritatis autem gratiâ, ob&longs;ervandum
e&longs;t, an onus palangâ (ut cum bajuli dolium ex funibus &longs;u&longs;pen­
&longs;um transferunt) an verò &longs;ubjectis humeris &longs;u&longs;tineatur.

Et primo &longs;it palanga AB, cujus extremitates à ge&longs;tatoribus
&longs;u&longs;tineantur; &longs;it autem onus in C.

Duplex effectus hîc con&longs;i­
derandus e&longs;t, videlicet oneris &longs;u&longs;ten­
tatio, & ge&longs;tatorum pre&longs;&longs;io; Si pri­
mum re&longs;picias, ge&longs;tatores A & B ratio­
nem habent potentiæ efficientis &longs;u­
&longs;tentationem, atque impedientis motum oneris &longs;uá gravitate
deor&longs;um conantis: Si &longs;ecundum, idem onus C munus potentiæ
pre&longs;&longs;ionem efficientis exercet, dum &longs;ecum palangam deor&longs;um
trahens, oppo&longs;itos ge&longs;tatorum humeros comprimit, aut &longs;i ma­
nibus palanga ge&longs;tatur contentos contracto&longs;que brachiorum
mu&longs;culos, quantum pote&longs;t, di&longs;trahit, atque relaxat.

Sunt
enim duo conatus, ge&longs;tatorum &longs;cilicet & oneris, motum in op­
po&longs;itas partes efficere valentes, ni&longs;i &longs;ibi mutuo impedimento
e&longs;&longs;ent: hinc &longs;i ge&longs;tatores conari ce&longs;&longs;ent, onus de&longs;cendit; Si ex
improvi&longs;o abruptis funibus onus à palangâ &longs;ejungatur, ge&longs;tato­
res palangam &longs;ur&longs;um attollunt, &longs;ive æqualiter, &longs;ive inæqualiter,
pro ut æquales aut inæquales &longs;unt eorum conatus.

Quare æ&longs;ti­
manda res e&longs;t ex motu, quem &longs;inguli conantes efficerent tum
in &longs;e, tum in oppo&longs;ito conante, ni&longs;i prohiberentur momento­
rum æqualitate.

Sic potentia in A &longs;uo conatu elevaret pondus
in C po&longs;itum, & circa centrum B arcum de&longs;criberent; &longs;imili­
ter potentia in B &longs;uo conatu elevaret pondus idem in C po&longs;i­
tum, & circa centrum A &longs;uos motus perficerent.

Quod ita­
que ad &longs;u&longs;tentationem &longs;pectat, ge&longs;tatores A & B vici&longs;&longs;im ha­
bent rationem potentiæ & fulcri; nam &longs;i A e&longs;t potentia, ful­
crum e&longs;t B; atque vici&longs;&longs;im &longs;i B &longs;it potentia, fulcrum e&longs;t A; &
e&longs;t duplex vectis &longs;ecundi generis, &longs;cilicet AB & BA. Q: od
verò ad pre&longs;&longs;ionem attinet, in qua onus C e&longs;t potentia premens,
ge&longs;tatores vici&longs;&longs;im habent rationem fulcri atque ponderi pre&longs;­
&longs;i; & e&longs;t duplex vectis tertij generis, quo utitur unica poten­
tia, &longs;icut in duplici vecte &longs;ecundi generis unicum e&longs;t pondus,
quod &longs;u&longs;tinent duæ potentiæ.

In vecte igitur &longs;ecundi generis po&longs;ito fulcro B, momentum
potentiæ A &longs;ur&longs;um nitentis, ad momentum ponderis C deor­
&longs;um conantis, e&longs;t ut AB ad CB; ac propterea potentia &longs;u&longs;tinere
valens &longs;ine vecte pondus C, ad potentiam vecte AB &longs;u&longs;tinentem
idem pondus C, e&longs;t ut AB ad CB; quanto igitur CB minor e&longs;t
quàm AB, tanto minor potentia requiritur in A, quàm require­
retur in C, &longs;i in C pondus &longs;ine vecte &longs;u&longs;tineretur.

Idem quod
de potentiâ A, po&longs;ito fulcro B, dictum e&longs;t, dic vici&longs;&longs;im de poten­
tiâ B; po&longs;ito fulcro A; Requiritur enim in B potentia ut CA, ad
potentiam, quæ e&longs;&longs;et ut BA, &longs;i &longs;ine vecte pondus in C &longs;u&longs;tinere­
tur.

Hinc e&longs;t vires &longs;u&longs;tinendi requiri reciprocè tantas, quanta
e&longs;t Ratio di&longs;tantiarum à pondere ip&longs;orum &longs;u&longs;tinentium: vires &longs;i
quidem in A requiruntur ut CB, & vires in B ut CA.

Si itaque
æquali intervallo pondus medium di&longs;tet à ge&longs;tatoribus, æqua­
liter eos conari oportet, ut illud &longs;u&longs;tineant in C: at &longs;i inæquali­
ter ab iis remotum &longs;it, ut in D, requiruntur in A vires tam eò ma­
jores quàm in B, quantò major e&longs;t di&longs;tantia DB quàm DA.

Quapropter datá virium inæqualitate; &longs;tatim innote&longs;cet, in quo
palangæ puncto adnectendum &longs;it onus; &longs;i nimirum palangæ lon­
gitudo dividatur &longs;ecundùm Rationem virium, & ge&longs;tatores re­
ciprocè collocentur.
Sint enim ex.

gr. duo, quorum alter vires
habeat ut 3, alter ut 2: concipe totam longitudinem AB in
quinque partes di&longs;tinctam, & hinc accipe duas AD, hinc verò
tres BD: locus ponderi debitus e&longs;t punctum D, in quod cadit
divi&longs;io in duas partes juxta datam Rationem: locus debilioris
ge&longs;tatoris e&longs;t in palangæ extremitate B, ad quam &longs;pectat major
di&longs;tantia ab onere in C po&longs;ito.

Similiter virium inæqualitatem
deprehendes, &longs;i pondere in medio puncto C po&longs;ito, alter &longs;e præ­
gravari &longs;entiat: palanga enim ita promota, ut pondere in D
con&longs;tituto neuter &longs;e ultra vires prægravatum experiatur, indi­
cabit vires ge&longs;tatoris A e&longs;&longs;e ut DB, ad vires ge&longs;tatoris B, quæ
&longs;unt ut DA.

At &longs;i vectem tertij generis, quatenus ge&longs;tatorum pre&longs;&longs;io ab
onere efficitur, con&longs;ideremus; po&longs;ito fulcro in A, potentia in C
aut in D exi&longs;tens non premit ge&longs;tatorem B perinde, atque &longs;i
nullo intercedente vecte ge&longs;tator e&longs;&longs;et pariter in C aut in D, &longs;ed
tanto minus, quanto minor e&longs;t CA aut DA, quam BA: idem­
que de ge&longs;tatore A, po&longs;ito fulcro in B, dicendum e&longs;t.

Quare re­
ciprocæ &longs;unt pre&longs;&longs;iones di&longs;tantiis ge&longs;tatorum ab onere, & A
premitur ut CB aut DB, B autem premitur ut CA aut DA.

Cum enim vis ip&longs;a gravitatis oneris deor&longs;um conantis apta &longs;it
circa centrum A moveri pro ratione di&longs;tantiæ CA aut DA, uti­
que in B motum efficere debet pro ratione di&longs;tantiæ BA: e&longs;t
autem CA major quam DA ex hypothe&longs;i, igitur, ex 8.lib.5.ma­
jor e&longs;t Ratio momenti CA quàm momenti DA ad idem mo­
mentum BA, ac proinde major pre&longs;&longs;io ge&longs;tatoris B efficitur ab
onere in C, quam in D, collocato.

Contra verò ge&longs;tatorem A
magis premit onus in D quam in C po&longs;itum, quia motus re&longs;pi­
cit centrum B, atque adeo ad eandem di&longs;tantiam AB major
e&longs;t Ratio di&longs;tantiæ DB majoris, quam CB minoris di&longs;tantiæ:
eadem autem e&longs;t di&longs;tantiarum, & motuum Ratio, ac proinde
momentorum.

Ob&longs;erva autem mihi ideò de ge&longs;tatoribus oneris &longs;ermonem
fui&longs;&longs;e, ut duplicem effectum &longs;u&longs;tentationis atque pre&longs;&longs;ionis ex­
pre&longs;&longs;ius recogno&longs;cerem; qui enim onus ge&longs;tando &longs;u&longs;tentant,
mu&longs;culorum contentione conantes elidunt impetum oneris de­
or&longs;um nitentis, & aliquid efficientes, dum Activè re&longs;i&longs;tunt, no­
men Potentiæ merentur.

At &longs;i onus palangæ connexum &longs;u&longs;ti­
neretur à duobus fulcris in extremitate po&longs;itis, hæc utique cùm
oneris gravitati nullo conatu adver&longs;arentur, &longs;olam re&longs;i&longs;tentiam
Formalem &longs;uâ &longs;oliditate exercerent, impediendo ne onus cum
palangâ de&longs;cenderet, &longs;ed nullam haberent Re&longs;i&longs;tentiam Activam,
quæ illis Potentiæ vocabulum tribueret.

In his unicus pre&longs;&longs;ionis
effectus attendendus e&longs;t, & validiori fulcro propiùs admoven­
dum e&longs;t onus, ne fortè fulcrum infirmius nimiâ pre&longs;&longs;ione coga­
tur &longs;uccumbere.

Unum adhuc in palangæ ge&longs;tatoribus attendendum e&longs;t, &longs;i vi­
rium inæqualium fuerint, & onus non ita &longs;it palangæ applica­
tum, ut ejus di&longs;tantiæ à ge&longs;tatoribus &longs;int permutatim ut eorum­
dem vires; nimirum contingere po&longs;&longs;e, ut validior ge&longs;tator dum
juxta &longs;uas vires conatur adversùs onus, magis premat infirmio­
rem ge&longs;tatorem, quam premeretur fulcrum infirmius, &longs;i unâ
cum validiore fulcro eandem gravitatem &longs;u&longs;tineret.

Quia vide­
licet in eâdem palanga AB vectem primi generis con&longs;iderare
po&longs;&longs;umus, in quo onus C deor&longs;um nitens contra vim ge&longs;tatoris
habeat rationem hypomochlij, & validior ge&longs;tator A &longs;it poten­
tia repellens ge&longs;tatorem infirmiorem B conantem adver&longs;us
onus, ac proinde illum premat: quemadmodum &longs;i funi deor&longs;um
firmiter alligato in&longs;ereretur palanga, cui humeros &longs;ubjicerent
duo inæqualibus viribus &longs;ur&longs;um conantes; con&longs;tat enim infir­
miorem à validiore premi, & e&longs;&longs;e vectem primi generis.

Ex quo
vides, cur bajuli dato invicem &longs;igno curent, ne alter alterum
præveniat in elevanda palanga; ne &longs;cilicet qui &longs;egnior fuerit,
pre&longs;&longs;ionem, non ab onere adhuc jacente & nondum elevato, &longs;ed
à &longs;ocio diligentiùs &longs;uam palangæ extremitatem elevante, reci­
piat.

Hæc eadem, quæ de onere &longs;ublevando &longs;unt dicta, de eodem
trahendo pariter intelligantur, &longs;i vecti illigatum &longs;it onus, &
vectis extremitatibus jungantur trahentes: horum enim cona­
tus e&longs;&longs;e oportet permutatim in Ratione di&longs;tantiarum ab onere,
hoc e&longs;t à vectis puncto, cui onus adnectitur.

Id non &longs;ine jucun­
dâ quadam animi titillatione vidi aliquando ob&longs;ervatum à ru&longs;ti­
co, qui alterius equorum currum trahentium defatigati laborem
mi&longs;eratus, tran&longs;ver&longs;arium, cui ambo adjungebantur, ita tran&longs;tu­
lit, ut in partes inæquales à temone di&longs;tingueretur, & longior
tran&longs;ver&longs;arij pars ad debiliorem equum &longs;pectaret.

Inerant &longs;iqui­
dem tran&longs;ver&longs;ario tria foramina, per quæ temoni nectebatur fer­
reo clavo; unum quidem plane æqualiter ab extremitatibus abe­
rat, reliqua duo hinc & hinc à medio di&longs;tabant modico quidem
&longs;ed congruo intervallo, ut &longs;i equus dexter defatigaretur, clavus
immitteretur &longs;ini&longs;tro foramini, aut contra dextro, &longs;i &longs;ini&longs;ter
equus languidiùs traheret.

Verùm cautè modica intervalla de­
finierat, ne nimia fieret momentorum inæqualitas; quod enim
alteri equorum laboris demebatur, addebatur reliquo.

Quando autem non palangâ defertur onus, &longs;ed ip&longs;um imme­
diate à duobus &longs;u&longs;tinetur, eadem pror&longs;us e&longs;t philo&longs;ophandi ra­
tio, quandoquidem e&longs;t quodammodo onus vecti conjunctum,
atque juxta vectis longitudinem di&longs;tributum.

Quamvis verò
&longs;ingulis partibus &longs;ua gravitas in&longs;it, quia tamen in unam coale&longs;­
cunt gravitatem, ideò totius molis gravitas ibi intelligenda e&longs;t,
ubi e&longs;t centrum gravitatis; vectis autem longitudo æ&longs;timanda
e&longs;t in lineá jungente puncta, quibus ge&longs;tatores aut &longs;u&longs;tinentes
applicantur: Ex quibus punctis &longs;i ponamus exire lineas paral­
lelas lineæ directionis exeunti ex centro gravitatis, cadent om­
nes ad perpendiculum in lineam horizontalem tran&longs;euntem per
centrum gravitatis, aut illi parallelam.

Harum igitur parallela­
rum, quæ directionem conatûs oppo&longs;iti gravitationi ponderis
referunt, di&longs;tantia à lineâ directionis centri gravitatis, ip&longs;orum
deferentium conatum in &longs;u&longs;tinendo, permutatim &longs;umpta de­
finiet; quæcumque demùm &longs;it oneris figura.

Sit onus deferendum, cujus centrum gravitatis E; linea per
ge&longs;tatores tran&longs;iens, haben&longs;que rationem vectis, &longs;it BC, quæ
intelligatur horizonti parallela.

In hanc igitur ad angulos
rectos cadit linea directionis EF; & ge&longs;tatores in quocumque
puncto lineæ BC fuerint, permutatim habent momenta &longs;u&longs;ti­
nendi, aut recipiunt momenta pre&longs;&longs;onis pro Ratione di&longs;tan­
tiarum à puncto F, in quod cadit linea directionis: cùm enim
linea BC ex hypothe&longs;i &longs;it horizonti parallela, omnium ip&longs;i FE
parallelarum di&longs;tantia ab eádem FE, de&longs;umenda e&longs;t ex inter­
valli, ge&longs;tatorum & puncti F.

At verò &longs;i recta BC non fuerit horizonti parallela, vel quia
deferentes onus non &longs;unt æquè alti, vel quia in clivo con&longs;i&longs;tunt,
utique linea directionis centri gravitatis E non cadit amplius in
rectam BC ad angulos rectos in F, &longs;ed obliquè incidit in H.

Concipiatur itaque per H tran&longs;iens linea GI horizonti paral­
lela, & ip&longs;i EH &longs;int parallelæ CD & BK: &longs;unt igitur di&longs;tan­
tiæ HD & HK, quæ eandem inter &longs;e habent Rationem, quæ
reperitur inter HC & HB; &longs;unt enim triangula HDC &
HKB rectangula ad D & K, æquales angulos ad verticem H
habentia, ac proinde &longs;imilia, & per 4. lib.6 ut HD ad HK,
ita HC ad HB.

Quo igitur magis ab horizonte removetur
punctum B præ puncto C, etiam linea directionis ex E propior
cadit puncto C; atque adeò qui inferior e&longs;t, magis gravatur
ab onere.

Id quod ex iis, quæ hujus libri cap.4. dicta &longs;unt, confirma­
tur: Nam vectis CB habens hypomochlium B, & pondus E
vecti impo&longs;itum, e&longs;t infra horizontem inclinatus; igitur plus la­
boris potentia impendit, quàm in horizontali po&longs;itione vectis.

Similiter vectis BC habens hypomochlium C & pondus E
vecti impo&longs;itum, e&longs;t elevatus &longs;upra horizontalem; igitur mi­
nus laborat potentia quàm in po&longs;itione horizontali.

Itaque &longs;i
po&longs;ita lineá BC horizonti parallelâ æqualiter premebantur
ge&longs;tatores in B & in C, facta inclinatione ad horizontem, mi­
nùs premitur B &longs;uperior quàm C loco inferior.

Quòd &longs;i ge&longs;tatores non &longs;u&longs;tineant onus &longs;ubjectis humeris, &longs;ed
illud manibus arreptum qua&longs;i &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;um retineant in M & N;
&longs;imili ratione attendenda e&longs;t di&longs;tantia illorum à puncto, in quod
cadit linea directionis centri gravitatis E; quæ utique ad angu­
los recto incidit in rectam MN, &longs;i hæc &longs;uerit horizonti pa­
rallela, & labor ge&longs;tatorum e&longs;t permutatim ut eorum di&longs;tantia
à pancto S.

At verò &longs;i linea MN fuerit ad horizontem incli­
nata, & linea directionis &longs;it EO; utique minor e&longs;t di&longs;tantia à
&longs;uperiore M, quam ab inferiore N, ideoque plus laborabit &longs;u­
perior retinendo, quam inferior.

Id quod pariter ex dictis
cap.4. confirmatur; nam pondus e&longs;t vecti &longs;ubjectum, & vectis
MN habens hypomochlium N e&longs;t &longs;upra horizontalem lineam,
ac propterea potentia plus laborat quam in horizontali: contra
autem vectis NM habens hypomochlium M e&longs;t in&longs;ta horizon­
talem lineam depre&longs;&longs;us, ideoque minus potentia laborat quam
in horizontali.

Quæ omnia tam aperte re&longs;pondent quotidia­
no experimento, ut mirum videatur potui&longs;&longs;e aliquos authores
idem planè opinari, &longs;ive ge&longs;tatores &longs;u&longs;tineant impo&longs;itum onus,
&longs;ive illud &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;um retineant in po&longs;itione vectis declivi; Si
enim ducti per O lineâ horizonti parallelâ, ducantur ex M &
N rectæ MT, & NV parallelæ lineæ directionis centri gravi­
tatis EO, utique di&longs;tantiæ &longs;unt TO & VO: atqui TO ad
VO e&longs;t ut MO ad NO propter triangulorum OTM &
OVN &longs;imilitudinem; & MO ad ON habet minorem Ratio­
nem quàm MS ad SN ex 8.lib.5. igitur etiam TO ad OV
habet minorem Rationem quàm MS ad SN: igitur in po&longs;itio­
ne vectis declivi, M &longs;uperior laborabit ut ON, atque N infe­
rior laborabit ut OM.

Ex his unu&longs;qui&longs;que intelligit non ad duos tantùm ge&longs;tato­
res, &longs;ed etiam ad plures referenda e&longs;&longs;e, quæ hactenus diximus,
habitâ &longs;cilicet di&longs;tantiarum ratione, quibus &longs;inguli ab&longs;unt a
pondere, adeò ut qui æqualibus intervallis à pondere di&longs;tant,
æqualem conatum impendant in eo &longs;u&longs;tinendo.

Sic &longs;i à pon­
dere P æqualiter di&longs;tent A & B, æqua­
liter premuntur: item C & D æquali­
ter di&longs;tantes ab eodem pondere P æqua­
lem pre&longs;&longs;ionem recipiunt: Et &longs;i compa­
rentur invicem D & B, aut C & A,
manife&longs;tum e&longs;t propinquiores premi præ remotioribus; ac
propterea, &longs;i &longs;olùm po&longs;itionis ratio haberetur, qui robu&longs;tiores
&longs;unt, collocandi e&longs;&longs;ent in C & D, infirmiores verò in A & B:
&longs;ed quoniàm contingit inter plures &longs;odales aliquem aliquando
connivere, ideò ut plurimum extremi A & B validiores &longs;unt,
ut &longs;i fortè mediorum aliquis languidiùs conetur &longs;u&longs;tinendo,
illi faciliùs muneri &longs;uo &longs;atisfaciant.
CAPUT X.

An vis Ela&longs;tica ad aliquod Vectis genus
pertineat.

QUoniam Græcis e)lasma\ tùm laminam, tùm plicam &longs;eu
flexum &longs;ignificat, atque e)/lastrw=n e&longs;t id, quod impellit; &longs;æ­
pius autem chalybeas laminas in machinulis ita di&longs;ponimus, ut
primùm flexæ, deinde &longs;ibi dimi&longs;&longs;æ, dum &longs;e&longs;e re&longs;tituunt, aliud
corpus impellant, cui motum concilient; propterea Ela&longs;mata,
&longs;eu Ela&longs;mos, huju&longs;modi laminas dicimus, quas Itali Su&longs;te aut
molle vocamus; & facultatem illam, qua &longs;ibi congruentem fi­
guram atque po&longs;itionem hæ laminæ reparant, Vim Ela&longs;ticam
appellamus.

Quamquam non &longs;olis laminis, &longs;ed cæteris quoque
corporibus per vim inflexis, & ad &longs;ibi debitam rectitudinem
redeuntibus, facultas hæc Ela&longs;tica tribuenda e&longs;t, quemadmo­
dum flexilibus virgultorum ramis, à quibus &longs;ecundus in &longs;ylvâ
&longs;ibi cavere debet, & perticæ, quâ toreutæ utuntur in toreu­
mate elaborando, dum tornum circumagunt circumducto fu­
niculo, qui depre&longs;&longs;o &longs;uppedanco perticam flectit, hæc enim,
ce&longs;&longs;ante pedis pre&longs;&longs;ione, funiculum retrahens &longs;uam &longs;ibi repa­
rat rectitudinem.

An verò ignis atque aër &longs;ive externá com­
pre&longs;&longs;ione, &longs;ive alieno frigore concretus, & in exigua &longs;patia con­
tractus, ubi ce&longs;&longs;ante vi, aut abeunte frigore, extenuatus am­
pliorem locum occupat, proximumque corpus pellens à &longs;uá &longs;e­
de removet, facultate Ela&longs;ticâ præditus dicendus &longs;it, quæ&longs;tio
Grammaticis dirimenda relinquatur: hæc enim fluida corpora,
nullam partium texturam habentia, nec certis figuræ, quam
expetant, terminis &longs;uapte naturà circum&longs;cripta, vix quicquam
cum Ela&longs;mate commune habere videntur.

Cum itaque inæquales deprehendantur ela&longs;matis eju&longs;dem
vires pro diversâ &longs;uarum partium po&longs;itione juxta longitudinem,
animum &longs;ubiit cupido examinandi, an forte in eo aliqua vectis
&longs;pecies reperiatur, ut propterea & vectis rationibus illa virium
inæqualitas definienda &longs;it.

Et quidem manife&longs;tum e&longs;t aliquam
ela&longs;matis partem fixam e&longs;&longs;e atque manentem, &longs;ive illa extrema
&longs;it, ut in perticâ toreutæ, &longs;ive media, ut in arcu bali&longs;tæ, &longs;ive
utraque extremitate manente pars media flectatur in &longs;inum, ut
citharæ nervis contingit.

Quî enim fieri po&longs;&longs;et, ut per vim la­
mina flecteretur, &longs;i partes omnes æqualiter moverentur?

Ut igi­
tur externam vim recipiat, & flectatur, aliquam ejus partem
oportet aut omnino immotam manere, aut &longs;altem languidiùs
moveri.

Hinc e&longs;t ela&longs;matis motum, dum inflectitur, circa partem
manentem perfici, ac proinde particulas, quæ ad cavam qui­
dem &longs;uperficiem &longs;pectant, per vim comprimi, quæ verò ad con­
vexam, intendi.

Quòd &longs;i particulæ illæ non ita tenaci nexu in­
ter &longs;e invicem cohærerent, ut facilè di&longs;traherentur contentæ,
& exprimerentur compre&longs;&longs;æ, quemadmodum plumbeæ laminæ,
quæ in figuram quamlibet conformatur, accidit, ami&longs;&longs;am recti­
tudinem non recuperarent.

Sed quoniam arcti&longs;&longs;imo vinculo
conjunguntur, quod ni&longs;i validioribus viribus revelli non pote&longs;t,
ut in chalybeâ laminâ ob&longs;ervamus; ce&longs;&longs;ante externâ vi, quæ
contentæ fuerant, &longs;e contrahunt, quæ compre&longs;&longs;æ, &longs;elatiùs ex­
plicant; atque adeò his debitam po&longs;itionem &longs;ibi reparantibus,
lamina ad pri&longs;tinam formam eò vehementiùs redit, quò majo­
rem violentiam patiebatur.

Quare Potentia movens &longs;unt ip&longs;æ
particulæ illatam vim excutientes, & ad &longs;ibi debitam po&longs;itio­
nem redeuntes.

Licet igitur in arcu bali&longs;tæ intento duplex ela&longs;ma hinc atque
hinc con&longs;iderare; media &longs;i quidem pars arcûs bali&longs;tæ manubrio
infixa manet, & &longs;ingula cornua &longs;inuantur, &longs;ed eò difficiliùs,
quò breviora &longs;unt, cæteris paribus, attentâ eorum cra&longs;&longs;itie, &
ferri temperatione; pari enim flexione paucioribus minoris ar­
cûs particulis major violentia inferenda e&longs;t, quippe quas ma­
gis comprimi, magí&longs;que intendi oportet, quàm in longiore ar­
cu, ubi minore plurium partium compre&longs;&longs;ione & intentione
flexio eadem habetur.

Præterquam quod in ip&longs;a flexione adhi­
betur quodammodo vectis &longs;ecundi generis, quem ip&longs;a longitu­
do repræ&longs;entat, pars manens vicem hypomochlij &longs;ubit, & par­
tes intermediæ, quas per vim coarctari aut dilatari oportet, lo­
cum obtinent ponderis: nihil igitur mirum, &longs;i Potentia extre-
mitatem arcûs ad &longs;e nervo adnexo trahens faciliùs moveat par­
ticulas ea&longs;dem, quò, longiùs ab&longs;ens ab hypomochlio, faciliùs
movetur.

Hîc autem ubi arcûs mentio incidit, in ip&longs;o nervo illud ela&longs;­
matis genus occurrit, quod utramque extremitatem habet ma­
nentem; curvato enim arcu nervus inflexus intenditur; po&longs;tea
cùm dimittitur, pars media, cui &longs;agitta aut globus excutiendus
aptatur, plus movetur quàm ejus extremitates arcûs cornibus
cohærentes.

Univer&longs;a autem violentia, quam nervus conten­
tus &longs;ubit, con&longs;i&longs;tit in &longs;uarum particularum intentione, quæ,
dum &longs;e contrahentes aliquid juvant ad nervum ip&longs;um juxta
rectam lineam extendendum, aliquid etiam impetûs &longs;agittæ ex­
cu&longs;&longs;æ imprimunt.

Quod verò ad ip&longs;a arcûs cornua attinet, &longs;atis liquet illa &longs;i­
milis cra&longs;&longs;itiei, paris longitudinis, æquali&longs;que temperationis
e&longs;&longs;e debere, ut æqualis fiat hinc & hinc compre&longs;&longs;io atque in­
tentio partium, ex qua æquales oriantur vires &longs;e&longs;e in pri&longs;tinam
formam re&longs;tituendi.

Si enim alterutra pars arcûs majorem
violentiam pa&longs;&longs;a velociùs atque validiùs præ reliquâ &longs;e move­
ret, à de&longs;tinato &longs;copo &longs;agitta aberraret in dexteram aut in &longs;i­
ni&longs;tram declinans.

Ut igitur hi&longs;ce prænotatis ad propo&longs;itam quæ&longs;tionem acce­
damus, non e&longs;t hîc &longs;ermo de laminâ in &longs;piram multiplicem in­
flexâ, atque &longs;pi&longs;sè per vim contorta, quæ amoto repagulo &longs;e&longs;e
in ampliores gyros explicans &longs;ecum rapit aliud corpus extremi­
tati mobili adnexum; cuju&longs;modi e&longs;t Ela&longs;ma in Automatis ho­
ras indicantibus, cujus extremitati adnectitur tympanum &longs;pi­
ram illam includens; dum enim ex dilatatione Ela&longs;matis in am­
pliorem &longs;piram, circumagitur tympanum, adnexam catenu­
lam conum circumplexam trahit, totique machinulæ motum
conciliat.

Hîc &longs;iquidem, uti nulla longitudo in con&longs;ideratio­
nem cadere pote&longs;t, nullam vectis &longs;peciem habere po&longs;&longs;u­
mus; nam facultas movendi non ratione po&longs;itionis exte­
nuatur, ut in vecte, &longs;ed vires initio validæ &longs;en&longs;im lan­
gue&longs;cunt, quia ela&longs;matis partes compre&longs;&longs;æ atque conten­
tæ, pro ratione violentiæ, quam &longs;ubeunt, excutiendæ, ve­
hementiùs primùm, deinde remi&longs;&longs;iùs conantur.

Quare con­
trover&longs;ia in illo e&longs;t, utrùm in ela&longs;mate, cujus aliqua
longitudo de&longs;ignari pote&longs;t, aliqua vectis &longs;pecies repe­
riatur.

Et ut majori in luce quæ&longs;tio ver&longs;etur, perticam toreutæ,
oculis &longs;ubjiciamus, quæ &longs;it AB, &
in A fixa atque immota per&longs;everet,
quamvis extremitas B deprimatur,
ut veniat in C.

In hac perticæ
flexione partes, quæ circa D ex.

gr. intelliguntur, maximam violentiam patiuntur, nam inter
eas, quæ ad cavitatem &longs;pectantes compre&longs;&longs;ione coarctantur,
illæ præ cæteris hinc atque hinc cohærentibus urgentur ma­
gis; inter eas verò, quæ convexitatem re&longs;picientes di&longs;tentu
explicantur, quæ ibi &longs;unt, præ reliquis à &longs;ummo flexu paulò
remotioribus vehementiùs tenduntur.

Hinc licèt particulæ
omnes in hac flexione vim pa&longs;&longs;æ, dum nituntur &longs;ingulæ pri&longs;ti­
num &longs;tatum &longs;ibi reparare, conatus &longs;uos exerant, majores aut
minores pro ratione majoris aut minoris violentiæ; poti&longs;&longs;ima ta­
men vis ela&longs;tica ibi con&longs;ideranda e&longs;t, ubi &longs;umma inflexio &longs;um­
mam vim particulis infert; ibi enim majore conatu quàm alibi
violentiam excutit natura.

Quamvis igitur vis ela&longs;tica per uni­
ver&longs;am ela&longs;matis longitudinem, quàm particulæ compre&longs;&longs;æ at­
que contentæ obtinent, extendatur, ibi tamen poti&longs;&longs;imùm col­
locata intelligitur, ubi in &longs;ummo flexu puta in D, validiùs co­
natur.

Jam verò quis ignorat in tornando plurimum intere&longs;&longs;e, utrùm
funiculus in ipsâ extremitate B, an verò in E adnectatur?

Si­
quidem, &longs;icut ex E difficiliùs flectitur pertica, quàm ex B, æqua­
li flexione, ita cæteris paribus in E validiùs retrahitur funicu­
lus, & minor motus perficitur quàm in B.

E&longs;t igitur hîc ratio
Vectis tertij generis, in quo hypomochlium e&longs;t A pars fixa &
immota; Potentia movens (&longs;cilicet particulæ vim illatam ex­
cutientes) e&longs;t poti&longs;&longs;imùm in D; pondus, quod movetur, e&longs;t
ultra D, &longs;ive in extremitate B, &longs;ive in aliqua ex partibus inter­
mediis, ut in E.

Quare in collocatione corporis, quod ope
ela&longs;matis movendum e&longs;t, attendere oportet, quanto motu opus
&longs;it, ut in majore &longs;eu minore di&longs;tantiâ à puncto ela&longs;matis ma­
nente, & immoto applicetur: quo enim minor e&longs;t di&longs;tantia,
minus &longs;patium percurrit.

Quamvis autem ela&longs;matis vires ad impellendum vel trahen­
dum corpus ex huju&longs;modi di&longs;tantiâ pendeant, & comparatis
inter &longs;e duabus po&longs;itionibus E atque B, validiùs operetur in E
quàm B, non tamen eâdem vi motus (quicumque demum ille
&longs;it &longs;ive major, &longs;ive minor) inchoatur, atque procedit, ut &longs;upra
innuimus; natura quippe remi&longs;&longs;iore ni&longs;u reluctatur, ubi mino­
rem patitur violentiam, ac proinde &longs;en&longs;im attenuatur conatus,
quatenus particularum violenta compre&longs;&longs;io atque contentio di­
minuitur.

Hæc quæ de ela&longs;mate pror&longs;us recto explicata &longs;unt, etiam de
incurvo intelliguntur; cuju&longs;modi e&longs;&longs;et lamina chalybea RT
inflexa in S, cujus manens & immota ex­
tremitas e&longs;&longs;et R: dum enim pars ST pro­
pellitur versùs R, particulæ, poti&longs;&longs;imùm
quæ in S, comprimuntur atque intendun­
tur.

Quod &longs;i pars RS paulo longior fuerit,
contingere pote&longs;t, ut facilius &longs;it illam inflecti &longs;altem leviter,
quàm particulas in S ulteriùs comprimi, aut intendi.

Quare
particulæ ip&longs;ius RS &longs;e&longs;e re&longs;tituentes impellunt S, particulæ au­
tem ip&longs;ius ST impellunt T.

Semper autem Potentiam minùs
moveri, quàm corpus, quod impellitur, con&longs;tat, quemadmo­
dum ratio vectis tertij generis exigit.

Neque his, quæ dicta &longs;unt, adver&longs;antur percu&longs;&longs;iones, quæ
in extremitate longioris ela&longs;matis per vim inflexi, &longs;tatimque di­
mi&longs;&longs;i, validiores fiunt, quam in partibus mediis; &longs;icut ip&longs;e te
docere potes, &longs;i longiu&longs;culi virgulti inflexi atque dimi&longs;&longs;i pri­
mùm parti mediæ deinde extremitati manum in eodem plano
verticali con&longs;titutam opponas, quam percutiat, magis enim ex
&longs;ecundâ quàm ex primâ percu&longs;&longs;ione dolebis.

Quia &longs;cilicet non
impetus &longs;olùm primo productus, &longs;ed & velocitas percutientis
cum impetu acqui&longs;ito ex motu ante percu&longs;&longs;ionem (ut &longs;uo loco
dicetur) attenditur, ut validior &longs;it ictus: majorem autem e&longs;&longs;e
partis extremæ quàm mediarum velocitatem con&longs;tat, quamvis
initio illæ impetu eodem, aut æquali moveantur.

Quando ve­
rò ela&longs;matis vires prope partem manentem majores e&longs;&longs;e, quam
procul ab illâ, dictum e&longs;t, non e&longs;t habita ratio percu&longs;&longs;ionis,
quæ prævium percutientis motum requirit, &longs;ed tractionis aut
impul&longs;ionis, quæ nullum trahentis aut impellentis prævium
motum exigunt, eóque faciliores accidunt, quò tardiores &longs;unt;
minùs enim re&longs;i&longs;tit corpus, quod tardè movetur, ac proinde
validiùs trahitur aut impellitur, quo minorem potentia invenit
re&longs;i&longs;tentiam: Contrà quàm accidat in percu&longs;&longs;ione, quæ vali­
diorem facit ictum, quo majorem invenit re&longs;i&longs;tentiam; hæc
autem major e&longs;t, quò velociùs moveri deberet corpus percu&longs;­
&longs;um, ut percutientis motui ob&longs;ecundaret, cui magis re&longs;i&longs;tens
majorem ictum recipit; cum tamen hic languidior e&longs;&longs;et atque
infirmior, &longs;i manum &longs;en&longs;im &longs;ubduceres virgulto percutienti.

Quare pars ela&longs;matis extrema validiùs percutit, quia majorem
invenit re&longs;i&longs;tentiam, pars media validiùs trahit aut impellit,
quia minùs illi re&longs;i&longs;titur.
CAPUT XI.

Cur longiora corpora faciliùs flectantur, difficiliùs
&longs;u&longs;tineantur.

PRæ&longs;ens di&longs;putatio non di&longs;tat ab iis, quæ ab Ari&longs;totele in­
quiruntur in Mechanicis quæ&longs;t.14. Cur eju&longs;dem magnitu­
dinis lignum faciliùs genu frangitur, &longs;i qui&longs;piam æquè diductis ma­
nibus extrema comprehendens fregerit, quàm &longs;i juxta genu: & &longs;i
terræ illud applicans pede &longs;uperimpo&longs;ito manu longè diductâ confre­
gerit, quàm propè. & quæ&longs;t.

16. Cur quanto longiora &longs;unt ligna,
tanto imbecilliora fiunt: & &longs;i tollantur, inflectuntur magis; tamet&longs;i
quod breve quidem e&longs;t, ceu bicubitum, fuerit tenue; quod verò cu­
bitorum centum, cra&longs;&longs;um? & quæ&longs;t.

26. Cur difficilius e&longs;t longa
ligna ab extremo &longs;uper humeros ferre, quàm &longs;ecundùm medium,
æquali exi&longs;tente pondere?

Et quidem quod ad primum, &longs;cilicet ad flexionem &longs;pectat,
quam demum con&longs;equitur fractio, quemadmodum flectendi
corpus aliquod longum aut frangendi difficultas oritur ex com­
plexione atque copulatione particularum, quibus con&longs;tat, ægrè
di&longs;&longs;olubili, ita illud inflectitur, atque frangitur, cum earum­
dem particularum coagmentatio vehementi impul&longs;ione labe-
factatur, his quidem per vim compre&longs;&longs;is, his verò validè in di­
ver&longs;a di&longs;tractis.

Quo igitur faciliùs compre&longs;&longs;io hæc atque di­
&longs;tractio perficitur, eò etiam faciliùs flectitur corpus, aut fran­
gitur.

Hanc autem particularum compre&longs;&longs;ionem atque di­
&longs;tractionem faciliùs contingere longiori corpori quàm breviori
manife&longs;tum e&longs;t; quia videlicet motus ille particularum ad fle­
xionem aut fractionem nece&longs;&longs;arius minorem Rationem habet
ad motum Potentiæ longiùs applicatæ, quàm ad motum Po­
tentiæ propioris.

Potentia movens bifariam con&longs;iderari pote&longs;t, &longs;ivè in ip&longs;o cor­
pore inclu&longs;a, cuju&longs;modi e&longs;t illi in&longs;ita atque ingenita gravitas,
vi cujus &longs;ponte &longs;uâ flectitur; &longs;ivè extrin&longs;ecùs adhibita, ut &longs;i
onus aliquod grave deor&longs;um premens adjiciatur, aut potentia
vivens ad motum in quamcumque po&longs;itionis differentiam apta:
utrobique tamen e&longs;t eadem ratio; ubi &longs;cilicet a&longs;&longs;umpta atque
adventitia potentia applicatur, ibi operatur; atque ibi innata
gravitas intelligitur &longs;ua exercere momenta, ubi partis ultra &longs;ub­
jectum fulcrum extantis centrum gravitatis reperitur; illáque
e&longs;t à fulcro di&longs;tantia potentiæ flectentis, aut etiam frangentis.

Sit enim pri&longs;ma AB, cujus pars AC
infixa &longs;it parieti, extra quem emineat
horizonti parallela pars CB &longs;uâ gravi­
tate deor&longs;um connitens; quæ &longs;ane non
e&longs;t intelligenda in B, &longs;ed qua&longs;i tota
con&longs;tituta e&longs;&longs;et in D, ubi e&longs;t centrum gravitatis non totius cor­
poris AB, &longs;ed partis extantis CB.

Quod &longs;i brevius e&longs;&longs;et pri&longs;­
ma AE, partis CE minor e&longs;&longs;et gravitas, quàm partis CB, &
prætereà minus abe&longs;&longs;e à fulcro C intelligeretur, quippe cujus
centrum gravitatis e&longs;&longs;et F multo propius quàm D.

Plura igi­
tur momenta habet CB quàm CE ad flectendum pri&longs;ma parie­
ti infixum, juxta ea, quæ uberiùs dicta &longs;unt lib.2. cap.6. ubi &longs;o­
lidorum Re&longs;i&longs;tentiam re&longs;pectivam con&longs;ideravimus, nec vacat
hic iterum inculcare.

Unum hîc con&longs;iderandum e&longs;t, quod ad rationes vectis atti­
net, videlicet, &longs;i &longs;uperiori pri&longs;matis parti, quæ re&longs;pondet ip&longs;i
AC, incumberet onus, quod faciliùs loco moveri po&longs;&longs;it, quàm
particularum complexio labefactari, aut omnino di&longs;&longs;olvi, pri&longs;
ma neque frangi, aut forta&longs;&longs;e ne flecti quidem contingeret;
&longs;ed rationem vectis primi generis haberet, cujus fulcrum e&longs;&longs;et
in C, pondus in A, potentia in D.

At &longs;i onus impo&longs;itum nul­
latenus dimoveri queat, quemadmodum cùm pri&longs;ma parieti in­
figitur, &longs;i CB ejus &longs;it longitudinis, ut vis gravitatis ad de&longs;cen­
dendum tali intervallo CD &longs;ejuncta à fulcro C plus habeat
momenti, quàm particularum coagmentatio, ne compriman­
tur, aut di&longs;trahantur; tunc vectis e&longs;t &longs;ecundi generis, fulcrum
quidem habens in C, quatenus totum &longs;egmentum AC retine­
tur pror&longs;us immotum, & potentia in D, pondus verò, cujus
vires vincuntur, eo loco, ubi maxima fit particularum com­
pre&longs;&longs;io atque di&longs;tractio.

Hinc factum videtur &longs;atis Ari&longs;toteli quærenti, cur faciliùs
flectatur lignum cra&longs;&longs;um cubitorum centum, quàm tenue bi­
cubitum; quia nimirum in cra&longs;&longs;o ligno cubitorum centum è
pariete extantium, &longs;i ponatur &longs;imilem atque æquabilem cra&longs;&longs;i­
tiem juxta totam longitudinem habere, gravitatis centrum
di&longs;tat à fulcro cubitis quinquaginta, tenue verò atque exile
lignum &longs;imilis figuræ atque materiæ centrum habet uno tantùm
cubito di&longs;tans à fulcro, & gravitas illius ad hujus gravitatem in
eâ e&longs;t Ratione, quam habent inter &longs;e ip&longs;orum lignorum moles,
quæ &longs;cilicet ex Rationibus ba&longs;ium atque longitudinum compo­
nitur.

Cum itaque longitudo ad longitudinem &longs;it ut 50 ad 1,
&longs;i ba&longs;ium &longs;imilium latera homologia &longs;int ut 10 ad 1, ba&longs;ium
Ratio e&longs;t ut 100 ad 1: quare cùm longioris ligni gravita­
tis Ratio ad gravitatem brevioris componatur ex Ratione ba­
&longs;ium ut 100 ad 1, & ex ratione longitudinum ut 50 ad 1, gravi­
tas longioris ad gravitatem brevioris e&longs;t ut 5000 ad 1. Atqui
momenta ad de&longs;cendendum componuntur ex gravitate & di­
&longs;tantia à fulcro; igitur momenta longioris ad momenta brevio­
ris &longs;unt ut 250000 ad 1. At verò re&longs;i&longs;tentia ab&longs;oluta, ne flectan­
tur, aut frangantur huju&longs;modi ligna, e&longs;t in Ratione compo&longs;itâ
ex Rationibus ba&longs;ium atque cra&longs;&longs;itierum; ac proinde &longs;i ba&longs;es
&longs;int &longs;imiles, & &longs;imiliter po&longs;itæ, Ratio e&longs;t triplicata Rationis la­
terum homologorum, hoc e&longs;t Rationis 10 ad 1; atque adeò re­
&longs;i&longs;tentia longioris ad re&longs;i&longs;tentiam brevioris e&longs;t ut 1000 ad 1.
Patet igitur momenta ut 250.000 ad re&longs;i&longs;tentiam ut 1000 ma­
jorem habere Rationem, quàm momenta ut 1 ad re&longs;i&longs;tentiam
ut 1: faciliùs ergo illa quàm hæc momenta re&longs;i&longs;tentiam &longs;ibi con-
gruentem &longs;uperant, atque faciliùs lignum cra&longs;&longs;um longius
flectitur, aut frangitur, quàm brevius.

Quæ autem de ligno parieti &longs;ecundum alteram extremitatem
infixo dicta &longs;unt, &longs;ervatâ analogiâ de eodem dicantur, &longs;i circa
medium fulcro alicui in&longs;i&longs;tat ita, ut hinc atque hinc habeat
gravitatis momenta compo&longs;ita ex ip&longs;arum partium gravitate &
ex di&longs;tantia centrorum gravitatis à fulcro, cui innititur: eâdem
enim ratiocinatione colligitur in longiore ligno majorem e&longs;&longs;e
Rationem momentorum gravitatis ad re&longs;i&longs;tentiam ortam ex
partium complexione, ne flectatur, quàm in breviore.

Quod
verò &longs;pectat ad longioris ligni faciliorem flexionem, quando
utraque extremitas innixa e&longs;t &longs;ubjecto fulcro, non videtur pro­
priè hujus loci, &longs;ed de eâ dictum e&longs;t &longs;uperiùs lib.3. cap.12.

Ex his, quæ de pri&longs;mate extra parietem extante, quod faci­
liùs flectitur, hactenus diximus, ulteriùs patet, cur ex contra­
rio longius lignum ut AB, etiam&longs;i parem cum breviore AE
cra&longs;&longs;itiem habeat, alterâ extremitate æqualiter in AC ap­
prehen&longs;um difficiliùs &longs;u&longs;tineatur.

Nam quod longius e&longs;t ad il­
lud, quod brevius e&longs;t, &longs;ecundùm gravitatem, quæ deor&longs;um ni­
titur, eam habèt Rationem, quæ e&longs;t longitudinis majoris CB
ad longitudinem minorem CE: & præterea momenta, quæ ex
di&longs;tantia oriuntur, &longs;unt ut CD ad CF, hoc e&longs;t ut CB ad CE,
&longs;i quidem ex hypothe&longs;i centrum gravitatis intelligatur in me­
diâ longitudine; &longs;ecus autem, univer&longs;aliter juxta di&longs;tantias cen­
tri gravitatis à fulcro.

Quare tota momentorum Ratio ea e&longs;t
quæ componitur ex Rationibus gravitatum re&longs;pondentium
moli ultrà fulcrum proten&longs;æ, & di&longs;tantiarum centri gravitatis.

Cum itaque in longiore ligno plus inveniatur gravitatis, & ma­
gis à fulcro di&longs;tet centrum gravitatis, quàm in breviore ligno,
nil mirum, &longs;i vis in A po&longs;ita, ut contranitatur momentis lon­
gioris ligni innixi fulcro C, major e&longs;&longs;e debeat, quàm ut re&longs;i&longs;te­
ret momentis ligni brevioris.

De&longs;inant igitur mirari, qui &longs;ari&longs;&longs;am decem cubitorum per­
pendicularem extremo digiti apice &longs;u&longs;tineri, eandem verò ho­
rizontaliter jacentem non ni&longs;i valido conatu elevari vident.

Res enim ex dictis per&longs;picua e&longs;t; quia dum ha&longs;ta perpendicu­
laris digito incumbit, centrum gravitatis rectá deor&longs;um urgens
digito motum &longs;ibi æqualem præ&longs;cribit, ac proinde vici&longs;&longs;im
æqualis e&longs;t digiti & ha&longs;tæ motus &longs;ur&longs;um, &longs;i digitus &longs;ur&longs;um co­
netur: hinc e&longs;t &longs;olam Rationem gravitatis comparatæ ad vires
&longs;u&longs;tinendi attendendam e&longs;&longs;e, ideóque &longs;i &longs;ari&longs;&longs;æ pondus &longs;it ex.
gr. lib.10, &longs;olo ni&longs;u opus e&longs;t, quo libræ 10 &longs;u&longs;tineantur.

Cum
verò ha&longs;ta obliqua e&longs;t, & horizonti parallela, &longs;ive ad illum in­
clinata, jam non idem &longs;eu æqualis convenit motus manni
ha&longs;tam elevanti, atque centro gravitatis, &longs;ed hoc ad motum
multo majorem incitatur; ac propterea momentorum Ratio
non ex &longs;olâ gravitate pendet, verùm etiam ex motuum Ratio­
ne componitur.

Sit ha&longs;ta horizontaliter jacens AI cubitorum 10; pars manu
apprehen&longs;a &longs;it IC quinta
fermè pars cubiti adeò ut
IC ad CA &longs;it ut 1 ad 49:
punctum I re&longs;pondet ex­
tremæ parti metacarpij,
quâ carpo adhæret arti­
culatio minimi digiti:
punctum autem C re&longs;pondet &longs;ecundo indicis articulo; motú&longs;­
que elevationis ha&longs;tæ perficitur deprimendo I & elevando C,
ac motûs centrum e&longs;t in juncturâ manûs cum o&longs;&longs;e cubiti; quod
centrum propterea intelligitur re&longs;pondere &longs;ari&longs;&longs;æ ex.

gr. in O
inter C & I.

Quapropter &longs;i facultas in I deprimens con&longs;idere­
tur, vectis e&longs;t primi generis, &longs;in autem vis in C elevans atten­
datur, vectis e&longs;t tertij generis; pondus verò movendum e&longs;t &longs;i­
ve tota gravitas longitudinis OA in centro gravitatis E, &longs;ive
&longs;emi&longs;&longs;is gravitatis in extremitate A, ut con&longs;tat ex iis, quæ di&longs;­
putata &longs;unt lib.3. cap.2. de brachiis libræ.

Intelligatur itaque, facilioris explicationis gratiâ, centrum
motû, in O planè medium inter C & I; eritque tam AO ad
OC, quàm AO ad OI, ut 99 ad 1. Gravitas igitur partis OA
e&longs;t lib. (9 9/10) ex hypothe&longs;i; illius &longs;emi&longs;&longs;is e&longs;t lib.(4 19/20); cujus mo­
mentum in A ad momentum, quod haberet illa eadem in Caut
in I, e&longs;t ut 99 ad 1. Cùm autem potentia in I deprimens æqui­
valeat potentiæ elevanti in C, quippe illarum di&longs;tantia ab O
centro motûs ex hypothe&longs;i e&longs;t æqualis, perinde e&longs;t atque &longs;i in C
unica potentia totum pondus elevans po&longs;ita e&longs;&longs;et æquivalens
duplici illi potentiæ in I & in C.

Quare potentia in C elevans
pondus perpendiculare lib.(9 9/10) ad potentiam in C pariter con&longs;ti­
tutam elevantem lib.(4 10/20) in di&longs;tantia, quæ exigat motum unde
centuplum erit ut (9 9/10) ad 490, hoc e&longs;t, tàm valida e&longs;&longs;e debet, ut
po&longs;&longs;et perpendiculariter elevare libras 490.

Porrò elevatâ ha&longs;tâ ita ut A veniat in F, jam non intelligi­
tur &longs;emi&longs;&longs;is gravitatis in A, &longs;ed in G puncto, quod definitur à
perpendiculari cadente ex F in horizontalem: & idcirco gra­
vitas (4 19/20) ducenda e&longs;t in di&longs;tantiam GO minorem quàm AO;
atque ita deinceps minuitur, u&longs;que dum ha&longs;ta fiat in O hori­
zonti perpendicularis, & facillimè &longs;u&longs;tineatur, aut attollatur.

Si
autem in hac ratiocinatione tibi, Lector, placuerit non negli­
gere momentum illud exiguum, quod potentiæ elevanti addi­
tur à gravitate particulæ OI, non abnuo, &longs;i operæ pretium te
facturum exi&longs;times.

Quòd &longs;i punctum I concipiatur omnino immotum, illud e&longs;t
centrum motûs, & vis elevans in C aliam habet Rationem;
nam potentiæ motus ad motum &longs;emi&longs;&longs;is ponderis ha&longs;tæ in A e&longs;t
ut 1 ad 50; &longs;unt igitur lib.5 ex hypothe&longs;i, quæ moventur motu
quinquagecuplo; ac propterea vis elevandi datam ha&longs;tam po&longs;i­
ta in C, quando ha&longs;ta e&longs;t horizonti parallela, ea e&longs;&longs;e debet, quæ
po&longs;&longs;it elevare libras 250 perpendiculares.

Hinc e&longs;t quod, &longs;i
ha&longs;tam eandem lib.10. humero ita imponas in C, ut apprehen­
&longs;um calcem in I manus retineat, & CI &longs;it pars decima totius
longitudinis ha&longs;tæ parallelæ horizonti, &longs;emi&longs;&longs;is (&longs;cilicet lib.4 1/2)
reliquæ ha&longs;tæ ultra humerum intelligitur in A, & ut IC ad
CA, hoc e&longs;t ut 1 ad 9, ita lib.4 1/2 ad lib.40 1/2, quibus æquiva­
lere debet partis CI momentum & vis manûs deor&longs;um urgen­
tis, atque in I retinentis ha&longs;tam horizonti parallelam.

Perinde
itaque humerus in C premitur ab ha&longs;tâ &longs;ic po&longs;itâ, & à manu
deor&longs;um urgente, atque &longs;i ponderis librarum 81 centrum gra­
vitatis immineret humero; nam &longs;i loco manûs deor&longs;um trahen­
tis adderes in I pondus faciens æquilibrium, e&longs;&longs;e oporteret
lib.40; &longs;iquidem partis CI momentum e&longs;t lib.
1/2 in I.

At &longs;i ex­
tremitas I retineatur quidem, &longs;ed nemine deor&longs;um urgente
(quemadmodum &longs;i in parietis foramen inferatur, & à &longs;uperio­
re foraminis &longs;axo impediatur, ne po&longs;&longs;it elevari) in C verò &longs;u&longs;ti­
neatur ab humero; tunc humeri pre&longs;&longs;io &longs;oli gravitati ha&longs;tæ tri-
buenda e&longs;t; ha&longs;ta quippe e&longs;t vectis &longs;ecundi generis hypomo­
chlium in I habens, pondus movendum, hoc e&longs;t, humerum
premendum in C, potentiam verò, hoc e&longs;t lib.5. &longs;emi&longs;&longs;em gra­
vitatis ha&longs;tæ, in A, ita ut AI di&longs;tantia &longs;it decupla di&longs;tantiæ CI:
premitur ergo humerus, qua&longs;i &longs;u&longs;tineat libras 50.

Demum, ne intacta relinquatur Ari&longs;totelis quæ&longs;tio 14. de
ligno, quod terræ applicatum pede impo&longs;ito faciliùs frangitur
manu longè diducta quàm prope, dic ligni partem, quæ inter
pedem impo&longs;itum, & terram &longs;ubjectam interjicitur, e&longs;&longs;e pror­
&longs;us &longs;imilem parti pri&longs;matis infixi parieti, ne moveatur, manum
verò e&longs;&longs;e potentiam, quæ longiùs applicata majora habet mo­
menta ad vincendum nexum particularum ligni; e&longs;t enim lon­
gior vectis.

Similiter applicato ad genu ligno, & æquè di­
ductis manibus; duo &longs;unt vectes hinc atque hinc, fulcrum ad
genu, &longs;cilicet ad duo puncta contactuum, habentes, eóque
longiores, quò magis diductæ fuerint manus, ac proinde faci­
liùs di&longs;trahentes particulas extimas ligni, quod circa genu
curvatur, faciliú&longs;que comprimentes particulas eju&longs;dem ligni
ad cavam faciem pertinentes; quæ dum &longs;ibi vici&longs;&longs;im ob&longs;i&longs;tunt,
uberiorem reliquarum di&longs;tractionem juvant: longiorem autem
vectem præ breviori eligendum e&longs;&longs;e quis ne&longs;ciat?

ac propterea
&longs;i ad genu propiùs admoverentur manus ligno, cùm minor e&longs;­
&longs;et illarum motûs Ratio ad motum particularum ligni di&longs;trahen­
darum, quàm &longs;it Ratio motûs illarum longiùs diductarum, uti­
que difficiliùs frangeretur lignum; ideóque longiùs diducun­
tur manus, ut longiores &longs;int vectes.
CAPUT XII.
Vnde oriantur forcipum & forficum vires.

FOrcipum duplex e&longs;t u&longs;us; primus quidem ad corpus ali­
quod firmiter apprehendendum, &longs;ecundus verò ad evel­
lendum illud faciliùs, vel &longs;uâ è &longs;ede dimovendum; id quod
adhibito huju&longs;modi in&longs;trumento faciliùs perficitur, quàm nudâ
manu.
Hinc Ari&longs;toteles mechan.
quæ&longs;t.

21. quærit, Cur medi­
ci faciliùs dentes extrahunt denti forcipis onere adjecto, quàm &longs;i &longs;o­
lâ utantur manu? Quia nimirum infixum mandibulæ dentem
extrahendum vix &longs;ummis duobus digitis, quibus non multa vis
ine&longs;t, arripere valent, & ob carnis mollitudinem facilè è tra­
hentibus digitis elabitur lubricus dens: at forcipulam in os im­
mittere potiùs, quàm digitos, &longs;æpe facilius e&longs;t, validiû&longs;que
trahit manus in pugnum con&longs;tricta forcipi dentem per vim
educenti applicata, quàm digitorum extremitates dentem
adhuc in gingivâ hærentem evellere valeant.

Præterquam
quod in dentiforcipe, cuju&longs;cumque tandem figuræ &longs;it, ratio
vectis intercedit ad dentem firmiùs apprehendendum, dum
pre&longs;&longs;o manubrio arctiùs con&longs;tringitur: nec facilè Chirurgus
operam ludit, ubi dens forcipem &longs;ubterfugere nullatenus po­
te&longs;t.

Totam igitur vectis vim in dentiforcipe agno&longs;co ad &longs;trin­
gendum dentem, ut medica manus illum faciliùs evellat: ne­
que enim eâdem ratione à medicis (ni&longs;i fortè veterinariis) ex­
trahuntur dentes, quâ fabri lignarij revellunt infixos tabulæ
clavos, de quibus mox erit &longs;ermo.

Similiter quia ad &longs;tringendam exilem aliquam materiam
inepta e&longs;&longs;et digitorum cra&longs;&longs;itudo, minutorum opu&longs;culorum fa­
bricatores forcipulis utuntur, quibus illam apprehendentes fir­
miter, aut limæ &longs;ubjiciunt, aut opportunè collocant.

Et quia
candens ferrum manu tractari nequit, ut in quamcumque par­
tem ver&longs;etur, incudique impo&longs;itum ni&longs;i retineretur, &longs;æpè &longs;e­
cundis aut tertiis malleorum ictibus &longs;e &longs;ubduceret, propterea
fabri ferrarij forcipes adhibent, quarum author & inventor
Cinyra Cyprius Agriopæ filius &longs;cribitur à Plinio lib.
7 cap.
56;
ideóque forcipes, qua&longs;i forvicapes, dictæ &longs;unt, quòd iis for­
va, ide&longs;t calida, capiantur.

Vis autem forcipum in eo &longs;ita e&longs;t, quòd duo vectes primi
generis AB, & CD in E connexi
commune hypomochlium E habent;
potentia verò in B & D longiorum
brachiorum extremitates adducens eò
validius &longs;tringit ferrum brevioribus brachiis EA & EC ap­
prehen&longs;um, quo major fuerit Ratio BE ad EA: támque firma
retentio e&longs;&longs;e pote&longs;t, ut modico pueri conatu extremitates B & D
vici&longs;&longs;im comprimentis, robu&longs;ti&longs;&longs;imi cuju&longs;que vires elidantur,
ne arreptum ferrum ex AC po&longs;&longs;it eximere.

Quòd &longs;i forcipibus
BA & DC utatur aliquis veterinarius vice Po&longs;tomidis (&longs;eu, ut
aliquibus Grammaticis placet Pa&longs;tomidis) equi nares, ad frænan­
dam ejus tenaciam, ut loquitur Fe&longs;tus, inter longiora brachia
BE & DE contingens; jam BE & DE vectes &longs;unt &longs;ecundi ge­
neris, cum illud, quod ponderis vicem &longs;ubit, inter hypomo­
chlium & potentiam interjiciatur.

Huju&longs;modi forcipibus vectis in EC & EA non ab&longs;imile fui&longs;&longs;e
exi&longs;timo in&longs;trumentum antiquioribus Græcis ad frangendas
ab&longs;que ictu percutientis mallei nuces familiare, ut ex Ari&longs;tote­
le Mechan. quæ&longs;t.

22. colligitur: quod forta&longs;&longs;e vel in alterutrâ,
vel in utraque interiori facie breviorum brachiorum modicè
excavatá frangendæ nuci locum de&longs;ignabat; adducto enim in
oppo&longs;itas partes utroque vecte BA & DC, quo propior erat
nux communi hypomochlio, puncto &longs;cilicet connexionis E, eò
faciliùs frangebatur, quia eò major erat Ratio motûs poten­
tiæ ad motum particularum nucis ex compre&longs;&longs;ione dividenda­
rum, quàm e&longs;&longs;et Ratio re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ ex earumdem particularum
complexione ortæ, ad vim motivam potentiæ.

Et quoniam in
nucum mentionem incidi, ne levitati mihi tribuas, quòd hîc
puerile inventum à me puero, & tunc quidem admiratione
ob&longs;tupefacto, ob&longs;ervatum commemorare non erube&longs;cam.

Vide­
bam pueros clande&longs;tinis jentaculis indulgentes, ut citra multi­
plicis percu&longs;&longs;ionis &longs;trepitum nuces confringerent, eas inter
po&longs;tium angulos & fores collocare; tum adductis foribus levi&longs;­
&longs;imo negotio unâ operâ confringere.

Erat &longs;cilicet vectis primi
generis, cuius majorem longitudinem definiebat foris latitudo,
minorem ip&longs;ius foris cra&longs;&longs;itudo, ita ut vectis e&longs;&longs;et in angulum
inflexus, cujus hypomochlium cardinibus re&longs;pondebant.

U&longs;que adeò natura ip&longs;a Mechanicen, u&longs;umque vectis, vel pue­
ros docet.

His adde acutas forcipulas, quibus catenularum fabricatores
extremitatem fili ferrei inflectunt: ratio enim vectis poti&longs;&longs;i­
mùm con&longs;i&longs;tit in validâ & firmâ ip&longs;ius fili ferrei apprehen&longs;io­
ne; nam quo ad eju&longs;dem inflexionem &longs;pectat, non e&longs;t, cur nos
torqueamus, ut aliquam demum vectis umbram venemur: &longs;a­
tis e&longs;t, &longs;i manubrij amplitudinem con&longs;iderantes, eámque cum
tenui apice forcipulæ, circa quem filum ferreum contorquetur,
comparantes motum potentiæ manubrio applicatæ longè ma­
jorem motu particularum fili ferrei, quod flectitur, deprehen­
damus; hinc quippe aucta potentiæ momenta cogno&longs;cimus.

Aliud forcipum genus frequentiùs u&longs;urpatur, quarum poti&longs;­
&longs;imus u&longs;us e&longs;t in eximendis clavis,
& minora brachia AE & CE non
recta &longs;unt, &longs;ed curva; non &longs;olùm ut
clavus tenaciùs apprehendatur ex­
cepto ejus capite intra forcipum &longs;i­
num, verùm etiam ut forcipes aliam
exerceant vectis curvi rationem: cùm enim arrepto inter A &
C clauo inclinantur forcipes, ut punctum H tangat &longs;ubjectum
planum, &longs;ive paries &longs;it, &longs;ive tabula, jam hypomochlium e&longs;t
in H, & momenta potentiæ in B ad re&longs;i&longs;tentiam clavi evellen­
di, &longs;unt ut BH ad HA, cùm circa punctum H perficiatur
motus.

Quare ad con&longs;tringendum clavum momentorum Ra­
tio e&longs;t ut BE ad EA (perinde atque &longs;i ab E ad A ducta e&longs;&longs;et
recta linea) ad revellendum verò momentorum Ratio e&longs;t ut
recta ex B ad H ducta ad rectam, quæ ex H ad A ducitur; ne­
que enim curva linea ex H ad B, aut ex H ad A, &longs;ed recta le­
gem con&longs;tituit motibus potentiæ in B, & ponderis in A.

Id quod pariter contingit cùm aver&longs;am mallei partem &longs;ubti­
liorem clavo &longs;ubmittimus, & in oppo&longs;itam partem manu­
brium retrahimus, ut clavus extrahatur: e&longs;t &longs;iquidem curvus
quidam vectis fulcrum habens in E, circa
quod punctum manens uterque motus perfi­
citur; & motus potentiæ in H ad motum
clavi in I habet Rationem rectæ HE ad
rectam EI.

Ex quo patet pro majori manu­
brij longitudine augeri etiam potentiæ mo­
menta.

Quoniam verò aliquando forcipes huju&longs;­
modi curvæ aciem habent in A & C, ut id,
quod con&longs;tringitur vehementiùs, etiam &longs;cin­
datur, non e&longs;t alia philo&longs;ophandi ratio, quod quidem &longs;pectat
ad momenta potentiæ duplici illi vecti applicatæ, hoc uno dif­
ferunt, quod vis &longs;cindendi orta ex acie ferri pertinet ad ratio-
nes Cunei, de quo inferiùs &longs;uo loco.

Idem dicendum de for­
ficibus, quarum acies pariter ex rationibus Cunei vim &longs;cin­
dendi habent; majora autem momenta potentiæ, quæ faci­
liùs &longs;cindat, petenda &longs;unt ex rationibus vectis; &longs;unt enim
hîc pariter duo vectes in oppo&longs;itas partes commoti, commu­
ne hypomochlium in puncto connexionis habentes; & quo
majorem Rationem manubriorum longitudo habet ad di&longs;tan­
tiam rei &longs;cindendæ à puncto connexionis, eò etiam facilior
contingit &longs;ci&longs;&longs;io.

Idcirco quæ duriora &longs;unt, prope connexio­
nis punctum applicantur, quia eadem manubriorum longi­
tudo ad minorem di&longs;tantiam habet majorem Rationem quàm
ad di&longs;tantiam majorem; & quæ ad hæc duriora &longs;cindenda
in&longs;titutæ &longs;unt forfices, breviora habent brachia, quæ ad
&longs;cindendum exacuuntur, longiora verò ea, quibus poten­
tia movens applicatur; cuju&longs;modi &longs;unt forfices, quibus fa­
bri ferrarij ad æreas aut ferreas laminas &longs;cindendas utuntur.

In harum u&longs;u illud etiam ob&longs;ervare poteris, &longs;atis e&longs;&longs;e, &longs;i
duorum vectium communi fulcro connexorum, ita ut de­
cu&longs;&longs;ati exi&longs;tant, alterum moveatur manente altero: hoc
enim poti&longs;&longs;imum attenditur, quo pacto potentia validiùs
applicetur, ubi multâ opus e&longs;t virtute; cum autem uni­
cum huju&longs;modi forficum brachium movetur, tota illi ma­
nus applicatur, & reliquo deor&longs;um connitente corpore va­
lidè premit.
CAPUT XIII.
Cur Tollenones juxta puteos con&longs;tituantur.

QUi Tollenones Latinis (Ciconias aliqui vocant) Græcis
*kelo/nia dicuntur, familiaria ru&longs;ticis & olitoribus in&longs;tru­
menta ad hauriendas ex puteis non admodum altis aquas, ali­
qua habent explicatu digna, quæ ex Vectis doctrinâ petenda
&longs;unt, nec vi&longs;um e&longs;t Ari&longs;toteli quæ&longs;tione 28. hanc eandem di&longs;­
putationem in&longs;tituere indecorum, aut homini Philo&longs;opho mi-
nùs conveniens.

Et primùm quidem ip&longs;a Tollenonis con­
&longs;tructio pendet ex rationibus vectis primi generis, habet &longs;i qui­
dem fulcrum medium inter potentiam moventem & pondus
elevatum.

Erecto enim tigno DA imponitur tran&longs;ver&longs;a ha&longs;ta
CE, infigitúrque axi in A, circa quem liberè converti po&longs;&longs;it.

Tum extremitati E puteo appo&longs;itæ alligatur plumbum, aut &longs;a­
xum, &longs;ive grave aliud quodpiam; ab extremitate autem C,
quæ puteo re&longs;pondet, funis CF pendet (&longs;eu ha&longs;ta fune con­
vexa in C, &longs;ed tamen facilè mobilis) cui in F &longs;itula adnectitur.

Jam, verò duplex motus in hauriendâ aquá con&longs;iderandus
e&longs;t, alter, quo hydria vacua in puteum demittitur, alter, quo
eadem hydria aquæ plena è puteo extrahitur.

Priori motui
utique non favet tolleno, faciliùs quippe hydria de&longs;cende­
ret, &longs;i nullum e&longs;&longs;et onus in E, quod depre&longs;sâ hydria e&longs;&longs;et
elevandum; hujus enim gravitas major e&longs;t hydriæ gravita­
te; ac propterea præter eju&longs;dem hydriæ gravitatem alia po­
tentia deprimens requiritur in F, ut major &longs;it Ratio gra­
vitatis & potentiæ in F ad gravitatem ponderis in E, quàm
&longs;it reciprocè Ratio di&longs;tantiæ AE ad di&longs;tantiam AC.

Quare
&longs;i AC longitudo multo major &longs;it longitudine AE, facilior
erit hydriæ vacuæ depre&longs;&longs;io; contra verò deprimendi difficul­
tas augebitur, quo magis pondus E di&longs;tabit à fulcro A.

Sed hæc eadem, quæ deprimendi difficultatem augent, ju­
vant ad extrahendam faciliùs hydriam: pondus enim E quò
longiùs aberit à fulcro A, eò plura habebit momenta adversùs
gravitatem aquæ & hydriam pendentes ex C.

Hinc e&longs;t poten­
tiæ atque ponderis vices permutari; in depre&longs;&longs;ione nimirum
pondus in E exi&longs;tens attollitur, & potentia in C de&longs;cendit; at
in elevatione vici&longs;&longs;im pondus elevatur in C, & potentia in E
de&longs;cendit.

Prudenter itaque providere oporte, ut & ha&longs;tæ
CE longitudo opportunè di&longs;tinguatur in partes CA, AE, &
pondus in E neque ita leve &longs;it, ut parum adjumenti afferat in
extrahendâ aquâ, neque ita grave, ut detrimento &longs;it in depri­
mendâ hydriâ.

Præ&longs;tat tamen plus aliquid laboris &longs;u&longs;cipere in
deprimenda hydriâ, ut ea deinde elevetur majore compen­
dio: nemo quippe dubitat, quin longè faciliùs &longs;it homini
funem FC deor&longs;um trahenti attollere pondus E, quàm pa­
rium momentorum aquam è puteo extrahere.

Porrò non abs re fuerit monere hîc aliquem, ne &longs;e ru&longs;ticis
ridendum præbeat, ubi pro altitudine putei a&longs;&longs;umpto fune CF,
ha&longs;tam CE æquo longiorem con&longs;tituerit præter rationem inter­
valli inter tigillum DA & puteum; contingeret enim, ut
ha&longs;ta in putei labra incurrens nece&longs;&longs;ariam funis longitudinem
minueret.

Quapropter tria hæc nece&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t &longs;ibi invicem pro­
portione re&longs;pondere, videlicet ha&longs;tæ CE longitudinem, tigilli
AD altitudinem, ejú&longs;que à puteo di&longs;tantiam; ut erecta ferè ad
perpendiculum ha&longs;ta eam admittat funis longitudinem, quæ
& facile hydriæ jungi po&longs;&longs;it, & putei altitudinem exæquet.

Cur autem tùm in deprimendo Tollenone, ut hydria im­
mergatur, tùm in attollendo, ut aqua è puteo eximatur, non
parem &longs;emper & æquabilem experiamur facilitatem, ratio in
promptu e&longs;t; quia &longs;cilicet varia e&longs;t potentiæ medio fune FC
tollenonem agitantis applicatio; quo enim acutior fuerit angu­
lus FCA, eò minora &longs;unt potentiæ trahentis momenta, quæ
cre&longs;cente angulo pariter augentur, ut tunc maxima &longs;int, cùm
funis FC, & ha&longs;ta CA angulum rectum con&longs;tituerint.

Et qui­
dem licèt, ubi funis ab angulo recto ad obtu&longs;um de&longs;ci erit, ite­
rum momenta potentiæ decre&longs;cant, &longs;i applicationis potentiæ
eju&longs;dem tantummodo habeatur ratio; fieri tamen pote&longs;t, ut
ponderis in E momenta minuantur, quo altiùs attollitur, &longs;i il­
lud fuerit ha&longs;tæ impo&longs;itum, cum eju&longs;dem linea directionis ca­
dat in ha&longs;tæ punctum, quod magis ad fulcrum A accedat, jux­
ta ea, quæ hujus libri cap.
3. dicta &longs;unt; atque adeò deprimendi
facilitas, quæ hinc &longs;umit incrementum, diminutâ ponderis E re­
&longs;i&longs;tentiâ &longs;uppleat decrementum, quod obliquam potentiæ ap­
plicationem con&longs;equitur.

Nec ab&longs;imilis momentorum varietas contingit ex di&longs;parili
angulorum amplitudine, quos lineæ directionis gravitatum
tum aquæ attollendæ, tum ponderis E, cum ha&longs;tâ CE con&longs;ti­
tuunt.

Nam depre&longs;sâ ha&longs;tâ, & pondere maximè elevato, hu­
jus momenta initio minora &longs;unt, & &longs;ubinde augentur receden­
te à fulcro A lineâ directionis centri gravitatis, &longs;i illud quidem
ha&longs;tæ incumbat: Pondere igitur E minùs conante adversùs
aquam cum hydriâ attollendam, plus laborandum e&longs;t homini
funem &longs;ur&longs;um trahenti; cujus deinde labor minuitur auctis gra­
vitatis E momentis; & tunc poti&longs;&longs;imùm præ&longs;tare videntur, cum
angulus FCA ex recto in acutum tran&longs;it; tunc enim aquæ de­
or&longs;um connitentis ac oppo&longs;ito ponderi re&longs;i&longs;tentis momenta de­
cre&longs;cere incipiunt, ac infirmiora fieri.

Ex his non parum lucis affulget &longs;cenicis machinationibus,
in quibus non planè ad perpendiculum, &longs;ed obliquè a&longs;cenden­
dum e&longs;t aut de&longs;cendendum, &longs;i enim &longs;tatuatur vectis ZX ha­
bens in P fulcrum, & fune
ZN pendeat corpus demit­
tendum, utique obliquus erit
de&longs;cen&longs;us ex N in M, & vici&longs;­
&longs;im obliquus a&longs;cen&longs;us ex M in
N: momenta autem ponderis
X, aut S, pro variâ po&longs;itione,
ut dictum e&longs;t, di&longs;&longs;imilia atque
di&longs;paria &longs;unt: Quapropter
temperanda &longs;unt pro motûs
in&longs;tituendi opportunitate; atque &longs;i pondus X levius &longs;it corpore
demittendo ex N, hoc &longs;ponte de&longs;cendet; &longs;i verò in S augea­
tur pondus, ut corporis in M gravitatem &longs;uperet, hoc ex M
in N elevabitur.

Quod autem de &longs;cenicâ machinatione hîc
innui, ad alias motiones corporum elevandorum (ut &longs;i ex navi
in altiorem fluminis ripam onus transferendum e&longs;&longs;et) facilè
traduci po&longs;&longs;e ita manife&longs;tum e&longs;t, ut pluribus non &longs;it opus, &longs;i
accuratè examinetur altitudo, ad quam deducendum e&longs;t, &
amplitudo &longs;eu di&longs;tantia parallelarum, intra quas obliquus mo­
tus perficiendus e&longs;t, ut vecti congrua longitudo &longs;tatuatur, &
opportuno loco collocetur, ubi eam anguli RPZ inclinatio­
nem habeat, cui Sinus Ver&longs;us RN re&longs;pondeat.
CAPUT XIV.
Remorum vires in agendâ navi expenduntur.

REmum, quo naves aguntur, Copen&longs;ibus, & Platæen&longs;ibus
debemus, ut Plinius lib.
7 cap.
56. &longs;cribens ait, Remum
Copæ, latitudinem ejus Platææ (utraque e&longs;t Bœotiæ urbs) inve­
nerunt; & nomen ip&longs;um ab inventoribus inditum videtur, nam
Græcis xw/ph Remus, pla/th Palmula, latior &longs;cilicet remi pars
dicitur.

Ratem &longs;iquidem conto propellere rudis adhuc ars nau­
tica noverat, ubi fluminis non admodum alti fundum perticâ
pertentare licebat; at ubi uberior unda prohibet, ne fundum
attingatur, operam luderet, qui navim
conto AB impellere &longs;e po&longs;&longs;e &longs;ibi per­
&longs;uaderet, ni&longs;i fortè extremitati B ligneam
tabellam adjungeret, ita levem, ut
&longs;ponte &longs;uâ innataret; illam enim per
vim velociter immergenti obliquam,
aqua re&longs;i&longs;teret, & navis aliquantulum
promoveretur: cæterum ingens e&longs;&longs;et
labor in conto retrahendo, & tabellâ ex
aquis extrahendâ, etiam&longs;i &longs;calmo tigil­
lus longiu&longs;culus EF ad perpendiculum
infigeretur, ex cujus &longs;ummo vertice
funis EI penderet, fune autem contus
medius in I &longs;u&longs;penderetur.

Quare opus fuit in&longs;trumentum
moliri, quo & facile uteremur, & aliquod laboris compen­
dium inveniremus.

Ratione &longs;uæ longitudinis ad unum aliquod vectis genus re­
ferendus e&longs;t remus, ad cujus caput applicatur potentia, videli­
cet remex; extrema palmula immergitur aquæ, & circa me­
dium innititur &longs;calmo: &longs;ed aquæ ne?
an &longs;calmo?

ratio fulcri
conveniat, di&longs;putatur.
