Si Ari&longs;toteles audiendus e&longs;&longs;et mechan.
quæ&longs;t.

4. hypomochlion fit &longs;calmus, &longs;tat enim ille, pondus verò mare
e&longs;t, quod propellit remus, vectem autem movens ip&longs;e e&longs;t remex.

Id
quidem verum e&longs;&longs;et, &longs;i quis anchoris nondum &longs;olutis, & &longs;tante
navi, adumbratâ ad &longs;peciem remigatione &longs;e exerceret; nil enim
præ&longs;taret præter aquarum impul&longs;ionem.

Cæterùm nautæ re­
morum pul&longs;u non aquam verberare, &longs;ed navim impellere con­
tendunt.

Igitur aqua, cui remi palmula immergitur, divi&longs;io­
ni re&longs;i&longs;tens, atque impediens motum palmulæ, hypomochlij,
cui vectis, hoc e&longs;t remus, innititur, rationem habet; navis ve­
rò ip&longs;a, quæ promovetur, quatenus e&longs;t &longs;calmo conjuncta, uti­
que e&longs;t pondus, ex cujus movendi, non ex aquæ repellendæ
difficultate æ&longs;timandus e&longs;t nautarum labor: alioquin eodem
remo, qui &longs;calmo &longs;imiliter in&longs;i&longs;teret, æqualis labor e&longs;&longs;et, &longs;ive
actuarium, &longs;ive corbitam impellere oporteat; pari &longs;iquidem
aquæ occurrit utrobique palmula.

Manife&longs;tum e&longs;t igitur pon­
dus vecte promovendum navim e&longs;&longs;e, non aquam, ac propterea
hypomochlij vices aquam &longs;ubire, adeóque remum cen&longs;endum
e&longs;&longs;e vectem &longs;ecundi generis, cujus extremitates potentia &
fulcrum occupant.

Hinc e&longs;t aliquod &longs;emper haberi laboris compendium, pon­
deris enim motus, qui vecte perficitur, minor e&longs;t motu poten­
tiæ remi capiti applicatæ, illud enim minùs, hæc magis ab hy­
pomochlio di&longs;tat.

Motus, inquam, qui vecte perficitur, mi­
nor e&longs;t motu potentiæ; fieri enim contingit, ut vi impre&longs;&longs;i im­
petûs, etiam ce&longs;&longs;ante remigis impul&longs;ione, navis promoveatur,
adeò ut pro ratione impetûs multo major &longs;it navis motus, quàm
potentiæ impellentis.

Verum hoc non ex vecte ob idip&longs;um,
quia vectis e&longs;t, oritur, &longs;ed quia navis innatans aquæ non eam
invenit à corpore fluido re&longs;i&longs;tentiam, quam cæteroqui ex mu­
tuo tritu inveniunt pondera corpori &longs;olido in&longs;i&longs;tentia, etiam&longs;i
vecte horizontaliter moveantur; ac proinde impre&longs;&longs;us impetus,
ce&longs;&longs;ante vi externâ, non &longs;tatim perit.

Id autem intelligendum
e&longs;t, cum in lacu vel tranquillo mari navigatur, cum &longs;cilicet
aqua &longs;uo cur&longs;u non adver&longs;atur motui navis: nam &longs;i adver&longs;o flu­
mine promovendum &longs;it navigium, contrarius aquæ impul&longs;us
impetum à remige impre&longs;&longs;um elidit, fieríque pote&longs;t, ut utilius
accidat navim trahere, quàm remigando impellere, ne &longs;ubla­
tis ex aquâ remis navigium vi aquæ fluentis retro-actum eò re­
deat, unde di&longs;ce&longs;&longs;it, & alternâ remorum immer&longs;ione atque ex­
tractione opera ludatur: præterquam quod quò magis immer&longs;a
remi palmula ab adver&longs;o flumine repellitur, eò amplius detrahi­
tur motui navis.

Ideò quamvis navim trahens plus laboris &longs;im­
pliciter impendat, quàm remigans, facit tamen operæ pretium,
qui enim navim adversùs profluentem trahit, etiam retinet, ne
retror&longs;um agatur; at qui remo impellit, &longs;ublatâ ex undis pal­
mulâ, rece&longs;&longs;um impedire non valet.

Cum itaque remus vectis &longs;it &longs;ecundi generis, remigis vires
æ&longs;timandæ &longs;unt ex Ratione, quam longitudo remi habet ad il­
lam eju&longs;dem remi partem, quæ aquæ & &longs;calmo interjecta e&longs;t;
hæc &longs;iquidem Ratio e&longs;t motuum, ac proinde & momentorum,
ut &longs;æpiùs dictum e&longs;t.

Remi autem longitudinem non ab&longs;olutam
intelligas; &longs;ed primùm ea demenda e&longs;t palmulæ particula, quæ
aquæ immergitur; quippe quæ aquam repellens qua&longs;i hypomo­
chlio incumbit.

Deinde attendendum e&longs;t, quam remi partem
remex apprehendat; &longs;i enim plures eundem remum agitent, ut
in triremibus, non &longs;unt æqualia momenta &longs;ingulorum, &longs;ed ejus,
qui &longs;calmo propior e&longs;t, minora &longs;unt (perinde atque &longs;i remo
adeò brevi uteretur) ejus, qui remi caput apprehendit, maxi­
ma &longs;unt momenta; medij autem medio modo &longs;e habent.

Quare longitudo vectis in remo definitur intervallo, quod in­
ter aquam, & remigis manum interjectum e&longs;t; ponderis di&longs;tan­
tiam ab hypomochlio metitur intervallum, quo &longs;calmus ab aquâ
palmulam excipiente disjungitur.

Si igitur intervallum illud
e&longs;t hujus intervalli duplum aut &longs;e&longs;quialterum, momenta Po­
tentiæ ad momenta ponderis Rationem habent duplam aut &longs;e&longs;­
quialteram, & quatuor remiges ad promovendam navim tan­
tumdem ferè valent ac &longs;ex aut octo, qui pari conatu navim
eandem &longs;ine remis propellerent, aut traherent.

Dixi, ferè, quia
cum motus cuju&longs;libet vectis &longs;it circularis circa punctum hypo-
mochlij, remex, qui in dextero navis latere remigat, &longs;ecun­
dùm vectis naturam arcum de&longs;cribit ad dexteram inclinatum,
id quod pariter contingit &longs;ini&longs;tro remigi arcum &longs;ini&longs;tror&longs;um
de&longs;cribenti: Cum autem navis non ni&longs;i unico motu moveri po&longs;­
&longs;it, ex his duobus circularibus &longs;ibi adver&longs;antibus re&longs;ultat tertius
medius, &longs;cilicet rectus, qui proinde tantus e&longs;&longs;e non pote&longs;t,
quantus e&longs;&longs;et, &longs;i &longs;ex aut octo homine, æquali ni&longs;u navim &longs;ine
remis impellerent aut traherent; quia contrariæ illæ directio­
nes ad dexteram & ad &longs;ini&longs;tram nequeant in tertiam mixtam
directionem coale&longs;cere, &longs;inè aliquo impetûs detrimento.

Quod &longs;i remiges omnes non con&longs;entirent in deprimendo, im­
pellendo, atque extrahendo remo, &longs;ed alij alios præverterent,
non &longs;olùm id incommodi accideret, quod ab in&longs;tituto itinere de­
flecteret navis in alterutram partem, ni&longs;i æqualis utrinque e&longs;&longs;et
impul&longs;us, verùm etiam retardaretur motus, tùm quia minor im­
pul&longs;us à paucioribus navi imprimitur, tum quia remi tardiores,
reliquis elevatis, adhuc immer&longs;i dum communi navis motu
moventur, minùs impellunt aquam po&longs;t &longs;e fugientem, & pal­
mulæ latitudo occurrenti aquæ obver&longs;a moram infert, ut eam
dividat; ex quo fit, ut aliquid impetûs ab aliis remigibus im­
pre&longs;&longs;i deteratur, qui citra hoc impedimentum adhuc per&longs;evera­
ret.

Sunt &longs;cilicet plures remi plures vectes, quibus idem pon­
dus movetur; & ni&longs;i remiges omnes con&longs;piraverint, aut navis
tardiùs movetur, aut aliquorum labor augetur: haud &longs;ecus ac
&longs;i plures homines uni vecti ad pondus aliquod elevandum appli­
carentur, uno aut altero ce&longs;&longs;ante reliquorum ni&longs;us augendus
e&longs;&longs;et, &longs;upplementum de&longs;idio&longs;orum.

Ex rationibus igitur vectis &longs;atisfit quæ&longs;tioni ab Ari&longs;totele
propo&longs;itæ, Cur <02>, qui in navis medio &longs;unt remiges, maxime navim
movent? Allatam à Philo&longs;opho re&longs;pon&longs;ionem intactam relinquo;
an &longs;atis commoda &longs;it, alij examinent.

Remigum alij in puppi
con&longs;tituuntur, qui Thranitæ dicebantur, ut e&longs;t apud Suidam,
alij in prorâ, qui Thalamij &longs;eu Thalamitæ, alij in navis medio,
qui Zygitæ: & quamvis omnes ad promovendam navim &longs;uum
conatum conferant, non tamen omnium æqualis e&longs;t labor, aut
par in movendo efficacitas; quia non &longs;ecundùm eandem Ratio­
nem &longs;ingulorum remorum longitudo in partes à &longs;calmo di&longs;tin­
guitur; &longs;ed quia puppis altior e&longs;t, & &longs;patium angu&longs;tum, major
remi pars extra navim e&longs;t, parúmque à &longs;calmo di&longs;tat remex;
ideò motus potentiæ ad motum ponderis minorem habet ratio­
nem, quàm &longs;i brevior e&longs;&longs;et inter palmulam, & &longs;calmum, lon­
giórque inter &longs;calmum & remigem di&longs;tantia, ut contingit in
medio, ubi navis depre&longs;&longs;ior e&longs;t, & maximam habet latitudi­
nem; pondere enim minùs di&longs;tante ab hypomochlio, majora
&longs;unt potentiæ momenta, cum eadem ponatur utrobique vectis
longitudo.

Quæ autem de puppi dicta &longs;unt, &longs;altem quo ad &longs;pa­
tij angu&longs;tias, etiam de prorâ intelligenda &longs;unt, quæ quia de­
pre&longs;&longs;ior e&longs;t puppi, & aliquanto altior quàm circa medium,
propterea Thalamiorum labor medius e&longs;t inter Thranitarum &
Zygitarum laborem.

Dicuntur autem remiges, qui in navis
medio &longs;unt, maximè movere vim, non quia navis motus, qui
circa hypomochlium tanquam circa centrum fit, ibi &longs;it major
motu, qui fit in puppi, &longs;i remiges parem arcum de&longs;cribant,
nam potiùs oppo&longs;itum contingit; &longs;ed quia remex in medio mi­
norem inveniens ponderis movendi re&longs;i&longs;tentiam plus navim
impellit, quàm &longs;i in puppi pariter conaretur, ubi eodem ni&longs;u
non pote&longs;t eodem temporis &longs;patio tam amplum arcum de&longs;cribe­
re.

Propterea forti&longs;&longs;imi remiges ad puppim &longs;tatuuntur, ut ma­
jore impetu producto vincant majorem re&longs;i&longs;tentiam; ideóque
Thranitis præter publicum &longs;tipendium etiam extraordinarium
datum commemorat Thucydides lib.
6. Hæc verò, quæ de An­
tiquorum navibus magis propriè dicuntur, quarum forma à
no&longs;tris di&longs;&longs;idebat, no&longs;tris tamen celocibus aut triremibus &longs;erva­
tâ analogiâ accommodari po&longs;&longs;unt; nam etiam apud nos &longs;cal­
mus ad proram & ad puppim a&longs;cendit, & in medio major e&longs;t
navigij amplitudo, ita ut, licèt remorum capita in eâdem rectâ
lineâ juxta navigij longitudinem con&longs;tituantur, di&longs;pari tamen
Ratione à &longs;calmo di&longs;tinguantur in partes.

Sed præ&longs;tat ip&longs;um navis motum paulo attentiùs con&longs;iderares
quandoquidem &longs;i hypomochlium e&longs;&longs;et pror&longs;us immobile, &
aqua locum non daret palmulæ urgenti, utique motus navis
ad motum capitis remi in eâ e&longs;&longs;et Ratione, quæ intercedit
inter di&longs;tantias &longs;calmi, & capitis remi ab aquâ.

Nam &longs;i pal­
mula B immota maneret, & &longs;calmus e&longs;&longs;et in C, motus remi­
gis AD ad motum navis CE e&longs;&longs;et ut AB ad CB.

Contra
verò &longs;i aqua nihil pror&longs;us ob&longs;i&longs;teret remo (&longs;icuti continge-
ret, &longs;i ille admodum lentè moveretur, aut palmula nimis
obliqua aquam finderet) tantúmque palmula retrogrederetur
per BH, quantum remex per AD
progreditur, immota maneret na­
vis in C: id quod etiam continge­
ret, &longs;i regre&longs;&longs;us BH ad progre&longs;­
&longs;um AD e&longs;&longs;et in Ratione CB ad
CA.

Quod &longs;i palmula à profluen­
te rapta ex B in L majus &longs;patium
conficeret, quàm remex ex A in D
(aut &longs;altem BL ad AD e&longs;&longs;et in
majore Ratione quàm CB ad CA)
utique navis ip&longs;a retrocederet, &
&longs;calmus ex C veniret in F.

Cum
igitur promoveatur navis, & aqua
palmulæ ob&longs;i&longs;tens &longs;it hypomochlium mobile, nece&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t pro­
gre&longs;&longs;u remigis AD minorem e&longs;&longs;e palmulæ regre&longs;&longs;um BI, ut
&longs;calmus ex C propellatur in E.

Quare quo magis aqua re&longs;i&longs;tit,
minú&longs;que palmula movetur in oppo&longs;itam remigis motui par­
tem, magis promovetur navis, quia majorem impul&longs;um recipit.

Majorem autem aquæ re&longs;i&longs;tentiam efficere pote&longs;t aut velocior
remi motio, aut major palmulæ immer&longs;io: con&longs;tat &longs;i quidem, &longs;i
baculo aquam lentè dividas, vix percipi in illa &longs;cindendâ labo­
rem; at &longs;i velociter baculum immer&longs;um agitare libeat, multò
validiùs illam re&longs;i&longs;tere: &longs;imiliter quò major palmulæ immer&longs;æ
pars plus aquæ propul&longs;at, eò majorem invenit re&longs;i&longs;tentiam, dif­
ficiliùs enim multa, quàm modica aqua dividitur.

Verùm cum
fe&longs;tinato opus e&longs;t, &longs;atius e&longs;t velociter remum movere, & parum
immergere palmulam, ut frequentiori remorum percu&longs;&longs;ione
plus impetûs navi imprimatur.

Quod demum &longs;pectat ad remi motum, unum &longs;upere&longs;t ob&longs;er­
vandum, videlicet, non eum tantummodo motum capiti remi
tribuendum, qui re&longs;pondet partibus navis, quatenus ex remigis
mu&longs;culorum contentione atque membrorum inclinatione pen­
det, cujus men&longs;uram definiret perpendiculum à capite remi in
&longs;ubjectum navis planum de&longs;cendens, & in eo remi iter de&longs;cri­
bens; &longs;ed præterea addendus e&longs;t motus navis, qui omnibus in
navi exi&longs;tentibus communis e&longs;t, adeò ut navis vi remorum acta
moveatur à motore tran&longs;lato.

Quapropter &longs;i AD e&longs;t univer&longs;us
capitis remi, &longs;eu manús remigis motus, demendus ex illo e&longs;t
navis progre&longs;&longs;us CE, & re&longs;iduus motus à remigis conatu, qua­
tenus remum impellit, pendet.

Sed antequàm ab hac remorum contemplatione animum
avertamus, placet innuere, quæ de Sinen&longs;ium remis attigit
Atlas Sinicus in Præfatione pag.

10, ubi de Præfectorum navi­
bus, quæ no&longs;tris triremibus æquales &longs;unt, hæc habet. Dum
ce&longs;&longs;ant ventorum flatus, ad&longs;unt de&longs;tinati, qui remulco trahant, aut
remis moles tota impellitur motis ad modum caudæ pi&longs;cium, methodo
facili, & compendiosâ; quippe &longs;ine ulla aquæ percu&longs;&longs;ione, extractio­
neve remi, vel remo unico propellitur & dirigitur navis; adeòque
unus hic &longs;ex aut octo no&longs;tratibus nautis æquivalet.

Po&longs;tremum hoc
de uno remige &longs;ex aut octo no&longs;tratibus nautis æquivalente,
adeò magnificè dictum videtur, &longs;ed & adeò jejunè expo&longs;itum,
ut verba mihi dari non facilè patiar, nec me libenter præbeam
credulum: fundamentum con&longs;tituendæ fidei fui&longs;&longs;et remigan­
di ordo de&longs;criptus, remorum forma atque po&longs;itio verbis aut
iconi&longs;mo propo&longs;ita, ut, quanta &longs;int remigis Sinici momenta,
innote&longs;cerent; aliam enim utique à no&longs;tratibus remorum for­
mam e&longs;&longs;e nece&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t, quippe quos flexiles e&longs;&longs;e oporteat, ut ad­
modum caudæ pi&longs;cium moveantur; hi &longs;cilicet po&longs;tremam cor­
poris &longs;ui partem flectunt priùs atque contorquent, ut caudam
po&longs;tmodum velociter porrigentes aquam verberent, qua re­
&longs;i&longs;tente conceptus impetus totum corpus promoveat, quandiu
ille per&longs;everat.

Ubi animadvertendum e&longs;t, quàm &longs;apienti na­
turæ in&longs;tituto factum &longs;it, ut pi&longs;ces caudam lentiùs inflectant,
&longs;ed velociùs explicent, inflectant obliquam, explicent erectam;
&longs;i enim erectam caudam velociter flecterent, ita aqua re&longs;i&longs;te­
ret, ut potiùs retrocederent, quemadmodum A&longs;taci fluviati­
les (cammaros, alij cancros fluviatiles vocant, rectè ne?

an
perperam?

non e&longs;t hujus loci examinare) quando timent, cau­
dâ aquam validè percutientes, ac qua&longs;i ad &longs;e velociter trahen­
tes non procedunt, &longs;ed retror&longs;um curvatâ caudâ &longs;ecedunt.

Sic
etiam contingeret cymbæ, &longs;i quis in puppi &longs;tans ligneam tabel­
lam extremæ perticæ infixam aquæ à tergo po&longs;itæ immitteret,
perticámque ad &longs;e velociter traheret, nam cymba retror&longs;um
agi videretur.

Cùm autem pi&longs;ces caudam & obliquè & lentiùs
inflectant, minorem aquæ re&longs;i&longs;tentiam percipiunt.

Quare, ut
remus &longs;uo motu imitetur motum caudæ pi&longs;cium, opus e&longs;t
erectam palmulam (hoc e&longs;t, in plano verticali longitudinem
navis obliquè, aut ad rectos angulos, &longs;ecante exi&longs;tentem) aquæ
occurrere, ut aquâ re&longs;i&longs;tente propellatur navis, eandem verò
palmulam po&longs;teà obliquam fieri, ne dum, intra aquam retrahi­
tur ad iterandum impul&longs;um, tantam inveniat re&longs;i&longs;tentiam, &longs;ed
aquam faciliùs findat.

Hinc conjecturâ aliquâ ducebar ali­
quando ad &longs;u&longs;picandum, an ita remi palmula reliquæ remi lon­
gitudini adnexa e&longs;&longs;et fibulâ plicatili, ut, cùm remi caput pup­
pim versùs, palmula verò in oppo&longs;itam partem impelleretur,
hæc occurrenti aquæ cederet, eámque obliquè finderet modi­
câ manûs remigis deflexione remum interim contorquentis.

Sed, ut quod res e&longs;t eloquar, vereor, ne argutum nimis, víx­
que aliquid habens compendij, artificium hoc videatur: nam
& no&longs;trates cymbularij communi remo cymbam ex puppi
agentes eam propellunt, & dirigunt aquam non percutientes,
nec remum extrahentes, cujus varia inclinatione, loco guber­
naculi, cymbæ motum temperant remigando.

Ut quid ergo
remum in duas partes, quæ fibulâ jungantur, divi&longs;um adhibe­
re: quippe qui noceat potiùs; nam remigis motus in proram
directus nullum impul&longs;um imprimit navi, ni&longs;i quando iterum
rectus factus fuerit remus.

Sed flectatur & dirigatur remus in
morem caudæ pi&longs;cium; quid hoc, ut unus remex &longs;ex aut octo
no&longs;tratibus nautis æquivaleat?

Hac autem oblatâ occa&longs;ione
cùm varias excogitaverim rationes utendi remis aquæ &longs;emper
immer&longs;is, liceat mihi per lectoris patientiam unum proponere,
quod forta&longs;&longs;e nec incommodum, nec inutile accideret, &longs;i in
u&longs;um deduceretur, tunc maximè, cum plures hinc & hinc re­
miges adhibentur, qui navis æquilibrio non officerent: neque
enim facilè author e&longs;&longs;em, ut levioribus cymbis methodus hæc
communis e&longs;&longs;et: quippe quæ deficiente ponderis hinc & hinc
æqualitate in alterutram partem nimis inclinarentur, nec citra
casûs nautæ, aut ever&longs;ionis naviculæ periculum.

Remiges
&longs;tatuo hinc & hinc &longs;calmo in&longs;i&longs;tentes; id quod incommo­
dum non erit; quandoquidem additis extrin&longs;ecùs opportu­
nis fulcris cra&longs;&longs;iorem &longs;atí&longs;que firmam tabulam impono me­
diocris latitudinis à &longs;calmo di&longs;tantem tanto intervallo, quan-
to opus e&longs;t, ut interjici valeat remus, commodéque agitari:
externam autem additæ tabulæ oram ambiat limbus, ne facilè
pes labatur; alterum enim pedem tabulæ, alterum &longs;calmo com­
mode imponere poterit remex.

Remi longitudinem definit al­
titudo &longs;calmi ferè &longs;upra navis fundum,
addita mediocri hominis altitudine;
ipsíque remi capiti cylindrulus tran&longs;­
ver&longs;arius injicitur, ita tamen, ut in eo­
dem plano inveniatur cum remi pal­
mulâ: apprehen&longs;o &longs;i quidem utrâque
remigis manu hinc & hinc cylindrulo,
palmulæ planities aquæ obvertitur,
eámque impellit; apprehensâ autem
alterâ tantum extremitate, &longs;ive A, &longs;i­
ve B, quando retrahitur remus, pal­
mula DE aquam findit, & e&longs;t quo­
dammodo parallela carinæ.

Duplicem
igitur motum remo conciliare oportet,
alterum quidem à puppi ad proram, & vici&longs;&longs;im, cùm &longs;cilicet im­
pellitur, & retrahitur, alterum verò circa &longs;uum axem longitu­
dinis, ut convertatur nunc ad impellendam, nunc ad findendam
aquam.

Primus motus perficitur, &longs;i ferreo circulo HI remus in­
&longs;eratur duos polos habenti; quorum alter &longs;calmum, alter additam
tabulam ingrediatur (&longs;ivè potiùs excavatæ congruæ crenæ in­
cumbant, ut extrahi pro libito po&longs;&longs;int) síntque facilè ver&longs;atiles:
remus enim in eodem plano verticali &longs;emper exi&longs;tens deprimi
pote&longs;t, ut horizontem versùs inclinetur, atque iterum elevari ac
etiam in oppo&longs;itam partem inclinari.

Secundus autem motus fa­
cillimè habetur, &longs;i remo ferreus rotundus claviculus F adjicia­
tur circuli HI &longs;uperiorem partem contingens; impedit enim,
ne remus deor&longs;um prolabatur, adeóque nullo labore converti­
tur circa axem &longs;uæ longitudinis remus, dimi&longs;sâ alterutrâ cylin­
druli AB extremitate, quando retrahitur.

Inventum hoc rudi­
ter propo&longs;itum expolire, atque accuratiùs excolere poteris, in­
genio&longs;e Lector, qui forta&longs;&longs;e tuâ indu&longs;triä con&longs;equeris artem
mihi ignotam remos ita di&longs;ponendi, ut remex unus pluribus
nautis æquivaleat, quemadmodum de Sinen&longs;ibus narratur.
CAPUT XV.
Quomodo Naves à gubernaculo moveantur.

REs e&longs;t, cui a&longs;&longs;iduus u&longs;us admirationem detraxi&longs;&longs;e videtur,
non tamen propterea minus habet admirabilitatis, motus
&longs;cilicet navium, quæ à gubernaculo reguntur, cùm magnum
pondus temporis momento moveatur.

Nam & Apo&longs;tolus S. Ja­
cobus in Canonicâ Epi&longs;tola cap.3.ait, Ecce & naves cum magnæ
&longs;int, & à ventis validis minentur, circumferuntur à modico guber­
naculo, ubi impetus dirigentis voluerit.

Et Ari&longs;toteles Mechan.
quæ&longs;t.

5. inquirit. Cur parvum exi&longs;tens gubernaculum, & in ex­
tremo navigio, tantas habet vtres, ut ab exiguo temone, & ab homi­
nis unius viribus alioquin modicè utentis, magnæ navigiorum movean­
tur moles? Partes duas in gubernaculo invenimus; alteram ex­
trin&longs;ecùs navi adjectam, ligneam videlicet alam, &longs;ive cardini­
bus, circa quos converti pote&longs;t, po&longs;tremæ puppis parti affixam,
&longs;ive ad latus puppi adjacentem, tignóque, quod ex &longs;calmo a&longs;­
&longs;urgit, adalligatam, prout maritimo vel fluviatili itineri de&longs;ti­
nata &longs;unt navigia; alteram intra navim, temonis in morem; ex
cujus conver&longs;ione aut pars illa externa in oppo&longs;itam plagam
convertitur, ita ut deductâ temonis extremitate ad dexteram,
gubernaculi ala extremæ puppi adjacens in &longs;ini&longs;tram circa &longs;uos
cardines deflectat, & vici&longs;&longs;im hæc ad dexteram, temone in &longs;i­
ni&longs;tram conver&longs;o: aut in navigiis, quorum in fluminibus u&longs;us
e&longs;t, gubernaculum ad puppis latus habentibus, depre&longs;&longs;o temo­
ne &longs;uperior extremitas alæ in triangulum &longs;ubjecto cylindro
infixum conformatæ propiùs accedit ad navim, temone autem
elevato ab illa recedit: contra verò &longs;i ala infra cylindrum con&longs;ti­
tuatur, ejus extremitas inferior ad navim accedit temone ele­
vato, à navi recedit temone depre&longs;&longs;o.

Quemadmodum autem ad propellendam navim in&longs;tituti &longs;unt
remi, ita ad eju&longs;dem cur&longs;um dirigendum, atque pro opportu­
nitate in dexteram aut in &longs;ini&longs;tram inclinandum, clavus ad-
jectus e&longs;t.

Quamquam enim remorum pul&longs;u navis acta proram
in dexteram obvertere po&longs;&longs;it, &longs;i remiges &longs;ini&longs;tri ce&longs;&longs;ent, atque
è contrario in &longs;ini&longs;tram ce&longs;&longs;antibus dexteris; aut etiam vento
navim impellente fieri po&longs;&longs;it hæc in alterutram partem decli­
natio modò pa&longs;&longs;o, modò contracto velo, ut me ob&longs;erva&longs;&longs;e me­
mini, cum ex in&longs;ula Seelandia per fretum Ore&longs;unticum in Sca­
niam (El&longs;ingorâ &longs;cilicet El&longs;emburgum) navigiolo transfreta­
rem: id tamen longè faciliùs, atque ad unius gubernatoris ar­
bitrium perficitur conver&longs;o opportunè clavo, ut quotidiano
experimento docemur.

Porrò dupliciter gubernaculi motum con&longs;iderare po&longs;&longs;umus;
neque enim eadem e&longs;t ratio, cùm navis quie&longs;cit, nullu&longs;que e&longs;t
aquæ motus, atque cùm navis vento &longs;eu remis agitur, aut aqua
ip&longs;a movetur.

Et quidem &longs;i navigium in aquà immotâ quie&longs;­
cat, qui gubernaculi temonem movet, e&longs;t potentia applicata
vecti, cujus hypomochlium e&longs;t aqua, &longs;i navis non &longs;it tantæ gra­
vitatis, ut faciliùs ip&longs;a moveatur, quam tota aqua propellatur
ab alâ gubernaculi; & tunc e&longs;t vectis &longs;ecundi generis, nam
puppis, aquâ re&longs;i&longs;tente, &longs;ecedit ad dexteram aut ad &longs;ini&longs;tram
&longs;equens temonis conver&longs;ionem.

At &longs;i tanta &longs;it navis gravitas,
ut multo faciliùs tota aqua propellatur, quàm navis loco mo­
veatur, vectis e&longs;t primi generis habens hypomochlium in car­
dinibus, circa quos gubernaculi ala convertitur, pondus au­
tem, quod movetur, e&longs;t aqua, quæ eò faciliùs, minori &longs;cilicet
labore, propellitur, quò longior e&longs;t temo; tunc enim potentia
plus habet momenti.

Hinc duplex vectis ratio invenitur, cùm
aliquâ ex parte aqua, aliquâ ex parte puppis movetur; quo in
motu &longs;atis con&longs;tat neque motum puppis fieri circa aquam extre­
mæ gubernaculi alæ re&longs;pondentem, neque motum aquæ re&longs;pon­
dentis extremo gubernaculo fieri circa cardines puppi inhæren­
tes; &longs;ed conver&longs;ionem fieri circa punctum aliquod intermedium
reciprocè acceptum pro Ratione re&longs;i&longs;tentiarum aquæ & navis,
juxta dicta cap.5. hujus libri.

Cùm autem re&longs;i&longs;tentia aquæ æ&longs;ti­
manda &longs;it ex magnitudine & figura alæ gubernaculi aquam
ip&longs;am impellentis, & re&longs;i&longs;tentia navis pariter definienda &longs;it tùm
ex ejus gravitate, tum ex aquæ propellendæ quantitate, dum
navis in dexteram aut in &longs;ini&longs;tram convertitur, patet nul­
lum certum punctum navibus omnibus commune &longs;tatui po&longs;&longs;e;
&longs;unt &longs;iquidem huju&longs;modi re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ multiplici varietati ob­
noxiæ.

At verò cùm navis in motu e&longs;t, & vento impellente &longs;eu re­
mis agitur, potentia quidem pro temonis longitudine &longs;ua ha­
bet momenta, & ad navis conver&longs;ionem juvat, magis tamen
accipiendo vim externam & ferendo, quàm agendo & facien­
do, hoc e&longs;t retinendo gubernaculum in illa obliquâ po&longs;itione
adversùs vim aquæ in contrarium nitentis, aut re&longs;i&longs;tentis.

Quò
enim velociùs fertur navis, obviam aquam prorâ &longs;cindens illam
ità dividit, ut ad navis latera hinc atque hinc velociùs refluat
in puppim; ubi &longs;i gubernaculi alam inveniat rectam, pergit na­
vis recto itinere; Sed &longs;i aqua refluens obli­
quum gubernaculum offendat, ut &longs;i exi&longs;ten­
te carina AB fuerit gubernaculum obli­
quum CD, aqua in alam AD incurrens
dum illam urget, puppim cogit declinare
ex A in E, & prora obvertitur versùs F.

Hæc tamen, quæ de aquá ad navis late­
ra refluente dicta &longs;unt, non ita accipi velim,
ut non ni&longs;i ab ejus impetu flecti navis cur­
&longs;um exi&longs;times; &longs;ed hæc deflexio præcipuè
tribuenda e&longs;t re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ ip&longs;ius aquæ, in
quam incurrit gubernaculum obliquum,
dum navis tota impellitur; eò autem major
e&longs;t aquæ re&longs;i&longs;tentia, quò velociùs illam &longs;cindi oportet, ut &longs;æ­
piùs dictum e&longs;t.

Ideò quo validiore venti aut remorum impul­
&longs;u agitur navis, faciliùs flectitur ope gubernaculi, majorem
quippe invenit re&longs;i&longs;tentiam.

Cum verò re&longs;i&longs;tentia hæc ex al­
terutra tantùm parte inveniatur, nece&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t proram in eandem
obverti plagam.

Cujus rei obvium experimentum &longs;umere qui&longs;­
que pote&longs;t, &longs;i corpus aliquod angulatum (cuju&longs;modi e&longs;&longs;et nor­
ma, qua ad angulum rectum de&longs;cribendum utimur) in plano
inclinato æquabili ac polito de&longs;cendere permittat: nam &longs;i, quod
ponè &longs;equitur, brachium in offendiculum aliquod incurrat, il­
lico reliquum brachium ad eam partem inclinari videbit, im­
petu &longs;cilicet promovente corpus, atque objectum impedimen­
tum declinante.

Quare id, quod navim maximè movet in dexteram aut &longs;i-
ni&longs;tram, e&longs;t impetus ab ip&longs;o vento aut à remigibus navi impre&longs;­
&longs;us; gubernaculum autem infert moram & impedimentum, ne
motus omnino fiat juxta directionem impetûs ab impellente im­
pre&longs;&longs;i: quamdiu verò impedimentum per&longs;everat, navis magis
aut minùs obliquè fertur, pro ut modificata impetûs directio
exigit.

Juvat autem, ut dictum e&longs;t, aqua, quæ à prorâ dividi­
tur, & ad latera refluit, maximè &longs;i adver&longs;o flumine, aut contra
marini æ&longs;tus cur&longs;um navigatio in&longs;tituatur; aucto enim impedi­
mento faciliùs flectitur in&longs;tituta progre&longs;&longs;io; &longs;ed idcircò etiam
navis motus retardatur magis.

Quod quidem &longs;pectat ad gubernaculum extremæ puppis pla­
næ faciei adhærens, ut in majoribus navigiis maritimo itineri
de&longs;tinatis, &longs;atis jam explicatum e&longs;t: unum addendum videtur,
quod in navigiis ad devehendas merces fabricatis in fo&longs;sâ qua­
dam manufactâ aliquando ob&longs;erva&longs;&longs;e me memini; ex puppi vi­
delicet extremâ in acutum a&longs;&longs;urgente, qua&longs;i caudæ in morem,
clavus longiùs protendebatur apici puppis in&longs;i&longs;tens remo ab&longs;i­
milis tantùm, quatenus palmula paulò latior, nec juxta &longs;capi
longitudinem directa, &longs;ed inflexa intra aquam immergebatur;
caput autem temonis fune jungebatur navigij plano ita, ut gu­
bernaculi pars externa &longs;uo pondere recidere nequiret, ac fun­
dum alvei non peteret, &longs;ed palmula paulò infra aquæ &longs;uperfi­
ciem con&longs;i&longs;teret.

Hinc enim fiebat, ut temonis capite in alteru­
tram partem adducto in eandem puppis recederet aquâ re&longs;i&longs;ten­
te palmulæ, ac proinde prora in oppo&longs;itam partem obvertere­
tur: perinde atque in cymbis gubernaculo de&longs;titutis, cùm remi
ad latus extremæ puppis directè immer&longs;i caput ad &longs;e retrahit
nauta, puppim ip&longs;am impellit, ac proram in oppo&longs;itam partem
convertit.

Huc &longs;pectare po&longs;&longs;unt, quæ habet Atlas Sinicus
pag.123 in XI Provincia Fokien loquens de flumine Min, quod
ex Puching ad oppidum u&longs;que Xuiken per valles & &longs;axa ingen­
ti impetu ac violentiâ volvitur, inde placidi&longs;&longs;imum flumen e&longs;t;
& quantumcumque violentum enavigatur tamen à Sinis con­
&longs;uetâ illorum indu&longs;triâ, ac parvarum navicularum artificio: hæ
enim naves clavum, ut aliæ non habent, &longs;ed duos longi&longs;&longs;imè
porrectos, ad puppim unum, ad proram alterum: his per &longs;axa
ac &longs;copulos prominentes facillime ac veloci&longs;&longs;imè naves, ac &longs;i
fræno equos continerent, dirigunt.
Hæc ibi.

Sed ut aliquid etiam de guberna culo ad puppis latus con&longs;ti­
tuto in navigiis, quorum poti&longs;&longs;imus u&longs;us e&longs;t in fluviis, dicatur,
animadvertendum e&longs;t huju&longs;modi navigia non &longs;olùm proram,
&longs;ed & puppim habere, quæ obliquè a&longs;&longs;urgentes in acutum de­
&longs;inunt, gubernaculum autem con&longs;tare ex cylindro obliquè
de&longs;cendénte juxta puppis longitudinem, atque ex alâ triangu­
lari ut plurimùm &longs;ur&longs;um re&longs;piciente, cujus latus unum cylin­
dro congruit, cui ïnfixum e&longs;t.

Quandiu ala &longs;ur&longs;um re&longs;picit,
nihil impedit navis motum, æqualiter enim aqua hinc & hinc
fluit, ac proinde navis fertur juxta impetûs à vento aut à remi­
gibus impre&longs;&longs;i directionem (idem dic, cùm navis trahitur)
quam &longs;equitur, ni&longs;i aliquid fortuito interveniat, à quo turbe­
tur motus, & præter nautarum voluntatem aliò flectatur.

Quod
&longs;i convoluto circà &longs;uum axem cylindro, ala in hanc aut illam
partem vertatur, jam occurrit aquæ, ex cujus e&longs;i&longs;tentiâ impe­
dimentum objicitur navi, ne recta feratur, &longs;ed in alteram par­
tem detorquetur: nam &longs;i depre&longs;&longs;o temone, qui priùs erat hori­
zonti parallelus, ala versùs navim inclinetur, aqua inter guber­
naculum & navim intercepta re&longs;i&longs;tit, atque interfluens conatur
alam gubernaculi in directum re&longs;tituere: quapropter puppim in
dexteram trahens, illíque ad dexteram re&longs;i&longs;tens (clavus &longs;cilicet
dextero puppis lateri adjacet) proram obvertit ad &longs;ini&longs;tram.

At
&longs;i gubernaculi ala in oppo&longs;itam navi partem extror&longs;um verta­
tur, obviam habet aquam externam, qua re&longs;i&longs;tente repellitur
puppis in &longs;ini&longs;tram, & prora in dexteram convertitur.

Quod &longs;i
alam triangularem placeat potiùs cylindro &longs;ubjicere, elevato te­
mone ala accedit ad navim, & depre&longs;&longs;o temone ala recedit à na­
vi: quapropter ibi puppis repellitur in &longs;ini&longs;tram, hîc ab aquâ in­
tercurrente trahitur in dexteram, motù&longs;que oppo&longs;iti proræ
conveniunt.

Ex his facilè innote&longs;cit, quid præ&longs;tet gubernaculum inter
puppes duorum pontonum, quos impo&longs;itus pons jungit, vali­
dú&longs;que rudens congruæ longitudinis retinet, ne &longs;ecundo flu­
mine rapiantur; prout enim in hanc vel illam partem guberna­
culi ala vertitur, obvium habet interjectarum aquarum impe­
tum, quo propellitur in adver&longs;am partem, eáque ratione traji­
citur flumen, ut in Pado & aliis Galliæ Ci&longs;alpinæ fluviis pa&longs;&longs;im
videre e&longs;t.

Illud po&longs;tremò con&longs;ideratione dignum e&longs;t, quod ad ip&longs;ius
navis conver&longs;ionem attinet nimirùm quodnam &longs;it punctum
circa quod convertitur: Manife&longs;tum e&longs;t enim neque circa pup­
pim tanquam circa centrum de&longs;cribi arcum à prorâ, neque vi­
ci&longs;&longs;im circa proram qua&longs;i centrum arcum à puppi de&longs;cribi, quia
aquæ quantitas re&longs;pondens longitudini carinæ plurimum re­
&longs;i&longs;tit, ne circulariter moveatur tota ad eandem partem, coge­
retur &longs;cilicet nimis amplum arcum de&longs;cribere, nimí&longs;que veloci­
ter moveri in latus, ut per de&longs;tinatum navigationis Rumbum
nova loxodromia in&longs;titueretur: faciliùs igitur convertitur na­
vis, &longs;i dum pars anterior proræ aquam in dexteram propellit,
reliqua pars po&longs;terior puppi proxima aquam repellat in &longs;i­
ni&longs;tram, utraque enim extremitas minore arcu de&longs;cripto ad ma­
jorem angulum carinam inclinat atque deflectit à lineâ prioris
cursûs, & minore velocitate aquam urgens minorem invenit
re&longs;i&longs;tentiam.

Fit igitur conver&longs;io circa punctum aliquod me­
dium inter proram & puppim; illud autem e&longs;t, circa quod na­
tura faciliùs a&longs;&longs;equitur propo&longs;itum, & minore motu removetur
impedimentum, quod ab aquâ occurrente infertur, quæ cùm
dividatur à prorâ, refluátque juxtà navis latera, æqualiter qui­
dem à prorâ di&longs;pertitur, &longs;ed ubi navis ventrem, hoc e&longs;t ampli&longs;­
&longs;imam navigij partem prætergre&longs;&longs;a e&longs;t, offendens ex alterâ
parte gubernaculi alam fluere non pote&longs;t, qua velocitate flue­
ret nullo objecto offendiculo; propterea aquæ refluenti ex ad­
ver&longs;o navis latere objiciendum e&longs;t obliquè puppis latus, ut illa
pariter lentiùs fluat, divisóque impedimento æquales aquæ por­
tiones ex utroque puppis latere fluant.

Quare probabili con­
jecturâ exi&longs;timo conver&longs;ionem fieri circa illud carinæ punctum,
quod re&longs;pondet maximæ navigij amplitudini; pars quippe na­
vigij anterior juxta &longs;uam latitudinem occurrens aquæ invenit
re&longs;i&longs;tentiam; aqua igitur incurrens in gubernaculum movet
partem po&longs;teriorem in latus, ubi non e&longs;t tam valida aquæ re­
&longs;i&longs;tentia.

Cum autem in majoribus navigiis præcipuus malus
&longs;tatuatur in maxima navigij amplitudine, hoc e&longs;t, ubi carinæ
longitudo be&longs;&longs;em relinquit puppim ver&longs;us, & trientem versùs
proram, carina ad proram &longs;pectans minùs movetur quàm quæ
ad puppim; &longs;ed propter notabilem proræ projecturam &longs;i pars na­
vis &longs;uprema in&longs;piciatur, malus ille e&longs;t circa mediam totius na-
vis longitudinem, ibíque fit conver&longs;io.

Cæterùm quicumque
navis formam, tormentorumque bellicorum di&longs;po&longs;itionem ac
numerum ob&longs;ervet, utique centrum gravitatis inter puppim &
malum præcipuum interjectum e&longs;&longs;e affirmabit; præ&longs;ertim cum
id nece&longs;&longs;e &longs;it, ne ventorum vi prora nimis deprimatur; id quod
multo manife&longs;tiùs innote&longs;cit in minoribus navigiis, &longs;i fortè ve­
lo uti contingat, malus enim maximè ad proram accedit.

Sit igitur carina AB, maxima navis latitudo HI, malus pri­
marius in G, centrum gravitatis navigij
ex.
gr. in K.

Duo &longs;unt principia moven­
tia; unum e&longs;t ventus in G, alterum e&longs;t
aqua refluens in AD: duo pariter &longs;unt hy­
pomochlia, &longs;eu impedimenta; vento re&longs;i&longs;tit
gubernaculum AD, propterea navim mo­
tione tran&longs;versâ promovens transfert cen­
trum gravitatis K ver&longs;us H: aquæ refluenti
re&longs;i&longs;tit vis venti in G, ita ut non valeat na­
vim retror&longs;um agere, propterea puppim ex
A transfert in E, & centro gravitatis K im­
petum imprimit dirigentem versùs I, cui
tamen prævalente impetu venti dirigente
versùs H, obliquus navis motus efficitur.

Quare duplex e&longs;t
vectis &longs;ecundi generis; aqua in AD ad re&longs;i&longs;tentiam centri gra­
vitatis K habet momentum ut AG, &longs;eu DG, ad KG: Ventus
in G ad eju&longs;dem centri gravitatis K re&longs;i&longs;tentiam habet momen­
tum ut GA ad KA.

Ex quo con&longs;tat majorem quidem e&longs;&longs;e Ra­
tionem AG ad KG minorem, quàm ad KA majorem; &longs;ed
multo validiorem potentiam e&longs;&longs;e ventum, quàm aquam re­
fluentem, ni&longs;i fortè addatur naturalis fluxus aquæ, qui aliquan­
do prævalere digno&longs;citur ex occultis Maris Currentibus, quæ
navim aliquando retror&longs;um agunt contrà vim venti.

Sed quo­
niam tam varia & multiplex e&longs;t navigiorum forma, nec in iis
con&longs;truendis omnes artifices eandem &longs;ervant partium membro­
rúmque Rationem, nulla a&longs;&longs;ignari pote&longs;t certa Ratio, quæ in­
tercedat inter di&longs;tantiam centri gravitatis ab extremitate pup­
pis, atque di&longs;tantiam puncti, circa quod fit conver&longs;io, ab ea­
dem extremitate.

Hìc autem (ne quis facilè &longs;imiliter labatur) fateor me ali-
quando veri quadam &longs;pecie deceptum exi&longs;tima&longs;&longs;e intervallum
inter extremam proram & punctum conver&longs;ionis ad quartam
totius longitudinis partem proximè &longs;tatuendum e&longs;&longs;e; ducebar
&longs;cilicet quadam analogiâ de&longs;umpta ex cylindro ligneo innatan­
te, cujus quie&longs;centis extremitatem &longs;i tanto impetu percu&longs;&longs;eris,
quo certum &longs;patium percurrat, videbar mihi ritè inferre
punctum, circa quod convertitur, di&longs;tare ab extremitate per­
cu&longs;sâ ad totius longitudinis dodrantem: &longs;atis enim ip&longs;o u&longs;u in­
note&longs;cebat, nec punctum medium, &longs;cilicet centrum gravitatis,
nec oppo&longs;itam extremitatem e&longs;&longs;e centrum conver&longs;ionis.

Vide­
batur autem naturæ &longs;ua jura tueri conanti valde con&longs;enta­
neum, &longs;i corpus amans quietis externo impul&longs;ui ita ob&longs;ecun­
det, ut quam minimo totius corporis motu impre&longs;&longs;us impetus
partem percu&longs;&longs;am pro &longs;uæ inten&longs;ionis modo transferat.

Sit enim Cylindrus AB, cujus medium atque centrum gra­
vitatis C: AE verò &longs;it
totius longitudinis do­
drans: percutiatur extre­
mitas A tanto impetu,
quanto illa ferri po&longs;&longs;et
per &longs;patium AD, &longs;i mo­
veretur circa centrum C.

Ducatur igitur per C
recta DO æqualis toti
cylindro; qui &longs;i movere­
tur circa punctum C, utique &longs;uo motu de&longs;criberet duos Secto­
res, ACD, & BCO.

Item per E ducatur ip&longs;i DO parallela
FI ita, ut ip&longs;i EA æqualis &longs;it EF, & ip&longs;i EB æqualis &longs;it EI.

Cy­
lindrus igitur AB conver&longs;ione factâ circa punctum E de&longs;cribe­
ret Sectores AEF & BEI duobus prioribus &longs;imiles.

Sunt au­
tem Sectores &longs;imiles, ut quadrata Radiorum; quemadmodum
facilè colligitur ex 2 lib.
12: atque ideò, cum Radius AC ad
Radium AE &longs;it ut 2 ad 3, Sector ACD ad Sectorem AEF e&longs;t
ut 4 ad 9: & quia Radius BC ad Radium BE e&longs;t ut 2 ad 1,
Sector BCO ad Sectorem BEI e&longs;t ut 4 ad 1. Motus igitur cy­
lindri circa centrum C ad motum circa centrum E e&longs;t ut 8 ad
10, &longs;i Sectores &longs;imiles de&longs;cribantur.

Atqui impetus impre&longs;&longs;us
&longs;olùm pote&longs;t extremitatem A transferre per &longs;patium æquale
ip&longs;i AD (e&longs;t autem arcus AD ad arcum AF &longs;imilem, ut Ra­
dius AC ad Radium AE, hoc e&longs;t ut 2 ad 3) igitur eandem
transfert &longs;olùm per AG be&longs;&longs;em arcûs AF, ac proinde motus e&longs;t
per Sectores AEG & BEH, qui ex ult.

lib.
6. &longs;unt bes duo­
rum Sectorum AEF & BEI, quorum &longs;umma e&longs;t 10; ip&longs;ius au­
tem 10 bes e&longs;t 6 2/3. Motus igitur circa centrum E minor e&longs;t
motu circa centrum C, & impetus impre&longs;&longs;us æqualiter transfert
extremitatem A.

Fateor potui&longs;&longs;e &longs;tatui AE mediam proportionalem inter to­
tam longitudinem AB & ejus &longs;emi&longs;&longs;em AC, & motus fui&longs;&longs;et
paulo minor.

Ponatur enim tota AB 200, AC 100, e&longs;t AE
141 2/5 proximè: igitur ut quadratum AC ad quadratum AE
mediæ proportionalis, hoc e&longs;t ut 10000 ad 19994, ita Sector
ACD ad &longs;ectorem AEF &longs;imilem; & ut ip&longs;ius CB 100 qua­
dratum 10000, ad ip&longs;ius EB 59 proximè quadratum 3481, ita
Sector BCO ad Sectorem &longs;imilem BEI.

Quare &longs;umma Secto­
rum ACD, BCO e&longs;t 20000, Sectorum verò AEF, BEI e&longs;t
23475. Sed quia ut AC ad AE, ita arcus AD ad arcum AF,
quarum partium AD e&longs;t 100, AF e&longs;t 141 proximè: & a&longs;&longs;ump­
to arcu AG 100, &longs;umma Sectorum AEG & BEH, ad &longs;um­
mam Sectorum AEF & BEI erit ut 100 ad 141, hoc e&longs;t, ut
16649 ad 23475: minor igitur e&longs;t quàm &longs;umma Sectorum
ACD & BCO, quæ e&longs;t 20000. At &longs;i AE &longs;it 150, & EB 50,
&longs;umma Sectorum AEF, BEI ut 25000, bes autem 16666 2/3,
qui excedit numerum &longs;uperiùs inventum 16649 adeò modico
intervallo, ut contemnendum &longs;it; cùm maximè impetus per ar­
cum AF aliquantulo majorem motum efficiat quàm per cir­
cumferentiam circuli minoris, ac propterea cen&longs;endus &longs;it arcus
AG aliquantulum major quàm arcus AD; idcircò vero pro­
pior e&longs;t AE dodrans totius longitudinis AB, quàm AE media
proportionalis inter AC & AB.

Verùm quæ de cylindro in aquâ quie&longs;cente dicuntur &longs;atis
probabiliter, non omninò congruere po&longs;&longs;unt motui navis, quæ
præter motum aquæ percutientis gubernaculum promovetur à
vento aut à remigibus, & præterea non habet æquabili ductu
con&longs;titutam figuram, quemadmodum cylindrus: propterea
huic analogiæ non acquie&longs;cendum duxi.

Sed & illud adden-
dum, quod neque de cylindro &longs;atis certus e&longs;&longs;e po&longs;&longs;um; nam &longs;i
alia fiat hypothe&longs;is, & ad totius longitudinis be&longs;&longs;em &longs;tatuatur
punctum conver&longs;ionis ita ut &longs;emi&longs;&longs;is AC &longs;it 3, AE verò &longs;it 4,
& EB &longs;it 2; Sector ACD ad Sectorem AEF e&longs;t ut 9 ad 16,
& Sector BCO ad Sectorem BEI e&longs;t ut 9 ad 4; igitur &longs;umma
priorum ad &longs;ummam po&longs;teriorum e&longs;t ut 18 ad 20. Atqui Sector
AEG ad Sectorem AEF e&longs;t ut 3 ad 4 (id quod de &longs;imili
Sectore BEH ad Sectorem BEI intelligendum e&longs;t) igitur, cum
AEF &longs;it 16, AEG e&longs;t 12, & cum BEI &longs;it 4, BEH e&longs;t 3, ac
propterea &longs;umma Sectorum AEG & BEH e&longs;t ut 15 ad &longs;um­
mam Sectorum ACD & BCO ut 18. In prima autem hypo­
the&longs;i quando erat AC ut 2 & AE ut 3, erat motuum Ratio ut
8 ad 6 2/3, quæ e&longs;t planè eadem cum Ratione 18 ad 15. Cum
itaque eadem motuum Ratio &longs;equatur, &longs;ive AE &longs;it bes, &longs;ive
dodrans totius longitudinis AB, cur dodrantem potiùs quàm
be&longs;&longs;em pronunciemus, ni&longs;i aliunde doceamur?
CAPUT XVI.
An malus in motu navis habeat Rationem vectis.

NAvim impelli ventorum vi certum e&longs;t, qui velum implent
ex antennâ &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;um atque expa&longs;&longs;um, funibù&longs;que, quos
Propedes vocant, po&longs;teriori navis parti alligatum.

Quoniam
verò, ut quotidiano u&longs;u didicimus, quò altiùs evecta fuerit an­
tenna, eò validiùs, cæteris paribus, navis à vento impellitur,
quæritur ab Ari&longs;totele quæ&longs;t.6. Cur quando antenna &longs;ublimior
fuerit, ii&longs;dem velis, & codem vento, celeriùs feruntur navigia?
Cau&longs;am ille ex vectis rationibus petendam opinatur, qua&longs;i ma­
lus &longs;it vectis habens hypomochlium in ea carinæ parte, cui in­
figitur; potentia movens &longs;it ventus velum implens &longs;upremæ
mali parti applicatus, ubi antenna cum malo connectitur; pon­
dus verò &longs;it navigium: quò igitur potentia magis ab hypomo­
chlio abe&longs;t, plus habere momenti manife&longs;tum e&longs;t.

Verùm non
ego hîc inani labore &longs;u&longs;cepto, ut Philo&longs;ophi dicto aliquam veri
&longs;imilitudinem adjiciam, tempus conteram: Cui otium e&longs;t,
Authores legat.

Si quæ&longs;tio e&longs;&longs;et, Cur longiores mali &longs;int magis obnoxij peri­
culo fractionis, facilè invenirem rationem vectis, quia ponde­
ris vicem &longs;ubeunt particulæ ip&longs;æ, quarum nexus per vim &longs;ol­
vendus e&longs;t in fractione; quò autem longior e&longs;t malus, ad mo­
tum partium, quæ dividuntur, majorem Rationem habet mo­
tus venti applicati longiori malo, quàm motus eju&longs;dem brevio­
ri malo applicati.

Sed hîc, ubi de navis motu quæ&longs;tio e&longs;t, &longs;ive
altè a&longs;&longs;urgat malus, &longs;ive brevis &longs;it, &longs;emper eadem e&longs;t Ratio mo­
tûs venti velo excepti, atque navis.

Quomodo enim pterna,
ide&longs;t ima mali calx, e&longs;&longs;e pote&longs;t extremus vectis in carinâ, cui
in&longs;eritur, velut in hypomochlio quie&longs;cens, navis verò tota &longs;i­
mul mota æquali motu, rationem habet ponderis à vecte impul­
&longs;i?

nonne hypomochlium, pondus, & potentia æquali planè
motu moventur?

neque enim velociùs movetur ventus velo ex­
ceptus, quàm ip&longs;um velum, nec velum velociùs quàm navis;
& cum ip&longs;a navi planè æqualiter movetur carinæ punctum, cui
malus infigitur.

Quis autem motus per Vectem, qua Vectis e&longs;t
Facultas mechanica, huju&longs;modi æqualitatem admittit?

Non
igitur malus in motu, quo navis progreditur, Rationem vectis
habere dicendus e&longs;t.

Sit malus CD cujus pterna C in&longs;eratur carinæ AB, car­
che&longs;io autem D applicetur an­
tenna cum velo pendente, cujus
imæ extremitates navis lateribus
opportunè ad ventum excipien­
dum jungantur.

Certum e&longs;t ma­
lum CD moveri &longs;emper &longs;ibi pa­
rallelum (ni&longs;i fortè aliquanto
plus extremitas D moveatur, &longs;i­
cut in homine plus caput move­
tur quàm pedes &longs;upra &longs;phæricam
terræ vel aquæ &longs;uperficiem, &longs;ed
hoc nihil refert) neque po&longs;&longs;e obtinere rationem vectis ni&longs;i
comparatè ad eum motum, quo circa C tanquam circa centrum
fieret conver&longs;io; quemadmodum &longs;i deprimenda e&longs;&longs;et prora &
elevanda puppis, ut carina AB non e&longs;&longs;et horizonti parallela,
&longs;ed B deprimeretur infra planum horizontale, & A &longs;upra illud
elevaretur.

Verùm (præterquam quod non hic e&longs;t navis mo­
tus, de quo di&longs;putatur) ob&longs;ervandum e&longs;t in navigiis minoribus,
quibus movendis unicus malus adhibetur, hunc &longs;tatui non in
medio navigio, &longs;ed magis accedere ad proram, in majoribus
autem navibus, quæ plures malos habent, maximum quidem
malum, cujus validi&longs;&longs;imæ &longs;unt vires, aliquanto quidem magis
ad puppim quàm ad proram accedere (&longs;i longitudo in &longs;uperiori
parte attendatur) ut in Oceano videre e&longs;t Anglicas, Gallicas,
Hollandicas naves, comparatè tamen ad carinam, majorem
carinæ partem puppim, minorem proram re&longs;picere.

Id autem
eo con&longs;ilio factum e&longs;t, ne malus centro gravitatis navis re&longs;pon­
deat, neque exercere po&longs;&longs;it munus vectis deprimendo proram,
puppímque elevando.

Quando enim magis ad proram accedit
malus, major pars navigij inter malum & puppim interjecta re­
nititur &longs;ua gravitate, ne elevetur, quando verò à medio pup­
pim versùs recedit, major pars navis, quæ deprimenda e&longs;&longs;et,
majorem aquæ re&longs;i&longs;tentiam invenit; ac proinde &longs;ervatà carinæ
po&longs;itione horizontali faciliùs navis movetur.

Hinc tardiorem
fieri navigij cur&longs;um contingit, vel quia perperam collocatus e&longs;t
malus, vel quia pondera in navi non &longs;unt ritè di&longs;tributa, adeò
ut à malo vix ab&longs;it centrum gravitatis navigij onu&longs;ti; tunc enim
depre&longs;sâ prorâ & carinâ ad horizontem inclinatâ major vis ob­
viæ aquæ re&longs;i&longs;tit.

Quare tantum abe&longs;t malus à ratione vectis,
vi cujus progrediatur navigium, ut potius caveatur, ne vectis
munus ille exerceat, motum aliquem efficiendo, qui celeritati
non parum officeret.

In motu autem majoris navigij pluribus malis in&longs;tructi non
&longs;olus malus, qui præcipuus e&longs;t & maximus, attenditur, &longs;ed etiam
reliqui: potior tamen ad provehendam navim e&longs;t malus, qui à
medio ad proram accedit, quippe qui navim trahit; nam qui â
centro gravitatis puppim versùs recedit, navim impellit potiùs,
quàm trahat: quamquam ille, qui ad puppim proximè &longs;pectat,
& velum habet triangulare, maximè juvat, ut gubernatoris pro­
po&longs;ito, qui clavum regit, ob&longs;ecundet ad navis cur&longs;um in alteru­
tram partem dirigendum.

Verum quicumque malus con&longs;ide­
retur, in nullo rationem vectis reperies, &longs;ive ad impellendam,
&longs;ive ad trahendam navim.

At, inquis, &longs;i adver&longs;o flumine deducendum &longs;it navigium &longs;i­
ve à nautica turbâ &longs;ive ab equis trahentibus, cur funis ma­
lo, non autem proræ, alligatur, &longs;i nihil confert facilitatis appli­
catio potentiæ trahentis medio fune ad majorem altitudinem à
carinâ?

Ego verò ex te, qui&longs;quis hæc objicis, quæro, cur jidem
nautæ &longs;i remulco navim trahere aggrediantur, funem navi non
tam altè alligant; &longs;i ex vectis rationibus illa altitudo aliquod af­
fert compendium laboris in trahendo.

Sed &longs;atis utrique quæ&longs;tio­
ni factum videbis, &longs;i ob&longs;erves non planè æqualem e&longs;&longs;e in uni­
ver&longs;o alveo aquæ altitudinem, ac proinde neque po&longs;&longs;e navim
æquè &longs;emper abe&longs;&longs;e à fluminis ripâ, in qua trahentes progre­
diuntur; idcircò longiore fune opus e&longs;t, qui &longs;uo pondere &longs;pon­
te curvatus aquam &longs;ecaret, & trahentium laborem augeret, aut
in occultum aliquem &longs;ub aquis latentem obicem incurreret non
&longs;ine gravi incommodo, &longs;i funis extremitas depre&longs;&longs;iori loco navi­
gij alligaretur; propterea malo altiùs adnectitur, eo quoque
con&longs;ilio, ut &longs;i quæ virgulta aut arbu&longs;culæ &longs;ecundùm fluminis
ripam occurrant, minori impedimento &longs;int funi obliquè incli­
nato, quàm &longs;i horizonti e&longs;&longs;et ferè parallelus.

Qui verò navim
remulco trahunt, non adeò longè ab illa abe&longs;&longs;e coguntur, nec
huju&longs;modi impedimentis obnoxij &longs;unt; ideò breviore fune
utuntur, quem proræ alligant.

Cæterùm nullæ vectis vires
exercentur; non enim prora infra aquam deprimi, & puppis
elevari pote&longs;t: id quod &longs;i contingeret, prora magis demer&longs;a
plus inveniret re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ ab aquâ dividendâ.

Quid igitur, ais, cau&longs;æ e&longs;t, quòd antennâ u&longs;que ad carche­
&longs;ium D elevatâ, magis promovetur navis, quàm &longs;i tantummodo
u&longs;que ad E attolleretur?

quandoquidem nulla vectis ratio hîc
habetur.

Eos, qui cum Ari&longs;totele &longs;entiunt, æquivocatione la­
borare facilè o&longs;tenditur: quid enim refert, utrùm antenna ma­
gis an minùs elevetur, &longs;i potentia, videlicet ventus velum im­
plens, illi mali parti applicata intelligeretur, cui antenna ad­
nectitur?

hæc autem funibus, quos mesoui/as vocant, &longs;ur&longs;um
trahitur, &longs;emperque, &longs;ive altior, &longs;ive depre&longs;&longs;ior &longs;it, adnectitur
carche&longs;io in D: quemadmodum nauta fune in D alligato na­
vim trahens, &longs;emper in D applicatus intelligitur, quamvis hu­
miliore in loco, quàm D, con&longs;tituatur.

Verùm non ibi vis
venti præcisè intelligenda e&longs;t, ubi antenna e&longs;t, &longs;ed toti malo
aut ejus parti applicatur, quæ re&longs;pondet velo non &longs;olùm anten­
næ cornibus, &longs;ed etiam navis lateribus alligato: velum autem
in humiliore loco minus recipit venti, quia alta majorum na­
vium puppis (ni&longs;i ventus ex latere &longs;piret) vento oppo&longs;ita illum
&longs;ubtrahit velo, & præterea ventus, qui in navis puppim & la­
tera illiditur, reflectitur, & proximas venti partes turbat, atque
alior&longs;um dirigit, vel &longs;altem illarum impetum imminuit; ex quo
oritur minori vi impelli velum.

At partes venti &longs;ublimiores ab
his inferioribus reflexis, vel nihil, vel mitiùs turbantur, atque
adeò plures ad implendum velum majore vi accurrunt.

Adde (his etiam mente &longs;eclu&longs;is) ventum in &longs;ublimiore loco
multo validiorem e&longs;&longs;e, quàm in inferiore, ac propterea quò al­
tius attollitur velum, non &longs;olùm majorem, &longs;ed etiam validio­
rem ventum excipit, quo fit, ut incitatior &longs;it navigij motus.

Neque de hoc venti di&longs;crimine dubitare poterit cui contin­
gat iter habere in ampla planitie arboribus & ædificiis va­
cuâ vento flante; &longs;i enim ex equo de&longs;iliat, & humi &longs;edeat,
manife&longs;tè percipiet, quanto minore vi impetatur à vento.

Id
quod pariter ex ipsâ veli figurâ arguitur; &longs;ive enim velum trian­
gulare fuerit, & obliquâ antennâ erigatur ita ut qua&longs;i aurem
leporis imitetur, altiori vento, utpote vehementiori, pars veli
&longs;trictior objicitur; &longs;ive pluribus quadrangularibus velis in&longs;trua­
tur navigium ita, ut alia &longs;uperiora, &longs;cilicet dolones, alia infe­
riora &longs;int, videlicet Acatia; quæ &longs;upra Corbem &longs;tatuuntur,
non &longs;olum minora &longs;unt inferiore velo, &longs;ed etiam eorum &longs;upre­
ma pars longè &longs;trictior e&longs;t ba&longs;i, ut nimirum minus recipiat
venti validioris: propterea ingruente tempe&longs;tate primùm &longs;u­
periora vela deprimuntur, at majori ventorum vi &longs;ubducan­
tur; eriguntur autem celeritatis cau&longs;a, ut &longs;i quando effusè fu­
gere opus &longs;it.

Ecce igitur citra omnem vectis rationem, Cur quando anten­
na &longs;ublimior fuerit, ii&longs;dem velis, & vento codem, celeriùs feruntur
navigia: quia &longs;cilicet velum altiùs &longs;ublatum & plus venti, &
validiorem ventum recipit.

Quod &longs;i ad vectis rationes confu­
giendum e&longs;&longs;et, non quæreretur, cur celeriùs ferantur navigia,
&longs;ed, cur faciliùs?

Nam vectis longitudo (ni&longs;i fortè in vecte ter­
tij generis, cujus nullum ve&longs;tigium deprehenditur in malo na­
vis) non celeritatem motûs ponderi conciliat, &longs;ed facilitatem,
ita ut po&longs;ito longiore vecte potentia &longs;ervans eandem &longs;ui motûs
velocitatem faciliûs quidem moveat propo&longs;itum pondus &longs;ed
tardiùs quàm breviore vecte, po&longs;ità eádem ponderis ab hypo­
mochlio di&longs;tantiâ: Ac propterea, &longs;i in hoc navis motu, de quo
quæ&longs;tio e&longs;t, intercederet ratio vectis, idem ventus eadem vela
altiùs &longs;ublata implens eâdem quidem velocitate moveretur, &longs;ed
tardiùs navim moveret, quamquam faciliùs, hoc e&longs;t magis
onu&longs;tam.

Id autem à vero longi&longs;&longs;imè abe&longs;&longs;e te&longs;tatur experien­
tia; quæ idcirco confirmat navigij malo nihil e&longs;&longs;e cum vecte
commercij ad navim promovendam.
CAPUT XVII.
An ex vectis rationibus pendeat u&longs;us anchoræ.

QUandoquidem nauticas aliquot quæ&longs;tiones cum Ari&longs;tote­
le &longs;uperioribus capitibus examinare placuit, liceat & hanc
addere, quæ ad u&longs;um anchoræ &longs;pectat in firmanda navi, ne à
fluctibus, aut à vento abripiatur: tranquillo enim mari, aut in
lacu quie&longs;cente, &longs;ua &longs;ponte &longs;ub&longs;i&longs;tit navis, nec anchoræ ope in­
diget, ut &longs;ua in &longs;tatione permaneat.

Et quidem ip&longs;a navis gra­
vitas cum &longs;uis in&longs;trumentis, & onus quod illa ferre pote&longs;t (cu­
jus gravitas æquat navigij gravitatem) &longs;atis per &longs;e re&longs;i&longs;tunt,
nec facilè cuilibet auræ aut fluctui cedunt.

Quare major e&longs;&longs;e
debet vis venti, aut fluctuum, aut profluentis, quàm ut illi ob­
&longs;i&longs;tere valeat univer&longs;um navigij pondus, ad hoc ut &longs;it opus an­
chorâ, qua navigium firmetur.

In anchorâ autem &longs;pectanda e&longs;t & gravitas, & figura; utra­
que enim juvat: aliquando &longs;i quidem &longs;olum anchoræ pondus
&longs;ufficit, ne placidiores fluctus, aut fluminis impetus, aut lenis
flatus navim &longs;ecum rapiant.

Sic legi&longs;&longs;e me memini navim à
naufragio anchoris omnibus de&longs;titutam in &longs;tatione totam
noctem quievi&longs;&longs;e &longs;ecuram firmatam &longs;acculo, quo mille trecen­
ti Hi&longs;pani Crucigeri (octo Reales &longs;ingulis Crucigeris tribuun­
tur) continebantur, rudentis autem munus &longs;upplebat evolutus
telæ &longs;capus: qui enim fluctus navim aliò propellere potui&longs;&longs;ent,
non &longs;atis habebant virium, ut etiam illud argenti pondus ma­
ris fundo incumbens & navi connexum pariter trahere po&longs;&longs;ent.

Simili igitur ratione anchora, licèt duriori &longs;olo dentem infige­
re non valeat, aliquando &longs;uo pondere navim firmabit.

Re&longs;pon­
det autem anchoræ gravitas oneri, quod ferre pote&longs;t navis, ea
Ratione, ut pro oneris libris 40000 (hoc e&longs;t 20 Amphoris aut
doliis, &longs;ingulorum quippe doliorum gravitas &longs;tatuitur librarum
bis mille, & &longs;ingulis libris unciæ &longs;exdecim tribuuntur) ferri li­
bras centum & decem habeat primaria & maxima anchora,
&longs;ecunda habeat primæ dodrantem, tertia be&longs;&longs;em, quarta &longs;emi&longs;­
&longs;em.

Rudentis vero, cui anchora adnectitur, pondus ferè
ponitur duplum &longs;e&longs;quiquartum gravitatis &longs;uæ anchoræ.

Quam­
quam non omnino &longs;ervetur hæc Ratio ponderis anchoræ in in­
gentibus navigiis, quæ nimirum &longs;uâ gravitate maximè re­
&longs;i&longs;tunt fluctuum impul&longs;ioni, ac proinde minore anchorâ opus
habent.

Primariæ anchoræ poti&longs;&longs;imus u&longs;us communiter e&longs;t, cùm va­
lidior tempe&longs;tas navim aggreditur; &longs;ecundæ, ut navis in &longs;ta­
tione quie&longs;cat; tertiam adhibent nautæ, ut duabus anchoris ad
diver&longs;a plagas con&longs;titutis (puta, alterâ ad Sub&longs;olanum, alterâ
ad Boream aut ad Borrhapeliotem,) vento & fluctibus navis re­
&longs;i&longs;tat validiùs, nec abrepta à fluctibus anchoram pariter &longs;ecum
rapiat, &longs;ed tantum alternis motibus qua&longs;i circa centrum agite­
tur: Quartam demum lintre transferunt procul à navi juxta lon­
gitudinem funis adnexi ducentorum circiter cubitorum, quem
machinâ ad id de&longs;tinatâ colligentes accedunt ad anchoram, &
&longs;tationem commutant, aut portum intrant, &longs;eu ab illo exeunt,
ubi ce&longs;&longs;at ventus, aut adver&longs;us &longs;pirat.

Ad firmandam verò navim plurimum habet momenti longi­
tudo ip&longs;a rudentis; &longs;atis enim manife&longs;tum e&longs;t, quantâ vi opus
&longs;it, ut longior funis intendatur, qui ce&longs;&longs;ante externâ vi illico
&longs;inuatur; ac propterea vehementi conatu ventorum ac fluctuum
navis impellenda e&longs;t, ut rudens intentus anchoram trahat.

Varia e&longs;t autem Rudentis longitudo pro anchorarum Ratione;
longitudo &longs;i quidem rudentis anchoræ primariæ cubitos habet
centum viginti, &longs;ecundæ cubitos centum, tertiæ cubitos octo­
ginta: quò enim adversùs validiorem impetum repugnandum
e&longs;t, eò longior adhibetur rudens, ut difficiliùs intendatur, ac
idcirco fractionis periculo minùs obnoxius &longs;it, & venti
fluctuumve impetus in rudente intendendo eli&longs;us minus vi­
rium habeat ad rapiendam &longs;imul cum navi anchoram.

Hine
ingentes bellicæ naves in Oceano ferè &longs;emper primariam an­
choram demittunt, & tres aut quatuor rudentes capitibus in­
vicem firmiter colligatis in unam longitudinem productos adji­
ciunt; vix enim tanta e&longs;&longs;e pote&longs;t fluctuum aut venti vis, quæ
valeat tam longum rudentem intendere atque dirumpere, ni&longs;i
fortè ad navis latus aut ad &longs;copulum colli&longs;us atteratur.

Id quod
aliis quoque nautis placet tùm propter eandem cau&longs;am, tùm ut
longiùs à littore con&longs;i&longs;tere po&longs;&longs;it navis, & anchora arenæ infi­
gi, etiam&longs;i altior &longs;it aqua.

Mihi &longs;anè contingit nautarum incu­
riam experiri in Albi fluvio; cùm enim anchoram breviore ru­
dente demi&longs;i&longs;&longs;ent, nocturno maris æ&longs;tu intume&longs;centibus undis
ita elevatum e&longs;t navigium, ut ex prorâ penderet &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;a an­
chora, nó&longs;que dormientes æ&longs;tus abriperet; quos demum exci­
tavit fragor ex colli&longs;ione cum altero navigio, in quod tanto im­
petu impacti fuimus, ut abrupto fune &longs;capham ami&longs;erimus.

Sed quod ad anchoræ formam attinet, non eadem omnibus
e&longs;t figura; navigia enim, quorum in majoribus fluminibus u&longs;us
e&longs;t, ut noctu in medio alveo &longs;ub&longs;i&longs;tant, anchoram habent qua­
tuor aduncis brachiis in&longs;tructam; cuju&longs;modi pariter &longs;unt trire­
mium anchoræ.

At in Oceano navium anchoræ non ni&longs;i duo
habent brachia ad angulum acutum inflexa cum &longs;capo; ne ve­
tò demi&longs;&longs;a anchora pror&longs;us jaceat in maris fundo, &longs;capo prope
annulum adnectitur ligneum tran&longs;ver&longs;arium (cujus gravitas
e&longs;t ferè &longs;ubquintupla gravitatis anchoræ, &longs;i tamen etiam fer­
reos clavos, quibus firmatur, in computationem admittas) eju&longs;­
dem cum Scapo longitudinis, adeò ut jacente utroque brachio
Scapus tran&longs;ver&longs;ario &longs;ecundum extremitatem innixus obliquè
inclinetur.

Ex quo etiam fit, ut extremæ brachiorum palmulæ
obliquè occurrentes maris fundo faciliùs in &longs;ubjectum &longs;olum
penetrent.

Quando igitur vehementior e&longs;t fluctuum impetus,
aut venti impul&longs;us validior, quàm ut illi re&longs;i&longs;tere po&longs;&longs;it ip&longs;a an­
choræ gravitas, intento rudente tanti&longs;per abripit cum navi an­
choram, quæ maris fundum &longs;ulcans, ubi brachiorum palmu­
læ arenis aliquantulum immer&longs;æ inæqualem invenerint &longs;ubjecti
&longs;oli re&longs;i&longs;tentiam (quocumque tandem ex capite oriatur hæc re­
&longs;i&longs;tentiæ inæqualitas) po&longs;itionem mutat, nec ampliùs jacet
utrumque brachium, &longs;ed illud, cui minùs ob&longs;i&longs;titur, elevatur,
adnitente etiam ligneo tran&longs;ver&longs;ario, cui naturalis e&longs;t in aquâ
po&longs;itio horizonti parallela, quam acquirens ita anchoram con­
vertit, ut Dens maris fundo inhærens magis in illud infigatur
tùm urgente deor&longs;um ip&longs;ius anchoræ gravitate, tùm trahente
ip&longs;a navi, quam fluctus aut ventus impellit; cùm etenim bra­
chium cum &longs;capo acutum angulum con&longs;tituat, non ad perpen­
diculum, &longs;ed obliquè fundum ingreditur, & idcirco in illud
profundiùs penetrat.

Cum itaque anchoræ &longs;capo alij duplicem, alij triplicem tri­
buant alterius brachij longitudinem, hæc utique major e&longs;t,
quàm di&longs;tantia inter extremos anchoræ dentes, non enim bra­
chia cum &longs;capo rectum &longs;ed acutum angulum, ut dictum e&longs;t,
con&longs;tituunt.

Ad hanc igitur extremorum dentium di&longs;tantiam
major tran&longs;ver&longs;arij longitudo majorem habet Rationem, quàm
minor; e&longs;t autem longitudini &longs;capi par tran&longs;ver&longs;arij longitudo;
quare longioris anchoræ tran&longs;ver&longs;arium longius e&longs;t, ejú&longs;que
conver&longs;io, ut &longs;e horizonti parallelum &longs;tatuat, magis juvat an­
choræ conver&longs;ionem, ut dens inferior profundiùs in arenam
infigatur.

Sit primùm anchoræ &longs;capus AB duplex longitudinis bra­
chij AC, & prope an­
nulum in B æquale tran&longs;­
ver&longs;arium EF adjiciatur
ad angulos rectos, ea ta­
men conditione, ut ja­
centibus brachiis AC
& AD in plano hori­
zontali, tran&longs;ver&longs;arium
&longs;it in plano verticali, ejú&longs;­
que altera extremitas, ex.

gr.F.maris fundum con­
tingat, altera E &longs;ublimis
&longs;it, ac proinde &longs;capus AB
inclinetur ad horizon­
tem grad. 30. Vento, aut fluctu, navim impellente intenditur
rudens, & &longs;capi extremitas B annulo proxima elevatur, nec
ampliùs tran&longs;ver&longs;arium in F incumbit arenæ; propterea bra­
chiorum palmulæ C & D in triangulum conformatæ, dum &longs;i­
mul cum navi trahuntur, &longs;e &longs;e profundiùs in arenam in&longs;inuant:
&longs;ed &longs;i inæqualem offendant re&longs;i&longs;tentiam, aut altera, ex.gr. C,
profundiùs infigatur præ reliquâ (&longs;ive ex &longs;ubjecti &longs;oli diver&longs;i­
tate, &longs;ive quia navis in tran&longs;ver&longs;um acta trahit anchoræ caput B
in latus, & brachij alterius extremitas de&longs;cribens circa A in
&longs;olo arcum versùs navim profundiùs infigitur, atque adeò re­
liqua extremitas oppo&longs;iti brachij in contrarium mota circa A,
vix terram mordet) vis in B trahens, neque valens pariter
utrumque brachium trahere, cogitur circa C, tanquam circa
centrum, &longs;eu potiùs tanquam circa polum, moveri.

Et quia
punctum B &longs;ublimius e&longs;t puncto C, nece&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t ita huju&longs;modi
conver&longs;ionem fieri, ut oppo&longs;ita extremitas D elevetur, atque
ex fundo extrahatur.

Cúmque jam tran&longs;ver&longs;arium non æqua­
liter hinc & hinc retineatur per vim in plano verticali, &longs;ed ejus
&longs;uperior pars BE versùs C inclinetur, conatur po&longs;itionem ho­
rizontalem acquirere, ejú&longs;que inferior pars BF ad latus decli­
nans a&longs;cendit, juvátque ip&longs;ius brachij AD a&longs;cen&longs;um; ex quo
fit demum centrum gravitatis totius anchoræ imminere palmu­
læ C, quæ propterea etiam urgente gravitate profundiùs in­
figitur.

In hac lignei tran&longs;ver&longs;arij conver&longs;ione ob&longs;ervandum e&longs;t par­
tem alteram &longs;ublimiorem BE per vim in aquâ deprimi, partem
autem inferiorem BF in aquâ &longs;ponte a&longs;cendere, ac proinde,
propter intermediam gravitatem in B, illam re&longs;i&longs;tere huic &longs;ur­
&longs;um conánti, atque ideò illam habere rationem hypomochlij,
hanc potentiæ, pondus verò e&longs;&longs;e in B, quod & convertitur:
non quidem quia totum pondus &longs;it in B, &longs;ed quia totius ancho­
ræ centrum gravitatis e&longs;t in &longs;capo AB, adeóque intelligitur
applicatum puncto B, quamvis ip&longs;ius centri gravitatis conver­
&longs;io fiat circa extremitatem C manentem.

At verò &longs;i &longs;capus AK fuerit triplex brachij AC, etiam tran&longs;­
ver&longs;arium HI &longs;capo æquale e&longs;t eju&longs;dem brachij triplex: hinc
fit ip&longs;ius longioris tran&longs;ver&longs;arij HI vim, qua &longs;e horizontale
&longs;tatuat in aquâ, majorem e&longs;&longs;e, quàm brevioris EF; lignum
enim longiùs difficiliùs in aquâ erectum retinetur.

Quamvis
autem eadem &longs;it Ratio FE ad BE, quæ e&longs;t IH ad KH, ta­
men major e&longs;t Ratio motûs ip&longs;ius K ad motum centri gravitatis
circa extremitatem C manentem, quàm &longs;it Ratio motûs ip&longs;ius B
ad motum centri gravitatis circa idem punctum C: in illa enim
conver&longs;ione centrum gravitatis exi&longs;tens in aliquo puncto lon­
gitudinis AK elevari vix pote&longs;t ad majorem altitudinem, quàm
&longs;it CL; quia in longiore anchorâ AK centrum gravitatis ma­
gis recedens ab extremitate A, quàm in anchorâ breviore AB,
magis imminet palmulæ C, eámque profundiùs in arenam in­
figit; ideóque &longs;i fortè &longs;it inter L & K, atque ex inclinatione
&longs;capi ad horizontem paulò altius exi&longs;teret quàm CL, &longs;i C ma­
neret in &longs;uperficie fundi maris, ip&longs;a depre&longs;&longs;io puncti C infra il­
lam &longs;uperficiem demit aliquid ex altitudine.

Nam quod &longs;pectat ad centrum gravitatis anchoræ longioris,
certum e&longs;t illud non removeri ab extremitate Scapi A &longs;ecun­
dùm eandem Rationem, &longs;ecundùm quam ejus longitudo pro­
ducitur: &longs;i enim &longs;capus e&longs;&longs;et longitudo pari & æquabili cra&longs;&longs;itie
ducta, utique &longs;icut AK e&longs;t ip&longs;ius AB &longs;e&longs;quialtera, etiam cen­
tri gravitatis di&longs;tantia ab A in &longs;capo longiore e&longs;&longs;et &longs;e&longs;quialtera
di&longs;tantiæ centri gravitatis ab A in Scapo breviore.

Quoniam
verò & pars BK aliquanto decremento deficit à cra&longs;&longs;itie reli­
quæ partis BA, & pro centro gravitatis totius anchoræ atten­
denda e&longs;t non &longs;olius &longs;capi gravitas, &longs;ed & brachiorum, mani­
fe&longs;tum e&longs;t centrum gravitatis anchoræ longioris removeri ab A
minùs, quàm in Ratione &longs;e&longs;quialtera.

Atqui circa punctum A
(quando jacent brachia, & elevari incipit extremitas altera &longs;ca­
pi) moventur B & K pro Ratione di&longs;tantiarum, hoc e&longs;t in Ra­
tione &longs;e&longs;quialtera; igitur motus ip&longs;ius K ad motum &longs;ui centri
gravitatis e&longs;t in majore Ratione, quàm motus puncti B ad mo­
tum &longs;ui centri gravitatis.

Hinc e&longs;t intento rudente faciliùs pro rata portione elevari
extremitatem K longioris &longs;capi, quam B brevioris, & centrum
gravitatis inter A & K, hoc e&longs;t inter hypomochlium & poten­
tiam, habere rationem ponderis, quod elevatur vecte &longs;ecundi
generis AK.

Quia autem facta elevatione puncti K jacentibus
adhuc brachiis, po&longs;tea fieri debet conver&longs;io circa palmulam C
manentem, tunc punctum C habet rationem hypomochlij, &
pondus intelligitur e&longs;&longs;e centrum gravitatis interjectum inter K
& C, &longs;i minus &longs;it intervallum inter K & centrum gravitatis,
quàm inter K & hypomochlium C, cuju&longs;modi e&longs;&longs;et, &longs;i cen­
trum gravitatis e&longs;&longs;et citra L versùs K, & e&longs;&longs;et vectis curvus &longs;e­
cundi generis.

Quòd &longs;i magis di&longs;tat centrum gravitatis à
puncto K, quàm ab eodem puncto K di&longs;tet punctum C, vectis
e&longs;t curvus primi generis.

Quid autem, inquis, &longs;i pari interval­
lo di&longs;ter punctum K à puncto C, atque à centro gravitatis?

cu­
ju&longs;modi generis vectis erit?
primi-ne?
an &longs;ecundi?

Re&longs;pondeo in vecte hoc curvo, cujus altera extremitas ma­
net, & pondus non ad perpendiculum, neque motu recto in
plano verticali, &longs;ed conver&longs;ione elevatur, attendenda e&longs;&longs;e pla­
na, in quibus tùm potentia, tùm pondus propriam conver&longs;io­
nem perficiunt; his autem planis parallelum concipe aliud pla­
num, quod per extremitatem C manentem tran&longs;eat, quod pla­
num &longs;i interjectum fuerit inter illa plana conver&longs;ionum, vectis
erit primi generis, quia hypomochlium e&longs;t inter potentiam &
pondus; &longs;in autem hoc extremum fuerit, & medium locum ob­
tineat planum, in quo convertitur centrum gravitatis, vectis
erit &longs;ecundi generis.

Facta demùm conver&longs;ione ita, ut tran&longs;ver&longs;arium ligneum
po&longs;itionem habeat horizontalem, & utrumque brachium in
eodem &longs;it plano verticali; quia faciliùs elevatur K quàm B, &
tran&longs;ver&longs;arium HI longius majorem habet vim &longs;u&longs;tinendi,
quàm tran&longs;ver&longs;arium EF brevius, hinc e&longs;t brachium AC ma­
gis inclinari ad &longs;ubjectum maris planum horizontale, ac prop­
terea etiam validiùs in arenam infigi, quando à navi trahitur
anchora.
CAPUT XVIII.
Plures Vectis u&longs;us exponuntur.

QUod &longs;uperiore libro præ&longs;titimus libræ atque &longs;tateræ u&longs;um
extendentes, & hîc præ&longs;tare operæ pretium fuerit, tum
ut vectis natura ex uberiori utilitate innote&longs;cat, tum ut fax ali-
qua tyronibus præferatur viam common&longs;trando, qua &longs;imiles
u&longs;us po&longs;&longs;int pro opportunitate excogitare.
PROPOSITIO I.
Duplex Vectis genus in uno vecte conjungere.

SÆpi&longs;&longs;ime contingit unico quidem vecte nos uti, re tamen
vera duplicem e&longs;&longs;e vectem; quemadmodum cùm ingentis
alicujus &longs;axi extremitati vectem &longs;ubjicimus, quo extremitatem
illam attollimus.

Sit enim &longs;axum, cujus centrum gravitatis S,
& &longs;ubjecto vecte AB ha­
bente hypomochlium in
C attollatur extremitas F,
manente extremitate E:
utique vectis primi gene­
ris e&longs;t AB; &longs;ed &longs;i rem at­
tentiùs perpendamus, etiam
longitudo FE, aut potiùs
BE vectis e&longs;t &longs;ecundi ge­
neris habens impo&longs;itum pondus S, & fulcrum in E; at­
que quò magis &longs;upra horizontem elevatur, linea Directio­
nis SD magis accedit versùs E, ex quo oritur movendi fa­
cilitas; quam juvat Potentiæ A depre&longs;&longs;io, ex qua fit ut B ma­
gis accedens ad F, magis etiam recedat ab hypomochlio E.

Manife&longs;tum e&longs;t autem pondere accedente ad hypomochlium,
& potentiâ ab eodem recedente, majorem fieri Rationem mo­
tûs Potentiæ ad motum Ponderis, atque adeò augeri movendi
facilitatem.

Quare momenta potentiæ in A &longs;u&longs;tinentis &longs;axum
ea &longs;unt, quæ componuntur ex Ratione AC ad CB, & Ratio­
ne BE ad EI.

Sed de hoc nullus mihi hîc &longs;ermo; quia vel duo
vectes &longs;unt, ut explicatum e&longs;t, alter quidem ab ip&longs;o pon­
dere non &longs;ejunctus FE, alter verò ab eo di&longs;tinctus AB; vel
&longs;i unicus intelligatur vectis, qui ponderi applicatur, hic
&longs;anè ad unum pertinet genus non ad duo, ut hæc propo­
&longs;itio exigit.

Sit igitur dati vectis longitudo CD, in cujus medio hypo­
mochlium O bifariam æqualiter dividat totam longitudinem,
& &longs;it pondus in P. Erit, peri 7. lib.
5. eadem Ratio CO ad
OP, atque DO ad OP; &
&longs;i in C &longs;it potentia depri­
mens, in D autem potentia
elevans, æqualia habent mo­
menta ad elevandum pondus
in P.

E&longs;t ergo CP vectis primi generis, & DO vectis &longs;e­
cundi generis, cui cum primo commune e&longs;t hypomochlium
O, & communis pars OP.

Quòd &longs;i Potentiæ inæquales fue­
rint, utraque autem valeat &longs;ive deprimere, &longs;ive elevare, di­
vidatur longitudo CD in duas partes, quarum Ratio eadem
&longs;it ac Potentiarum, & in puncto divi&longs;ionis &longs;tatuatur fulcrum:
tum in extremitatibus reciprocè collocentur Potentiæ, vali­
dior &longs;cilicet propior &longs;it fulcro, debilior verò remotior, ut æqua­
lium &longs;int momentorum.

Datæ Potentiæ &longs;int ut 5 ad 3. Dividatur CD partium
octo ita in P (ubi &longs;tatuendum e&longs;t fulcrum) ut CP &longs;it 5,
PD &longs;it 3; & Potentia robu&longs;tior, quæ e&longs;t ut 5 &longs;it in D;
infirmior verò, quæ e&longs;t ut 3, &longs;it in C; & pondus &longs;it in R,
quoniam CP ad PR e&longs;t ut 5 ad 1, & DP ad PR e&longs;t ut
3 ad 1. Igitur &longs;i pondus R &longs;it lib.
30, attolletur à Poten­
tia C potente &longs;ine vecte attollere lib.
3, & à Potentia D
potente &longs;ine vecte elevare lib.
5: utriu&longs;que enim momenta
&longs;ingillatim accepta &longs;unt 15 compo&longs;ita ex virtute movendi &
motûs velocitate.

At &longs;i pondus P &longs;it lib.
30, & fulcrum in
O, &longs;it autem CO ad OP, atque DO ad OP ut 4 ad 1,
&longs;atis e&longs;t &longs;i &longs;ingulæ Potentiæ æquales C & D po&longs;&longs;int &longs;ine vecte
attollere lib.
3. unc.

Porrò &longs;i inæqualium potentiarum altera po&longs;&longs;it &longs;olùm depri­
mendo vectem elevare pondus, manife&longs;tum e&longs;t ad illam per­
tinere vectem primi.

generis: ac propterea &longs;i illa &longs;it potentia
validior, eidem tribuetur minor di&longs;tantia ab hypomochlio; &longs;in
autem illa &longs;it imbecillior, ip&longs;i tribuetur di&longs;tantia major, atque
illam inter ac pondus &longs;tatuetur fulcrum.

Hinc facilè pote­
rit potentia vivens uti ope potentiæ inanimatæ, quæ vi &longs;uæ
gravitatis deor&longs;um premat oppo&longs;itam extremitatem propo&longs;iti
vectis.

Huc &longs;pectare videtur facillimum genus antliæ &longs;implicis,
qua ex depre&longs;&longs;iore loco in altiorem aquas attollimus.

Sit enim
modiolus B, cui aptè in&longs;eratur congruens embolus medio
ha&longs;tili CD connexus cum tran&longs;ver&longs;ario EF ver&longs;atili circa
axem infixum in I: cujus tran&longs;ver&longs;arij extremitatem E occu­
pet ma&longs;&longs;a plumbea opportunæ gravitatis ad deprimendum em­
bolum intra modiolum, po&longs;tquam elevatus fuerit à potentia fu­
nem FG trahente adnexum in altera extremitate F.

Vectis FE
e&longs;t primi generis duplex habens pondus, alterum in E, alterum
in D, utrumque enim per vim elevatur.

At vectis EI e&longs;t &longs;e­
cundi generis, in quo E e&longs;t potentia deprimens embolum, &
quo magis di&longs;tabit ab hypomochlio I, minor ma&longs;&longs;a plumbea
eadem obtinebit momenta.

Quòd &longs;i IF con&longs;tet materiâ &longs;atis
gravi, jam habet rationem ponderis, ac propterea di&longs;tantia
centri gravitatis illius H à puncto I determinabit ejus momen­
ta.

Quare potentia E vecte EI &longs;ecundi generis deprimet em­
bolum, & vecte EH primi generis attollet pondus brachij IF.

Hinc e&longs;t commodius accidere, &longs;i longitudo EK ferrea &longs;it, in K
verò in&longs;eratur, ut firmiter cohæreat, &longs;atis validus baculus
ligneus KF; poterit enim longior e&longs;&longs;e, & faciliorem efficere
antliæ agitationem, quin gravitas nimia indigeat multo plum­
bo in E, ut præponderetur.

Quòd &longs;i non placeret addere plumbum in E, & &longs;olo vecte
primi generis FD uti velles, recurrendum e&longs;&longs;et ad vim ela&longs;ti­
cam, qua vel arcûs X in &longs;uperiore loco firmati nervo, vel
extremæ perticæ AM longiu&longs;culæ (ut Toreuticen exercen­
tibus &longs;olemne e&longs;t) adnecteretur funis pertingens ad F, ut
ex tractione Potentiæ GF curvatus arcus, vel inflexa per­
tica, ce&longs;&longs;ante potentiâ, iterum &longs;e &longs;uum in &longs;tatum re&longs;titueret,
&longs;ursúmque traheret extremitatem F, ac proinde embolum
intra modiolum B deprimeret.

Tunc enim e&longs;&longs;et FD vectis
primi generis, cujus extremitati F applicarentur duæ Poten­
tiæ, altera deor&longs;um, altera vici&longs;&longs;im alterno conatu &longs;ur&longs;um
trahens.

At &longs;i fortè duplicem antliam velis &longs;imul componere, dupli­
cémque potentiam viventem alternis operis conantem adhi­
bere, jugo RS ver&longs;atili cir­
ca axem X adde duo, le­
viora quidem, &longs;ed &longs;atis fir­
ma, manubria RO & SM,
quorum extremitates aut
premi, aut adjecto fune
trahi deor&longs;um valeant:
nam depre&longs;sâ extremitate
O deprimitur pariter ha&longs;ti­
le infixum in R, & e&longs;t OX
vectis &longs;ecundi generis, at­
que attollitur ha&longs;tile ad­
nexum in S, & e&longs;t OS
vectis primi generis.

Simi­
liter MX vectis e&longs;t &longs;ecundi generis, movens pondus po&longs;itum
in S, atque MR e&longs;t vectis primi generis attollens pondus po­
&longs;itum in R.

Propterea autem leviora dixi adjecta manubria
RO & SM, ne &longs;uâ gravitate movendi difficultatem augeant.

Verùm &longs;i &longs;olus volueris antliam utramque agitare, unus &longs;it
continuus funis ex O per rotulas P & Q tran&longs;iens, atque in M
connexus: quacumque enim in parte con&longs;titutus fueris, tan­
tumdem funis &longs;equitur a&longs;cendentem extremitatem, quantum
trahitur deprimendo alteram extremitatem: &longs;ic trahendo fu­
nem PO deprimitur extremitas O, deinde trahendo funem
PQ deprimitur extremitas M.

Aut etiam &longs;it unicum ma­
nubrium SM, & erit RM: atque premens in M attollet
ha&longs;tulam R, elevans aut in M attollet ha&longs;tulam S.

Ut au­
tem faciliùs attollatur M, &longs;it in &longs;uperiore loco orbiculus,
per quem tran&longs;eat funis connexus in M, alteram ením ex­
tremitatem deor&longs;um trahens attollet manubrium M.

Quod
&longs;i ab oculis remotam volveris antliam, fac per parietis fora­
men in proximum conclave exire funem MI orbiculi H
excavatæ ab&longs;idi in&longs;ertum, & per orbiculos P, Q, tran&longs;ire
funem OP QL; connexis enim funium extremitatibus I
& L modò hunc modò illum funem trahendo utramque
