antliam agitabis.
PROPOSITIO II.
Antliam opportuno vecte in&longs;truere.

UT aliquam &longs;peciem vectis curvi oneri movendo de&longs;tina­
ti exhibeam, placet in antlia, qua ad hauriendas aquas
utimur, exemplum ponere, quod facilè in reliquis pro re
nata imitari po&longs;&longs;imus.

E&longs;t in antliâ loco ponderis aqua, quæ
adducto embolo attrahitur in modiolum, eóque reducto ex­
primitur, & prætereà conflictus ip&longs;e emboli cum modiolo;
&longs;uperanda quippe e&longs;t difficultas, quæ ex mutuo horum con­
tactu oritur, & aqua per vim elevanda e&longs;t, &longs;ive &longs;olùm at­
trahatur, ut ex modiolo per emboli reducti foramen &longs;ubin­
de erumpens effluat, &longs;ive in modiolo compre&longs;&longs;a ab embolo,
cùm reducitur, exprimatur in tubum, ut adhuc altiùs a&longs;cen­
dat, juxta ea, quæ in Hydrotechnicis fu&longs;iùs dicuntur.

Id
quidem fieret &longs;i ha&longs;tili, quod embolo infigitur, ip&longs;a poten­
tia proximè applicaretur; &longs;ed ut minus laboris illa &longs;ubeat,
additur vectis, ut multo major &longs;it potentiæ motus, quàm
emboli.

Sit enim embolus A congruens modiolo B, illíque in­
fixum ha&longs;tile CA; quo elevato aqua
per &longs;ubjectum modiolo tubum F at­
trahitur in modiolum ip&longs;um B, quo
depre&longs;&longs;o aqua cogitur ex eodem mo­
diolo exire.

Sed ut minore operâ id
totum perficiatur, additur in C vectis
curvus CDE ver&longs;atilis circa axem D
infixum parieti interjecto inter an­
tliam & potentiam moventem.

Nam
extremitatem E arripiens potentia &longs;i
vectem urgeat versùs parietem inter­
medium, elevatur embolus, & aqua
modiolum implet, &longs;i verò vectis ex­
tremitatem à pariete removeat, deprimitur embolus, &
compre&longs;&longs;a aqua exprimitur.

Hìc vectem primi generis agno­
&longs;cis habentem hypomochlium in D, &longs;cilicet in axe, circa
quem ver&longs;atur vectis; & pro Ratione longitudinis DE ad
longitudinem DC e&longs;t Ratio momentorum potentiæ ad re­
&longs;i&longs;tentiam ponderis, hoc e&longs;t tantò magis augentur potentiæ
vires, quò major e&longs;t Ratio DE ad DC: &longs;umitur autem DE
recta linea non computato flexu DGE, qui eatenus ad&longs;trui­
tur, quatenus parietis cra&longs;&longs;ities ob&longs;taret, ne commodè utere­
mur vecte EDC inflexo in D.

Quia verò faciliùs ab homine urgetur vectis in E, quàm
ip&longs;a extremitas E retrahatur, ideò in antliâ &longs;olùm attrahen­
te utendo hoc vecte primi generis curvo minus e&longs;t laboris,
nam in deprimendo embolo minus e&longs;t difficultatis quàm in
elevando.

At &longs;i aqua altiùs elevanda e&longs;&longs;et &longs;upra antliam non
attrahentem &longs;olum, &longs;ed etiam expellentem, faciliùs attol­
leretur embolus, quàm deprimeretur, propter majorem aquæ
re&longs;i&longs;tentiam, cùm exprimitur, juxtà altitudinem perpendi­
cularem, ad quam expellitur: propterea tunc mutanda e&longs;­
&longs;et po&longs;itio, ut e&longs;&longs;et vectis &longs;ecundi generis; hypomochlium
enim &longs;tatuendum e&longs;&longs;et in C, & ha&longs;tile emboli adnecten­
dum in D.

Quod &longs;i potentia viribus abundet, poterit duplicem an­
tliam agitare, cuju&longs;modi e&longs;&longs;et &longs;i jugum RS bifariam divi&longs;um
in X jungeretur in R & S duplici ha&longs;tili, centrum autem
motûs re&longs;ponderet puncto X, cui
firmiter adnecteretur manu­
brium XZ, quod agitaretur pa-
rallelum plano, per quod tran&longs;it
axis jungens jugum RS cum
manubrio ip&longs;o: dum enim Z

remeans in Q deprimit embo­

Sunt
autem duo vectes curvi ZXR
& ZXS primi generis partem
unam, videlicet manubrium XZ,
habentes communem.

Sed quoniam po&longs;ito longiore manubrio ZX, vel DE, faci­
liùs quidem attollitur aqua, quàm &longs;i illud brevius e&longs;&longs;et, major
tamen corporis agitatio requiritur, & multâ membrorum incli­
natione laborio&longs;a exercitatio &longs;u&longs;cipienda e&longs;t, propterea &longs;atius
e&longs;t uti vecte recto, ut prop.
1. dictum e&longs;t, quem etiam &longs;edens
modico labore commovere poteris adnexum extremitati fu­
nem deor&longs;um trahendo.
PROPOSITIO III.

Rotam in profluente po&longs;itam, quæ aquam faciliùs elevet ex
vectis Rationibus, con&longs;tituere.

AQuam ex depre&longs;&longs;iore loco in altiorem provehi va&longs;culis ab­
&longs;idi rotæ circum circa alligatis, quæ in infimâ rotæ parte
&longs;ubjectam aquam immer&longs;a hauriunt, & circumactâ rotâ, ubi
circuli &longs;emi&longs;&longs;em a&longs;cendendo perfecerint, de&longs;cendendo effun­
dunt, quibus per Helvetios iter facere contigit, per&longs;pectum
e&longs;t; &longs;i in Tigurinâ Urbe, quam lacus Limagum fluvium exci­
piens interluit, ob&longs;ervârunt ab utrâque ripâ ductum ex palis
confertim den&longs;atis obicem obliquum u&longs;que ad medium alveum,
ut ex angu&longs;tiis erumpens aqua cæteroqui leniter defluens, ve­
lociùs fluere cogatur, & validiùs in prominentes rotæ palmulas
incurrens ingentem illam rotam cum adjunctis va&longs;culis aquâ
plenis faciliùs circumagat, atque adeò in &longs;ubjectum vas ponti
impo&longs;itum effu&longs;a aqua per urbem univer&longs;am dividatur.

Verùm
quia pondus, &longs;cilicet aqua va&longs;culis contenta, &longs;emper à centro
rotæ intervallo eodem abe&longs;t, aliud rotæ genus excogitari po­
te&longs;t, quod aquam facilius elevet, nec adnexa, &longs;ed congenita
habeat va&longs;cula.

In plano ex a&longs;&longs;eribus rite conjunctis compacto, centro A, in­
tervallo AB, intelli­
gatur de&longs;criptus cir­
culus, cujus &longs;emidia­
meter aliquanto ma­
jor &longs;it altitudine, ad
quam aqua evehen­
da e&longs;t, dividatúrque
de&longs;cripti circuli peri­
pheria in quotlibet
æquales partes, ex.

gr. duodecim, aut
plures.

Tum a&longs;&longs;ump­
tâ palmulæ congruâ
altitudine BD, alius
interior circulus eo­
dem centro A, in­
tervallo AD de&longs;cribatur, qui à ductis per centrum A dia­
metris &longs;imiliter in totidem æquales partes dividitur.

A&longs;&longs;ump­
tâ itaque CF æquali ip&longs;i DB, &longs;tatuatur CE intervallum op­
portunæ amplitudinis, ut aqua facilè ingredi po&longs;&longs;it.

Et ductâ
rectâ lineâ BE, re&longs;ecetur particula exterior, ut &longs;it BE CF:
idémque de cæteris partibus intelligatur, prout adjectum
&longs;chema refert.

Duo huju&longs;modi plana parentur omnino æqualia, &longs;imilitérque
denticulata, quæ cylindro (&longs;ive pri&longs;mati &longs;imilem ba&longs;im haben­
ti cum polygono ab initio de&longs;cripto) hoc e&longs;t axi in&longs;erantur in
A, & parallela &longs;int.

Planorum autem intervallum definiant a&longs;­
&longs;eres æquè lati, qui perpendiculares in&longs;i&longs;tant lineis GBE, &
&longs;imilibus; quorum a&longs;&longs;erum latitudo palmulis quoque DB, CF,
& reliquis latitudinem &longs;tatuet.

Omnibus ritè firmatis, ac ob­
&longs;tructis accuratè rimulis, rota &longs;uper polos axi infixos collocetur
in profluente, ità ut palmula tota in aquam immergatur, quæ per
apertum o&longs;culum CE ingrediens impleat &longs;patium EBD.

Impetu igitur profluentis dum rota convertitur, aqua inclu&longs;a
paulatim versùs rotæ centrum &longs;ecedit, donec quadrantem cir­
culi a&longs;cendendo tran&longs;gre&longs;&longs;a proxima fiat axi: cùm enim B vene­
rit in H, aqua erit in I, cùm verò ex H in S venerit, jam aqua
in &longs;ubjectum vas effluet.

Quare, licèt æqualium conver&longs;ionum
non &longs;int æquales a&longs;cen&longs;us in eâdem circuli peripheriâ, &longs;ed ab
imo puncto u&longs;que ad finem Quadrantis cre&longs;cant, quia tamen
centrum gravitatis aquæ &longs;e in æquilibrio &longs;tatuentis &longs;en&longs;im cen­
trum versùs recedit, ejus a&longs;cen&longs;us minor e&longs;t, quàm &longs;i eodem
&longs;emper intervallo abe&longs;&longs;et à centro rotæ.

E&longs;t itaque vectis curvus primi generis, cujus hypomochlium
re&longs;pondet centro A, Potentia movens duplex e&longs;t, &longs;cilicet vis
profluentis applicata in B, atque vis aquæ de&longs;cendentis exi&longs;tens
in S: pro variâ autem centri gravitatis aquæ elevatæ di&longs;tantiâ
ab hypomochlio A, diver&longs;a etiam e&longs;t motuum Ratio & momen­
torum.

Aqua enim in &longs;uperiore &longs;emicirculo &longs;upra RS in &longs;ingu­
lis loculamentis &longs;ibi invicem hinc atque hinc re&longs;pondentibus
æqualiter di&longs;po&longs;ita obtinet æqualia gravitatis momenta.

Qua­
propter totus profluentis conatus impenditur in elevandâ aquâ,
quæ loculamentis inter B & R interceptis continetur.

Quare
&longs;i multæ &longs;int profluentis vires, cra&longs;&longs;ior rota &longs;tatui pote&longs;t, ut,
planis magis di&longs;tantibus, major aquæ copia &longs;ingulis loculamen­
tis hauriatur: quo fiet, ut palmula latior majorem incurrentis
aquæ impetum recipiat.

Quòd &longs;i placuerit palmulas addere la­
tiores, quàm &longs;it rotæ cra&longs;&longs;itudo, non abnuo: hæc enim, & cæ­
tera, quæ con&longs;tructionis facilitatem juvent, prudentis machi­
natoris arbitrio relinquuntur: mihi &longs;atis e&longs;t innui&longs;&longs;e, quid com­
pendij ex vectis rationibus peti po&longs;&longs;it.
PROPOSITIO IV.

A pluribus hominibus ingens pondus transferri po&longs;&longs;e ita, ut
omnes æqualiter ferant.

ONus ingens palangâ transferri pluribus hinc atque hinc
longo ordine &longs;uccollantibus, notum e&longs;t: &longs;ed quoniam non
omnium æqualis e&longs;t di&longs;tantia à pondere (ni&longs;i fortè bini & bini
æquè di&longs;tarent à centro gravitatis) non &longs;unt æqualia momenta;
&longs;ed qui propiores &longs;unt magis premuntur, cæteris paribus, quàm
remotiore, maximè &longs;i quis &longs;en&longs;im &longs;e &longs;ubducat oneri adeò, ut
inæqualis fiat oneris di&longs;tantia ab iis, qui illud &longs;u&longs;tentant.

Prop­
terea methodus aliqua excogitanda e&longs;t, qua fiat ut &longs;inguli pa­
rem experiantur in deferendo onere difficultatem.

Sit ponderi dato alligatus vectis AB, & gravitatis centro
re&longs;pondeat punctum C,
atque æqualia &longs;int in­
tervalla AC & BC.

Si
centrum gravitatis pon­
deris re&longs;pondens puncto
C vectis non fuerit pla­
nè in mediâ eju&longs;dem
ponderis longitudine,
neque fuerit vectis val­
dè longior ip&longs;o ponde­
re, non poterunt plu­
res ita æqualiter di&longs;po­
ni, ut ad ferendum
æqualiter pondus &longs;in­
gulis anterioribus &longs;in­
guli po&longs;teriores re&longs;pon­
deant æquè à puncto C
di&longs;tantes, impediente
videlicet ipsâ ponderis
longitudine.

Quare tam in A quàm in B duo alij vectes DE, & FG
bifariam æqualiter divi&longs;i &longs;u&longs;tineant vectem AB: atque adeò
quemadmodum in A (idem dic de B) &longs;u&longs;tinetur &longs;emi&longs;&longs;is
totius gravitatis, in D &longs;u&longs;tinetur tantùm quadrans, &longs;icut
& in E.

Su&longs;tineatur &longs;imiliter extremitas D alio vecte HI
(id quod præ&longs;titum intellige pariter in extremitatibus E, F, G)
& in H &longs;u&longs;tinetur octava pars: item extremitas H &longs;u&longs;ti­
neatur vecte KL, & extremitas K vecte MN; percipitur
in K gravitatis pars decima &longs;exta, & in M pars trige&longs;ima
&longs;ecunda.

Poterunt igitur hac ratione di&longs;poni homines 32,
qui &longs;i po&longs;&longs;int &longs;inguli deferre lib.
100, transferent pondus
lib.
3200, & erit æqualiter inter illos di&longs;tributa gravitas.

Quòd &longs;i &longs;patium non prohibeat adhuc vectem &longs;ingulis ex­
tremitatibus adjungere, numerus hominum deferentium du­
plicabitur, & vel &longs;ingulorum labor dimidiatus erit, vel du­
plicatum pondus transferre poterunt.

Porrò vectem vecti
e&longs;&longs;e firmo vinculo connectendum, ne fortè in motu, vecte
aliquo &longs;e &longs;ubducente, luxetur machina, non opus e&longs;t mo­
nere, cum per &longs;e res ip&longs;a loquatur.

Illud ob&longs;erva, quod
vectium inter &longs;e æqualitatem, &longs;ive longitudo, &longs;ive cra&longs;&longs;i­
ties &longs;pectetur, non opus e&longs;t &longs;tudiosè accurare, dum­
modo &longs;inguli vectes æqualiter bifariam dividantur: im­
mò po&longs;tremi, & breviores e&longs;&longs;e po&longs;&longs;unt, ut minus &longs;pa­
tij requiratur, & graciliores, minùs quippe urgentur à
pondere.
In Atlante Sinico hæc lego pag.

125. In ferendis oneri­
bus &longs;citißimi &longs;unt Sinæ, ac rustici illic non parvum &longs;anè &longs;ta­
ticis no&longs;tris &longs;peculatoribus face&longs;&longs;erent negotium ad cau&longs;as inve­
niendas ac rationes, &longs;i viderent illos tormenta etiam majora,
ac &longs;imilia pondera, ita vectibus utrinque &longs;u&longs;pendentes, ut per
arcti&longs;&longs;imas etiam montium fauces facillimè transferant; ac li­
cèt præcedant alij, alij &longs;ub&longs;equantur, multí&longs;que pa&longs;&longs;ibus à pon­
dere &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;o di&longs;tent, ita tamen illud vectibus ac funibus ex æquo
nôrunt dividere, ut quilibet æquale ferè &longs;entiat onus, &longs;eu paulò re­
motior &longs;it, &longs;ive vicinior.

Hoc pacto ingentia marmora, atque inte­
gras etiam arbores facilè videas humeris ge&longs;tare Sinas. Hæc ibi.

Sed quonam id artificio in praxim deducatur, nullum planè
apparet ve&longs;tigium.

Si igitur funibus &longs;u&longs;penditur pondus, & deferentes alij
propiores &longs;unt, alij remotiores, duo ob&longs;ervanda &longs;unt.

Pri­
mum e&longs;t, quòd &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;io non e&longs;t perpendicularis &longs;ed obli­
qua, ac proinde plus virium requiritur, ut con&longs;tat ex iis,
quæ dicta &longs;unt tum lib.
1. cap.
16. de elevationibus obli­
quis, tum lib.
3. cap. 12, de præponderatione, & æquili­
britate gravium fune &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;orum.

Verùm hoc momento­
rum augmentum in elevatione & &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;ione obliquâ, ubi
operis abundamus, non con&longs;ideratur; videtur quippe &longs;atis
leve incommodum, quod facilitate transferendi onus com­
pen&longs;atur.

Secundum e&longs;t, quòd &longs;i omnes ferè æqualiter la­
borant, non di&longs;&longs;imiles e&longs;&longs;e oportet, &longs;ed proximè ea&longs;dem
obliquitates funium, ex quibus onus &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;um defer­
tur: manife&longs;tum enim e&longs;t in minori obliquitate &longs;u&longs;pen­
&longs;ionis minus virium requiri, quàm in majori obliqui­
tate.

Quare &longs;i hanc Sinarum indu&longs;triam æmulari conarer, pri­
mùm oneris transferendi extremitatibus (vel &longs;altem in pa­
ri di&longs;tantiâ à centro gravitatis, quantùm conjecturâ a&longs;&longs;e­
qui po&longs;&longs;em) vectes tran&longs;ver&longs;os firmin mè alligarem, ut
vectium horum capitibus jungerem funes, quibus &longs;u&longs;pen­
&longs;um onus deferatur.

Horum autem tran&longs;ver&longs;orum vectium
longitudinem ita definirem, ut in lineâ vectibus parallelâ,
& æquali quatuor &longs;altem homines commodè collocari
queant, quin &longs;ibi ullum impedimentum progredientes in­
ferant.

Deinde &longs;atis validos funes utrique vectium extre­
mitati adnexos tantæ longitudinis &longs;tatuerem, quantâ opus
&longs;it, ut (tribus hominibus ante onus &longs;ibi ordine recto &longs;uc­
cedentibus ac mediocriter di&longs;tantibus, quin po&longs;terior prio­
ris calcem progrediendo feriat) ad tertij humerum pertin­
gere po&longs;&longs;it; hæc enim videtur minima obliquitas &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;io­
nis, & quæ proximè accedat ad &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;ionem perpendicu­
larem: Si verò major fuerit funium longitudo, majori labo­
re deferetur onus, &longs;i maximè ita elevetur, ut multum di&longs;tet
à &longs;ubjecto &longs;olo, major enim erit obliquitas &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;ionis.

Tum extremitati funis alius vectis alligetur, qui vecti­
bus aliis &longs;u&longs;tentetur eâ methodo, quam paulo &longs;uperiùs in­
dicavi.

Sit onus transferendum P; extremitati anteriori (omnia
eadem in alterâ extre­
mitate po&longs;ita intelli­
gantur) adnectatur vec.

Quare &longs;i totidem fu­

&longs;imili ratione applicen­

Ex quo fit non adeò difficile e&longs;&longs;e in exercitu, ubi non e&longs;t
hominum &longs;uccollantium inopia, bombardas ex loco in locum
transferre, &longs;i nimis arduum &longs;it iter, nec equis trahi po&longs;&longs;int:
Nam majoribus bombardis pro &longs;ingulis globi ferrei libris me­

minoribus bombardis metalli libræ 238 u&longs;que ad 266 in &longs;ingu­
las globi libras communiter tribuuntur.

Quòd &longs;i eæ &longs;int viarum angu&longs;tiæ, quæ octo homines pariter
incedentes non capiant, adhibeatur longior funis, duos, aut
etiam tres, aut plures vectes connectens ita invicem di&longs;tan­
tes, ut intentus funis rectus &longs;it, & propiores quidem &longs;uum
vectem aut manu apprehen&longs;um &longs;u&longs;tentent, aut fune &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;um
alio vecte parallelo humeris ge&longs;tent, remoti&longs;&longs;imi verò humeros
&longs;uo vecti &longs;ubjiciant.

Sic di&longs;ponatur funis AH, ut intentus
pertingat ad humeros
eorum, qui in E & F
&longs;u&longs;tentant vectes DE
& FI.

Quoniam ve­
rò vectis MN longè
depre&longs;&longs;ior e&longs;t, quàm
humeri eorum, qui tam
propè ab&longs;unt à ponde­
re; propterea vel &longs;olis

quod &longs;atius e&longs;t, alium

lum vecti MN, ita ut
ex illo funibus ad per­
pendiculum intentis
&longs;u&longs;pendantur extremi­

Id quod
etiam de reliquis, at­

vectibus dictum intel­

Omnes autem
æqualiter conari palàm
e&longs;t, quia intento fune
AH eadem e&longs;t obliqua
&longs;u&longs;pen&longs;io ponderis, &
paria &longs;unt momenta ad­
versùs &longs;ingulos vectes,
quos funis connectit.

Illud tamen negari non
pote&longs;t, quod pro majore
funis AH longitudine
major e&longs;t &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;ionis
obliquitas, ac proinde,
& major &longs;u&longs;tentandi labor.

Unum adhuc hìc addere (ne quid intactum relinquatur) fuerit
operæ pretium, videlicet, &longs;i ponderis transferendi cra&longs;&longs;ities
&longs;eu altitudo mediocris &longs;altem fuerit, ita ut non &longs;olùm infi­
mo plano &longs;ubjici vectes po&longs;&longs;int, &longs;ed etiam &longs;upremæ aut me­
diæ parti adnecti, po&longs;&longs;e eidem lateri duos aut etiam tres fu­
nes, non quidem omninò, &longs;ed proximè parallelos alligari,
quibus duæ, aut tres, ferè &longs;imiles obliquæ &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;iones fiant,
& deferentes pondus alij aliis remotiores &longs;int, ferè tamen
æqualiter conantes.

Sic ingentis &longs;axi altitudo &longs;it FG, & al­
ligatus in F funis connectantur cum vecte in S aliis vectibus
&longs;u&longs;tentato, ut &longs;upra.

Item in E & in G alij funes paralleli &longs;imili­
ter jungantur cum vectibus in T & V, ut homines ibi &longs;uccollan­
tes vectibú&longs;que &longs;ubjecti &longs;ibi invicem impedimento non &longs;int.

Si
igitur &longs;ingulis lateribus ad B, C, D tres funes hac ratione addan­
tur, erunt 12 funes, & &longs;i homines 16 &longs;ingulis funibus applicen­
tur methodo &longs;uperiùs indicatâ, pondus ge&longs;tabitur à viris 192:
con&longs;tat igitur quàm ingens onus facilè transferri vectibus
queat.
PROPOSITIO V.
Multiplici vecte moventis vires augere.

PRo vectis longitudine majori, in eâdem ab hypomochlio
di&longs;tantiâ ponderis, potentiæ momenta augeri, quia Ratio
motûs potentiæ ad motum ponderis augetur, &longs;atis manife&longs;tum
e&longs;t ex dictis.

Verùm quia non rarò tam longus vectis, quanto
opus e&longs;&longs;et, in promptu non e&longs;t, aut ip&longs;a longitudo illum redde­
ret fractioni, aut &longs;altem flexioni, magis obnoxium, aut, &longs;i peri­
culo huic occurratur, tam immanis e&longs;t vectis moles, ut non levi
incommodo &longs;it eo utentibus: propterea ars aliqua excogitanda
e&longs;t, qua oblati vectis brevitatem compen&longs;atione aliquâ &longs;up­
pleamus.

Et primò quidem &longs;i oblatus &longs;it vectis AB, habens hypomo­
chlium in C, & pondus in B tam
grave, ut unica potentia in A non
&longs;atis &longs;it ad vincendam oneris re&longs;i­
&longs;tentiam, utique &longs;i altero, aut ter­
tio movente opus &longs;it, non omnes in
extremitate A vectem apprehen­
dere valent, &longs;ed alter in D, tertius
in E; qui propterea, licèt &longs;inguli
æquali robore polleant, non tamen
æqualia habent momenta, &longs;ed pri­
mus ut AC, &longs;ecundus ut DC, ter­
tius ut EC.

Quapropter alter vectis GH adnectatur extremi­
tati A ad angulos rectos, ut huic applicati motores plus ha­
beant momenti.

Si enim AC ad CB fuerit ut 10 ad 1, perinde
e&longs;t, atque &longs;i decima ponderis pars à duabus in G & H æquali­
ter ab A di&longs;tantibus movenda e&longs;&longs;et, ac propterea &longs;inguli &longs;emi&longs;­
&longs;em decimæ partis re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ percipiunt, hoc e&longs;t, habent &longs;imul
&longs;umpti momentum ut 20 ad 1: qui autem in A e&longs;&longs;et &longs;olus, habe­
ret momentum ut 10, & qui in D haberet momentum ex.gr. ut
9; qui idcircò &longs;imul &longs;umpti minùs po&longs;&longs;unt quàm G & H.

At &longs;i volueris tres homines in extremitatibus vectis GH di­
&longs;tribuere in potentias æqualiter conantes, di&longs;tingue GH in tres
partes, & &longs;it AH triens totius longitudinis GH: tum duo ap­
plicentur extremitati H, tertius verò extremitati G: ut enim
potentia duplex in H ad potentiam in G, ita reciprocè duplex
di&longs;tantia GA ad di&longs;tantiam AH.

Nam quemadmodum de
&longs;u&longs;tinentibus pondus vecte &longs;ive æqualiter, &longs;ive inæqualiter di­
vi&longs;o dictum e&longs;t, ita hìc pariter de Prementibus dicendum, qui
in H & in G &longs;unt vici&longs;&longs;im Potentia & Hypomochlium: ex eo
&longs;cilicet quòd potentia in H premit, habet rationem hypomo­
chlij, dum re&longs;i&longs;tit, ne potentia in G premens elevet ip&longs;am ex­
tremitatem H, ac propterea deprimat pondus in A exi&longs;tens; &
vici&longs;&longs;im potentia in G premens habet rationem hypomochlij
re&longs;i&longs;tendo, ne elevetur à potentiâ premente in H; quæ prop­
terea deprimit pondus in A.

E&longs;t itaque veluti duplex vectis &longs;e­
cundi generis; & AG ad AH &longs;i fuerit ut 2 ad 1, momentum
potentiæ in G ad re&longs;i&longs;tentiam ponderis in A e&longs;t ut 3 ad 1, hoc
e&longs;t ut GH ad AH: & momentum unius potentiæ in H ad re­
&longs;i&longs;tentiam ponderis in A e&longs;t ut 3 ad 2, hoc e&longs;t, ut HG ad AG.

Sed quia in H ex hypothe&longs;i &longs;unt duæ potentiæ, duplicatæ po­
tentiæ in H momentum erit ut 6 ad 2, hoc e&longs;t, &longs;ingularum
momentum ut 3 ad 1. Igitur qui e&longs;t in G habet momentum at­
que conatum, qua&longs;i &longs;ine vecte moveret trige&longs;imam partem pon­
deris in B exi&longs;tentis; & duo, qui in H, &longs;inguli habent momen­
tum æquale atque conatum &longs;imilem.

Ponatur pondus B lib.60;
in A percipitur ponderis (1/10), hoc e&longs;t, lib.
6. Igitur potentia in
G percipit re&longs;i&longs;tentiam lib.2, & duæ potentiæ in H &longs;imul lib.4,
hoc e&longs;t &longs;ingulæ lib.2.

Quod &longs;i non placuerit longitudinem GH habere tanquam
vectem, qui non alternâ quadam motione & quiete extremita­
tum perficitur motus, &longs;ed G, & A, & H omnino &longs;imul &
æquali motu moventur, non admodum contendo: perinde erit,
atque &longs;i tres potentiæ in A e&longs;&longs;ent con&longs;titutæ, quarum &longs;ingulæ
tertiam partem ponderis moveant conatu &longs;ubdecuplo illius co­
natus, quo tertia illa pars &longs;ine vecte movenda e&longs;&longs;et.

Hinc &longs;altem con&longs;tat, quo virium atque conatûs compendio
valeat unicus homo oblati vectis momenta augere: Nam &longs;i idem
&longs;it primi generis vectis AB, & AC ad CB &longs;it ut 10 ad 1, adhi­
be vectem &longs;ecundi generis GH, & alterâ extremitate fixâ, ut
ibi &longs;it hypomochlium, idem augebit momenta juxta Rationem
totius longitudinis GH ad di&longs;tantiam ip&longs;ius A ab hypomo­
chlio: Quare &longs;i Ratio &longs;it dupla, aut tripla, æquivalebit duobus
aut tribus, qui in A moventes haberent momentum decuplum;
nam A movetur decuplo velociùs quàm B, & po&longs;ito hypomo­
chlio H, movetur potentia G duplo aut triplo velociùs quàm A,
hoc e&longs;t vigecuplo aut trigecuplo velociùs quàm B.

Id quod
u&longs;um habet non &longs;olùm, quando vectis AB movendus e&longs;t in pla-
no Verticali, &longs;ed etiam in plano horizontali, ut &longs;i duo marmora
disjungenda e&longs;&longs;ent, aut clathri di&longs;&longs;ipandi.

Juxta autem loci op­
portunitatem adjungendus e&longs;t &longs;ecundus vectis GH aut proxi­
mè ip&longs;i primo vecti, aut remotè medio fune extremitatem A
connectente cum &longs;ecundo
vecte.

Sic inter duo mar­
mora immi&longs;&longs;us ferreus cla­
vus SR jungitur vecti TV
fune SO, & potentia in
T habet momentum com­
po&longs;itum ex Rationibus
TV ad VO, & SX ad XR.

Neque duos tantummodo, verùm etiam plures vectes adhi­
bere po&longs;&longs;umus, tunc maximè, cùm ingenti oneri exiguus
motus tribuendus e&longs;t.

Sit enim marmor P attollendum &longs;ub­
jecto vecte AB &longs;ecundi
generis habente hypo­
mochlium in B, ac pon­
dere incumbente illi in
C: & AB ad CB &longs;it
ut 7 ad 1. Quia vectis
attollendus e&longs;t, &longs;ubji­
ce illi in A vectem al­
terum DE, ut.

ED ad
AD &longs;it in Ratione 3 ad 1. Item extremitati E &longs;ubjice tertium
vectem FG, & &longs;it GF ad EF ut 8 ad 1. Igitur A movetur &longs;ep­
tuplò velociùs quàm C, & E triplo velociùs quàm A, atque
G octuplo velociùs quàm E.

Quare motus potentiæ in G ad
motum ponderis in C e&longs;t ut 168 ad 1. Quàm difficile autem
accideret, &longs;i tam longum vectem parare oporteret, cujus lon­
gitudo e&longs;&longs;et ad CB ut 168 ad 1!

Adde non &longs;olùm vectibus rectis hoc
momentorum incrementum acquiri
po&longs;&longs;e, &longs;ed etiam pro loci opportunita­
te vectibus curvis aut angulatis.

Si
enim in &longs;uperiore loco fuerit vectis
&longs;ecundi generis MN oneri &longs;ubjectus,
aut oneri inferiùs po&longs;ito junctus fune
in O, non &longs;olùm po&longs;&longs;umus extremitatem M fune connectere
cum vecte recto &longs;uperiùs po&longs;ito, &longs;ed etiam &longs;ubjicere illi po&longs;&longs;u­
mus vectem curvum KL fixum in I, & extremitas L fune LR
trahi pote&longs;t deor&longs;um, ut IK elevetur, atque illo motu attol­
lat extremitatem M, quantum ferre pote&longs;t flexus IK.

Non
e&longs;t autem opus monere inæqualia &longs;en&longs;im fieri momenta, prout
&longs;ubjectus vectis curvus KIL in alio atque alio puncto contingit
vectem MN, pro variâ &longs;cilicet di&longs;tantiâ ab hypomochlio.

In vecte tertij generis majorem e&longs;&longs;e ponderis motum mo­
tu potentiæ, ac proinde majores requiri potentiæ vires ad at­
tollendum onus, &longs;i illa conjuncta ac &longs;ociata &longs;it cum huju&longs;mo­
di vecte, quàm &longs;i ip&longs;a &longs;olitaria manum admoveret ponderi
&longs;ublevando, manife&longs;tum e&longs;t; propterea infirmiori potentiæ &longs;ub­
&longs;idium aliquod indu&longs;triâ comparare po&longs;&longs;umus, & propo&longs;itum
vectem in aliam vectis &longs;peciem qua&longs;i convertere, etiam &longs;i &longs;patij an­
gu&longs;tiis coarctemur, modò liceat proximum parietem perfodere.

Sit parieti AB innixus vectis CD, cujus extremitati D
adnectendum &longs;it
pondus ex.

lib.
200: poten­
tia autem appli­
cari nequeat ni­
&longs;i in E, ita ut
EC &longs;it quarta
pars totius vectis
CD. Igitur, cum
motus in D &longs;it quadruplus motûs in E, ut potentia &longs;ublevet onus
D, tanta &longs;it, oportet, ut ip&longs;a &longs;e &longs;ola valeat quadruplum onus, &longs;ci­
licet lib.800 attollere: id quod valdè incommodum accideret,
&longs;i adeò validam potentiam invenire opus e&longs;&longs;et.

Perfode igitur in
&longs;uperiore parte B parietem, illíque immitte vectem FG facile in
B hypomochlio ver&longs;atilem, ita ut BF pars imminens &longs;ubjecto
vecti &longs;it æqualis parti EC, hoc e&longs;t, di&longs;tantiæ potentiæ E ab hy­
pomochlio C, & fune FE connectantur: pars verò ultra parie­
tem in proximum conclave extans BG ad partem BF &longs;it in qua­
cumque Ratione.

Tum in inferiore loco, prout opportunius ac­
ciderit, vectem alium &longs;tatue HI, cui junge &longs;uperioris Vectis ex­
tremitatem G fune GM: nam Ratio compo&longs;ita ex Rationibus
IH ad MH, & GB ad BF dabit momentum potentiæ in I po­
&longs;itæ ad attollendum pondus in D con&longs;titutum per vectem da­
tum CD habentem potentiam in E.

Hîc habes tria vectis genera; nam IH e&longs;t &longs;ecundi generis, quia
pondus intelligitur in M inter potentiam I & hypomochlium H;
GF e&longs;t primi generis, quia hypomochlium B e&longs;t inter potentiam
G & pondus in F; CD e&longs;t tertij generis, quemadmodum ab ini­
tio con&longs;titutum e&longs;t.

Si itaque in E requireretur vis attollendi
lib.800, & &longs;it GB dupla ip&longs;ius BF, requiritur in G vis attollendi
lib.400. Si verò I H ad MH &longs;it quadrupla, requiritur in I vis
elevandi lib.100. Quare & uteris vecte tertij generis CD, quo
&longs;atis notabiliter movetur pondus D; & potentiæ momenta
auxi&longs;ti adeò, ut non &longs;olùm non requiratur potentia major
pondere attollendo, &longs;ed &longs;ufficiat potentia minor, habet quippe
motum duplo majorem, quàm &longs;it motus ponderis D; nam mo­
tus extremitatis F & puncti E &longs;unt æquales; motus potentiæ I
e&longs;t quadruplus motus ip&longs;ius M; hoc e&longs;t extremitatis G; hæc ve­
rò motum habet duplum motus ip&longs;ius F: igitur motus poten­
tiæ I e&longs;t octuplus motûs puncti E, quod movetur motu &longs;ubqua­
druplo extremitatis D: Motus igitur potentiæ I ad motum
ponderis D e&longs;t ut 8 ad 4, hoc e&longs;t ut 2 ad 1.
PROPOSITIO VI.
Stateræ vires addito Vecte augere.

PAretur ha&longs;ta AB, atque extremitati A addatur annulus, cui
in&longs;eri valeat &longs;tateræ CD uncus, & extremitas B ita confor­
metur, ut notabile &longs;it & con&longs;picuum punctum, quod hypomo­
chlio re&longs;pondeat; &longs;itque certa nota, qua digno&longs;catur vec is pa­
rallelú&longs;ne &longs;it horizonti, an inclinatus.

Tum di&longs;tantia BA di-
vidatur primùm in duas partes, deinde in tres, & &longs;ic deinceps,
quatenus commodè fieri id poterit citra confu&longs;ionem, quando
opus fuerit huic aut illi puncto adnectere onus expendendum,
adeò ut certi &longs;cimus, quotuplex &longs;it totius vectis AB longitudo
comparata cum di&longs;tantiâ ponderis ab hypomochlio B.

Hoc vecte ad u&longs;um parato, examinetur &longs;taterâ communi,
quantum ille gravitet parallelus horizonti: & &longs;it æquipondium
&longs;tateræ ex.

gr. in H indicans lib.
2: id quod memoriâ retinen­

2.

B 6. igitur convertendo ut 1 ad 6, ita lib.10. unc.8. ad lib.64.

Quoniam verò accidere pote&longs;t, ut oblatum pondus exce­
dat quidem datæ &longs;tateræ vires, &longs;ed ejus gravitas minor &longs;it quàm
dupla ejus, cui æquipondium in extremo &longs;tateræ jugo re&longs;pon­
det; propterea divi&longs;iones eædem, quæ ex 2 ad B adnotatæ &longs;unt,
transferantur ex 2 versùs A, ut habeamus diver&longs;a puncta in
vecte, quibus applicari po&longs;&longs;it onus ponderandum.

Ex numero
igitur adnotato, cui adnectitur pondus, fiat numerator fractionis,
cujus Denominator &longs;it unitate minor ip&longs;o numeratore; & per
hanc fractionem multiplicetur numerus à &longs;taterâ indicatus
(demptâ priùs vectis gravitate, ut &longs;uperiùs dictum e&longs;t) & habe­
bitur oneris gravitas.

Sit igitur inter A & 2 adnexum pondus in
puncto 7, & &longs;tatera indicet lib.13. unc.7: demo vectis gravita­
tem, quæ e&longs;t lib.
2 ex hypothe&longs;i, remanent lib.11. unc.7. mul­
tiplicandæ per 7/6, & dabitur oneris gravitas lib.

&longs;ci eadem gravitas.

Generatim itaque atque universè oblato quocumque vecte
ad &longs;ubitum u&longs;um properato utere, etiam&longs;i nullæ in eo divi&longs;io­
nes adnotatæ fuerint, examinato tamen priùs ip&longs;ius vectis ho­

&longs;taterâ extremo vecti applicatâ elevari po&longs;&longs;it.

Facto demum
æquilibrio, &longs;tateræ numerum (dempto priùs vectis momen­
to) multiplica per Rationem, quam habet vectis longitudo ad
di&longs;tantiam ponderis ab hypomochlio; & propo&longs;itum obtine­
bis.

Hìc habes maximum compendium ad ingentium ponde­
rum gravitatem explorandam: etiam&longs;i enim vectis non &longs;it
adeò cra&longs;&longs;us, quia tamen non procul ab extremitate illius, ubi
e&longs;t hypomochlium, alligatur onus, validè re&longs;i&longs;tit fractioni;
& quo major e&longs;t Ratio longitudinis vectis ad di&longs;tantiam pon-
eris ab hypomochlio, tanto majore incremento augentur &longs;ta­
teræ vires.

Quod &longs;i fortè unicus vectis &longs;atis non fuerit, nihil prohibet
plures adhiberi vectes multo majore compendio, quàm &longs;i uni­
cum longiorem adhiberes.

Nam &longs;i vectis AB non ita &longs;tateræ
vires multiplicet,
ut tormentum æ­
neum in C alli­
gatum elevari po&longs;­
&longs;it ab æquipondio
&longs;tateræ, alium

vectium fune HI conjunctorum & po&longs;itionem horizonti paral­
lelam habentium gravitatis momentum expendatur.

Deinde
facto æquilibrio dematur vectium momentum, & reliquus li­
brarum numerus à &longs;taterâ indicatus multiplicetur primò per
Rationem FE ad HE, & quod ex hac multiplicatione con&longs;ur­

gr. IB ad

His autem indicatis &longs;tatim occurit animo non duos tantum­

MECHANICORUM LIBER QUINTUS.
De Axe in Peritrochio.

QUÆ de Vecte ejú&longs;que viribus &longs;uperiore libro
di&longs;putata &longs;unt, illa quidem vera &longs;unt, & ad­
mirabilia, &longs;ed, ni&longs;i vectis admodum longus
&longs;it, exiguus motus conciliatur ponderi, adeò
ut, &longs;i ad notabilem aliquam altitudinem attol­
lendum illud &longs;it, oporteat &longs;ubinde & ip&longs;i ponderi fulcrum
&longs;upponere, ne recidat, & ip&longs;i vecti hypomochlium altiùs
&longs;ubjicere, ut congruo loco &longs;tatuatur.

Præterquam quod pro
variâ ip&longs;ius vectis inclinatione, onerí&longs;que illi impo&longs;iti, aut
&longs;ubjecti po&longs;itione, varia quoquè &longs;unt momenta potentiæ
vectem urgentis.

Hinc alia Facultas excogitata e&longs;t, quæ,
ut pluribus placet, vectis quidam &longs;it perpetuus, citrà in­
commoda, quæ in &longs;implici Vecte, ut innuebam, occur­
runt. Vectem autem appellant, quia ad vectis Rationes il­
lius vim revocant; perpetuum verò, quia nullâ opus e&longs;t
hypomochlij mutatione: proprio tamen, tritóque jam ve­
tu&longs;tate vocabulo, communiter dicitur Axis in Peritrochio,
qua&longs;i Axis in Rota, ut quidam interpretantur; &longs;ed forta&longs;sè
clariùs, pleniú&longs;que vocabuli vim a&longs;&longs;equeremur, &longs;i Axem
Convolutum vocaremus; neque enim &longs;emper ade&longs;t Rota,
cum tamen &longs;emper inter&longs;it Convolutio, &longs;imul quippe vol­
vitur, & Axis ip&longs;e, & id, cum quo Axis conjungitur.
Neque hic &longs;umitur Axis quemadmodum in Cono, Cylin­
dro, atque Sphærâ, pro linea rectâ, circa quam immo­
tam corpora illa in gyrum aguntur; &longs;ed e&longs;t corpus &longs;uâ
præditum cra&longs;&longs;itie, cui Axis nomen inditum e&longs;t, quia ro­
tarum axem imitatur, non tamen circà illum fit convolu­
tio, &longs;ed ip&longs;e circa idem centrum volvitur minore motu,
circa quod potentia motu majore rotatur, quatenus illi ap­
plicatur, ut ex his, quæ dicentur, manife&longs;tum fiet.
CAPUT I.

Axis in Peritrochio forma, & vires
de&longs;cribuntur.

AXis in Peritrochio forma à Pappo Alexandrino circa
finem lib.
8. Collect. Mathem. de&longs;cribitur, quadratum
&longs;cilicet lignum tympano quadra­
to foramen AB eidem ligno con­
gruens circa &longs;uum centrum ha­
benti in&longs;eritur, ut &longs;imul verti
po&longs;&longs;int: ligni autem partes è
tympano prominentes in cylin­
dricam rotunditatem conforman­
tur; & lignum horizonti parallelum &longs;uper polos æreos, aut
ferreos (choinicidas Pappus vocat) congruis fulcris in&longs;i&longs;ten­
tes &longs;tatuitur.

Extremæ verò tympani orbitæ infiguntur Ra­
dij CD, EF, &c, quos Pappus Scytalas, Ari&longs;toteles Col­
lopes nominat, longiores &longs;cilicet paxilli, quibus arreptis
ver&longs;atur tympanum, & cum eo Axis, quem ductarius fu­
nis HI in convolutione circumplectens attollit adnexam in
I &longs;arcinam; atque hæc tantumdem attollitur, quantus funis
Axem circumplicat ex convolutione.

Ut Axis huju&longs;modi vires explicentur, communiter in eo
agno&longs;cunt Vectis Rationes: cum enim CB &longs;it &longs;emidiame­
ter cylindri, quem funis complectitur, & CE &longs;emidiame-
ter tympani circumpo&longs;iti, EA verò longitudo Radij, conci­
piunt AB qua&longs;i Vectem
primi generis habentem hy­
pomochlium in C, adeò ut
ex Ratione AC ad CB mo­
mentum potentiæ in A ap­
plicatæ computetur.

Quæ
quidem vera e&longs;&longs;e non nega­
verim, &longs;i hoc unum intelli­
gatur, quòd Ratio AC ad
CB &longs;imilis &longs;it Rationi, quam
haberet æqualis Vectis &longs;imi­
lem habens po&longs;itionem Po­
tentiæ, Hypomochlij, &
Ponderis.

Verùm cur primi
potiùs quàm &longs;ecundi gene­
ris vectis dicatur Axis in Pe­
ritrochio, cùm æquè attolla­
tur pondus P, &longs;i Radij extre­
mitas D elevetur &longs;ur&longs;um, ac &longs;i extremitas Radij A deprimatur
deor&longs;um?
E&longs;to facilior &longs;it depre&longs;&longs;io, quàm elevatio.

Quid,
&longs;i Axis &longs;tatueretur horizonti perpendicularis, tympanum au­
tem horizonti parallelum, non ad attollendum, &longs;ed ad trahen­
dum pondus?

Utique par e&longs;&longs;et trahendi facilitas, &longs;ive impel­
latur D versùs H, &longs;ive A versùs I: adeóque nulla e&longs;&longs;et ratio,
cur primi potiùs quàm &longs;ecundi generis Vectis diceretur: an
utrique generi a&longs;cribendus e&longs;t?
Sed quid Axem ad Vectem revocare opus e&longs;t?

cùm eodem
ex fonte ita utriu&longs;que vires emanent, ut etiam&longs;i Vectem extra
omnem Naturæ facultatem po&longs;itum, atque inter a)/dunata re­
cen&longs;endum e&longs;&longs;e fingeremus, adhuc Axi &longs;ua permanerent mo­
menta: E&longs;t nimirum, &longs;i &longs;ecundum velocitatem comparentur,
motûs potentiæ ad motum Ponderis Ratio major, quàm gravi­
tatis ponderis ad virtutem potentiæ: dum enim funis ductarius
&longs;emel cylindrum circumplectitur, potentia &longs;emel percurrit &longs;pa­
tium æquale peripheriæ circuli ab extremo Radio de&longs;cripti;
cùm autem &longs;int peripheriæ circulorum in Ratione &longs;emidiame­
trorum, motus potentiæ A ad motum ponderis P e&longs;t ut AC ad
CB.

Quare potentiæ Peritrochium ver&longs;antis conatus, ad cona­
tum potentiæ &longs;ine machinâ attollentis pondus P, erit in Ratio­
ne CB ad AC; quò enim minor &longs;ecundùm velocitatem e&longs;t
motus ponderis comparatus cum motu potentiæ, eo minor e&longs;t
eju&longs;dem re&longs;i&longs;tentia; minorem autem re&longs;i&longs;tentiam minor cona­
tus &longs;uperat.

Quæ ita ex dictis tùm lib.2.cap.5. tum lib.4.cap.1.
clara &longs;unt, ut uberior explicatio &longs;upervacanea cen&longs;enda &longs;it.

Hinc apparet, quid juvet ip&longs;ius rotæ adjunctæ magnitudo,
aut infixarum &longs;cytalarum longitudo; quò enim fuerit major
Potentiæ di&longs;tantia à centro motûs, eò pariter major erit mo­
vendi facilitas.

Quo circa &longs;i eidem Peritrochio placuerit dupli­
cem applicare potentiam, atque ideò &longs;cytalas non exteriori ab­
&longs;idi tympani infigas, &longs;ed potiùs extremam tympani oram &longs;cy­
talis ad ejus planum perpendicularibus transfigas; tunc ad au­
genda Potentiæ momenta nequicquam prode&longs;t &longs;cytalæ longitu­
do, &longs;ed à foramine, cui illa infigitur, u&longs;que ad centrum de&longs;u­
menda e&longs;t potentiæ di&longs;tantia, quæ ut major fiat, tympani dia­
meter augenda e&longs;t.

Id quod pariter dicendum e&longs;t, quando ma­
nubrium (unicus &longs;cilicet paxillus tympani plano infixus) appo­
nitur, quod moventis manu perpetuò in conver&longs;ione retine­
tur; ejus enim di&longs;tantia à centro perinde con&longs;ideratur, atque &longs;i
potentia illi tympani parti fui&longs;&longs;et proximè applicata, cui manu­
brium infigitur.

Cavendum tamen hìc videtur, ne quis majorem aliquam ro­
tam ultrà manubrium excurrentem cylindro circumpo&longs;itam
con&longs;iderans, quæ aliquando plus habere videtur momenti,
quàm &longs;i rota non major e&longs;&longs;et, quàm ferat manubrij à centro
di&longs;tantia, exi&longs;timet non ex hac di&longs;tantiâ computandum e&longs;&longs;e po­
tentiæ manubrio applicatæ momentum.

Ob&longs;ervet, oportet, hoc
non contingere in immanibus & colo&longs;&longs;icoteris ponderibus, im­
mò neque in mediocribus movendis, &longs;ed in iis tantummodo,
quæ leviore negotio & velociter moveri po&longs;&longs;unt: Rota enim,
cujus &longs;emidiameter major e&longs;t, quàm manubrij à centro di&longs;tan­
tia, impre&longs;&longs;um à movente potentiâ impetum concipit, qui le­
vem nactus re&longs;i&longs;tentiam non &longs;tatim perit, &longs;ed aliquanti&longs;per per­
&longs;everans motum rotæ unà cum novo potentiæ conatu efficit
majorem, quàm pro &longs;olitariis potentiæ viribus: immò tanta fie­
ri pote&longs;t impetûs impre&longs;&longs;i acce&longs;&longs;io, ut po&longs;t aliquod tempus,
etiam dimi&longs;&longs;o à potentiâ manubrio, vi eju&longs;dem impre&longs;&longs;i impe­
tûs adhuc &longs;e rota in gyrum contorqueat.

Hinc e&longs;t aliquando
eju&longs;dem rotæ diametrorum extremitatibus addi plumbeas ma&longs;­
&longs;as, quæ plus impetûs concipientes, atque diutiùs retinentes,
rotæ conver&longs;ionem validiùs promoveant, etiam ce&longs;&longs;ante poten­
tiâ.

Sed hìc non unica e&longs;t potentia, quæ manubrio applicatur,
cujus momenta ex di&longs;tantiâ manubrij à centro definimus; &longs;ed
præterea impetus ille per&longs;everans rationem habet alterius po­
tentiæ applicatæ illis rotæ partibus, quibus ine&longs;t; & pro variâ
à centro di&longs;tantiâ, alia pariter atque alia &longs;unt particularum ip­
&longs;ius impetûs impre&longs;&longs;i momenta ad rotam convertendam.

Quo­
niam verò rotæ &longs;emidiameter ex hypothe&longs;i major e&longs;t, quàm
manubrij à centro di&longs;tantia, nil mirum, &longs;i particulæ impetûs ex­
tremæ rotæ impre&longs;&longs;i multum habeant momenti, quippe quæ
magis di&longs;tant, & velociorem motum efficiunt.

Quod verò ad cylindrum &longs;pectat, quem funis ductarius cir­
cumplicat, non e&longs;t nece&longs;&longs;e illum e&longs;&longs;e exactè & Geometricè ro­
tundum, &longs;ed &longs;atis e&longs;t &longs;i cylindricam figuram æmuletur: catenus
&longs;iquidem rotundum axem con&longs;truimus, quatenus eadem volu­
mus in convolutione &longs;ervari momenta: &longs;i verò angulatus e&longs;&longs;et
axis, perpendiculum, in quo e&longs;&longs;et pondus, modò vicinum cen­
tro e&longs;&longs;et, modò ab eo remotum, ac propterea eju&longs;dem remoti
majora e&longs;&longs;ent momenta, quàm vicini.
Sit enim ex.

gr. qua­
dratus Axis BDHG: utique per­
pendiculum, in quo e&longs;t funis reti­
nens pondus quod attollitur, va­
riam habet à centro C di&longs;tantiam;
nam quando latus BD congruit fu­
ni perpendiculari, di&longs;tantia à cen­
tro C æqualis e&longs;t &longs;emi&longs;&longs;i lateris GB,
& e&longs;t CI; cum verò latus BD in
conver&longs;ione fit obliquum, di&longs;tan­
tia perpendiculi fit major, & e&longs;t
CE, ita ut demùm di&longs;tantia maxi­
ma &longs;it æqualis ip&longs;i CB; quæ iterum decre&longs;cit, donec funis
congruat lateri BG.

Potentiæ autem à centro di&longs;tantia eadem
&longs;emper manet AC, ideòque momentorum potentiæ ad mo­
menta ponderis Ratio &longs;ubinde mutatur.

Quòd &longs;i non quadra-
tus &longs;it Axis, &longs;ed plurium angulorum, ita ut latera brevi&longs;&longs;ima
&longs;int, &longs;icuti vix di&longs;tat à rotunditate cylindri, ita vix momento­
rum di&longs;paritatem infert.

Illud quidem animadver&longs;ione dignum e&longs;t, quòd non te­
merè &longs;tatuenda &longs;it Axi cra&longs;&longs;itudo, &longs;ed adeò validus e&longs;&longs;e de­
bet ac firmus, ut ponderis gravitati ob&longs;i&longs;tere po&longs;&longs;it, quin
flectatur, aut di&longs;&longs;iliat; &longs;i enim incurve&longs;ceret, augeretur mo­
vendi difficultas, quia nimirum in conver&longs;ione majorem
ambitum de&longs;criberet, quàm pro ejus &longs;oliditate.

Sed neque
idcircò præter modum cra&longs;&longs;us Axis eligi debet, quia quò
major ille e&longs;t atque cra&longs;&longs;ior, eò major etiam e&longs;t potentiæ
moventis labor, ni&longs;i pariter majus illi addatur Peritro­
chium.

Hinc fit contingere po&longs;&longs;e, ut in attollendo ponde­
re augeatur labor potentiæ circa finem motûs; quia vide­
licet, &longs;i ductarij funis &longs;piræ jam univer&longs;am cylindri faciem
circumplectantur, & &longs;equentes &longs;piræ non cylindro cohæ­
reant, &longs;ed &longs;ubjecto funi, jam intelligitur &longs;emidiameter axis
aucta cra&longs;&longs;itudine funis &longs;ubjecti, ac proinde &longs;ecundus hic
&longs;pirarum ordo majorem funis longitudinem exigit, adeóque
etiam infert majorem ponderis motum, quo tempore poten­
tia motum non majorem perficit: quare diminutâ Ratione mo­
tûs potentiæ ad motum ponderis, minora fiunt illius momenta
ad attollendum pondus.

Porrò non e&longs;t omnino nece&longs;&longs;e, ut ad pondus attollendum
Axis &longs;tatuatur in &longs;uperiore loco, &longs;ed fieri pote&longs;t, ut longè al­
tiùs elevetur pondus &longs;upra locum Axis; &longs;i nimirum funis
ductarius tran&longs;eat per orbiculum &longs;uperiùs firmatum: Ve­
rùm ita firmiter &longs;tabilienda e&longs;t machina, ut hæc à nimiâ
ponderis gravitate non rapiatur &longs;ur&longs;um.

Cæterùm cùm fu­
nis immediatè nectitur ponderi inferiùs po&longs;ito, ip&longs;a ponde­
ris gravitas &longs;tabilit machinam &longs;uis fulcris in&longs;i&longs;tentem &longs;olo.

Hactenus quidem Axem rectum, prout magis communiter
u&longs;urpatur, &longs;tatuimus; pro opportunitate tamen adhiberi etiam
pote&longs;t curvatus.

Quemadmodum &longs;i ex profluente aquam &longs;ur­
&longs;um antliâ propellere velimus, rotæ BC congruis prunis
in&longs;tructæ, in quas aqua incurrens vim &longs;uam exerceat, addi­
tur cra&longs;&longs;ior ferreus &longs;tylus centro A infixus, curvatú&longs;que
ADEFGHIK (&longs;i IK &longs;it alter polus, cui machina incum-
bit, nam &longs;i fulcrum &longs;it propè A inter A & D, &longs;ufficit &longs;i in H
terminetur) ita ut ip&longs;i DE
æqualis &longs;it particula HI, utri­
u&longs;que autem dupla FG, atque
inter EF & GH annulo in&longs;e­
ritur ha&longs;ta adnexa embolo, ita
ut dum alter embolus attolli­
tur, alter deprimatur.

Hìc
attendenda e&longs;t Ratio &longs;emidia­
metri rotæ, &longs;eu di&longs;tantiæ poten­
tiæ à centro, ad DE, quæ e&longs;t
&longs;emidiameter cylindri, qui ex
ejus convolutione gignitur;
perinde atque &longs;i e&longs;&longs;et cylin­
drus, cujus tota diameter e&longs;&longs;et
FG: atque ideo non ex ip&longs;ius
ferrei &longs;tyli cra&longs;&longs;itudine, &longs;ed ex flexu æ&longs;timanda e&longs;t Axis &longs;e­
midiameter; eatenus quippe cra&longs;&longs;ior, aut exilis ferreus &longs;tylus
eligitur, quatenus majore aut minore vi opus e&longs;t in attollendo
atque deprimendo embolo.
CAPUT II.
Succulæ & Ergatæ u&longs;us con&longs;ideratur.

PEritrochij u&longs;us quidem frequens e&longs;t, &longs;ed & &longs;æpiùs &longs;ine rotâ
idem præ&longs;tatur, vel addito Axi manubrio, vel Radiis Axi in­
fixis; & machina Latinis Succula dicitur; parvulus autem paxil­
lus, cui funis ductarij caput adnectitur, Porculus nominatur: Si
tamen paxilli loco annulum cylindro adnectas, cui funis caput
in&longs;ertum firmetur, perinde e&longs;t.

Hu­
ju&longs;modi e&longs;t cylindrus AB &longs;uis polis
in&longs;i&longs;tens congruo pegmati, infixo&longs;­
que habens Radios CD, EF; quibus
manu arreptis cylindrus volvitur, &
funis adnexus paxillo I circumduci­
tur cylindro, atque connexum in H
onus attollitur.

Dupliciter autem
&longs;ucculâ uti licet, aut Radiis perpetuò infixis, aut qui cylindri
foraminibus dum ver&longs;atur, &longs;ubinde in&longs;erantur: Si perpetuò in­
fixi maneant, unus pote&longs;t Axem convertere alio po&longs;t alium Ra­
dio arrepto: at verò &longs;i idem Radius in aliud atque aliud fora­
men immittendus &longs;it, duo &longs;int, oportet, qui alternâ operâ &longs;uum
Radium deprimentes Axem convolvant; alioquin, ni&longs;i artificio
aliquo retineatur, dum ex uno foramine extrahitur Radius, ut
in aliud immittatur, pondus &longs;uâ gravitate deor&longs;um relaberetur.

Licet tamen hanc duplicis potentiæ nece&longs;&longs;itatem utilitate aliâ
compen&longs;are; ubi enim duo &longs;int, quorum vici&longs;&longs;itudine circum­
agatur Axis immi&longs;&longs;itio huju&longs;modi Radio, hic pote&longs;t e&longs;&longs;e multo
longior, quàm &longs;i eidem Axi infixus maneret; oporteret &longs;iqui­
dem plures Radios perpetuò manentes infigere; id quod, &longs;i lon­
giores e&longs;&longs;ent, non careret incommodo.

Quo autem longior
Radius fuerit, eò pariter faciliùs potentia movebit, quippe quæ
motum multò velociorem motu ponderis habebit, pro Ratione
longitudinis Radij plus &longs;emidiametro cylindri, ad eandem cy­
lindri &longs;emidiametrum.

Ad hoc forta&longs;&longs;e genus revocari po&longs;&longs;unt Scytalæ oneribus
promovendis &longs;ubjectæ, de quibus dictum e&longs;t lib.
2. cap.9; cùm
harum capitibus aptè perforatis immittuntur ferrei aut lignei
vectes, quorum ope &longs;cytalæ ip&longs;æ convertuntur, atque incum­
bens onus dum ad aliam atque aliam orbitæ partem accommo­
datur, promovetur.

Quo enim longioribus vectibus utimur,
potentia circa cylindri centrum multò velociùs movetur
quàm impo&longs;itum &longs;axum, cujus motus æqualis e&longs;t conver&longs;ioni
peripheriæ.

Nam quod motus ab&longs;olutè &longs;umptus &longs;it aliquantulo
major, quia centrum ip&longs;um promovetur, nihil refert, quia
motus hic & cylindro &longs;ubjecto, & oneri, & Potentiæ commu­
nis e&longs;t.

Præter Succulam Radiis infixis in&longs;tructam, cuju&longs;modi ea
e&longs;t, quæ ad hauriendas è puteis aquas vulgò u&longs;urpatur (quam­
quam ob radiorum brevitatem & ip&longs;ius Axis cra&longs;&longs;itudinem non
admodum potentiæ momenta augeantur) forma alia cæmenta­
riis maximè familiaris e&longs;t ad attollenda &longs;axa, lateres, & calcem,
duplici manubrio in oppo&longs;itas partes di&longs;po&longs;ito, ut quædam co­
natuum con&longs;tans &longs;imilitudo &longs;ervetur, dum altero &longs;uum manu­
brium deprimente, &longs;uum alter elevat: cùm enim vi brachio
deor&longs;um connitentium facilior contingat depre&longs;&longs;io, quàm ele­
vatio, &longs;i manubriorum inflexio ad eandem partem collocaretur,
uterque &longs;imul deprimendo faciliùs axem converteret, at
uterque &longs;imul elevans aliquid amplius laboris &longs;ubiret; alternis
autem elevationibus atque depre&longs;&longs;ionibus labor temperatur.

Cæterum quod ad potentiæ momenta attinet, parum intere&longs;t,
quam po&longs;itionem manubria habeant vici&longs;&longs;im comparata;
&longs;pectatur videlicet &longs;ingulorum longitudo & cuju&longs;modi motum
potentia manubrio applicata de&longs;cribat: Sic manubrij longitu­
do GH, hoc e&longs;t potentiæ apprehen­
dentis HO di&longs;tantia perpendicula­
ris ab axe cylindri, qui convolvitur,
attendenda e&longs;t, & cùm ip&longs;ius cylin­
dri, &longs;emidiametro comparanda, ut
Ratio motûs Potentiæ ad ponderis
motum innote&longs;cat, ac proinde Po­
tentiæ momentum de&longs;iniatur.

Hinc apparet pro ip&longs;ius GH longitudine ad cylindri axem
productum perpendiculari augeri momenta potentiæ; perinde
namque &longs;e habet, ac &longs;i infixus e&longs;&longs;et cylindro Radius KI ip&longs;i
GH æqualis; quia ut KI ad KE &longs;emidiametrum, ita GH ad
KE, & ambitus à potentia in H de&longs;criptus ad eju&longs;dem cylin­
dri ambitum.

Quare non leviter allucinantur, qui manubrij
longitudinem GH non rectam, &longs;ed in hemicyclum curvatam
volunt qua&longs;i hinc plus aliquid momenti potentiæ conferretur;
quamvis enim circuli &longs;emiperipheria &longs;it &longs;altem diametri &longs;e&longs;quial­
tera, potentiæ applicatæ motui non &longs;emiperipheria, &longs;ed diame­
ter legem &longs;tatuit: alioquin &longs;i ex ip&longs;a manubrij inflexione mo­
menta augerentur, &longs;atius e&longs;&longs;et non tantùm &longs;emiperipheriæ, &longs;ed
majori circuli &longs;egmento &longs;imile e&longs;&longs;e manubrium; id quod &longs;i expe­
riri voluerint, tantum abe&longs;t, ut movendi facilitatem acquirant, ut
potiùs momenta minui &longs;entiant; nam in circulo maximam lineam
e&longs;&longs;e diametrum, & quò majorum &longs;egmentorum arcus majores fiunt,
minui &longs;ubten&longs;as chordas, ex 15. lib.3. nôrunt ip&longs;i Elementarij.

Hac igitur manubrij longitudine perpensâ, non &longs;olùm non
e&longs;t eorum æqualitas religiosè &longs;ervanda, verùm author e&longs;&longs;em
cætementariis, ut manubriorum alterum paulò longius con&longs;ti­
tuerent; cùm enim ut plurimum inæquales &longs;int operarum vi-
res, &longs;i æqualia &longs;int manubria, qui infirmior e&longs;t, plus &longs;ubit
laboris, quàm ferre po&longs;&longs;it: at &longs;i alterum paulo longius &longs;it, de­
biliorem illi applicari oportebit, ut minore incommodo præ­
&longs;criptum opus perficiat.

Quòd &longs;i contingat ab unico homine
convertendam e&longs;&longs;e &longs;ucculam, non erit contemnendum laboris
compendium, &longs;i po&longs;&longs;it longiore manubrio uti.

Quamvis autem nullus &longs;tatuatur finis conver&longs;ioni, quia funis
ductarius &longs;ucculam non circumplectatur, eadem manet Ratio.

Si enim axi polygono in&longs;i&longs;tens catena &longs;ingulis palmaribus, aut
majoribus intervallis adnexos globulos aut di&longs;cos habeat tubo,
per quem tran&longs;eunt, congruentes, qui intra tubum aquam in­
tercipientes dum ex &longs;ucculæ conver&longs;ione attolluntur, aquam pa­
riter elevant, &longs;ecúmque rapiunt, perpetua fieri pote&longs;t conver­
&longs;io; pondus autem, quod movetur, e&longs;t aqua tubum implens.

Ubi aliquorum imperitiam ca&longs;tigare oporteret, qui manubrij
longitudinem (quæ ip&longs;e non &longs;ine in&longs;citiæ admiratione vidi,
narro) minorem &longs;emidiametro axis, cui catena in&longs;i&longs;tit, con&longs;ti­
tuunt, & operarum laborem fru&longs;tra augent, dum minor e&longs;t
potentiæ motus, quàm ponderis.

Quid enim paulo majorem
longitudinem manubrio non tribuunt?

minùs &longs;cilicet laboran­
tes operæ concitatiùs axem volverent, & globuli celeriùs ele­
vati minus aquæ elabi &longs;inerent.

Jam verò ad Ergatam, quæ modicum à &longs;ucculâ differt, tran­
&longs;eamus, cujus u&longs;us poti&longs;&longs;imùm e&longs;t in trahendis oneribus, quan­
quam illâ etiam, adhibitâ videlicet trochleâ, ad onera attollen­
da uti po&longs;&longs;imus, & frequenter utamur.

Quemadmodum autem
in &longs;ucculæ po&longs;itione e&longs;t cylindrus ut plurimùm horizonti pa­
rallelus, ita in Ergatâ &longs;tatuitur horizonti perpendicularis.

Cy­
lindro enim DC ita fir­
mato, ut vel circa extre­
mos polos, vel in locula­
mento congruo converti
po&longs;&longs;it, additur vectis GEF
(aut etiam plures vectes
eidem cylindro infigun­
tur) cui applicata Poten­
tia dum cylindrum circa
&longs;uum axem ver&longs;at, fu-
nemque convolvit, adnexam &longs;arcinam adducit.

Æ&longs;timatur au­
tem potentiæ momentum ex eju&longs;dem Potentiæ di&longs;tantiâ ab axe
cylindri, comparata cum ip&longs;ius cylindri &longs;emidiametro: quan­
tus nimirum funis cylindrum circumplectitur, tantus e&longs;t one­
ris adducti motus, qui ad potentiæ motum eam habet Ratio­
nem, quæ inter cylindri ambitum circularem, & peripheriam
Radio EF, aut EG, de&longs;criptam intercedit.

Cum verò huju&longs;­
modi vecti EF tanta tribui po&longs;&longs;it longitudo, quantam ferre po&longs;­
&longs;it &longs;patium; in quo Potentia movetur, patet longiore vecte mo­
mentum potentiæ pro arbitratu augeri po&longs;&longs;e.

Verum quidem
e&longs;t plures potentias eidem vecti EE applicatas inæqualia ha­
bere momenta pro Ratione inæqualium di&longs;tantiarum ab axe
cylindri.

Sed illud maximè commodum accidit in Ergatâ, quod hìc
jumentorum ope hominum laborem minuere licet, dum illa
extremo vecti alligata, & in gyrum acta cylindrum convolvunt;
à quibus tamen &longs;ub&longs;idium petere in &longs;ucculæ convolutione non
po&longs;&longs;umus; ni&longs;i fortè cylindrum horizontalem Verticali peritro­
chio in&longs;eramus, & extremam cra&longs;&longs;ioris peritrochij orbitam fu­
nis circumplectatur; qui dum jumento trahente evolvitur, co­
gat cylindrum converti, funémque, cui &longs;arcina adnectitur, cir­
ca cylindri orbitam convolutum attollere pondus.

Id quod
etiam præ&longs;tare valemus, &longs;i
trahendum &longs;it onus, ne­
que in locum inducere li­
ceat jumentum: nam per­
pendiculari cylindro HI
peritrochium, &longs;eu tympa­
num LM horizonti paral­
lelum circumponitur, &
pluribus &longs;piris tympano cir­
cumducitur funis, quem
in O jumentum trahens
quamvis procul po&longs;itum
explicat, atque cylindrum
convertit, ac propterea
onus in N adnexum ad­
ducit.

Porrò in funis ductarij circumvolutione circa &longs;ucculæ aut
Ergatæ cylindrum ob&longs;ervandum e&longs;t, non e&longs;&longs;e nece&longs;&longs;e totum
funem circumvolvi, illique adnecti; nimis enim multus ali­
quando e&longs;&longs;et, & non leve afferret incommodum; ut &longs;atis
con&longs;tat, cùm &longs;olvendæ &longs;unt anchoræ, &longs;i cra&longs;&longs;um illum ruden­
tem totum cylindro circumduci opus e&longs;&longs;et, ut anchora è maris
fundo extrahatur.

Satis igitur e&longs;t, &longs;i funis duplici aut triplici
&longs;pirâ cylindrum circumplectatur, quando ingentia pondera
movenda &longs;unt; hæc &longs;iquidem valdè re&longs;i&longs;tunt, & ita funis circa
ip&longs;um cylindrum con&longs;tringitur, ut illum validè premat, nec fa­
cilè po&longs;&longs;it excurrere, maximè &longs;i cylindrus non fuerit exqui&longs;itè
tornatus; nimius &longs;cilicet partium &longs;e &longs;e mutuo contingentium
affrictus, qui cum cylindri &longs;uperficie fieri deberet, perinde re­
&longs;i&longs;tit, atque &longs;i funis paxillo aut annulo e&longs;&longs;et idem cylindro ad­
nexus.

Quare &longs;atis fuerit, &longs;i puer funem in conver&longs;ione expli­
catum colligat.

Ex dictis tùm hoc, tùm &longs;uperiori capite, &longs;atis con&longs;tat, quæ­
nam longitudo &longs;tatuenda &longs;it Radio, cui potentia data applican­
da e&longs;t, &longs;i pariter cylindri &longs;emidiameter, & oneris gravitas detur.

Nam &longs;i fiat ut data Potentia ad datam ponderis gravitatem, ita
data cylindri &longs;emidiameter ad quæ&longs;itam Radij longitudinem,
habetur longitudo &longs;ufficiens ad &longs;u&longs;tinendum pondus in aëre
&longs;u&longs;pen&longs;um.

Quare pro arbitratu augeatur longitudo Radij, &,
cùm facta jam &longs;it major Ratio motûs potentiæ ad motum pon­
deris, quàm &longs;it Ratio gravitatis ponderis ad virtutem potentiæ
&longs;u&longs;tinentis, illa poterit propo&longs;itum pondus movere.

Sic quo­
niam in navibus ad proram jacet horizonti parallelus ver&longs;atilis
cylindrus (aut potiùs hexagonum &longs;eu octogonum pri&longs;ma) cu­
jus extremitas decre&longs;centibus crenis denticulata incumbentem
ligneam regulam &longs;ingulis &longs;ubinde crenis excipit, ne ponderis
vi in contrariam partem retroagi valeat, & cylindro circumdu­
citur rudens (Pi&longs;ma ab aliquibus dicitur) ex quo anchora pen­
det; nec habere pote&longs;t plures Radios perpetuò adnexos, quos
videlicet &longs;patij angu&longs;tiæ ferre non po&longs;&longs;ent, ideò foramina quæ­
dam habet, quibus, ubi opus fuerit, in&longs;eruntur vectes.

Ut
vectium longitudo &longs;tatuatur, anchoræ gravitas cum adjecto
ligneo tran&longs;ver&longs;ario con&longs;ideranda e&longs;t, quæ e&longs;t ferè &longs;ub trecen­
tupla gravitatis navis vacuæ, ut con&longs;tat ex iis, quæ lib.4.cap.17.
innuimus.

Navis autem capacitas (hoc e&longs;t pondus, quod
navis ge&longs;tare valet, & æquale e&longs;t gravitati navis in aëre)
vel per dolia, &longs;eu amphoras aquæ, quam &longs;ine incommodo
ferre pote&longs;t, numeratur, ut &longs;olent Galli & Angli &longs;ingulis do­
liis navalibus libras bis mille tribuentes, vel per pondera,
quæ Hollandis atque Germanis La&longs;t dicuntur, &longs;ingula li­
brarum &longs;altem quatuor millibus definita (nam La&longs;t Ham­
burgi continet libras 4554, Am&longs;telodami, &longs;i &longs;it triticum
habet lib.
4800, &longs;in autem &longs;iligo lib.
4200, Stevinus verò
lib.
3. &longs;taticæ pop.

10 &longs;ingulos modios definit lib.
360) &
&longs;ingulis libris unciæ &longs;exdecim, &longs;eu Lotones 32, hoc e&longs;t &longs;e­
munciæ tribuendæ &longs;unt.

CAPUT III.

Tympani à calcante circumacti vires
expenduntur.

TYmpana, quæ Græcis geranoi, Latinis retentâ vocabuli in­
terpretatione Grues dicuntur, hoc differunt à Succulâ,
quòd ab hominibus non brachiorum contentione, &longs;ed cor­
poris calcantis gravitate moventur.

Horum autem frequen­
ti&longs;&longs;imus e&longs;t u&longs;us tum in Hollandiâ tùm in Germaniâ juxta
fluvios navigabiles, ut ingentia pondera è navibus extra­
hant, & in ripa deponant: quamquam & ad alios u&longs;us fa-
cilè traduci po&longs;&longs;int, &longs;i apto loco collocentur.

Cylindro AB
ver&longs;atili, & horizon­
ti parallelo; ac ritè
firmato, ampliorem
rotæ peripheriam
CDE circumponi­
mus ex latioribus a&longs;­
&longs;eribus compactam,
ut unus &longs;altem ho­
mo ingredi valeat;
qui dum ex C in D
a&longs;cendere conatur, &longs;ua gravitate deprimens tympanum, cy­
lindrum pariter convertit, ductariúmque funem convolvit,
qui per orbiculos F & G &longs;uperiori trabi exporrectæ connexos
tran&longs;iens, cum onere in P connectitur, atque adeò ex Cylin­
dri conver&longs;ione attollitur pondus, etiam&longs;i à machinâ ip&longs;a ab­
&longs;it, quantum trabs exporrigitur.

Si placuerit eidem cylindro
duplex tympanum, aut unicum valdè amplum apponere, lice­
bit, ut plurium hominum operâ in elevando onere uti po&longs;­
&longs;imus.

Machinæ hujus vires eò majores e&longs;&longs;e, quò major e&longs;t &longs;emi­
diametri rotæ ad cylindri &longs;emidiametrum Ratio, &longs;atis mani­
fe&longs;tum e&longs;t ex iis, quæ &longs;æpi&longs;&longs;imè dicta &longs;unt; major e&longs;t enim
potentiæ motus, quò amplior e&longs;t rota.

Cavendum tamen ne,
quemadmodum in &longs;ucculâ atque Ergatâ, ita etiam hìc omnino
ex ip&longs;a &longs;emidiametrorum rotæ & Cylindri Ratione definiantur
potentiæ momenta: hìc &longs;cilicet potentia tympanum movens e&longs;t
in&longs;ita homini gravitas deor&longs;um connitens; in &longs;ucculâ autem
atque in Ergatâ potentia movens e&longs;t impul&longs;us ab animali facul­
tate impre&longs;&longs;us, ac in gyrum directis.

Quapropter in &longs;ucculâ, at­
que in Ergatâ cùm eadem &longs;it potentiæ directio &longs;imiliter appli­
catæ in quocumque &longs;itu, eadem manent in conver&longs;ione poten­
tiæ momenta: at hominis tympanum calcantis non eædem &longs;em­
per &longs;unt vires, &longs;ed quo magis a&longs;cendit versùs D, augentur ejus
momenta; quia videlicet perinde e&longs;t, atque &longs;i à centro ad
punctum orbitæ, in quo e&longs;t gravitas calcans, ducta e&longs;&longs;et linea;
ibi enim momentum de&longs;cendendi e&longs;t ut Sinus declinationis à
perpendiculo, juxta dicta lib.1.cap.15.

Sit enim rotæ CHG &longs;emidiameter EB, cylindri verò &longs;e­
midiameter EO.

Si homo
tympanum ingre&longs;&longs;us con­
&longs;i&longs;tat in infimo loco H, in
quem &longs;cilicet cadit per­
pendiculum EH, utique
machinam non movet, à
qua ip&longs;e &longs;u&longs;tinetur: Simi­
liter &longs;i funi, OC per &longs;upe­
rioris trabis orbiculos tran­
&longs;iens fuerit intentus, etiam­
&longs;i ex H a&longs;cendat in D, in
quod punctum cadit recta
CO cylindrum tangens,
non movetur pondus, quod ex hypothe&longs;i excedit gravitatem
hominis tympanum calcantis: quia nimirum in D homo ra­
tione po&longs;itionis non habet de&longs;cendendi momenta majora,
quàm &longs;it &longs;emidiameter OE, quæ pariter &longs;unt momenta one­
ris funi OC adnexi: Cùm autem ratione po&longs;itionis momen­
ta ponderis atque potentiæ æqualia &longs;int, &longs;ed ratione gravita­
tis potentia infirmior &longs;it ex hypothe&longs;i quàm pondus, illa uti­
que elevare pondus non valebit.

Procedet igitur a&longs;cenden­
do ex.

gr. u&longs;que ad I, ubi obtinebit momenta ut VE (hoc
e&longs;t IK &longs;inus anguli declinationis IEH) ad momenta one­
ris ut OE, adeò ut quæ Ratio e&longs;t VE ad OE, eadem &longs;it
Ratio gravitatis oneris ad gravitatem hominis; ac proinde
a&longs;cendentis ex I in G momenta augebuntur, & in G erunt
ut SE.

Cùm ergo SE ad OE Ratio major &longs;it quàm VE
ad OE, hoc e&longs;t gravitatis oneris ad gravitatem hominis,
jam prævalet potentia, & tympanum convertitur, de&longs;cen­
dítque illius punctum G in locum, ubi erat punctum I, in
quo fit con&longs;i&longs;tentia & quoddam æquilibrium &longs;u&longs;tentando
pondus, quod ut porrò moveatur, pergendum e&longs;t in per­
currendâ tympani orbitâ.

Numquam igitur ratione po&longs;itio­
nis potentiæ momentum e&longs;t ut &longs;emidiameter rotæ, ni&longs;i ho­
mo ita a&longs;cenderet, ut ejus centrum gravitatis re&longs;ponderet
puncto B; ex momento enim, quod potentia obtineret in
B, demendum e&longs;t, quantum ab ip&longs;o centro retrahitur: in G
autem retrahitur juxta men&longs;uram BS, & in I juxta men&longs;uram
BV, ac propterea ibi momentum remanet ut SE, hìc ut VE.

Perinde autem &longs;e habere momentum in G ad pondus, atque &longs;i
e&longs;&longs;et libra curva GEF, & ab alterâ extremitate F diametri cy­
lindri, duceretur recta FG &longs;ecans in R perpendicularem EH,
manife&longs;tum e&longs;t, quia ex 2. lib.
6. ut SE ad EF, hoc e&longs;t OE,
ita GR ad RF.

Quòd &longs;i tympani orbitam limbus hinc & hinc
ambiat, cui teretes paxilli in&longs;erti veluti gradus &longs;calas con&longs;ti­
tuant, quibus homo non &longs;olùm in&longs;i&longs;tat pedibus, &longs;ed quos etiam
manibus apprehendat; ob&longs;ervare oportet, pedibu&longs;ne tantum
premat &longs;ubjectum tympanum, an ex manibus qua&longs;i &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;us
pendeat.

Nam &longs;i in eodem perpendiculo non &longs;int paxillus, cui
in&longs;i&longs;tit, & is ex quo dependet, valde di&longs;paria &longs;unt momenta.

Si
verò non planè rectum &longs;it corpus, &longs;ed qua&longs;i procumbens incli­
netur, tunc potentiæ locus definitur à perpendiculo tran&longs;eunte
per centrum gravitatis ip&longs;ius hominis.

Id quod dicendum pari­
ter, quando tympano includitur canis (nam & à cane ingens
tympanum ver&longs;ari vidi, quo in Solarium attollebatur non me­
diocris ci&longs;ta linteis recens ablutis plena) cujus gravitatis cen­
trum &longs;pectandum e&longs;t, ejú&longs;que di&longs;tantia à perpendiculo tran­
&longs;eunte per tympani centrum.

Hinc &longs;i ex navi aliæ atque aliæ &longs;arcinæ hac machinâ extrahan­
tur, is qui tympanum ver&longs;at, etiam&longs;i omnino non videat onus ex­
tra machinæ domunculam po&longs;itum, facilè pronuntiabit major­
ne?

an minor &longs;it &longs;ecundæ &longs;arcinæ gravitas comparata cum prio­
re: quò enim magis a&longs;cendere cogitur in tympano, eò major e&longs;t
oneris gravitas; quærenda nimirum &longs;unt momenta majora ex
po&longs;itione, ut majore intervallo ab&longs;it à perpendiculo EH tran­
&longs;eunte per E centrum.

Simili ratione, &longs;i inter duos homines
quæ&longs;tio oriatur uter illorum gravior &longs;it, facilè litem dirimes, &longs;i
alter po&longs;t alterum ingrediatur tympanum, ut idem onus attollat;
qui enim magis a&longs;cendere cogitur, minus habet gravitatis, ideò­
que majora momenta quærit ex po&longs;itione.

Quanta autem &longs;it one­
ris gravitas, digno&longs;cetur ex artificio &longs;tatim indicando.

Unum hìc
qua&longs;i per anticipationem addendum, quod ad funem ductarium
&longs;pectat; præ&longs;tat &longs;cilicet ejus extremitatem unco extremæ trabi
infixo adnecti, & per orbiculum cum onere conjunctum tran&longs;i­
re, atque hinc per orbiculos G & F ad cylindrum deduci: hac
enim ratione attollendi facilitas geminatur, ut clariùs patebit ex
iis, quæ &longs;equenti libro de Trochleâ dicentur.

Ut igitur innote&longs;cat, quanta &longs;it proximè oneris gravitas ob­
&longs;ervandus e&longs;t in tympano locus, ubi homo illud calcans facit
cum pondere æquilibrium: quando &longs;cilicet eò venerit, ut paulo
altiùs a&longs;cendens incipiat attollere pondus.

Quoniam verò hu­
ju&longs;modi pondera ea &longs;unt, ut in iis exiguæ differentiæ contem
nantur, exqui&longs;ita quædam accuratio omnino &longs;upervacanea e&longs;­
&longs;et, &longs;i &longs;ingulas, aut pauculas libras ad calculos revocandas e&longs;&longs;e
cen&longs;eremus, cum &longs;æpè non ni&longs;i per centenas libras eorum gra­
vitas definiatur.

Primùm ex centro E in ipsâ limbi cra&longs;&longs;itudine
de&longs;cribatur circuli peripheria BCH: id quod facilè fiet funi­
culo extento, & axem FRO complectente; quo funiculo cir­
cumducto &longs;tylus in extremitate colligatus de&longs;cribet peripheriam.

Deinde &longs;i nota non &longs;it accurata &longs;emidiametri men&longs;ura, quæ
peripheriæ &longs;extantem accipiat, punctum unum, quod placuerit,
&longs;tatue, ex quo peripheriam in partes aliquotas (qua&longs;cumque
tandem opportunitas dederit) dividere incipias: nam per nu­
merum partium divi&longs;is gradibus 360, &longs;tatim patebit, quot gra­
dus &longs;ingulæ partes contineant, quas aliquotas a&longs;&longs;ump&longs;i&longs;ti.

Par­
tem igitur unam in gradus &longs;ibi congruentes tribue; eorum enim
men&longs;ura in con&longs;equentem arcum tran&longs;lata, quoties oportuerit,
demùm integrum Quadrantem in gradus 90 divi&longs;um dabit.

Po­
namus commodam accidi&longs;&longs;e divi&longs;ionem peripheriæ in partes 15:
divi&longs;is gr. 360 per 15, quotiens 24 indicat numerum graduum
parti decimæ quintæ tribuendorum.

Quare partem unam bifa­
riam divide, & intervallum gr. 12 inter punctum divi&longs;ionis &
a&longs;&longs;umptum punctum, ex quo divi&longs;io incipit, iterum divide bifa­
riam, ut parti uni cedant gradus 6: his iterum bifariam divi&longs;is,

in tres æquales partes di&longs;tribue, & &longs;ingulorum graduum men­
&longs;ura manife&longs;ta e&longs;t.

Acceptis itaque tribus partibus decimis
quintis addantur gradus 18, & habebitur integer peripheriæ
Quadrans in gradus 90 di&longs;tributus, qui adeò notabiles erunt,
ut etiam gradûs partes, cuju&longs;modi e&longs;t &longs;emi&longs;&longs;is, triens, & qua­
drans &longs;atis clarè digno&longs;ci queant.
Tertiò.

Quia non arcus HG, &longs;ed &longs;emidiametri pars ES con­
&longs;ideratur, ut dictum e&longs;t, concipe &longs;emidiametrum EB in partes

Igitur ex
Canone Sinuum exquire arcum &longs;ingulis partibus, incipiendo à

ut &longs;tatim appareat, quo loco intelli­
gatur po&longs;ita potentia &longs;ive in &longs;emi&longs;&longs;e, &longs;ive in triente, &longs;ive in qua­
drante &longs;emidiametri, &longs;ive in eju&longs;dem be&longs;&longs;e aut dodrante &c.

Factâ &longs;iquidem comparatione inter di&longs;tantiam potentiæ ` cen­

Ponamus itaque tympani &longs;emi­
diametrum di&longs;tinctam in partes 10, ita ut Axis &longs;emidiameter

tamen opere pror&longs;us inutilis accideret tam exqui&longs;ita accuratio:

Quartò.

Funiculum Axi in&longs;i&longs;tentem, & facilè excurrentem
ita di&longs;pone, ut plumbeus globus in ejus extremitate pendulus
intendat funiculum ip&longs;um, qui in tympani limbo de&longs;ignet
punctum, per quod tran&longs;it linea perpendicularis ab Axis cen­
tro in horizontem de&longs;cendens.

Tum ab hoc puncto u&longs;que ad
punctum, ubi fit æquilibrium, &longs;umatur intervallum, atque
transferatur in Quadrantem gradibus di&longs;tinctum: Nam
punctum, in quod ab initio Quadrantis cadit altera ob&longs;ervati
intervalli extremitas, indicabit notâ in limbo prænotatâ, quotâ
&longs;emidiametri parte di&longs;tet à tympani centro gravitas calcans
ip&longs;um tympanum, ex.

gr. 3/5 aut 4/7. Cum igitur jam innotuerit
Ratio &longs;emidiametri Axis ad &longs;emidiametrum tympani, &longs;cilicet
ex hypothe&longs;i (1/10), fiat ut fractio index Rationis &longs;emidiametro­
rum, ad fractionem in limbo notatam, ita gravitas calcantis
tympanum ad gravitatem ponderis, cum quo facit æquilibrium,
videlicet ut (1/10) ad 3/5, ita gravitas hominis, puta lib.
250, ad gra­
vitatem oneris lib.
1500. Hinc patet in puncto D, per quod
tran&longs;it linea OD tangens Axem & parallela perpendiculari
EH ex centro demi&longs;&longs;æ, æquilibrium e&longs;&longs;e inter gravitates om­
nino æquales, ac proinde minimum pondus e&longs;&longs;e æquale gravi­
tati hominis calcantis: Nam &longs;i inter H & D fieret æquilibrium,
pondus levius e&longs;&longs;et quàm homo, & communi &longs;taterá facile po­
tes a&longs;&longs;equi illius gravitatem.

Maximum autem pondus e&longs;t il­
lud, quod indicat &longs;emidiameter tympani ad &longs;emidiametrum
Axis, homine nimirum &longs;uæ gravitatis vires exercente in B, ac
propterea gravitas ponderis ad gravitatem hominis in B e&longs;&longs;et
ex.
gr. in Ratione decuplâ.

Illud tamen hìc perpende, quòd, &longs;i homo calcans in B, aut
indè pendens, non volvit Axem, atque adeò non attollit pon­
dus adnexum, non con&longs;tat, an &longs;it æquilibrium, idem enim ac­
cideret etiam, &longs;i pondus e&longs;&longs;et multò majus; ac proinde neque
con&longs;tat de eju&longs;dem ponderis gravitate ni&longs;i hoc, quod &longs;it ut mi­
nimum decupla gravitatis hominis; quia nimirum nunquam il-
lud movebit; nam a&longs;cendens homo ex B versùs C minora &longs;em­
per obtinet momenta, quàm in B.

Hoc autem ubi contigerit,
& velis exploratam habere oneris gravitatem, a&longs;&longs;ume pondus
aliquod notæ gravitatis, quod adnectere valeas oræ tympani
aut in B, aut eo loco, ut deinde homo calcans infra B, attollat
pondus: ubi enim demum fiat æquilibrium, duplex in&longs;titue ra­
tiocinium, alterum quidem ratione hominis, alterum verò ra­
tione gravitatis additæ: inventi &longs;iquidem termini &longs;imul additi
indicabunt quæ&longs;itam oneris gravitatem.

Sic &longs;i a&longs;&longs;umptum pon­
dus &longs;it lib.36, & homo calcans &longs;it lib.
250, fiat autem æquili­
brium homine exi&longs;tente in X, pondere verò in G; &longs;umptis in­
tervallis XH & GH, atque tran&longs;latis in Quadrantem invenia­
tur pro homine (9/10), & pro pondere 4/5. Fiat primò ut (1/10) ad (9/10), ita
lib.
250 ad lib.
2250: deinde ut (1/10) ad 4/5, ita lib.36 ad lib.
288:
igitur &longs;umma lib.
2538 indicat ponderis gravitatem.

Quòd &longs;i
funis ductarij extremitas &longs;it adnexa extremæ trabi, ut indica­
tum e&longs;t, atque tran&longs;eat per orbiculum ponderi conjunctum,
inventus numerus lib.2538 duplicandus e&longs;t & &longs;unt lib.5076.

Ex his forta&longs;&longs;e alicui placeat &longs;tateræ L M vires augere addi­
to tympano huju&longs;modi EB ut &longs;upra prænotato.

Nam firmatâ
in &longs;uperiore loco &longs;taterâ
LM, cujus an&longs;a &longs;it in N,
primùm ob&longs;ervetur, quan­
tum ponderis requiratur
in M, ut fiat æquilibrium
cum &longs;olo brachio NL;
hæc enim gravitas &longs;emper
addenda erit gravitati, quæ
invenietur ex ratiocina­
tione, qua componuntur
Rationes &longs;tateræ & tym­
pani.

Deinde in tympani
limbo notetur punctum C,
cui congruit funis OL, quando &longs;tatera e&longs;t horizonti parallela;
ut hinc digno&longs;catur, quo in loco tympani, dum convertitur,
contingat æquilibrium.

Demum cùm nota &longs;it Ratio MN ad
NL, componatur cum Ratione &longs;emidiametri Axis ad partem
&longs;emidiametri tympani, ex.

gr. EO ad ES; & habetur Ratio
gravitatis hominis tympanum calcantis ad gravitatem oneris,
quod in M expenditur.

Sit EO ad ES ut (1/10) ad 4/5, & MN ad
NL ut 2 ad 25; Ratio compo&longs;ita e&longs;t ut 1/5 ad 20, hoc e&longs;t ut 1 ad
100. Igitur pondus in M expen&longs;um e&longs;t, ut minimum, centu­
plum gravitatis hominis; nam addenda præterea e&longs;t gravitas
re&longs;pondens gravitati brachij LN longioris ip&longs;ius &longs;tateræ.

Si verò neque tympano, quod ab homine intùs calcante
premitur, neque adeò incerto &longs;acomate, cuju&longs;modi e&longs;t varia
hominum gravitas, uti volueris, aut potius non ingentes &longs;arci­
nas, &longs;ed onera mediocria expendere placuerit, paretur CBH
di&longs;cus ligneus parvulum axem habens ad centrum E, & in eo
de&longs;cripta &longs;it peripheria circuli CBH, atque adnotatum
punctum C, per quod funiculus OL tran&longs;it, quando &longs;tateræ
jugum LM e&longs;t horizonti parallelum.

Tum conver&longs;o di&longs;co ita,
ut LO tran&longs;eat per C, dimi&longs;&longs;o perpendiculo in&longs;i&longs;tente Axi,
notetur in peripheria punctum H, per quod tran&longs;it perpendi­
cularis à centro E.

Deinde ex H versùs B a&longs;cendendo acci­
piantur gradus juxta &longs;uperiorem tabellam, affixis notis indici
bus partium, &longs;imiliter ac de tympano dictum e&longs;t.

Demum &longs;a­
coma certæ gravitatis, puta unius aut alterius libræ, ita di&longs;po­
natur, ut per di&longs;ci ambitum ex H versùs B excurrere po&longs;&longs;it, &
cochleâ firmari, ubi æquilibrium contigerit: Aut potiùs &longs;ingu­
lis Quadrantis gradibus, aut &longs;altem punctis partium notatis,
claviculos infige, qui in&longs;eri po&longs;&longs;int annulo &longs;acomatis.

Nota
enim Ratio &longs;emidiametri axis EO ad di&longs;ci &longs;emidiametrum EB
indicabit, quid faciendum &longs;it juxta dicta, ut gravitas ponderis
in M &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;i innote&longs;cat.

At &longs;i volueris Quadrantem HB in
&longs;uos 90 gradus di&longs;tribuere, & uti Canone Sinuum, priùs inno­
te&longs;cat Ratio &longs;emidiametri axis ad Radium in partibus Radij:
deinde fiat ut partes Radij axi congruentes, ad Sinum Rectum
graduum, ubi fit æquilibrium, ita Sacoma appen&longs;um ad gra­
vitatem ponderis, quod expenditur.
CAPUT IV.

An Axis in Peritrochio inveniatur etiam &longs;ine
tractione.

HActenus ductarij funis conver&longs;ionem circa Axem convolu­
tum con&longs;ideravimus, ex quo oritur ponderis fune connexi
tractio: &longs;ed numquid non etiam ad hoc genus machinæ aliquæ
revocari po&longs;&longs;unt, quibus non quidem trahitur pondus, &longs;ed ali­
qua re&longs;i&longs;tentia &longs;uperatur?

Occurrit autem primo loco antiquus &longs;ervorum metus Pi&longs;tri­
num, in quod detru&longs;i frumentum tundere cogebantur molâ
ver&longs;atili, &longs;ive in no&longs;trarum Moletrinarum &longs;peciem ac &longs;imili­
tudinem metam congruo Catillo impo&longs;itam manu truderent, ac
circumagerent, &longs;ive ingentem lapideum di&longs;cum perpendicula­
ri cylindro coagmentatum ver&longs;arent a&longs;ellorum vicarij laborio­
&longs;o muneri &longs;uccedentes, cum Vectis cylindro ad angulos rectos
infixi extremitatem aut traherent, aut propellerent: Cuju&longs;mo­
di machinæ genere nos quoque utimur in frendendis legumi­
nibus, & in contundendis &longs;eminibus, ex quibus demùm oleum
prælo exprimitur.

Et hìc quidem non ip&longs;ius molaris lapidis
gravitatem movendam attendimus, quippe qui ip&longs;ius machinæ
pars e&longs;t; &longs;ed poti&longs;&longs;imum corporis à molâ compre&longs;&longs;i re&longs;i&longs;tentia
con&longs;ideranda e&longs;t, quæ nimirum vincenda proponitur.

Oritur
autem hæc re&longs;i&longs;tentia ex corporis obterendi aut contundendi
duritiæ, in quod incurrit &longs;cabra molæ circumactæ &longs;uperficies;
cum verò illud incumbenti lapidi &longs;e &longs;ubducere non po&longs;&longs;it, à la­
pidis gravitate & potentiæ impetu cogitur di&longs;&longs;ilire in partes.

Quia igitur potentiæ cum machinâ connexæ motum impedit
illa granorum aut nucleorum frangendorum durities, compa­
randa e&longs;t di&longs;tantia potentiæ moventis à centro motûs, cum
di&longs;tantiâ corporis comminuendi; & quò major e&longs;t huju&longs;modi
intervallorum Ratio, majora pariter &longs;unt potentiæ momenta.

Hinc vides, cur in tru&longs;atili mola (quam mediocrem e&longs;&longs;e
oportet, ne nimio labore frangatur molitor in immani &longs;axo ver­
&longs;ando, catillus quidem planus e&longs;t, meta verò, quâ catillum
re&longs;picit, non omnino &longs;ubjecto plano congruit, &longs;ed cavam ob­
tu&longs;i&longs;&longs;imi coni &longs;uperficiem æmulatur: ut &longs;cilicet integra grana
per medium foramen immi&longs;&longs;a inter utrumque lapidem interci­
