piantur non procul à centro, à quo potentia abe&longs;t, comminu­
ta autem peripheriam versùs accedant ad angu&longs;tiora &longs;patia,
quò magis obterantur: cùm enim integra grana magis fractio­
ni ob&longs;i&longs;tant, quàm comminuta, integris frangendis majora de­
bentur potentiæ momenta, comminutis in minu&longs;culas particu­
las redigendi, minores vires &longs;ufficiunt.

In molâ autem A&longs;ina­
riâ ubi lapideus di&longs;cus in plano Verticali con&longs;titutus &longs;ub­
jectum catillum modicè excavatum vix extremo ambitu con­
tingit, eadem ferè e&longs;t &longs;emper di&longs;tantia à centro motûs, ni&longs;i
quatenus ip&longs;ius molæ cra&longs;&longs;itudo partem aliam centro motûs pro­
piorem, aliam remotiorem habet: porrò grana illa, quæ lapi­
dum contactui, vel qua&longs;i contactui, propiora &longs;unt, validiùs te­
runtur, quàm quæ magis ab eodem contactu recedunt: &longs;ed
hoc nihil ad præ&longs;entem di&longs;putationem attinet, ni&longs;i quatenus la­
pidis partes remotiores &longs;ubjecta grana agitantes, atque tunden­
tes cra&longs;&longs;iùs, majorem Rationem ad potentiæ motum habent in
&longs;uâ convolutione, quàm partes eju&longs;dem minùs à centro
remotæ.

Haud di&longs;&longs;imili ratione, &longs;i ex chalybe ellipticum &longs;phæroides
obliquis &longs;triis modicè a&longs;perum, qua&longs;i in limæ &longs;peciem, congruo
loculamento interiùs pariter a&longs;perato includatur, ita tamen, ut
&longs;patium, quo &longs;phæroides à loculamento di&longs;tat, paulatim à lati­
tudine in angu&longs;tias &longs;e &longs;e contrahat; axi verò &longs;phæroidis &longs;upe­
riùs producto addatur manubrium, quo arrepto converti po&longs;­
&longs;it in gyrum; grana piperis, aut &longs;imilia &longs;uperiùs immi&longs;&longs;a levi&longs;­
&longs;imo negotio comminuentur: quorum &longs;cilicet durities &longs;i cum
potentiæ viribus conferatur, re&longs;i&longs;tentiam habet maximam pro
Ratione &longs;emidiametri tran&longs;ver&longs;æ Ellip&longs;is ad manubrij longitu­
dinem: initio autem, quia grana minùs ab axe di&longs;tant, minùs
re&longs;i&longs;tunt, &longs;i cætera fuerint paria, hoc e&longs;t, &longs;i modicè comminu­
torum durities, integrorum duritiei omnino re&longs;pondeat; nam
minor di&longs;tantia à centro motûs minorem habet Rationem,
quàm di&longs;tantia major ad eandem manubrij longitudinem.

Par erit philo&longs;ophandi ratio, &longs;i tympanis non idem centrum
habentibus inclu&longs;a aqua ex interioris tympani conver&longs;ione ad
angu&longs;tias redigatur, atque compre&longs;&longs;a exprimatur ex tubo; cu­
ju&longs;modi forta&longs;&longs;e fuit veterum Hydraconti&longs;terium; de cujus for­
mâ non e&longs;t hìc di&longs;putandi locus; nam manubrij à potentiâ
commoti longitudo comparanda e&longs;t cum di&longs;tantia peripheriæ
tympani aquam comprimentis à centro, circa quod perficitur
motus, ut momentorum Ratio per&longs;pecta &longs;it; aqua &longs;cilicet dum
impellitur, atque exprimitur, re&longs;i&longs;tit.

Ad hæc porrò inver&longs;us quidam Axis in peritrochio u&longs;us con­
&longs;iderandus e&longs;t, quando videlicet potentia non peritrochio, &longs;ed
ip&longs;i Axi, applicatur; id quod tunc poti&longs;&longs;imum contingit, cùm
potentia vitibus abundat, motui autem, qui efficiendus e&longs;t,
non admodum re&longs;i&longs;tit corpus, quod vel modicè impellendum
e&longs;t, vel in orbem circumducendum.

Certum quippe e&longs;t poten­
tiam Axi applicatam tardiùs multò moveri, quàm peritrochij
peripheriam, pro Ratione &longs;emidiametrorum Axis & Peritro­
chij, ac proinde licèt impetus amplioris peripheriæ partibus
impre&longs;&longs;us imbecillior quodammodo &longs;it, ut pote di&longs;tractus, &longs;atis
tamen e&longs;&longs;e ad vincendam levem re&longs;i&longs;tentiam.

Hinc quoniam
ferrum cotis tritu extenuatur, eóque faciliùs, quò celeriùs eos
movetur, qui re&longs;tituunt obtu&longs;as cultorum aut novacularum
acies, lapidem ex cotariâ eductum in di&longs;cum rotundant, ut cir­
ca axem centro infixum ver&longs;atilis circumagi po&longs;&longs;it.

Quamvis
autem non rarò eidem axi cohæreat manubrium, quo circum­
ducto rotatur lapis, ut tamen minori labore adhuc etiam velo­
ciùs rotetur, &longs;apienter in&longs;tituerunt amplioris rotæ ab&longs;idi exca­
vatæ funem in&longs;i&longs;tere, qui rotulam eumdem cum lapide axem
habentem circumplectatur, ut minor hæc rotula amplioris ro­
tæ ductum &longs;equens &longs;ecum pariter rapiat cotem; cujus periphe­
ria, cùm adnexam rotulam valdè excedat, velociùs quoquè
movetur.

Quantùm verò motus hic, celeritate &longs;uâ, potentiæ
motum &longs;uperet, facilè con&longs;tabit, &longs;i motuum &longs;ingulis membris
convenientium ratio ineatur.
Sit ex.

gr. manubrij longitudo
ad amplioris rotæ &longs;emidiametrum &longs;ubquadrupla, hæc autem &longs;e­
midiameter ad rotulæ &longs;emidiametrum &longs;it octupla: demum ro­
tulæ eundem cum cote axem habentis &longs;emidiameter &longs;it &longs;ubtri­
pla &longs;emidiametri ip&longs;ius cotis.

Igitur puncti in cotis peripheriâ
notati motus triplo velocior e&longs;t motu &longs;imilis puncti in rotæ
peripheriâ: rotulæ motum definit funis, qui in convolutione ex­
plicatur, hic enim pariter majoris rotæ motum metitur: octies
ergo rotula, & cum eâ lapis rotatur, dum amplior rota &longs;emel in
gyrum agitur.

Quoniam verò rotæ &longs;emidiameter e&longs;t ad cotis
&longs;emidiametrum ut 8 ad 3 ex hypothe&longs;i, dum punctum in rotæ,
peripheriá notatum movetur velocitate ut 8, &longs;imile punctum
cotis movetur velocitate ut 24. Atqui motus rotæ cum motu
potentiæ manubrio applicatæ comparatus e&longs;t ut 4 ad 1, ex hy­
pothe&longs;i; igitur &longs;i duæ Rationes 1 ad 4, & 8 ad 24 componan­
tur, erit Ratio motus potentiæ ad motum cotis ut 1 ad 12. Sunt
hìc itaque duo Axes in Peritrochiis &longs;uis compo&longs;iti, & Potentia
Axibus applicata intelligitur; cùm enim in Verticali plano lapis
ip&longs;e ver&longs;etur &longs;uper polos læves atque politos, non admodum re­
pugnat motui; impre&longs;&longs;us autem impetus aliquandiu manens
potentiam ip&longs;am juvat.

Simile quiddam ob&longs;ervandum occurrit in horologiorum motu,
quæ in turribus &longs;tatuuntur: nam cylindrum horizonti paralle­
lum circumplicat funis, quo vi ponderis de&longs;cendentis explica­
to, circumagitur rota eidem axi infixa: ex hac in con&longs;equentes
rotas derivatur motus &longs;emper velocior, qui demum temperatur
ex quadam motûs retardati & brevi&longs;&longs;imæ morulæ vici&longs;&longs;itudine,
cum po&longs;tremæ rotæ dentes in &longs;erræ modum conformati fu&longs;um,
cui Tempus adnectitur alternis motibus agunt.

Primùm enim
dens rotæ &longs;uperior in pin­
nulam A incurrens eam
impellit, axémque HL
convertit unà cum tran&longs;­
ver&longs;ario CD & adjunctis
globulis plumbeis E & F,
qui &longs;imilem arcum de&longs;cri­
bunt, ac pinnula A, &longs;ed
longè majorem; propterea
pro ratione gravitatis glo­
bulorum, eorúmque di­
&longs;tantiæ ab axe, HL, etiam
major vis requiritur, adeóque impeditur, ac retardatur motus
rotæ dentatæ, & cum eâ reliquarum rotarum, atque ip&longs;ius pon-
deris, à quo totius machinæ motus initium &longs;umit: qui &longs;i fuerit
ju&longs;to velocior, globuli E & F removentur ab L, &longs;in autem
ju&longs;to tardior, admoventur, ut modò major, modò minor &longs;it re­
&longs;i&longs;tentia.

Deinde quia globuli E & F ex impul&longs;u pinnulæ A
impetum conceperunt ad certam plagam directum, pergerent
illor&longs;um moveri, quamdiu impre&longs;&longs;us impetus per&longs;everaret, ni&longs;i
in eâ conver&longs;ione inferior pinnula B occurreret inferiori denti
rotæ &longs;erratæ: hinc fit vi hujus impetûs brevi&longs;&longs;imam morulam in­
ferri conver&longs;ioni rotæ, quæ eandem pinnulam urgens ip&longs;os quo­
què globulos in contrariam plagam reflectit.

Po&longs;&longs;e autem adeò
exilibus viribus morulam inferri tanto ponderi de&longs;cendenti,
paulò inferiùs manife&longs;tum fiet, ubi de Rotis dentatis in unam
machinam compactis di&longs;&longs;eretur; illud &longs;altem palam e&longs;t, &longs;i mo­
rulam nullam admittas, re&longs;i&longs;tentiam e&longs;&longs;e non &longs;olùm pro gravi­
tate globulorum, eorúmque di&longs;tantiâ, verùm etiam pro ratione
impetûs impre&longs;&longs;i in antecedenti impul&longs;ione.

Quare globuli
iidem quando moventur impulsâ pinnulâ, rationem habent
ponderis peritrochio adnexi, & potentia impellens pinnulæ,
hoc e&longs;t axi, applicatur: Contrà verò ad retardandum, aut tan­
ti&longs;per coërcendum motum ponderis, quod pinnulæ applicatum
intelligitur, iidem globuli vi impetûs &longs;ibi impre&longs;&longs;i rationem ha­
bent potentiæ peritrochio applicatæ.

Quoniam verò hìc horologiorum mentio incidit, cur in illis,
quæ &longs;ecum qui&longs;que ad perpetuum u&longs;um ferre pote&longs;t, catenula
&longs;eu nervus cono, non cylindro, circumducatur, manife&longs;tum
e&longs;t: quia &longs;cilicet chalybea lamella, à qua motûs origo e&longs;t, initio
in &longs;pi&longs;&longs;iorem &longs;piram contracta &longs;uam vim ela&longs;ticam exerens va­
lidiùs conatur &longs;e re&longs;tituere, trahén&longs;que catenulam, &longs;eu ner­
vum FE, totum conum DEC eíque con­
nexam rotulam dentatam AB in gyrum agit;
cum verò illa fuerit in paulò laxiores &longs;piras
explicata, languidiùs conatur, atque catenu­
lam, &longs;eu nervum, trahens jam non propè verti­
cem coni, &longs;ed magis ad ba&longs;im, eandem rotam
AB circumagit.

Cùm igitur motus potentiæ
propè verticem coni, ad motum rotæ AB mi­
norem habeat Rationem, quàm ad eundem rotæ motum mo­
tus potentiæ in latiore coni parte (ibi enim breviorem, hìc ma-
jorem gyrum perficit) ut quædam motûs æquabilitas in horo­
logio &longs;ervetur, opportunum fuit potentiæ validiùs conanti ma­
jorem opponi re&longs;i&longs;tentiam, minorem verò languidiùs conanti:
nam &longs;i catenula non conum, &longs;ed cylindrum circumplecte­
retur, eadem &longs;emper e&longs;&longs;et motuum men&longs;ura atque Ratio,
&longs;ed inæquales vires ela&longs;ticæ motum inæqualiter velocem ef­
ficerent.

Huc pariter revocandas e&longs;&longs;e Terebrarum vires vix cui­
quam dubium e&longs;&longs;e pote&longs;t, quarum quò ampliora &longs;unt ma­
nubria, majores pariter e&longs;&longs;e vires con&longs;tat; quandoquidem
potentia ampliorem circulum de&longs;cribit, dum terebræ acies
minimo motu ligni aut metalli particulas, in quas incurrit,
ab&longs;cindit.

Quæcumque demum &longs;it terebræ forma, five ejus
apex in cochleam &longs;triatam exacutam
de&longs;inat, ut AB manubrium habens
CD rectum, &longs;ive in aciem obli­
quam aut planam, aut modicè ex­
cavatam exeat ut EF, manubrium
autem LHI inflexum habeat circa
GI ver&longs;atile (quam Zerebram Gal­
licam aliqui Itali appellant) &longs;ive fer­
rea lamina in orbem convoluta, &
inferiùs denticulata, ut MN, ma­
nubrio tran&longs;ver&longs;o OP coaptetur: Si­
militer &longs;emper e&longs;t momentorum Ra­
tio de&longs;umenda aut ex tran&longs;ver&longs;arij
CD longitudine ad cra&longs;&longs;itiem co­
chleæ &longs;triatæ B, aut ex di&longs;tantiâ
puncti H à lineâ tran&longs;eunte per GIEF ad integram &longs;eu di­
midiatam aciei F latitudinem (prout extremum punctum F in
mediâ aut in extremâ latitudine po&longs;itionem habet) aut ex ma­
nubrij OP longitudine ad diametrum circularis &longs;erræ NM:
partes autem &longs;ubjecti corporis ab&longs;cindendæ, ut illud perfore­
tur, habent rationem ponderis movendi eò difficiliùs, quò va­
lidiore nexu illæ invicem conjunguntur.

Eadem erit philo&longs;ophandi methodus in eo terebræ gene­
re, cui nos Itali proximè ad Græcum vocabulum tru/panon
accedentes nomen fecimus.

Teretis baculi BC extremitati C
additur chalybea cu&longs;pis CD ita in punctum de&longs;inens, ut ad
aliquam latitudinem obliquè a&longs;cendat pro
ratione &longs;emidiametri foraminis, quod ma­
ximum artificis animus de&longs;tinavit.

Inferior
baculi pars infigitur &longs;phæroidi H, & tran&longs;­
ver&longs;arium GI in medio E ita perforatum
e&longs;t, ut facillimè per in&longs;ertum baculum ex­
currens &longs;ur&longs;um deor&longs;um agitari po&longs;&longs;it:
cum enim extremitates G & I adnexum
funiculum habeant pertingentem u&longs;que
in B, hoc circa baculum contorto tran&longs;ver&longs;arium non procul
abe&longs;t à B, quod &longs;i deprimatur, explicatur funiculus, & bacu­
lus in gyrum agitur pariter cum infixa cu&longs;pide; qua &longs;en&longs;im ac
leniter minimas &longs;ubjectæ laminæ metallicæ particulas abraden­
te, demùm &longs;æpiùs repetitâ tran&longs;ver&longs;arij &longs;ur&longs;um deor&longs;um agita­
tione, atque adeò celeri terebellæ conver&longs;ione, foramen patet.

Quamvis autem artificis manus applicetur medio tran&longs;ver&longs;ario
in E, quod deprimit; potentia tamen intelligitur applicata &longs;u­
perficiei baculi medio funiculo illum circumplexo, perinde at­
que &longs;i inter utramque palmam alternis motibus adductam atque
reductam idem baculus convolveretur: tantóque major e&longs;t po­
tentiæ &longs;ic applicatæ motus, quanto exce&longs;&longs;u baculi ambitus &longs;u­
perat terebellæ &longs;ubjectam laminam abradentis gyrum.

Quo­
niam verò potentia, hoc e&longs;t manus, movetur de&longs;cendendo,
ejus motus comparandus e&longs;t cum multiplici convolutione ba­
culi, quæ fit, dum explicatur funis.

Sed & alia potentia hìc con&longs;ideranda occurrit: adjunctum
enim &longs;phæroides H, quod mediocriter grave &longs;tatuitur, non &longs;o­
lùm &longs;uo pondere juvat, ut cu&longs;pis paulò pre&longs;&longs;iùs adhæreat &longs;ub­
jectæ laminæ, verùm etiam concepto in convolutione impetu
dum explicatur funis, pergit ad ea&longs;dem partes moveri, expli­
catúmque funem iterum circa baculum contorquens cogit
tran&longs;ver&longs;arium GI a&longs;cendere versùs B, quo vici&longs;&longs;im ab artificis
manu depre&longs;&longs;o in contrarias partes volvitur.

Impetus igitur
&longs;phæroidi H impre&longs;&longs;us, dum illud movet, rationem habet po­
tentiæ cu&longs;pidem in gyrum contorquentis, cujus momenta ex
di&longs;tantiâ ab axe, circa quem efficitur motus, definienda &longs;unt.
CAPUT V.

Axium in &longs;uis peritrochiis compo&longs;itione vires
augentur.

COntingere pote&longs;t, & quidem non rarò, ad &longs;ervandam pe­
ritrochij & axis cum pondere & potentiá analogiam, tam
ingens tympanum aut manubrium Axi coaptandum e&longs;&longs;e, ut
aut loci angu&longs;tiæ commodè illud non patiantur, aut non ni&longs;i
majore di&longs;pendio, quàm &longs;it operæ pretium, tam ampla ma­
china parari, aut congruè di&longs;poni queat.

Quid enim, &longs;i &longs;pecta­
tâ potentiæ validioris virtute centuplum onus &longs;u&longs;tollendum
proponatur?

an cra&longs;&longs;iori Axi, qui &longs;atis firmus &longs;it, rotam aut
tympanum cujus diameter centupla &longs;it diametri Axis, adjun­
gemus?

quanto id incommodo futurum e&longs;&longs;et, quantáque &longs;ub­
&longs;idia comparare oporteret, ut tam immanis machina citrà luxa­
tionem &longs;ub&longs;i&longs;teret, & congruo pegmati inniteretur, nemo non
videt.

Satius itaque fuerit, in&longs;i&longs;tendo iis, quæ lib.2 cap.7. dicta
&longs;unt, machinam, quam ad centuplam altitudinem augere in­
commodum accideret, componere, pluribus Axibus cum &longs;uis
peritrochiis invicem ritè coaptatis.

Statuendus primùm e&longs;t Axis, cujus &longs;oliditas oneris gravi­
tati &longs;u&longs;tinendæ re&longs;pondeat, longitudo circumflexas ducta­
rij funis &longs;piras commodè capiat.

Deinde tympanum eligatur,
cujus diameter ad con&longs;tituti cylindri diametrum eam habeat,
quæ placuerit, Rationem, modò illa &longs;it majoris inæqualitatis,
ut manife&longs;tum e&longs;t: &longs;it ex.

gr. quintupla, & cylindri cra&longs;&longs;ities
palmaris ponatur.

Sed quoniam propo&longs;ito ponderi attollendo
impar e&longs;t potentia applicata machinæ re&longs;i&longs;tentiam gravitatis in
Ratione &longs;olùm quintuplâ extenuanti, alium adhibe Axem &longs;uo
Peritrochio infixum (vel quem fors tulerit antè in alios u&longs;us
paratum, vel &longs;ecundùm de&longs;tinatam Rationem elaboratum) cu­
jus ductarius funis ip&longs;i quidem Axi congruo loco conjungatur,
&longs;ed tympanum prioris Axis circumplectatur, ut in convolutio-
ne &longs;ecundi Axis evolutus tympano illi motum conciliet, adeò­
que etiam ponderi.

Duas igitur Rationes, quas &longs;ingula Peritro­
chia ad &longs;uos Axes habent, compone, ut potentiæ &longs;ecundo Peri­
trochio applicatæ momenta innote&longs;cant.

Sit Ratio hæc po&longs;te­
rior ex.

gr. quadrupla; & Ratio, quæ ex quadruplâ & quintuplâ
componitur, e&longs;t vigecupla, quæ adhuc minor e&longs;t, quàm opor­
teat.

Quare, cùm ex Ratione centuplâ Ratio vigecupla &longs;ubducta
relinquat Rationem quintuplam, tertium Axem cum manubrio
quintuplæ longitudinis ad eju&longs;dem Axis &longs;emidiametrum &longs;imili­
ter appone, & erit ex his tribus Rationibus compo&longs;ita Ratio
centupla quæ&longs;ita.

Quia enim potentia manubrio huic applicata
movetur quintuplo velociùs, quàm punctum, cui illa in &longs;ecundi
Axis tympano applicaretur, hoc verò quadruplo velociùs, quàm
&longs;imile punctum in tympano prioris Axis, potentia movetur vi­
gecuplo velociùs, quàm &longs;i applicaretur tympano prioris Axis:
huic autem tympano applicata moveretur quintuplo velociùs
quàm pondus: igitur manubrium illud ver&longs;ans potentia move­
tur centuplo velociùs quàm pondus: id quod fieri oportebat, ut
propo&longs;ita gravitas in altum attolleretur.

Placeat jam triplicem hunc Axem cum unico illo comparate,
qui &longs;olus adhiberetur, &longs;i machina &longs;implex e&longs;&longs;et, & non compo­
&longs;ita: ille &longs;iquidem &longs;i palmaris diametri e&longs;&longs;et, adjunctum tympa­
num haberet altitudinis palmorum centum; in quo con&longs;truen­
do quàm multâ materiâ opus e&longs;&longs;et, quantoque artificio compin­
genda, ne &longs;uâ mole labefactata di&longs;&longs;olveretur?

Triplex autem hic
Axis cum &longs;uis duobus tympanis, & manubrio (præterquam quod
multipliciter di&longs;poni pote&longs;t pro loci opportunitate, & potentiæ
moventis commodo) non &longs;olùm ad altitudinem palmorum viginti
non a&longs;&longs;urgeret, &longs;ed longè infra illam &longs;ub&longs;i&longs;teret, à quocunque artifice
nullo negotio con&longs;trueretur, ab alio in alium locum facillimè transfer­
retur, levíque di&longs;pendio pararetur, ut cuique con&longs;ideranti obvium e&longs;t.

Hocautem, quod in tribus Axibus explicatum e&longs;t, de pluribus
etiam dictum intelligatur: nam &longs;i Rationes &longs;ingulæ peritrochij ad
&longs;uum axem con&longs;iderentur, & &longs;imul componantur multiplicando
invicem omnes Rationum terminos Antecedentes, item omnes
Con&longs;equentes, ut habeatur novus Antecedens & novus Con&longs;e­
quens, apparebit Ratio motûs potentiæ ad motum ponderis, adeó­
que gravitatis ponderis ad virtutem potentiæ.

Ex quo patet quo&longs;-
cumque Axes oblatos utiles e&longs;&longs;e po&longs;&longs;e, modò Peritrochiorum ad
&longs;uos Axes Ratio innote&longs;cat, &longs;ive &longs;imiles &longs;int, &longs;ive di&longs;&longs;imiles Ratio­
nes, &longs;ive multiplices, &longs;ive &longs;uperparticulares, &longs;ive &longs;uperpartientes:
demum enim, &longs;i quid de&longs;it ad quæ&longs;itam Rationem, addi pote&longs;t
certus Axis cum manubrio ita, ut Ratio quæ&longs;ita expleatur.

Sint
quinque Axes in &longs;uis Peritrochiis omnino &longs;imiles, & &longs;inguli con­
tineant Rationem decuplam: quinque Rationes 10 ad 1 invicem du­
cantur, & erit motus Potentiæ ad motum ponderis, ut 100000 ad 1;
ac propterea quo conatu Potentia &longs;olitaria moveret talentum,
ac machinâ compo&longs;itâ movebit centum millia talentorum.

Sint
item quinque Rationes, 10 ad 1, 20 ad 7, 8 ad 3, 9 ad 2, 4 ad 1
(quocumque ordine inter &longs;e di&longs;ponantur) omnes Antecedentes
invicem ducti faciunt novum Antecedentem 57600, omnes au­
tem Con&longs;equentes invicem ducti dant novum Con&longs;equentem 42;
quare Ratio Compo&longs;ita e&longs;t 57600 ad 42, hoc e&longs;t 9600 ad 7: &
potentia valens attollere libras 7, hac machinâ compo&longs;itâ attol­
let libras 9600. Quod &longs;i oporteret moveri libras decies mille ab
hac eadem Potentiâ, auferatur Ratio 9600 ad 7 ex Ratione 10000
ad 7, & relinquitur Ratio 700 ad 672, hoc e&longs;t 25 ad 24: quare
addendus e&longs;&longs;et &longs;extus Axis cum manubrio, cujus longitudo ad
Axis &longs;emidiametrum e&longs;&longs;et ut 25 ad 24, & potentia eadem hu­
ju&longs;modi manubrio applicata attollere po&longs;&longs;et libras 10000.

Illud habere videtur incom­
modi hæc Axium compo&longs;itio,
quod magnam vim funium tym­
pana circumplectentium exi­
git, qui &longs;cilicet &longs;ingulorum tym­
panorum motui re&longs;pondeant.

Cum enim tympani A diameter
&longs;it quintupla Axis BC ex hypo­
the&longs;i, ejus motus e&longs;t quintuplo
major motu ponderis P, ac pro­
inde funis, qui tympani limbum
complectitur, quintuplo longior
e&longs;&longs;e debet fune PD, hoc e&longs;t mo­
tu ponderis; cujus funis tympa­
no A circumducti caput cum
Axe EF connectitur, circa
quem in motu convolvitur.

Quoniam verò tympanum O ex
hypothe&longs;i diametrum habet quadruplam diametri &longs;ui Axis EF
eju&longs;que motus e&longs;t ad motum &longs;ui Axis quadruplus, funis circum­
plicatus tympano O quadruplus e&longs;t funis, qui circa Axem EF
convolvitur, ac propterea etiam vigecuplus funis DP; adeo ut,
ubi totus funis evolutus fuerit, atque circa axem HG convolu­
tus, pondus &longs;ublatum u&longs;que in D intelligatur.

Ex quo fit poten­
tiam manubrio IL applicatam, quia IG longitudo e&longs;t quintu­
pla &longs;emidiametri Axis GH, adhuc quintuplo velociùs moveri
quàm tympanum O, cujus motum metitur evolutio funis illud
circumplectentis; atque idcirco Potentia in I movetur centu­
plo velociùs quàm pondus P.

Quare &longs;i adhuc quartum Axem ad­
dere oporteret, & loco manubrij GI tympanum &longs;uo fune in­
&longs;tructum apponeretur, funis ille e&longs;&longs;et ip&longs;ius PD centuplus; at­
que ita deinceps pro tympanorum & Axium multiplicatione
juxta &longs;ingulorum Rationem augeretur funium longitudo.

Verùm pro tantâ funium longitudine non e&longs;t tympanorum
limbo enormis amplitudo tribuenda, ut eos capiat; quia &longs;cilicet
quò longiores exiguntur huju&longs;modi funes, eò etiam tenuiores
atque exiliores e&longs;&longs;e po&longs;&longs;unt: Si enim funis DP oneri attollendo
par con&longs;tat funiculis contortis invicem ex.

gr. centum, funis
qui tympanum A complectitur, non ni&longs;i quintam ponderis par­
tem re&longs;i&longs;tentem habet, hoc e&longs;t ip&longs;um pondus P &longs;ubquintuplo
minore re&longs;i&longs;tentiâ repugnans potentiæ per tympanum A reti­
nenti: ac proinde &longs;i funium firmitatem funiculorum numerus
metitur, &longs;atis validus erit funis con&longs;tans ex funiculis viginti.

Si­
militer funis complectens tympanum O, quia pondus re&longs;i&longs;ten­
tiam &longs;ubvigecuplo minorem habet, &longs;atis firmus cen&longs;ebitur, &longs;iex
quinque funiculis invicem contortis confletur.

Quod &longs;i ju&longs;to
tenuiores timeas huju&longs;modi funes, licebit adhuc paulò cra&longs;&longs;io­
res adhibere.

Illud certè manife&longs;tum e&longs;t multo minores &longs;uffi­
cere, quàm &longs;it funis DP.

Ne autem tympanis limbi amplitudinem funis circumducti
capacem temerè con&longs;tituas, &longs;ingulorum funium cra&longs;&longs;itudo con­
&longs;ideranda e&longs;t, ut eorum diameter innote&longs;cat, & longitudinis ra­
tione habitâ &longs;pirarum numerus inveniatur, per quem ducta fu­
nis diameter dabit nece&longs;&longs;ariam limbi amplitudinem; quæ &longs;i
ju&longs;to minor e&longs;&longs;et primum &longs;pirarum ordinem &longs;ecundus ordo cir-
cumplecteretur: & quamvis initio hinc major aliqua movendi
facilitas oriretur (auctâ &longs;cilicet peritrochij diametro) tamen
evoluto &longs;ecundo hoc &longs;pirarum ordine diameter peritrochij di­
minuta majorem crearet movendi difficultatem; maxime &longs;i cir­
ca Axem convolutus funis &longs;pirarum ordinem pariter geminaret,
atque adeò Axis diametrum augeret.

Funes itaque qua&longs;i cylin­
dri con&longs;iderandi &longs;unt, quorum cra&longs;&longs;itudinis diametri &longs;unt in
&longs;ubduplicatâ ba&longs;ium Ratione; ac propterea inter ip&longs;as cra&longs;&longs;itu­
dines numeris definitas inventendus e&longs;t numerus medio loco
proportionalis, & hic indicabit tenuioris funis diametrum,
quemadmodum primus numerus major ponitur pro diametro
cra&longs;&longs;ioris funis.

Sic quoniam funis DP e&longs;t ex hypothe&longs;i ut 100,
& funis circa tympanum A &longs;ubquintuplæ cra&longs;&longs;itudinis e&longs;t ut
20, inveniatur inter 100 & 20 medius (44 72/100) proximè, & dia­
metri funium erunt proximè in Ratione 100 ad 45. Quare
quam amplitudinem requirunt 45 &longs;piræ maximi funis DP,
eandem exigunt 100 &longs;piræ minoris funis attributi tympano A,
&longs;i uteroue funis circa eumdem cylindrum convolvatur.

Sed
quia perimeter tympani A quinquies continet perimetrum
Axis BC, unica tympani &longs;pira quinque Axis &longs;piris æquatur &longs;e­
cundùm longitudinem, & centum &longs;piræ tympani quingentis
Axis &longs;piris re&longs;pondent, &longs;i lineæ longitudo &longs;pectetur: &longs;atis au­
tem e&longs;t, &longs;i longitudinem &longs;pirarum 225 circa Axem, ille funis
tympani obtineat, quia longitudo illa e&longs;t ad funis DP longitu­
dinem 45 quintupla.

Propterea tympani limbus minorem exi­
git amplitudinem, quàm &longs;it &longs;patium, quod in Axe BC occupa­
tur à convoluto fune DP: nimirum à limbo contineri oportet
&longs;ui funis circumplicati &longs;piras 45; &longs;atis igitur fuerit dimidiata
amplitudo.

Simili methodo tympano O limbi amplitudinem definies:
quoniam enim funis cra&longs;&longs;itudo ad cra&longs;&longs;itudinem funis DP e&longs;t
&longs;ubvigecupla, inter 100 & 5 medio loco proportionalis (22 36/100)
proximè inveniatur; & e&longs;t diameter funis tympani O ad dia­
metrum funis DP ut (22 36/100) ad 100. Quare &longs;i circa eundem cy­
lindrum uterque funis convolveretur, quod &longs;patium &longs;piras fu­
nis DP 45 contineret, tenuioris hujus funis &longs;piras &longs;altem 201
comprehenderet.

Ponamus tympani O perimetrum e&longs;&longs;e ad pe-
rimetrum Axis BC ut 4 ad 1: igitur limbus tympani O &longs;i ean­
dem habeat amplitudinem, quam funis DP occupat in &longs;uo Axe
BC, capiet &longs;ui funis &longs;piras 201, quæ in unam longitudinem
exten&longs;æ con&longs;tituunt longitudinem, quæ ad longitudinem &longs;pi­
rarum 45 funis DP e&longs;t ut 804 ad 45. Sed quia longitudo illius
funis e&longs;t vigecupla longitudinis funis DP, debet e&longs;&longs;e ut 900
ad 45; ideò adhuc majorem exigit amplitudinem, ut adhuc &longs;pi­
ras 24 aut 25 &longs;upra ducentas obtineat.

Quod &longs;i Axis EF &longs;ubti­
lior &longs;it quàm Axis BC, & tympani O diameter ad &longs;ui axis EF
diametrum quadrupla &longs;it, jam tympani perimeter ad perime­
trum Axis BC habebit minorem Rationem quàm 4 ad 1, ac
proinde ejus limbum adhuc ampliorem con&longs;titui nece&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t.

Quare &longs;i Axis BC diameter &longs;it palmaris, &longs;piræ 45 funis DP
convoluti elevabunt pondus P ad altitudinem palmorum circi­
ter 141, quanta nimirum e&longs;&longs;et ip&longs;ius funis convoluti longitudo:
funis circa tympanum A longitudo e&longs;&longs;et palmorum &longs;altem 705,
& funis circa tympanum O longitudo palmorum 2820. Hinc
quamvis præter primum Axem BC oneri &longs;u&longs;tinendo parem,
reliqui con&longs;equentes Axes EF, & GH, & &longs;i qui alij adhuc &longs;int,
po&longs;&longs;int in minorem &longs;oliditatem extenuari; &longs;i ponderis re&longs;i&longs;ten­
tia attendatur, quia tamen, quò &longs;ubtiliores &longs;unt, frequentiori­
bus etiam &longs;piris circumplicantur, ex quo fit ut plures &longs;pirarum
ordines fiant, adeoque Axis diameter aucta minuat momento­
rum Rationem; præ&longs;tat exiles Axes non &longs;tudiosè quærere, ni&longs;i
fortè nece&longs;&longs;itas aliqua iis uti &longs;uadeat.

Quamquam & huic in­
commodo occurri pote&longs;t, &longs;i, quemadmodum in Ergatæ u&longs;u
funem paucis aliquot &longs;piris circumductum, dum in conver&longs;io­
ne evolvitur, puer agglomerat, ita etiam hîc funem tympano­
rum A & O quatuor aut quinque &longs;piris circa Axes E & H con­
volutum puer colligeret: hoc enim pacto non contingeret, ut
primum &longs;pirarum ordinem alter &longs;pirarum ordo &longs;uperinductus
circumplecteretur.

Porrò ne tantam funium vim comparare cogamur, & am­
pliore limbo tympana circum&longs;cribere, haud &longs;anè ineptum cen­
&longs;erem, &longs;i pro eorum more, qui novaculas obtu&longs;as acuunt, ut aliàs
innui, funis in &longs;e&longs;e rediens unâ aut altera (aut etiam triplici, &longs;i
opus fuerit) &longs;pirâ tùm Axem, tum &longs;ubjectum tympanum arctè
complecteretur: &longs;ic enim fieret, ut Axe convoluto etiam &longs;ub-
jectum tympanum volveretur; idémque funis perpetuo ordine
à tympano in proximum Axem & ab Axe in tympanum &longs;uc­
cedens quantolibet motui perficiendo &longs;ufficeret.

Et ut omne
periculum &longs;ubmoveatur, ne funis excurrat, &longs;atius e&longs;t tùm Axis,
tùm tympani ambitum non in cylindricam &longs;uperficiem expoli­
re, &longs;ed angulis a&longs;perum e&longs;&longs;e.

Quod &longs;i aliquando languidior fu­
nis non adeò pre&longs;sè complecteretur Axem & tympanum,
&longs;pongiam aquâ imbutam ip&longs;i funi admove, & intentus fiet.

Demùm in huju&longs;modi Axium compo&longs;itione non &longs;ine
animadver&longs;ione prætereundæ videntur mutua Axium po&longs;itio,
atque di&longs;tantia, qua &longs;ecundus Axis à primo tympano abe&longs;t.

Sit
Axis A in Peritrochio CDE, at­
que ex fune perpendiculari BG
dependeat onus, & GB Tangens
cum Radio AB con&longs;tituat angu­
lum rectum ABG.

Producatur
recta AB u&longs;que ad tympani peri­
pheriam in C, & &longs;it ad angulum
rectum Tangens CH, cui ad­
nexa intelligatur potentia per
axem S trahens, atque tympa­
num CDE convertens; ex cu­
jus conver&longs;ione convolvitur Axis
AB versùs I, & pondus a&longs;cendit.

Verùm &longs;ecundus Axis S cum pri­
mo tympano comparatus non
hanc &longs;olùm po&longs;itionem obtinere
pote&longs;t, ut &longs;uperior &longs;it, &longs;ed etiam
con&longs;titui pote&longs;t ad latus ita, ut
funis ductarius cadens in hori­
zontem ad perpendiculum &longs;it KL, Tangens verò HC &longs;it ho­
rizonti parallela; aut ita di&longs;poni po&longs;&longs;unt, ut Axis A &longs;uperiore
loco, Axis S inferiore loco &longs;tatuatur, & funis pondus retinens
&longs;it MN, cui parallelus &longs;it funis CH.

Quamcumque ex his
tribus po&longs;itionem habeat Axis &longs;ecundus S, &longs;ivè &longs;uperior, &longs;ivè
ad latus, &longs;ive inferior &longs;it (modò linea CH vel parailela &longs;it li­
neis ductarij funis BG aut MN, vel parallela lineæ AK jun­
genti centrum Axis cum puncto contactûs perpendiculi KL)
eadem habere videtur momenta; quia punctum C, cui appli­
cata intelligitur potentia, juxta potentiæ directionem &longs;imili
Ratione accedit versùs potentiam comparatè ad a&longs;cen&longs;um
puncti Axis, cui applicatur pondus, ac e&longs;t Ratio &longs;emidiametri
tympani ad &longs;emidiametrum Axis.

Concipiamus enim in con­
volutione punctum C venire in F, punctum verò B in I:
punctum igitur C &longs;equens potentiæ directionem accedit versùs
potentiam juxta men&longs;uram Sinûs arcûs CF, hoc e&longs;t OF,
quemadmodum punctum B contrà directionem gravitatis pon­
deris a&longs;cendit juxta men&longs;uram Sinûs arcûs BI: &longs;unt autem hi
&longs;inus arcuum &longs;imilium &longs;imiliter po&longs;itorum in Ratione Radio­
rum AC ad AB.

Atqui &longs;ive in K, &longs;ive in M intelligatur pon­
dus, a&longs;cen&longs;us illius e&longs;t æqualis a&longs;cen&longs;ui BI; ergo ad illos, ut po­
te huic æquales, acce&longs;&longs;us puncti C ad potentiam, qui e&longs;t OF,
eandem habet Rationem, quæ e&longs;t Radij AC ad Radium AB.

At verò &longs;i Axis &longs;ecundus &longs;it T, potentia non intelligitur ap­
plicata tympano in C, &longs;ed in F, ubi circulum tangit recta TF;
nec ejus directio FT e&longs;t parallela directioni ponderis BG, &longs;ed
obliqua, adeò ut quamvis F veniat in Q per arcum æqualem
arcui CF, quia tamen non e&longs;t &longs;imiliter po&longs;itus, punctum F &longs;e­
quens directionem potentiæ accedit versùs potentiam acce&longs;&longs;u,
quem metitur RP; e&longs;t autem RP minor quàm AR, hoc e&longs;t
OF, ut ex doctrinâ Sinuum con&longs;tat; igitur acce&longs;&longs;us RP ad
a&longs;cen&longs;um BI habet minorem Rationem, quàm acce&longs;&longs;us OF ad
eundem a&longs;cen&longs;um BI.

Potentia igitur volvens Axem T in li­
neâ TF obliquâ minora habet momenta, quàm in parallelâ
HC.

Similiter &longs;i Axis fuerit V propior quàm Axis T; linea
VD tangit circulum in D puncto remotiore quàm F, à puncto
C; ac propterea datâ arcûs æqualitate adhuc minor e&longs;t acce&longs;&longs;us
in D quàm in F, multóque minor quàm in C, & idcircò mi­
norem habet trahendi facilitatem.

Quare quò propior e&longs;t Axis
&longs;ecundus, &longs;i tractio &longs;it obliqua, ut TF & VD, plus laboris re­
quiritur in movendo.

Neque hoc mihi incon&longs;iderantiæ tribuas, quod a&longs;&longs;ump&longs;erim
arcus CF & BI perinde atque &longs;i idem e&longs;&longs;et motus, ac quando
funis HC e&longs;&longs;et firmiter alligatus in C, & ejus caput veniret ex
C in F; cum tamen alia &longs;emper atque alia pars funis aliis &longs;ub­
inde peripheriæ tympani partibus re&longs;pondeat, in quibus fit ad
angulum rectum cum diametro contactus, dum ille evolvitur.

Eatenus enim notabilem arcum a&longs;&longs;ump&longs;i, quatenus ob oculos
ponenda erat momentorum Ratio: Cæterùm &longs;atis &longs;cio non adeò
notabiles arcus, ut CF & BI, con&longs;iderandos e&longs;&longs;e, &longs;ed eorum
particulam minimam, &longs;ive cente&longs;imam dicas, &longs;ive mille&longs;imam
aut decies mille&longs;imam: eadem &longs;cilicet erit Ratio Sinuum, qui
re&longs;pondent minimis arcubus &longs;imilibus ac &longs;imiliter po&longs;itis, qui
nimirum incipiunt à C & B, atque Sinuum re&longs;pondentium
majoribus arcubus &longs;imilibus ab ii&longs;dem punctis C & B incipien­
tibus.

Id quod pariter de punctis F & D comparatis cum
puncto B, aut K, aut M dicendum: Nam quæ inito &longs;emel mo­
tu intercedit momentorum Ratio inter potentiam & pondus
ratione po&longs;itionis, eadem in toto motu per&longs;everat.

At &longs;i funis
non evolveretur, &longs;ed puncto C e&longs;&longs;et firmiter colligatus, in
tractione ex C in F &longs;ubinde mutarentur Potentiæ momenta,
fieréntque &longs;emper minora, adeò ut demum perirent, & nulla
e&longs;&longs;ent, ubi in rectam lineam coale&longs;cerent Radius AC & fu­
nis HC.

Hæc quæ de &longs;ecundo Axe funem primo tympano circum­
ductum evolvente dicta &longs;unt, facilè traduci po&longs;&longs;unt etiam ad
funem in &longs;e &longs;e redeuntem, cuju&longs;modi e&longs;&longs;et funis FTEF, aut
DVXD: ni&longs;i enim funis contingat tympanum in puncto &longs;e­
midiametri tran&longs;euntis per contactum Axis & funis ductarij
(hoc e&longs;t in C extremitate &longs;emidiametri AC tran&longs;euntis per B,
aut M) ita ut &longs;it funi ductario parallelus, aut in puncto &longs;emi­
diametri parallelæ funi ductario KL, con&longs;ultius erit, cæteris
paribus, axem &longs;ecundum e&longs;&longs;e remotum ut T, quàm proximum
ut V: in proximo enim lineæ DV & XV productæ coirent
in angulum majorem, quàm lineæ FT & ET, ac propterea
comprehen&longs;us arcus DX minor e&longs;t arcu FE. Cæteris, in­
quam, paribus; &longs;i videlicet in eadem rectâ lineâ intelligan­
tur trium Axium centra A, V, T; nam &longs;i in lineâ eadem jun­
gente centra AT non e&longs;&longs;et V, &longs;ed recederet ita, ut funis tym­
panum contingens minùs obliquus e&longs;&longs;et, &longs;ed magis accederet
ad paralleli&longs;mum cum lineâ BG, aut cum Radio Axis AK,
quamvis Axis V propior e&longs;&longs;et, quàm Axis T, plus tamen
haberet momenti ratione directionis potentiæ minùs obliquè
trahentis.

Cave autem, ne hîc in latentem quendam æquivocationis
&longs;copulum incurras, &longs;i fortè permixtim accipias ponderis eleva­
tionem atque eju&longs;dem &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;i retentionem, ne recidat; hæc
enim duo oppo&longs;ito modo contingunt, & quæ minor funis obli­
quitas cau&longs;a e&longs;t facilioris elevationis, eadem difficiliorem ef­
ficit retentionem: nam pondus B retinetur à potentiâ C,
ab&longs;que eo quod potentia ullo conatu urgeat polos, quibus
axis & peritrochium incumbit, ideò pondus totas &longs;uas vi­
res exerit adversùs potentiam &longs;ur&longs;um directè trahentem: at
verò in F aut in D potentia &longs;ur&longs;um obliquè trahens tym­
panum ver&longs;us centrum quodammodo urget, & quidem eò
magis, quò magis obliqua e&longs;t tractio; ac proinde pondus
non &longs;olùm vincere debet potentiæ vires, &longs;ed etiam re&longs;i&longs;ten­
tiam ex illâ pre&longs;&longs;ione ortam; quæ quò major e&longs;t pro majo­
re declinatione à paralleli&longs;mo cum lineâ BG, aut Radio AK,
majorem quoque potentiæ tribuit retinendi facilitatem.

Hinc
quando &longs;ecundus Axis e&longs;t in inferiore loco, & potentiæ tra­
hentis directio deor&longs;um tendit, magis premuntur poli, quin
& à potentia deor&longs;um conante, & à ponderis gravitate ur­
gentur, & quidem eò magis, quò magis potentiæ deor&longs;um
trahentis directio accedit ad lineam directioni ponderis MN
parallelam, aut ultra illam excurrit &longs;e quodammodo invicem
decu&longs;&longs;ando.

An non exe&longs;a publicorum puteorum marmorea
labra aliquando ob&longs;erva&longs;ti, quæ diuturno atque frequenti&longs;­
&longs;imo u&longs;u à funibus, quibus aqua hauritur, detrita &longs;unt:
Utique aquam in &longs;itulâ &longs;ur&longs;um trahentis labor minor e&longs;&longs;et,
cæteris paribus, &longs;i &longs;olùm &longs;itulæ & aquæ gravitatem vince­
re oporteret, quàm &longs;i præter hanc etiam &longs;uperanda &longs;it re­
&longs;i&longs;tentia, quæ ex funis conflictu cum marmore oritur.

Sed
quia deinde hoc eodem conflictu efficitur, ut quando tractio
alternis morulis interciditur, retentio minorem potentiæ co­
natum exigat; propterea etiam trahentes facilè patiuntur
re&longs;i&longs;tentiam augeri, ut aliquantulo laboris compendio gau­
deant, quoties placuerit quietem aliquam captare.

Quamquam non negaverim rudes fœminas atque pueros hoc
in opere, naturâ duce, quærere etiam in trahendâ &longs;ur&longs;um &longs;i­
tulâ non leve laboris compendium: &longs;i enim rectâ, intacto pu­
tei labro, funis &longs;ur&longs;um trahendus e&longs;&longs;et, id utique &longs;olâ brachio-
rum contentione perfici po&longs;&longs;et; &longs;ed ubi funis labro innititur,
non &longs;olùm contentis brachiorum mu&longs;culis trahunt, &longs;ed etiam
inclinato retror&longs;um corpore hoc efficiunt, ut ip&longs;a corporis
gravitas nonnihil conferat, quo potentiæ animalis viribus
fiat additamentum.

Ex quo manife&longs;tum e&longs;t re&longs;i&longs;tentiam il­
lam ex pre&longs;&longs;ione ortam & difficiliorem efficere tractionem, &
faciliorem retentionem: ac proinde lap&longs;um putarem, qui tra­
hentis potentiæ momenta æ&longs;timaret ex majore retinendi fa­
cultate.

In his, quæ in po&longs;teriore hujus capitis parte di&longs;putata &longs;unt
de hac inæqualitate momentorum pro diver&longs;a po&longs;itione axis
&longs;ecundi, mihi videor &longs;atis probabiliter philo&longs;ophatus: verùm
&longs;i ad Rationes Vectis (ut pluribus placet) revocanda e&longs;&longs;et vis
Axis in Peritrochio, quamvis aliqua &longs;atis commodè explica­
ri po&longs;&longs;ent, ubi Vectis e&longs;t rectus, non omnia tamen, ubi Vectis
curvus intelligendus e&longs;t, congruam patiuntur explicationem,
ut cuilibet rem attentè con&longs;ideranti manife&longs;tum fiet; mihi
enim hìc non videtur operæ pretium in re parùm utili tempus
conterere; placuit tamen id obiter innuere, ut ip&longs;e tibi per&longs;ua­
deas inanem e&longs;&longs;e laborem, quo quis &longs;ingularum Facultatum
vires ad Vectem revocare conatur.
CAPUT VI.

Tympanorum dentatorum u&longs;us & vires
exponuntur.

QUæ hactenus tympana con&longs;ideravimus, fune circum­
ducto atque evoluto ver&longs;antur; nunc genus aliud, cujus
ampli&longs;&longs;imus u&longs;us e&longs;t, contemplari oportet, tympana videlicet
dentata, &longs;eu Rotas dentatas, in quibus &longs;ivè fuerint &longs;implices,
&longs;ivè compo&longs;itæ, aut nullo pror&longs;us fune indigemus aut illo tan­
tummodo, quo pondus proximè trahitur, aut attollitur: den­
tes enim majoris atque minoris tympani, ubi plura componun­
tur, &longs;e mutuâ collabellatione mordentes &longs;e vici&longs;&longs;im urgent,
pro ut hoc aut illud tympanum habet originem motûs.

Sit
chalybea lamina AB &longs;atis &longs;olida, in alte­
râ extremitate, quæ pondus re&longs;picit, mo­
dicè &longs;inuata, ut in A, & in validum un­
cum recurva, ut in C; latus autem DE
qua&longs;i &longs;erræ in morem &longs;it dentibus a&longs;pe­
rum.

Tum rotula I paris &longs;altem cum la­
minâ cra&longs;&longs;itudinis paretur dentes habens
ita in orbem di&longs;po&longs;itos, ut hi in rotulæ
circa &longs;uum centrum conver&longs;ione denti­
bus laminæ &longs;ubinde congruant: colloca­
tis enim in apto loculamento rotulâ, at­
que laminâ (cujus tamen pars DC extet)
adeò, ut hæc ex illius conver&longs;ione liberè
promoveri, illa circa &longs;uum axem, cui fir­
miter infixa &longs;it, facilè ver&longs;ari valeat, circumducto axis manu­
brio ad latus extra loculamentum extante, urgeri poterit pon­
dus, aut trahi: Nimirum &longs;i rotulæ conver&longs;io fiat ex H in I,
propellitur extra loculamentum lamina, ejú&longs;que extremitas A
recedens à rotulâ urget pondus obvium: contrà verò &longs;i rotula
convertatur ex I in H, laminam ad &longs;e intra loculamentum re­
trahit, & pondus unco C connexum ad &longs;e rapit.

Hinc clariùs
vides, quàm ut monendus &longs;is, oportere in attollendo, aut pro­
pellendo pondere loculamentum aut ponderi &longs;uppo&longs;itum firmo
&longs;olo in&longs;i&longs;tere, aut ponderi objectum &longs;olido repagulo inniti; in
trahendo autem pondere, quod uncus C apprehendit, oppo&longs;i­
tam loculamenti extremitatem valido fune retineri.

Illud potiùs attentè perpendendum, quod in &longs;tatuendis tùm
laminæ, tùm rotulæ dentibus plurimum refert, utrùm rari, an
&longs;pi&longs;&longs;iores &longs;int laminæ dentes, ac proinde utrùm pauci, an plures
in&longs;int ip&longs;i rotulæ, cujus peripheria in conver&longs;ione aptatur lami­
næ; hæc enim juxta numerum dentium rotulæ, quibus &longs;ubinde
coaptatur, promovetur, & cum ipsâ pondus pari velocitate aut
tarditate movetur.

Præ&longs;tare autem pondus tardè; potentiam
velociter moveri, quid opus e&longs;t iterùm inculcare?

Igitur quò
minor erit rotula & paucioribus dentibus in&longs;tructa, eodem ma­
nente manubrio, faciliùs movebitur pondus; quia ut &longs;emidia­
meter rotulæ ad manubrij longitudinem, ita motus ponderis,
ad motum potentiæ, & reciprocè ita potentiæ vis movendi, ad
pondus.

Quare ulteriùs manife&longs;tum e&longs;t, &longs;i majore potentiæ vir­
tute opus fuerit, &longs;pectatâ ponderis movendi difficultate, po&longs;&longs;e
augeri manubrium, ut majora &longs;int potentiæ momenta.

Quo­
niam verò non &longs;emper in promptu e&longs;t opportunum manubrium,
&longs;uaderem extremum axis caput, quod manubrio in&longs;eritur, qua­
dratum fieri, & longiu&longs;culum e&longs;&longs;e: loco autem vulgaris manu­
brij habeatur cra&longs;&longs;ioris cylindri fru&longs;tulum MN, in cujus imâ
ba&longs;i circa centrum excavatum &longs;it quadratum foramen S ad exci­
piendum caput axis, & ip&longs;ius cylindri &longs;capum penetrent fora­
mina rotunda R, T, quibus pro opportunitate in&longs;eri po&longs;&longs;int ba­
culi &longs;ive longiores, &longs;ive breviores.

Porrò cylindri cra&longs;&longs;itiem
nihil obe&longs;&longs;e apertè con&longs;tat, &longs;i quidem &longs;ola rotulæ &longs;emidiameter
attenditur ad definiendum ponderis motum comparata cum ba­
culi longitudine, quatenus potentia ab axe rotulæ di&longs;tat.

Quod &longs;i uno eodémque tempore duo pondera in oppo&longs;itas
partes di&longs;pellere, aut &longs;ibi invicem propiora fieri oporteat, &longs;imi­
lem alteram laminam priori parallelam in eodem plano &longs;ed con­
trario modo po&longs;itam (ut &longs;cilicet extremitas &longs;imilis ip&longs;i ACD
re&longs;piciat prioris laminæ extremitatem B) in oppo&longs;itâ rotulæ
parte colloca ad I, ut pariter laminæ dentes rotulæ dentibus im­
plicentur: Quia enim circuli circa &longs;uum centrum circumacti
partes adver&longs;æ oppo&longs;itis motibus cientur, etiam laminarum ex­
tremitates, quæ pondus propellunt aut trahunt, in contrarias
partes à rotulâ circumactâ moventur, ita ut vel à &longs;e invicem re­
cedant, vel ad &longs;e mutuò accedant.

Hoc idem quod laminæ rectæ dentatæ tympano &longs;imiliter den­
tato implicitæ contingit, accideret pariter, &longs;i illius in circulum
inflexæ extremam oram dentes ambirent: quemadmodum enim
recta lamina AB, tympani HI conver&longs;i ductum &longs;equitur, ita il­
la in circulum conformata circa &longs;uum centrum moveretur à
tympani dentibus impul&longs;a; eâ tamen ratione, ut duarum huju&longs;­
modi rotarum &longs;e invicem mordentium conver&longs;iones in oppo&longs;i­
tas plagas tenderent; &longs;i enim prioris rotæ pars &longs;uperior Occa­
&longs;um versùs converteretur, po&longs;terioris rotæ pars item &longs;uperior
Ortum versùs convolveretur; & &longs;i adhuc tertia rota dentata ad­
deretur, hæc iterum proximæ adver&longs;ata ad occa&longs;um pergeret;
atque ita deinceps alternis conver&longs;ionibus &longs;ibi vici&longs;&longs;im re&longs;pon­
dentibus.

Ob&longs;ervandum e&longs;t autem huju&longs;modi tympanorum, quæ den­
tata vocamus, multiplicem e&longs;&longs;e po&longs;&longs;e formam, eámque eligen­
dam, quæ præ&longs;tituto motui magis congruere videbitur: non &longs;o­
lùm enim pro majoribus tympanis a&longs;&longs;umi pote&longs;t di&longs;cus extre­
mum limbum habens &longs;erræ in morem denticulatim inci&longs;um, ve­
rùm etiam in orbem infigi po&longs;&longs;unt paxilli dentium loco promi­
nentes, &longs;ive peripheriam ip&longs;am qua&longs;i radij exeuntes ambiant, &longs;i­
ve &longs;uprà di&longs;ci planum erigantur ad perpendiculum certis inter­
vallis di&longs;tributi.

Hoc autem dentium in&longs;itorum genus non pa­
rum habet utilitatis præ dentibus illis qua&longs;i connatis: nam &longs;i lon­
go u&longs;u dens aliquis atteratur, aut excutiatur, facilè re&longs;titui po­
te&longs;t novo paxillo in prioris locum immi&longs;&longs;o; at non ita facilè re­
paratur pars illa limbi denticulata, quæ facta e&longs;t inutilis.

Simi­
liter pro minoribus tympanis non &longs;olùm dentatas rotulas adhi­
bere po&longs;&longs;umus &longs;uis axibus infixas, &longs;ed etiam uti licet aut paulò
cra&longs;&longs;ioribus axibus &longs;triatis, quorum excavatæ &longs;triæ majoris tym­
pani dentibus congruant, aut vertebris pariter &longs;triatis &longs;ubtiliori
axi infixis.

Quando verò majus tympanum paxillos habet pro
dentibus, tympanum minus illi re&longs;pondens e&longs;t Curriculus (quem
alij ex Italico idiomate Rocchetum dicunt) aliquot virgulis, ut
plurimum ferreis ad firmitatem, capita duobus parallelis planis
infixa habentibus con&longs;tans, ita ut in majoris tympani conver&longs;io­
ne &longs;ingulos paxillos excipiant &longs;ingula virgularum intervalla,
quibus propul&longs;is curriculus convolvitur, & cum eo aut pondus
ip&longs;um, aut aliud tympanum movetur.

Sic contingere pote&longs;t ut Axe AB attollendum &longs;it pondus, &
expediat uti jumento, quod tamen
non ni&longs;i in plano horizontali moveri
pote&longs;t; tympanum autem CD, in
quo e&longs;t Axis AB horizontalis, e&longs;t in
plano Verticali.

Ad tympani CD
planam faciem aver&longs;am perpendicu­
lares paxillos in ambitu &longs;tatue, &
Curriculum EF circa &longs;uum axem
&longs;uperiùs atque inferiùs firmatum
ver&longs;atilem adjice, cujus virgulæ con­
gruis intervallis di&longs;tinctæ tympani
dentibus re&longs;pondeant.

Aliud item tympanum HG horizonti
parallelum dentes habens ex peripheriâ extantes, & Curriculi
EF virgulis aptè congruentes, infigatur axi perpendiculari IK,
cui opportuno loco addatur vectis LM, ita ut in M commodè
jungi po&longs;&longs;it jumentum: hoc enim progrediente, & tympanum
ex G versùs O convolvente, dens H incurrens in virgulam cur­
riculi EF illum convertit versùs tympanum CD, cujus pariter
denti occurrens alia virgula, atque impellens cogit infimam
tympani partem D a&longs;cendere, &longs;imúlque Axem AB converti, &
convoluto fune ductario RS attolli pondus.

Hæc tympanorum duorum & curriculi intermedij complexio
&longs;i attentè perpendatur, non auget potentiæ momenta præter ea,
quæ obtineret proximè applicata tympano CD ad convolven­
dum Axem AB: Nam &longs;i ponatur vectis LM non longior &longs;emi­
diametro tympani dentati HG, perinde e&longs;t, ac &longs;i potentia in M
po&longs;ita exi&longs;teret in G, æquali &longs;cilicet motu cum tympani HG
peripheriâ movetur.

Curriculi autem EF motus æquè velox e&longs;t
atque motus tympani HG; licèt enim hoc &longs;it majus, ille mi­
nor, tamen dum illud &longs;emel, hic &longs;æpiùs convolvitur pro ratione
diametrorum; adeò ut &longs;i tympanum HG habeat dentes viginti,
curriculus &longs;trias quinque, hic quater volvatur ex unicâ tympani
conver&longs;ione: quapropter quatuor curriculi &longs;ubquadrupli con­
volutiones uni conver&longs;ioni tympani HG æquantur.

Similiter
& de tympano CD dicendum, cujus tantummodo dentes quin­
que re&longs;pondentes quinque &longs;triis aut virgulis curriculi EF ur­
gentur unicâ conver&longs;ione curriculi eju&longs;dem, & idcircò æqualis
e&longs;t utriu&longs;que motus, ac proinde etiam duo tympana CD & HG
æqualiter moventur, & potentiæ in M applicatæ momenta ea­
dem &longs;unt, quæ forent, &longs;i tympano CD proximè applicaretur.

Quamobrem, ut aliqua fiat momentorum acce&longs;&longs;io in potentiâ,
oportet vectem LM &longs;tatuere longiorem &longs;emidiametro tympani
HG: tunc enim ex Ratione longitudinis LM ad &longs;emidiame­
trum tympani, & Ratione diametri tympani CD ad diametrum
Axis AB, componitur Ratio, quæ definit momenta potentiæ;
e&longs;t &longs;cilicet Ratio motûs potentiæ ad motum ponderis.

Ex quo &longs;atis vides eatenus addi tympanum HG, quatenus
quærendus e&longs;t jumento locus, ut in gyrum circumagi valeat:
cæterum &longs;i tympanum CD cum &longs;uo Axe AB ita in &longs;uperiore
aut inferiore loco collocari atque firmari po&longs;&longs;it, ut nulli impedi-
mento &longs;it jumento in inferiore aut &longs;uperiore plano exi&longs;tenti &
circumacto, &longs;atius e&longs;t labori & &longs;umptibus parcere omi&longs;&longs;o tym­
pano HG, & circa cra&longs;&longs;iorem axem con&longs;truere curriculum EF,
cui axi opportunè adjungatur vectis LM, ut potentia ip&longs;um
curriculum immediatè convertat; erit &longs;iquidem major Ratio
ip&longs;ius vectis LM ad curriculi &longs;emidiametrum, quàm ad &longs;emi­
diametrum tympani HG; ac proinde minore conatu indige­
bit potentia, ut Curriculum cum adjacente tympano CD con­
vertat.

Non alio quàm huju&longs;modi artificio videtur u&longs;us Anonymus,
qui de Rebus Bellicis &longs;crip&longs;it ad Theodo&longs;ium Augu&longs;tum ejú&longs;­
que filios Honorium, & Arcadium Cæ&longs;ares, ubi liburnam pro­
ponit navalibus idoneam bellis, quam pro magnitudine &longs;ui virorum
exerceri manibus quodammodo imbecillitas humana prohibeat, &
quocumque utilitas vocet, ad facilitatem cursús ingenij ope &longs;ubnixa
animalium virtus impellit.

In cujus alveo, vel capacuate bini boves
machinis adjuncti, adhærentes rotas navis lateribus volvunt; qua­
rum &longs;upra ambitum vel rotunditatem extantes radij currentibus ii&longs;­
dem rotis in modum remorum aquam conatibus elidentes miro quodam
artis effectu operantur, impetu parturiente di&longs;cur&longs;um.

Hæc cadens
tamen liburna pro mole &longs;ui, próque machinis in &longs;emet operantibus
tanto virium fremitu pugnam capeßit, ut omnes adver&longs;arias libur­
nas cominùs venientes facili attritu comminuat.

Quamvis, quæ de­
mum machinæ e&longs;&longs;ent, quibus boves adjungebantur, Author
non exponat, facile tamen e&longs;t opinari boves in &longs;uperiore tabu­
lato circumacto versâ&longs;&longs;e axem carinæ perpendiculariter in­
&longs;i&longs;tentem, cui infra tabulatum rota dentata horizonti parallela
infixa e&longs;&longs;et dentes habens in alterutra tympani facie, quibus
&longs;ubinde apprehenderet virgulas curriculi in plano Verticali
convoluti, & infixi axi horizontali, qui utrumque navis latus
permearet, & in extantibus extremitatibus rotas haberet cum
palmulis prominentibus, quæ aquam in conver&longs;ione verbera­
rent.

Potuerunt autem huju&longs;modi machinæ juxta liburnæ lon­
gitudinem multiplicari, prout ip&longs;um &longs;chema ab Authore pro­
po&longs;itum exhibet.

An verò hujus liburnæ, quam in Præfatione
dicit veloci&longs;&longs;imum liburnæ genus, decem navibus ingenij magi&longs;terio
prævalere, tantus impetus, tantáque velocitas e&longs;&longs;et, ut adver&longs;a­
riæ liburnæ venientes facilè comminuerentur, di&longs;piciat lector,
cui otium fuerit, quemadmodum an no&longs;tris u&longs;ibus navalibus
artificium hoc aliquid utilitatis afferre po&longs;&longs;it.

Hinc manife&longs;ta fit illarum machinarum vis, quæ Pancratia
Glo&longs;&longs;ocoma, Chari&longs;tia, & &longs;i quod e&longs;t aliud vocabuli genus, di­
cuntur, ex plurium tympanorum complexione minorum & ma­
jorum, ita ut à minore tympano, cui manubrium additur, inci­
piat motus, & deinceps minora majoribus con&longs;equentibus mo­
tum communicent.

Quandoquidem rotula minor dentata &longs;i
comparetur cum rotâ majore, cum qua communem habet
axem, utique tardius movetur, quàm peripheria rotæ majoris,
cum qua connectitur: At verò &longs;i cum rotâ majore con&longs;equente
comparetur, cujus dentes apprehendit, utique æqualis e&longs;t ip&longs;a­
rum motûs velocitas, nam plures minoris conver&longs;iones æquales
&longs;unt uni conver&longs;ioni majoris, quam efficiunt.

Sit rota dentata
AB, cujus axi firmiter infixo additum &longs;it manubrium eju&longs;dem
rotæ &longs;emidiametri ex.

gr. quintuplum, ac propterea potentia
manubrio applicata quintuplo velociùs movetur, quàm
punctum in rotæ AB peripheriâ notatum.

Addatur rota ma­
jor BC, cujus dentes implicentur dentibus rotulæ BA: ex hu­
jus conver&longs;ione illa pariter convolvitur; &longs;ed &longs;i diameter BA &longs;it
diametri BC &longs;ubtripla, ter rotula BA volvitur, ut rota BC
compleat integram conver&longs;ionem, ac proinde potentia quin­
tuplo velociùs movetur, quàm rota BC.

Rota hæc major &longs;ibi
connexam habeat in eodem axe minorem SD, quæ apprehen­
dat dentes &longs;ecundæ majoris rotæ DE; quæ &longs;imiliter in eodem
axe conjunctam habeat minorem FR: hujus dentes mor-
deant peripheriam tertiæ majoris rotæ FG, in qua e&longs;t Axis
IH, ex cujus convolutione ductarius funis LO trahit
pondus.

Ut potentiæ momenta habeantur, ejus motum cum ponderis
motu collatum ad calculos revoca componendo Rationes, quas
&longs;ingulæ majores rotæ ad &longs;uas minores habent quo ad diame­
trum.

Quare &longs;i manubrium ad &longs;emidiametrum rotulæ AB ha­
beat Rationem quintuplam, diameter BC ad diametrum SD
triplam, DE ad RF item triplam, & FG ad IH &longs;imiliter tri­
plam, compo&longs;itis tribus Rationibus triplis cum Ratione quin­
tuplâ, oritur Ratio 135 ad 1: atque adeò ut po&longs;trema rota FG
& cum eâ Axis IH &longs;emel volvatur, prima rotula AB facit 27
conver&longs;iones; potentia autem manubrio applicata movetur
quintuplo velociùs quàm &longs;uæ rotæ AB peripheria; igitur pon­
deris motus ad motum potentiæ e&longs;t ut 1 ad 135. Porrò fieri 27
conver&longs;iones manubrij apertè con&longs;tat, quia hoc ter volvi po­
nitur, ut rota BC, atque adeò etiam SD illi connexa, &longs;emel
convolvatur: & quia ex hypothe&longs;i rotula SD tres conver&longs;io­
nes habet, ut toti peripheriæ rotæ DE congruat, manubrium
novies in gyrum agitur, ut rota major DE & minor RF &longs;emel
convertatur: demum quia pariter ex hypothe&longs;i rota minor RF
triplici convolutione indiget, ut toti peripheriæ rotæ majoris
FG re&longs;pondeat, ut hæc unicam circuitionem perficiat, viginti
&longs;eptem manubrij conver&longs;ionibus opus e&longs;t.

Quare momentum
Potentiæ manubrio applicatæ comparatæ cum rotulâ AB e&longs;t
ut 5, cum &longs;equenti rotulâ SD ut 15, cum rotulâ RF ut 45,
cum Axe IH ut 135.

Ne verò artifex huju&longs;modi rotas dentatas majores atque mi­
nores parare ju&longs;&longs;us inutili demùm labore &longs;e torqueat, monendus
e&longs;t, ut animum diligenter advertat, utrùm omnes majores ro­
tas, item omnes minores, inter &longs;e æquales &longs;tatuere velit, an in­
æquales; ex hoc enim ip&longs;arum rotarum collocationem definiet,
ne &longs;ibi vici&longs;&longs;im impedimento &longs;int.

Finge enim rotulas DS &
FR æquales e&longs;&longs;e, item majores BC & DE, atque alterno or­
dine po&longs;itas, ita ut &longs;i rotula DS fuerit in parte anteriore &longs;uæ
rotæ BC, vici&longs;&longs;im rotula FR &longs;it in parte aversâ rotæ DE:
quemadmodum dentes minoris DS implicantur dentibus
majoris DE, ita pariter dentes majoris BC implicantur
dentibus minores FR: igitur unica conver&longs;io majoris rotæ
BC ter convolveret minorem rotam FR: atqui cum minore
rotâ FR &longs;imul converteretur major DE in eodem axe; igitur
dum &longs;emel converteretur major rota BC, ter convolveretur
rota major DE: hoc autem omnino fieri nequit, quia unica ro­
tæ BC conver&longs;io e&longs;t etiam unica conver&longs;io rotulæ minoris DS,
hujus autem unica conver&longs;io re&longs;pondet &longs;olùm tertiæ parti con­
ver&longs;ionis majoris rotæ DE: plurimum igitur abe&longs;t à trinâ con­
ver&longs;ione.

Quare &longs;i huju&longs;modi æqualitas intercederet tùm inter
majores, tùm inter minores rotas dentatas, oporteret minores
rotas ad eandem partem re&longs;picere, ne rota major con&longs;equenti
minori rotæ motum ullum communicare po&longs;&longs;it.

Verùm hoc
forta&longs;&longs;e alicui videatur incommodum, quod non ita aptè in &longs;uo
loculamento huju&longs;modi rotæ collocari valeant, &longs;i rotarum ma­
jorum con&longs;equentium plana &longs;uperimponantur planis antece­
dentium; id quod exigit ip&longs;a minorum rotularum po&longs;itio, &longs;i
omnes partem eandem re&longs;piciant.

Propterea inæquales fiant
rotæ ita, ut alternatim po&longs;itæ minores rotulæ occurrant qui­
dem &longs;ingulæ peripheriæ con&longs;equentis majoris, non attingantur
autem à dentibus majoris rotæ antecedentis: hoc enim pacto
in &longs;uo loculamento pre&longs;&longs;iùs firmantur, & &longs;unt qua&longs;i duo plana
parallela, in quibus hinc rota minor inter duas majores, hinc
verò rota major inter duas minores con&longs;picitur.

Porrò minore, rotæ in eodem axe cum majoribus dupliciter
di&longs;poni po&longs;&longs;unt: primùm ut major rota minori proxima &longs;it, &
earum plana &longs;e contingant; deinde ut aliquo inter &longs;e ab&longs;int in­
tervallo.

Si minor majori cohæreat, &longs;uaderem minores rotas ex
lamina paulò cra&longs;&longs;iore fieri quàm majores; &longs;ic enim in locula­
mento ita di&longs;ponuntur, ut plana majorum &longs;e omninò non con­
tingant, ac proinde nullus &longs;it partium &longs;e vici&longs;&longs;im terentium con­
flictus, qui moram inferat motui.

Sin autem quæ in eodem axe
&longs;unt rotæ, major & minor invicem di&longs;tent, nullum quidem &longs;ub­
e&longs;t periculum ex mutuo affrictu majorum, verùm cavendum
e&longs;t, ne axis longior, quàm par fuerit, etiam &longs;it infirmior; &longs;i ni­
mirum axis longioris extremitates loculamento infixæ volvan­
tur.

Propterea aliter etiam di&longs;poni po&longs;&longs;unt, ita ut loculamentum
validi&longs;&longs;imum &longs;it, nec fractioni obnoxium, & facilè ex alio in
alium locum transferri valeat.

Parentur axes rotundi, &longs;ed utra-
que extremitas quadrata &longs;it, ut in&longs;eratur quadrato foramini,
quod rotarum centro ine&longs;t: tum tigni pars accipiatur cra&longs;&longs;itu­
dinis tantæ, ut congruis foraminibus rotundi, excipiat axium
rotunditatem, extantibus hinc atque hinc extremitatibus qua­
dratis.

Deinde quadratas axis extremitates excipiant rotæ den­
tatæ alterno ordine, ut qua parte prior axis habet rotam majo­
rem, &longs;ecundus axis habet rotam minorem, & vici&longs;&longs;im ille in op­
po&longs;itâ tigni parte habeat rotam minorem, hic majorem; illud
&longs;emper præcavendo, ne rota minor &longs;ecundi axis contingat pe­
ripheriam rotæ majoris primi axis; id quod fiet, &longs;i po&longs;teriores
rotæ majores etiam paulò majorem &longs;emidiametrum habeant.

Relinquitur autem artificis indu&longs;triæ ita foraminum extremi­
tates munire, ut nec axes ultrò citròque commeare valeant,
rotis ip&longs;is illos coërcentibus, nec nimio affrictu tigni faciem
rotæ circumactæ terant, interjecto inter tignum & rotam exiguo
circulo, cum quo tritus omnis atque conflictus exerceatur.

Quamvis autem tria tantummodo tympana dentata præter
primam rotulam manubrio affixam, brevitatis gratiâ, exami­
nanda propo&longs;uerim, plura, & plura &longs;imilia addi po&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t mani­
fe&longs;tum, adeò ut omni arrogantiæ notâ vacent magnificæ illæ
Mechanicorum propo&longs;itiones, quibus &longs;e quodcumque etiam
immane pondus moturos &longs;pondent, immò tellurem ip&longs;am, &longs;i lo­
cus daretur &longs;tatuendæ machinæ idoneus.

Illud tamen incom­
modum vitari nullatenus pote&longs;t, quod ex ponderis tarditate ori­
tur: quî enim fieri po&longs;&longs;it, ut gravitatis re&longs;i&longs;tentia ex motûs tar­
ditate minuatur, quin multo tempore opus &longs;it ad pondus mo­
vendum?

Idcirco unâ eadémque operâ, qua potentiæ momen­
ta inquiris componendo Rationes, quas majora tympana ha­
bent ad minora &longs;ibi adjuncta, etiam motûs tarditatem notam fa­
cis; ac proinde con&longs;tituto intra certam temporis men&longs;uram po­
tentiæ motu, innote&longs;cit ponderis motus, quem eodem tempo­
re perficit.

Fac e&longs;&longs;e decem Rationes quintuplas, quæ compo­
nendæ &longs;unt, &longs;i manubrium ad &longs;uæ rotulæ &longs;emidiametrum ha­
beat Rationem quintuplam, & &longs;imilis &longs;it Ratio majorum ad &longs;ua
minora tympana.

Motus potentiæ manubrio applicatæ e&longs;t ad
motum ponderis ut 9.765625 ad 1: tot igitur &longs;patij pedes itera­
tis revolutionibus confici à potentiâ nece&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t, ut pondus pe­
dem unum percurrat.

Quod &longs;i potentiam tantâ velocitate mo-
veri ponamus, ut horis &longs;ingulis pedum quindecim millia per­
currat, indigebit horis (651 1/24), hoc e&longs;t diebus 27, horis 3. min.
2 1/2, ut pondus à loco in locum pedis unius intervallo di&longs;tan­
tem transferat: atque ideò quis tantâ oculorum acie polleat, ut
ponderis motum digno&longs;cat, ni&longs;i po&longs;t aliquot horas?

quando­
quidem unius horæ &longs;patio vix unius unciæ partem quinquage­
&longs;imam quartam perficit, &longs;cilicet (1/651) pedis.

Verùm tam immane
pondus, quod ad gravitatem re&longs;pondentem potentiæ machinâ
de&longs;titutæ &longs;it ut 9. 765625 ad 1, movere, licet tardi&longs;&longs;imè, &longs;atius
e&longs;t, quàm nullo pacto movere.

Ex his liquet, quid contingat, &longs;i potentiæ & ponderis loca
ita commutentur, ut potentia extremo tympano applicetur,
pondus verò movendum primæ rotulæ axi aut manubrio re&longs;­
pondeat; exiguus enim validioris potentiæ motus veloci&longs;&longs;imè
movet pondus, motúmque diu continuat; ut palam e&longs;t in au­
tomatis horas indicantibus, &longs;ive potentia movens &longs;it vis ela&longs;ti­
ca laminæ chalybeæ inflexæ, &longs;ivè gravitas ponderis axem ma­
ximæ rotæ volvens; ni&longs;i enim Tempus alternis motibus objice­
ret rotæ &longs;erratæ dentibus &longs;ui fu&longs;i pinnulas, quæ moram infer­
rent, rota ip&longs;a &longs;errata veloci&longs;&longs;imè volveretur.

Sed quoniam ra­
rò contingit validi&longs;&longs;imam potentiam adhibere, ut leve pondus
moveatur, propterea non e&longs;t frequens huju&longs;modi locorum
commutatio inter pondus & potentiam: u&longs;um tamen aliquan­
do habere po&longs;&longs;et in rebus &longs;cenicis, maximè &longs;i æquabilis e&longs;&longs;e de­
beat motus; gravitas enim, quæ per unius aut alterius palmi
&longs;patium de&longs;cendat, non acquirit in motu notabile aliquod velo­
citatis incrementum, atque idcirco æquabilis apparet motus
tam ip&longs;ius gravitatis de&longs;cendentis, quàm ponderis illius virtu­
te a&longs;cendentis: hoc &longs;i non rectâ &longs;ur&longs;um trahatur, &longs;ed circum­
agatur, forta&longs;&longs;e impre&longs;&longs;us impetus velociorem circumvolutio­
nem efficere po&longs;&longs;it.

Quod demum ad ip&longs;os rotarum dentes attinet, &longs;ingulæ qui­
dem rotæ à &longs;uis dentibus in partes æquales tribuuntur; &longs;ed hal­
lucinati videntur non pauci fru&longs;tra requirentes in omnibus ro­
tis invicem comparatis dentium æqualitatem, & ex dentium
numero potentiæ momenta metientes; qua&longs;i &longs;ervari nequiret
eadem momentorum Ratio, etiam&longs;i minoris tympani dentes
non omninò &longs;imiles e&longs;&longs;ent, aut ut veriùs loquar, &longs;inguli non
e&longs;&longs;ent æquales &longs;ingulis dentibus majoris tympani in eodem axe
exi&longs;tentis.

Dentium æqualitas in iis tantummodo rotis requiri­
tur, quæ &longs;ibi mutuâ collabellatione cohærentes in convolutione
dentem dentibus implicant; ni&longs;i enim ab unius rotæ dentium
intervallis alterius dentes &longs;ubinde reciperentur, fieri non po&longs;­
&longs;et utriu&longs;que rotæ conver&longs;io.

Cæterùm nil prohibet, quomi­
nùs in plurium majorum tympanorum complexione alia rario­
res, alia &longs;pi&longs;&longs;iores dentes habeant, dummodo &longs;ingulis majori­
bus &longs;ingula minora, à quibus illa motum recipiunt, re&longs;pondeant
&longs;imilibus dentibus in&longs;tructa, etiam&longs;i hi di&longs;&longs;imiles &longs;int dentibus
tympani in eodem axe connexi.

Si enim prioris majoris tym­
pani peripheria &longs;it in dentes 24 di&longs;tributa, minoris autem tym­
pani eidem axi infixi peripheria &longs;ex dentes habeat, &longs;ed eorum
diametri &longs;int ut 3 ad 2, utique eorum motus non aliam habent
Rationem quàm &longs;e&longs;quialteram, licèt dentium numeri &longs;int in
Ratione quadruplâ.

Idem planè dicendum de &longs;ecundo tympa­
no majore, quod ad prioris motum convolvitur; hujus enim
motus pariter comparandus e&longs;t cum motu tympani minoris &longs;ibi
coniuncti &longs;pectatâ diametrorum Ratione, non dentium multi­
tudine, ut momenta innote&longs;cant.

Quare illæ dentium multi­
tudines invicem comparatæ &longs;atis quidem faciunt quærenti,
quoties potentia manubrium circumagat, ut &longs;emel convertatur
Axis, quem ductarius funis complectitur; &longs;ed quibus momen­
tis id perficiat ip&longs;a potentia, &longs;ola diametrorum Ratio &longs;pectata
indicabit.

Sed hìc ubi diametrorum incidit mentio (quamquam res
Mechanicæ in praxim deductæ tantâ &longs;ubtilitate non indigeant)
non e&longs;t di&longs;&longs;imulandum aliquam nece&longs;&longs;ariò intercedere momen­
torum inæqualitatem in ip&longs;o motu, quando tympanorum am­
bitus e&longs;t dentium inci&longs;uris a&longs;peratus: cum enim extremi den­
tium apices à centro magis ab&longs;int, quàm anguli, in quibus &longs;ibi
dentes occurrunt, non e&longs;t utrobique eadem movendi fa­
cultas, quippe quæ in majore à centro di&longs;tantiâ validior
e&longs;t, cæteris paribus.

Eatenus &longs;cilicet rota rotam urget, qua­
tenus rota movens &longs;ui dentis apice contingit faciem den­
tis rotæ, quæ movetur: hic autem contactus primùm fit
propè angulum, hoc e&longs;t minùs procul à centro, & &longs;en-
&longs;im dens rotæ moventis &longs;uo apice excurrens versùs extre­
mitatem dentis rotæ, quæ movetur, magis recedit à cen­
tro.

Cum igitur rota movens &longs;uam vim exerceat apice den­
tis, integra &longs;emper illius diameter aut &longs;emidiameter con&longs;i­
deranda e&longs;t; at rota, quæ urgetur, cum non in eodem
puncto recipiat moventis impul&longs;ionem, non e&longs;t ab&longs;olu­
tè attendenda integra illius diameter aut &longs;emidiameter,
&longs;ed potiùs mediocris quædam inter maximam & mini­
mam à centro di&longs;tantiam eligenda e&longs;t, ut alter Rationis
terminus habeatur.

Ex quo vides (&longs;i res &longs;ubtiliter elime­
tur) non parum intere&longs;&longs;e, utrùm minor rota majorem ur­
geat, an è contrario major minorem propellat.

Concipe
enim majoris rotæ integram &longs;emidiametrum e&longs;&longs;e particula­
rum 100, & talem e&longs;&longs;e dentium inci&longs;uram, ut angulus,
in quo ip&longs;i dentes coëunt, di&longs;tet à centro particulis 94:
rotæ autem minoris, quæ &longs;uos dentes illius dentibus impli­
cat, &longs;emidiameter integra &longs;it &longs;imilium particularum 20, &
angulus concursûs dentium di&longs;tet à centro particulis 14. Uti­
que &longs;i minor majorem urgeat illius Radius e&longs;t ut 20, hu­
jus verò e&longs;t ut 97: contra autem &longs;i major pellat minorem
illius Radius e&longs;t ut 100, hujus ut 17. Quare &longs;ingulæ com­
paratæ cum iis, quæ &longs;ecum communem habent axem, di­
ver&longs;am con&longs;tituunt Rationem: &longs;i enim major rota urgea­
tur à minore &longs;ibi proximâ, adeò ut &longs;ecunda minor movea­
tur ad motum majoris in eodem axe, & Ratio &longs;it ut 20 ad
97, &longs;i majore proximâ urgente minorem moveretur major
ad motum minoris in eodem axe, hujus minoris motus ad
motum &longs;uæ majoris non e&longs;&longs;et pariter ut 20 ad 97, &longs;ed ut 17
ad 100, quæ e&longs;t minor Ratio.
CAPUT VII.

Mole&longs;trinarum artificium ex Axe in Peritrochio
pendet.

ARtificia omnia, quæ ex Axe in Peritrochio pendent, re­
cen&longs;ere res e&longs;&longs;et non quidem injucunda, &longs;ed penè infi­
niti laboris, hi&longs;toriam potiùs redolens, quàm theoriam, cui
poti&longs;&longs;imùm in&longs;ervio Machinarum fontes indicans, ex quibus
ingenio&longs;us qui&longs;que Machinas &longs;uo in&longs;tituto opportunas moliri
queat.

Placuit tamen in Molendinorum artificio pauli&longs;per im­
morari, ut quam uberem ab Axe in Peritrochio utilitatem ad
vitæ commoda percipiamus, innote&longs;cat.

Quamvis autem po­
ti&longs;&longs;imùm in&longs;tituta &longs;int molendina ad comminuendum triticum
& alia &longs;emina, ut ex farinâ panis conficiatur, ad alios tamen
u&longs;us pars eorum aliqua de&longs;tinatur: omnibus quippe communis
e&longs;t rota exterior, quam aqua incurrens ver&longs;at, & Axis, qui
convolvitur.

Si enim tundenda &longs;it lana, aut Cannabis; &longs;i in
pollinem redigenda elementa pulveris pyrij carbo, &longs;ulphur,
nitrum; &longs;i antiqua linteorum re&longs;egmina conterenda, & in mi­
nimas particulas di&longs;&longs;ipanda ad conficiendam chartam, Axi in­
fixæ &longs;unt pinnulæ, quæ in conver&longs;ione occurrentes alis pi&longs;til­
lorum illos elevant, atque dimittunt, & eorum gravitate reci­
dente &longs;ubjecta materia aut contunditur, aut conteritur.

Nec di&longs;&longs;imili methodo di&longs;poni po&longs;&longs;ent pi&longs;tilli &longs;uis embolis
congruentes, qui à pinnulis Axis elevati aquam in embolum
attraherent, aut &longs;ponte irruentem admitterent per a&longs;&longs;arium,
tùm dimi&longs;&longs;i vi &longs;uæ gravitatis aquam exprimerent per tubum,
& in altiorem locum a&longs;cendere cogerent.

Vel &longs;i non adeò gra­
ves pi&longs;tillos parare placuerit, velí&longs;que certiùs aquam in altio­
rem locum pellere, di&longs;pone binos pi&longs;tillos fune, aut catenâ,
per excavatum rotæ &longs;uperiùs po&longs;itæ ambitum tran&longs;eunte con­
nexos, aut potiùs tran&longs;ver&longs;ario, qua&longs;i libræ jugo conjunctos,
ita ut altero depre&longs;&longs;o alter elevetur, pinnula autem Axis de-
primat pi&longs;tillum, vi cujus aqua in tubum a&longs;cendentem expri­
matur, & alter pi&longs;tillus attollatur aquam inferiùs po&longs;itam at­
trahens, qui pariter ab Axis pinnulâ ejus alæ re&longs;pondente &longs;ub­
inde deprimatur.

Hinc fit po&longs;&longs;e longiorem Axem addi rotæ,
& plura huju&longs;modi pi&longs;tillorum paria di&longs;poni pinnulis in ambi­
tu Axis ita di&longs;tributis, ut non plures &longs;imul pi&longs;tillos, &longs;ed &longs;ingu­
los unum po&longs;t alium premant, &longs;i non adeò valida fuerit poten­
tia rotam ver&longs;ans; Sin autem validior illa fuerit, plures &longs;imul
deprimant, ií&longs;que conjugatos attollant.

Ni&longs;i fortè magis arri­
&longs;erit duobus tantummodo pi&longs;tillis conjugatis uti, tot pinnulis
in Axe di&longs;po&longs;itis, ut in unâ eju&longs;dem Axis conver&longs;ione bis aut
ter pi&longs;tillus idem deprimatur.

Huc pariter &longs;pectant, quæ pa&longs;&longs;im videre e&longs;t in officinis mal­
leatorum cupri aut ferri, ubi & rota exterior vi aquæ labentis
circumacta interiùs in conclavi qua&longs;i manubrium convolvit,
quod &longs;uperiori Axi horizonti parallelo infixum Radium, &longs;ibí­
que regulâ in juncturis plicatili connexum, dum attollit, at­
que deprimit, in alterâ eju&longs;dem Axis extremitate tran&longs;ver&longs;a­
rium hinc pariter attollens atque hinc deprimens follibus alter­
num motum conciliat: Et rota alia validiorem aquæ deciden­
tis impetum recipiens, &longs;uúmque Axem convolvens, pinnulis
axi infixis extremitatem alteram deprimit tigilli, cujus oppo&longs;i­
tæ extremitati elevatæ cohæret ingens ferreus malleus, qui præ­
terlapsä Axis pinnulâ &longs;ponte recidens tundit &longs;ubjectum cuprum
aut ferrum ignitum.

In his omnibus rotæ quidem &longs;emidiameter attendenda e&longs;t,
in cujus extantes palmulas aqua incurrens vim potentiæ mo­
ventis obtinet; &longs;ed Axis &longs;emidiameter non &longs;olitariè accipienda
e&longs;t, verùm & addenda prominentis pinnulæ longitudo, ita ut
ex utrâque conficiatur unica &longs;emidiameter motûs, qui commu­
nicatur pi&longs;tillo, aut depre&longs;&longs;æ extremitati mallei.

Depre&longs;&longs;æ, in­
quam, extremitati mallei, nam mallei elevatio aliquanto major
e&longs;t, quam illa depre&longs;&longs;io, ut validior ictus &longs;equatur; neque enim
tigillus à &longs;uo axe, cui innititur, omnino æqualiter dividitur,
&longs;ed ab eo aliquantulo remotior e&longs;t malleus, quàm oppo&longs;ita ex­
tremitas, quæ deprimitur: ac proinde vis illam deprimens ma­
jor e&longs;t, quàm &longs;i tigillus in partes æquales di&longs;tingueretur.

Simi­
liter in follium motu primùm comparanda e&longs;t rotæ &longs;emidiame-
ter cum adhærente manubrio, deinde Radius Axi &longs;uperiori in­
fixus comparandus e&longs;t cum &longs;emi&longs;&longs;e tran&longs;ver&longs;arij, cui folles jun­
guntur; & ex his duabus Rationibus componitur Ratio mo­
mentorum potentiæ ad momenta ponderis movendi.

At verò in molendinis, quibus mola frumentaria plano ho­
rizontali parallela circumagenda e&longs;t, & quidem velociter, ut
granum in farinam di&longs;&longs;olvatur, non &longs;atis e&longs;t exterior rota aquæ
impetum recipiens & Axem &longs;ibi infixum volvens, &longs;ed etiam in­
terior rota denticulata in eodem Axe requiritur; & ne Machi­
næ membra fru&longs;trà multiplicentur, ita molares lapides com­
muniter di&longs;ponuntur, ut ferreus axis metam &longs;u&longs;tinens, & cur­
riculo in&longs;tructus, inferiorem locum obtineat, ac proinde cur­
riculus ip&longs;e proximè attingat &longs;uperiorem partem interioris rotæ
in &longs;uo plano denticulatæ eundem cum exteriore rotâ axem ha­
bentis.

Quod &longs;i molares lapides collocari non po&longs;&longs;int in plano,
infra vel &longs;upra quod volvatur rota interior denticulata, &longs;ed &longs;o­
lùm paulò infra, aut &longs;upra axem eju&longs;dem rotæ; quia Vertebra
&longs;triata proximè molari lapidi cohærens; adeóque lapidem ip&longs;um
volvens, di&longs;tat, à rotâ denticulatâ, hæc autem commodè non
admittit tam longos dentes, qui eju&longs;dem Vertebræ aut curri­
culi virgulis aptè commi&longs;ceri valeant, propterea exigitur alius
Axis horizonti perpendicularis curriculo & rotæ infixus, quem
convertat rota interior curriculi hujus virgulas &longs;uis dentibus
impellens; &longs;imul enim rota dentata horizonti parallela, eidem
Axi perpendicularis infixa volvitur, & curriculum molæ con­
junctum circumagit.

Hìc quoque plures Rationes componendæ &longs;unt; prima e&longs;t
Ratio diametri rotæ exterioris ad diametrum rotæ interioris in
eodem axe; deinde Ratio diametri curriculi molæ adhærentis
ad ip&longs;ius molæ circumactæ diametrum (&longs;ive integra diameter
accipienda &longs;it, &longs;ive illa tantum pars, quæ e&longs;t diameter circuli
in rotatione molæ de&longs;cripti à puncto inter centrum & periphe­
riam intermedio) & &longs;i, ut in &longs;ecundo ca&longs;u, interjectus fuerit
Axis perpendicularis, prætereà in compo&longs;itionem venit Ratio
diametri curriculi ad diametrum rotæ denticulatæ in eodem
Axe perpendiculari.

Ex quibus apparet præ&longs;tare rotæ interio­
ris diametrum minorem e&longs;&longs;e diametro rotæ exterioris, ut aquæ
hanc impellentis momenta validiora &longs;int: &longs;ed & cavendum, ne
illa ita minor &longs;tatuatur, ut ejus dentium numerus vix excedat
numerum virgularum curriculi molæ adhærentis, hæc enim
nimis tardè moveretur; & &longs;i intermedius fuerit Axis perpen­
dicularis, po&longs;itâ hac dentium æqualitate & virgularum cur­
riculi, unica rotæ exterioris conver&longs;io &longs;emel tantùm con­
volveret rotam denticulatam horizonti parallelam, atque
idcirco eodem tempore mola toties &longs;olùm converteretur,
quoties numerus virgularum ejus curriculi contineretur in
numero dentium rotæ denticulatæ infixæ Axi perpendi­
culari.

Ut autem convolutionem molæ numerum augeas, cave ne
movendi difficultas pariter plus ju&longs;to augeatur, &longs;i nimirum
in axe perpendiculari diameter curriculi &longs;it immodicè mi­
nor diametro rotæ denticulatæ in eodem axe: potentia &longs;i
quidem curriculo applicata multo tardiùs moveretur, quàm
pondus extremis rotæ dentibus applicatum, ac proinde mo­
vendi difficultas augeretur.

Quare omnia prudenter admi­
ni&longs;tranda, ut neque potentiæ moventis vires fru&longs;tra con­
terantur, neque mola tardiùs aut velociùs, quàm par &longs;it,
moveatur.

Quod &longs;i non placuerit, aut loci di&longs;po&longs;itio non tulerit,
axem illum intermedium &longs;tatui perpendicularem, &longs;ed hori­
zonti parallelus commodior accidat, tunc rotæ interioris
eundem cum exteriore rotâ axem habentis dentes non pla­
no infixi, &longs;ed in extremo ambitu defixi requiruntur, ut &longs;u­
perioris axis curriculum (&longs;ive majorem, &longs;ive minorem, prout
opus fuerit) convertant, & cum eo rotam non in ambitu, &longs;ed
in plano, denticulatam, à qua molæ curriculus convolvatur.

Neque aliter, ac priùs, momentorum Ratio componitur, ex
Rationibus videlicet tympanorum, quæ communem Axem
habent, ut &longs;atis con&longs;tat ex dictis.

Hinc quoniam potentia movens e&longs;t aqua, ob&longs;ervamus non
omnino eandem e&longs;&longs;e forman rotæ aquam excipientis; quæ
enim in profluente collocantur rotæ, nimis incommodæ e&longs;­
&longs;ent, &longs;i valdè amplam diametrum haberent; aut modico aquæ
labentis impetu pellerentur, &longs;i palmulis exiguis in&longs;truerentur:
propterea rotæ huju&longs;modi mediocrem quidem habent diame-
trum, &longs;ed valdè notabilem axis partem occupant palmulis
adeò juxtà axis longitudinem expan&longs;is, ut à multâ aquâ in
illas incurrente validiore impul&longs;u circumagantur.

Sic in Pa­
do communiter Rotæ hujus longitudo e&longs;t cubitorum 10,
diameter tota cubitorum 6; interior rota diametrum habet
cubit.
