5 1/2, dentes 108 plano infixos, & molæ curriculus in
fu&longs;os 9 di&longs;tinguitur; lapis autem molaris in cra&longs;&longs;itudine nu­
merat uncias 6 aut 7, in diametro cubitos 2 1/2. Quia ve­
rò aquæ ex alto cadentis motus major e&longs;t quàm profluen­
tis, propterea rotarum diameter amplior &longs;tatui pote&longs;t, &longs;i
opus fuerit, & palmularum latitudo valde mediocris &longs;uffi­
cit, quippe inclu&longs;a canali, per quem aqua decidens labi­
tur: modica &longs;cilicet aqua per planum magis elevatum pro­
lap&longs;a majora habet momenta, quàm per planum ferè ho­
rizontale: & præterea rota amplioris diametri faciliùs vol­
vitur etiam à minore aquâ, nam ad interiorem rotam,
cæteris paribus, habet majorem Rationem.

Porrò palmu­
læ communiter quidem planæ &longs;unt, aut non ni&longs;i mo­
dicè &longs;inuatæ, ita ut aqua hinc atque hinc diffluat; ali­
quando tamen limbo ex utraque parte concluduntur, &
qua&longs;i va&longs;cula aquam aliquandiu continent, ut ip&longs;ius aquæ
inclu&longs;æ gravitas conver&longs;ionem juvet deor&longs;um urgendo.

Ad­
de in ip&longs;o canali inclinato majores e&longs;&longs;e vires aquæ in parte
inferiore, quàm in &longs;uperiore propè initium casûs; quia vide­
licet aqua naturaliter de&longs;cendens motum habet acceleratum,
& ex antecedente de&longs;cen&longs;u acqui&longs;ivit impetum.

Hactenus Molendina, quæ aquarum vi aguntur con&longs;ide­
ravimus, nihil addentes de iis, quæ ab hominibus, aut ab
animalibus volvuntur, nihil enim hæc habent peculiare præ­
terquàm quod axis primæ rotæ, quæ cæteris con&longs;equentibus
membris motum conciliat, e&longs;t horizonti perpendicularis, quia
potentia faciliùs in plano horizontali movetur, quàm in tym­
pano Verticali, quod calcaretur, & loco exterioris rotæ ab
aquâ propul&longs;æ vectis axi infigitur, quem aut jumenta trahunt,
aut homines urgent.

Aliquid tamen innuendum de Molendinis, quæ vento
aguntur, &longs;ive ad comminuendas fruges, &longs;ive etiam ad agi-
tandas antlias, quibus aquæ depre&longs;&longs;ioribus campis, in&longs;iden­
tes exhauriuntur.

Quod enim attinet ad interius artificium
rotarum & curriculorum, &longs;imillimum e&longs;t iis, quæ in no&longs;tra­
tibus molendinis aquâ urgente commotis reperiuntur, ni&longs;i
quod in illis, ut pote à &longs;ubjectâ planitie remotis (locus &longs;i­
quidem amplo ventilabro opportunus tribuendus e&longs;t, & cap­
tandus ventus) per &longs;calas a&longs;cenditur, & in &longs;uperiorem lo­
cum comportandæ &longs;unt fruges, quas commolere oportet,
atque farina inde transferenda: quo labore levari pote&longs;t
molitor, &longs;i operâ eâdem, qua ventus axem primarium cum
rotis ver&longs;at, &longs;accos tritico aut farinâ plenos attollat, aut de­
ponat, fune ductario circa ip&longs;um Axem convoluto, aut evo­
luto.

Illud poti&longs;&longs;imum in hoc molendinorum genere atten­
dendum e&longs;t, quod ad ip&longs;a flabella, quibus ventus excipi­
tur, &longs;pectat; neque enim quemadmodum juxta aquæ cur­
&longs;um rotæ planum dirigitur, etiam ventilabrum flabella habet
ita di&longs;po&longs;ita, ut venti ductum &longs;equantur: &longs;ed &longs;uperior do­
munculæ pars, qua Axis cum rotâ denticulatâ continetur,
u&longs;que adeò convertitur, ut ventilabrum flanti vento adver­
&longs;um &longs;tatuatur.

Sunt autem flabella qua&longs;i quatuor &longs;calæ in primarij Axis
extremitate conjunctæ, quibus obducitur &longs;ingulis linteum,
ut vento re&longs;i&longs;tat; qui &longs;i ju&longs;to validior fuerit, lintei pars
complicata aliquem vento exitum præbet.

Non tamen fla­
bella hæc ita ex æquo collocantur, ut in uno eodémque pla­
no Verticali con&longs;tituantur, &longs;ed &longs;ingulorum flabellorum pla­
num modicè obliquum &longs;tatuitur latere altero &longs;e paulatim &longs;ub­
ducente à vento.

Ex quo fit ventum inter quatuor flabel­
lorum intervalla intercurrentem repellere in latus, & qua&longs;i
cubito percutere ip&longs;a flabella, atque adeò Axem converti
juxta flabellorum inclinationem.

Nam &longs;i nulla e&longs;&longs;et flabel­
lorum obliquitas, & omnia qua&longs;i unicum planum efficerent,
in quod Axis e&longs;&longs;et perpendicularis, incertum e&longs;&longs;et, quam
in partem fieret conver&longs;io.

Quod ad latitudinem aut longi­
tudinem huju&longs;modi flabellorum obliquè po&longs;itorum attinet,
non dubitatur, quin eorum latitudo maximè juvet motum;
quia eâdem obliquitate po&longs;itâ, major aëris pars incurrit in
amplius quàm in &longs;trictius linteum; & in vehementiori ven­
to, ne nimia &longs;it machinæ velocitas, experimur aliquando
non ni&longs;i dimidium velum expandi.

An verò fuerit operæ
pretium horum longitudinem augere, incertum e&longs;t: quam­
vis enim potentia magis à centro motûs di&longs;tans plus habeat
momenti, tamen quia longiorum flabellorum extremitates
valde inter &longs;e di&longs;tarent, ventus ampliora &longs;patia nactus mi­
nus haberet virium; &longs;icut & aqua fluens, velociùs atque
majore conatu per angu&longs;tias, quàm per patentem alveum
currit.

Propterea in huju&longs;modi flabellis non auderem omni­
no definire, quo loco potentiæ moventis vires &longs;tatuendæ
&longs;int qua&longs;i in centro virtutis; nam prope Axem, cui infixa
&longs;unt, modica e&longs;t di&longs;tantia, & ventus qua&longs;i eorum objectu
compre&longs;&longs;us velociùs &longs;pirat, procul autem ab Axe in majo­
re intervallo faciliùs elabens minùs incitat cur&longs;um.

Cum
verò non &longs;it temerè &longs;tatuendum venti compre&longs;&longs;ionem om­
nino re&longs;pondere mutuis flabellorum di&longs;tantiis, quæ in eâ­
dem Ratione &longs;unt ac di&longs;tantiæ ab Axe; neque facilè a&longs;&longs;eri
pote&longs;t eâdem Ratione decre&longs;cere vim venti ex compre&longs;&longs;io­
ne, qua eju&longs;dem momenta cre&longs;cunt ex di&longs;tantiâ ab Axe:
Ex quo fieret momenta compo&longs;ita ex di&longs;tantia ab Axe,
& ex vi compre&longs;&longs;ionis, e&longs;&longs;e per totam flabelli longitudi­
nem æqualiter diffu&longs;a, ac proinde in mediâ longitudine e&longs;­
&longs;e Centrum virtutis moventis.

Omnibus tamen ritè per­
pen&longs;is, exi&longs;timarem centrum hoc virtutis, cui applicata
potentia intelligitur, haud procul abe&longs;&longs;e à mediâ fibelli lon­
gitudine: Ni&longs;i fortè flabella ip&longs;a talia e&longs;&longs;ent, ut eorum la­
titudo ab Axe recedens augeretur; &longs;ic enim diminutâ in
extremitatibus flabellorum di&longs;tantiâ, etiam venti compre&longs;&longs;io
augeretur.

Quod &longs;i occurrendum putares incommodo, quod &longs;ubire
nece&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t ædiculam polo innixam ita convertendo, ut fla­
bella adver&longs;um ventum excipiant, haud abs re e&longs;&longs;e duce­
rem, &longs;i quis in &longs;upremo domûs fa&longs;tigio, loco patente &
ventis omnibus expo&longs;ito, cra&longs;&longs;um &longs;atí&longs;que validum axem ho­
rizonti perpendicularem &longs;tatueret, quem rota denticulata
horizonti parallela complecteretur, ex cujus conver&longs;ione de-
mum mola circumageretur.

At flabellorum latitudo juxta
Axis longitudinem in eju&longs;dem &longs;upremo capite extra tectum
collocanda e&longs;&longs;et, ut incurrentis venti impul&longs;­um exciperent,
perindè atque fluentis aquæ impetum recipiunt palmulæ ro­
tarum.

Sed quoniam plana flabella parùm apta videntur ad
conver&longs;ionem continuandam, quia, quæ &longs;unt à diametro
oppo&longs;ita, demùm venti viribus exponerentur æqualiter, nec
dexterum potiùs quàm &longs;ini&longs;trum impellendum e&longs;&longs;et, adeó­
que ce&longs;&longs;aret conver&longs;io; propterea flabella con&longs;truenda e&longs;­
&longs;ent modicè incurva; hac enim ratione fieret, ut oppo&longs;ita
inæqualiter urgerentur, & dextri quidem convexam, &longs;i­
ni&longs;tri verò cavam faciem ventus impeteret inæqualibus vi­
ribus, illud &longs;cilicet qua&longs;i &longs;e &longs;ubducit vento, nec admo
dum ejus impul&longs;ui opponitur extremitas juxtà venti directio­
nem inflexa; hoc autem cavo &longs;inu ventum excipiens to­
tum ejus impul&longs;um recipit.

Adde quod venti particula in
duo proxima flabella incurrens à convexâ unius facie in ca­
vam proximi faciem reflectitur, & auget impul&longs;ionem.

Quod &longs;i placuerit non quatuor, &longs;ed quinque flabella &longs;ta­
tuere, ne unquam duo ex diametro opponantur, non ab­
nuo.

Illud certum e&longs;t huju&longs;modi flabellorum tùm longi­
tudinem, tùm latitudinem plurimùm juvare, quo enim
ampliora &longs;unt, plus venti excipiunt, & quò longiora, ut
pote à motûs centro magis &longs;ejuncta, plus habent momen­
ti.

Quomodo autem &longs;i&longs;tenda &longs;it machina, explicanda aut
complicanda vela, ne præter molitoris voluntatem agitentur
flabella, nil refert hìc pluribus di&longs;putare, ubi tantummodo
vis movendi con&longs;ideratur.

Neque &longs;olùm hujus molendini
u&longs;us e&longs;&longs;et in comminuendis tritici aut leguminum granis,
&longs;ed etiam in attollendis atque alio derivandis aquis, ut palus
ex&longs;iccetur, & cæteris huju&longs;modi, quæ præ&longs;ente &longs;emper cor­
pore movendo, non certo tempori alligantur, quemadmodum,
opus molendi, quod non perpetuò exercetur.
CAPUT VIII.

Axis cum Vecte compo&longs;itus auget Potentiæ
momenta.

TAnta e&longs;t aliquando ponderis gravitas, ut datæ poten­
tiæ vires illi movendo impares &longs;int, aut de oblatæ ma­
chinæ &longs;oliditate ac firmitate dubitetur: propterea oppor­
tunum accidet Vectem cum Axe in Peritrochio componere.
Primùm dato Vecte
AB &longs;ecundi gene­
ris, cujus hypomo­
chlium &longs;it B, &
pondus con&longs;titutum
in C, Potentia, quæ
in extremitate A ap­
plicanda e&longs;t, minor
&longs;it, quàm pro gra­
vitate ponderis, da­
tâ vectis Ratione
CB ad AB.

Adhi­
beatur &longs;uccula EF
opportunè collata, ut funis ductarius in A alligatus Vectem
attollat: momenta enim potentiæ componuntur ex Ratio­
nibus radiorum &longs;ucculæ ad &longs;emidiametrum Axis, & di&longs;tan­
tiæ AB ad di&longs;tantiam CB in vecte.

Hinc &longs;i Ratio AB
ad CB &longs;it ut 3 ad 1, Ratio autem radiorum ad Axis &longs;e­
midiametrum &longs;it ut 4 ad 1, unicus homo Succulam ver­
tens momentum habet æquale momentis quatuor hominum
in A vecti applicatorum, quorum &longs;inguli æquiparantur tri­
bus, qui pondus idem &longs;inè vecte attollere conarentur: atque
adeò unicus homo &longs;ucculam convertens æquat vires duode­
cim hominum ponderi ip&longs;i proximè applicatorum citra quod­
libet machinæ &longs;ub&longs;idium.

Deinde in vecte primi generis, quando movendo pon­
deri velocitas aliqua concilianda e&longs;t, validiore potentiâ opus
e&longs;t, & tamen adjecto Axe infirmæ potentiæ adjumentum
comparare in promptu e&longs;t.

Sit enim vectis IG, & hypo­
mochlium in H. Uti­
que potentia in I tan­
to major requiritur,
quanto major e&longs;&longs;e de­
bet ponderis motus &longs;u­
pra motum potentiæ,
hoc e&longs;t in Ratione
HG ad HI.

Statua­
tur Axis RS, & fu­
nis ductarius Vectem
apprehendat in I.

Tum axi infigatur Radius VT; nam
pro Ratione longitudinis VT ad Axis &longs;emidiametrum ita
augeri po&longs;&longs;unt potentiæ momenta, ut non &longs;olùm ponderis
gravitati paria &longs;int, &longs;ed & illam excedant.

Fac enim IH
ad HG e&longs;&longs;e ut 1 ad 4, pondus verò in G e&longs;&longs;e lib.
200,
certè requireretur in I potentia major libris 800, ut &longs;uâ
virtute gravitati ponderis præ&longs;taret: At &longs;i Radius VT ad
Axis RS &longs;emidiametrum &longs;it ut 10 ad 1, jam potentia in T
motum habet ad motum ponderis in G ut 10 ad 4: igitur
reciprocè potentia in T ad pondus in G e&longs;&longs;et ut 4 ad 10,
ac proinde potentia habens vires attollendi ab&longs;que machinâ
libras 80, applicata in T attollet libras 200. Hæc quæ de
attollendo pondere dicta &longs;unt, intellige pariter &longs;i in plano
horizontali aut inclinato movendum e&longs;&longs;et; collocato &longs;cilicet
Axe non parallelo horizonti, &longs;ed vel perpendiculari, vel in­
clinato, pro ut loci opportunitas feret: hìc &longs;iquidem &longs;ola mo­
mentorum incrementa con&longs;iderantur ex harum duarum Fa­
cultatum compo&longs;itione.

Quid autem opus e&longs;t monere idem virium compendium
haberi po&longs;&longs;e in Vecte pariter primi generis, quando pon­
dus tardè movendum e&longs;t?

res enim per &longs;e clara e&longs;t, hypo­
mochlio &longs;cilicet magis ad extremitatem G accedente, quàm
ad extremitatem I, quæ potentiæ locus e&longs;t, ut &longs;i e&longs;&longs;et in L:
id quod tunc poti&longs;&longs;imùm u&longs;urpari pote&longs;t, cùm elevatio pon­
deris ad aliquam non minimam altitudinem requiritur; opor­
tet enim hypomochlium à pondere intervallo notabili abe&longs;&longs;e,
unde & major movendi difficultas oritur, atque idcircò addi­
tâ &longs;ucculâ potentiam juvari nece&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t.

Succulam verò po­
tiùs adhibendam proponere cen&longs;ui, quippe quæ & parabilior
e&longs;t, & commodior, nec multis impen&longs;is con&longs;truitur: Cæte­
rum nec Ergatam, nec tympana &longs;eu Grues, nec rotas denta­
tas, &longs;i placuerint, excludo.

Ex his &longs;atis liquet, quid de Vecte tertij generis dicendum
&longs;it, in quo Potentia media inter pondus & hypomochlium
collocatur: Succula &longs;cilicet in &longs;uperiore loco &longs;tatuenda e&longs;t,
ita ut funis ductarius vectem apprehendat, ubi potentiæ lo­
cus a&longs;&longs;ignatur: &longs;ed quoniam minor e&longs;t potentiæ, quàm pon­
deris motus, & augenda &longs;unt potentiæ momenta, ut ponde­
ris gravitati elevandæ par &longs;it, Axi addendus e&longs;t Radius tantæ
longitudinis, ut potentia non jam Vecti, &longs;ed Radio applicata
velociùs moveatur, quàm pondus.

Hactenus Axem in Peritrochio additum Vecti con&longs;ide­
ravimus, quatenus Vectem &longs;olitarium infirmior potentia
movere nequit: Nunc Vectem addere opportet Axi in
Peritrochio, ut hujus u&longs;us illo addito facilior accidat.

Ma­
chinulam &longs;ecum deferunt communiter aurigæ in Germania,
qua rotam currûs, &longs;i fortè limo profundiùs infixa inhæ&longs;e­
rit, &longs;ublevant, ac proinde recte pancratium aurigarum dici
pote&longs;t.

Lamina e&longs;t chalybea denticulata, cui rotula pariter
dentata congruit, cuju&longs;modi initio capitis 6. de&longs;crip&longs;imus:
parvula tamen e&longs;t rotula illa, &longs;ed centrum habens commu­
ne cum rotâ majore &longs;imiliter dentatâ, ex cujus conver&longs;ione
minor convolvitur, & laminam &longs;ur&longs;um propellit.

Majoris
rotæ dentes apprehendit Axis &longs;triatus, cujus motûs princi­
pium ducitur à manubrio extra loculamentum ad latus ex­
tante.

Quare duplex e&longs;t Ratio, videlicet manubrij ad &longs;emi­
diametrum axis &longs;triati, atque diametri rotæ majoris ad dia­
metrum rotulæ minoris concentricæ; ex quibus componi­
tur Ratio motûs Potentiæ manubrium ver&longs;antis, ad motum
ponderis &longs;ublevati.

Quia autem fieri pote&longs;t, ut aut de lami-
næ &longs;oliditate dubitetur, aut &longs;ubjectum rotæ &longs;olum non ad­
mittat congruam machinulæ po&longs;itionem; tunc rotæ elevan­
dæ capiti &longs;ubjiciatur validus fu&longs;tis alterâ extremitate incum­
bens telluri, alterâ innixus dentatæ laminæ; quæ eò minùs
à plau&longs;tri onere gravabitur, quò major erit Ratio totius lon­
gitudinis fu&longs;tis ad ejus partem inter rotæ caput, & &longs;olum,
cui innititur, interjectam.

Hinc &longs;i Ratio vectis &longs;it ut 2 ad 1, machinæ lamina non
ni&longs;i à ponderis &longs;emi&longs;&longs;e gravatur; & Potentiæ manubrio Pan­
cratij applicatæ momenta geminantur.

Nam &longs;i manubrij
longitudo ad Axis &longs;triati &longs;emidiametrum &longs;it ut 8 ad 1, ro­
tæ autem majoris diameter ad rotulæ concentricæ diame­
trum &longs;it ut 4 ad 1, potentiæ motus ad motum laminæ den­
tatæ e&longs;t ut 32 ad 1: &longs;ed appo&longs;ito vecte, cujus Ratio datur ut
2 ad 1, jam motus potentiæ ad motum ponderis elevati e&longs;t ut
64 ad 1, & potentiæ conatus, qui &longs;atis e&longs;&longs;et ad attollendas
&longs;ine machinâ libras 20, hoc Pancratio unâ cum Vecte attol­
leret libras 1280.

Similiter &longs;i Ergatâ AB raptandum e&longs;&longs;et onus, & poten­
tia infirmior e&longs;­
&longs;et, quam ut in
extremitate Ra­
dij CD valeret
&longs;uperare oneris
re&longs;i&longs;tentiam, ad­
hibe Vectem
EF, & extre­
mitate E inni­
tente &longs;ubjecto
&longs;olo, potentia
applicetur ex­
tremitati F; nam
ejus momenta
componuntur ex
Rationibus CD
Radij ad &longs;emidiametrum Axis AB, & vectis FE ad DE.

Pote&longs;t autem po&longs;t aliquantulum motum &longs;ubinde promoveri
extremitas E vectis, ut manife&longs;tum e&longs;t.

Quod &longs;i Ergatâ ipsâ
uteremur ad &longs;en&longs;im demittendum in plano inclinato onus
quoddam ingens, & timeretur, ne vis gravitatis vinceret co­
natum hominum in D reluctantium, ne præceps delabatur
onus; adhibeatur vectis EF, quo &longs;en&longs;im dimi&longs;&longs;o certiùs reti­
netur onus, & lentiùs de&longs;cendit.
CAPUT IX.
Multiplex rotarum dentatarum u&longs;us innuitur.

QUanquam ea, quæ ad Mechanicam &longs;cientiam &longs;pectant
circa tympana dentata, &longs;atis in &longs;uperioribus explicata
&longs;int, quatenus ex iis &longs;ub&longs;idium petitur ad virium &longs;upplemen­
tum, & fontes indicati &longs;int, ex quibus unu&longs;qui&longs;que variam
huju&longs;modi tympanorum complexionem pro opportunitate ex­
cogitare po&longs;&longs;it; placuit tamen auctarium adjicere multiplicis
usûs, etiam aliquando citra momentorum potentiæ moven­
tis incrementum.

Illud autem generatim ob&longs;ervandum e&longs;t,
ne pluribus membris di&longs;tinguatur machina, &longs;i pauciora &longs;uf­
ficiant: fieri &longs;iquidem non pote&longs;t, quin motui mora aliqua
inferatur, ubi plurium membrorum multiplex conflictus at­
que tritus contingit, etiam&longs;i omnia ritè di&longs;ponantur, & &longs;ibi
invicem proportione re&longs;pondeant.
PROPOSITIO I.
Anemo&longs;copium, Ventorum flantium indicem di&longs;cribere.

SI quis in conclavi manens cogno&longs;cere cupiat, quo vento
impellatur aër externus, & Anemo&longs;copium con&longs;truen­
dum curet, &longs;i hoc quidem in fornice, aut in laqueari de&longs;­
cribendum &longs;it, nullo opus e&longs;t artificio; &longs;ed &longs;atis e&longs;t intra
laminæ VK foramen erecto axi perpendiculari AB, qui
nodo C laminæ in&longs;i&longs;tat facilè ver&longs;atilis, adjicere flabellum AD
&longs;upra tecti fa&longs;tigium loco apto ita eminens, ut directè, citra
reflexionum &longs;u&longs;picionem, cuju&longs;li­
bet auræ flantis impul&longs;um exci­
piens, & venti ductum &longs;equens
convertatur, atque ejus extremi­
tas D cœli plagam vento oppo&longs;i­
tam re&longs;piciat.

In alterâ verò axis
extremitate B infra laquearis aut
fornicis faciem, in qua ritè juxta
horizontis po&longs;itionem de&longs;cripti
&longs;int ventorum cardines, adnecta­
tur index BF, ea lege, ut ex dia­
metro contrariam flabello AD
po&longs;itionem BF obtineat: hinc
enim fiet, ut quoniam ventus ex
A in D directus &longs;pirat, index F
eam horizontis partem, unde flat,
re&longs;piciat.

Sin autem in plano Verticali
(aut etiam inclinato) de&longs;criben­
dum &longs;it Anemo&longs;copium, &longs;it axis
AH cum flabello AD tran&longs;iens
per C foramen, & acutâ cu&longs;pide
in&longs;i&longs;tens plano H, ut facillimè
converti queat, vertebram &longs;tria­
tam EG habens in octo æquales
&longs;trias di&longs;tinctam, quibus &longs;ubinde
exactè congruere po&longs;&longs;int rotæ MN dentes octo, in quos ferrea
lamina di&longs;tributa e&longs;t æqualiter, antequàm in circulum inflecte­
retur.

Ex hujus rotæ centro infixus exeat axis R parietem per­
vadens, & in extremitate adnexum indicem convolvens ad indi­
candos ventos in interiori, aut exteriori parietis facie de&longs;criptos.

Verùm in ventorum de&longs;criptione cavendum, ne, quemad­
modum in Mappis Geographicis &longs;upremus locus Septentrioni,
infimus Au&longs;tro, dexter (qui &longs;cilicet e&longs;t ad dexteram a&longs;picien­
tis) Sub&longs;olano, &longs;ini&longs;ter Favonio tribuitur, ita hìc ordinem eun­
dem &longs;erves: quia enim vento flabellum impellente &longs;i vertebra
&longs;triata convertatur ex G in I, rota dentata a&longs;cendit ex N in M,
& &longs;imiliter index convolvitur ex T in L; propterea &longs;i ventus ab
Arcto &longs;pirans in &longs;upremâ parte de&longs;criptus &longs;it in T, & in infimâ
qui à meridie in O, is, qui ab ortu flat, de&longs;cribendus e&longs;t ad &longs;i­
ni&longs;tram in L, & qui ab Occa&longs;u, ad dexteram in P.

Quare mani­
fe&longs;tum e&longs;t, quo ordine reliquos intermedios de&longs;cribere oporteat.
PROPOSITIO II.
Currûs motum metiri.

QUæ Vitruvius lib.
10. cap.
14. &longs;crip&longs;it methodum innuens,
qua Veteres navi aut rhedâ vecti peractum iter dimetie­
bantur, plurium ingenia excitarunt (quandoquidem non paucis
Vitruvij verba ob&longs;curitate admodum laborare videbantur, quam
tamen notam illi inurere non au&longs;im) ad varias rationes excogitan­
das, quibus hoc idem a&longs;&longs;equi &longs;e po&longs;&longs;e confidant.

Maneat &longs;ua cui­
que Machinatori laus; neminis inventa improbo, aut a&longs;pernor:
Mihi plani&longs;&longs;imam inire viam &longs;emper placuit, qua putaverim ad id,
quod volumus, perveniri po&longs;&longs;e: quapropter nec certam rhedæ
formam, nec ver&longs;atilem cum affixis rotis axem præ&longs;cribo, &longs;ed ali­
quid vulgaribus rhedis aut curribus commune commini&longs;ci pla­
cuit, modò liceat alterius po&longs;teriorum rotarum (quippe anterio­
bus altiores &longs;unt) modiolo ad partem interiorem infigere bre­
viorem paxillum, quo rota ip&longs;a, dum convertitur, motum ma­
chinulæ currui alligatæ conciliet.

Unum moneo, quod ad Vitruvium &longs;pectat (in quo nullam re­
perio ob&longs;curitatem) non arguendum e&longs;&longs;e o&longs;citantiæ, quòd rotæ
diametrum &longs;tatuerit pedum quaternum & &longs;extantis, deinde verò
totam rotæ ver&longs;ationem definiat pedibus duodecim; cùm tamen
ex Rationibus Cyclicis &longs;int ut minimum tredecim; atque adeò
quadringentæ ver&longs;ationes perficiant pedes 5200, hoc e&longs;t pa&longs;&longs;us
geometricos 40 &longs;upra milliare; ex quo integrâ die, qua milliaria
30 computarentur, error e&longs;&longs;et pa&longs;&longs;um 1200, qui milliaribus 30 ad­
dendi e&longs;&longs;ent.

Contra verò &longs;i rotæ ambitus &longs;olùm peragat pedes
12; quadringentæ ver&longs;ationes dant pedes 4800, & pedes 200 de­
&longs;unt ad milliaris complementum: quare & hìc in milliarium 30
computatione dee&longs;&longs;ent pa&longs;&longs;us 1200, qui milliaribus 30 demen­
di e&longs;&longs;ent.

Ip&longs;e tamen Vitruvius quadringentis ver&longs;ationibus tri­
buit &longs;patia pedum 5000, hoc e&longs;t integri milliaris.

Non e&longs;t, inquam, o&longs;citantiæ arguendus Vitruvius, quem i&longs;ta
latere non potuerunt, cùm &longs;int admodum obvia cuique vel levi­
ter Geometricis a&longs;per&longs;o; &longs;ed eo con&longs;ilio rotæ diametrum &longs;upra
quatuor pedes &longs;extante auxit, ut quod deteritur ex aliquâ rotæ
depre&longs;&longs;iore in &longs;olo, cui impre&longs;&longs;a ve&longs;tigia relinquit, hoc augmento
aliquâ ex parte re&longs;tituatur, adeóque tota ver&longs;atio con&longs;i&longs;tat intra
pedes 12 & 13; addere autem certam fractiunculam pedibus 12,
temerarium fui&longs;&longs;et, illa quippe valdè incon&longs;tans & incerta e&longs;t:
&longs;atis fuit demum in &longs;ummâ 400 ver&longs;ationum medium eligere
inter 5200, & 4800: neque enim error, qui notabilis e&longs;&longs;et, obre­
pere poterat.

Non tamen placet Vitruvianum tympanum, cujus orbita in
quadringentos æquales denticulos e&longs;&longs;et di&longs;tributa, nimia quippe
& incommoda mihi videtur huju&longs;modi tympani magnitudo: &longs;i
enim ligneum fuerit tympanum, &longs;ingulorum dentium pedem, quo
orbitæ cohærent, vix puto minorem e&longs;&longs;e po&longs;&longs;e latitudine digitali,
hoc e&longs;t quatuor granorum hordei, &longs;i quidem &longs;atis validi, & ad pe­
rennitatem con&longs;tructi intelligantur: &longs;in autem ferreum fuerit
tympanum, latitudo &longs;ingulorum &longs;altem æquabit duo grana hor­
dei.

Quare orbita tympani in 400 huju&longs;modi dentes di&longs;tributa,
erit digitorum 400, aut 200, hoc e&longs;t, palmorum 100, aut 50; ac
proinde diameter erit palmorum ferè 32, aut 16. Commodius
igitur acciderit minora tympana componere, quàm adeò in­
gens tympanum con&longs;truere in tot dentes divi&longs;um.

Sit it a que primùm rota denticulata A, cujus denti in&longs;i&longs;tens
ha&longs;tula CI axiculo in I jun­
gatur laminæ HI ita fixæ
in H, ut elateris, non tamen
admodùm validi, vice fun­
gatur.

Tum ha&longs;tulæ CI
&longs;ubjiciatur ela&longs;ma D ali­
quanto validius, quantum
&longs;atis fuerit ad efficiendum
motum, quem &longs;tatim indi­
cabo.

Alia pariter ha&longs;tula
FG cum &longs;uo ela&longs;mate E ita
di&longs;ponatur, ut denti G occurrens non permittat rotam retroagi
ex G versùs B, &longs;ed &longs;olùm converti po&longs;&longs;e ex G in C, atque à &longs;in-
gulis dentibus elevata &longs;tatim vi ela&longs;matis E recidat, séque illis
objiciat, ne retrocedant.

Additus igitur &longs;uniculus CS &longs;i trahatur,
dentem rotæ convertit ha&longs;tula CI impellens &longs;ubjectum ela&longs;ma
D, eademque operâ dens unus tran&longs;greditur ha&longs;tulam FG, quæ
vi ela&longs;matis E recidens prohibet, ne in contrarium fieri po&longs;&longs;it ro­
tæ conver&longs;io.

Quia verò ha&longs;tula CI dum trahitur, dentem quo­
què &longs;ecum rapit, & ab eo inclinato demum liberatur, dimi&longs;&longs;o fu­
niculo, vi ela&longs;matis D &longs;ur&longs;um validè propellitur, & per obliquum
dentis latus excurrens extremitas C, obliquè pariter de&longs;inens,
repellit in I elaterem HI, donec ha&longs;tula ip&longs;a dentis apicem
tran&longs;gre&longs;&longs;a ab elatere HI &longs;e&longs;e re&longs;tituente coaptetur lateri &longs;upe­
riori dentis.

Quo pacto &longs;inguli rotæ dentes &longs;ubinde convertun­
tur; atquè tandiu huju&longs;modi convolutio per&longs;everat, quandiu
trahitur, & dimittitur funiculus.

Deinde rota altera pariter denticulata paretur, &longs;uóque axi in­
fixa ita di&longs;ponatur priori rotæ parallela (&longs;ed citra planorum con­
tactum) ut in ejus dentes incurrat paxillus L in rotæ A plano ad
perpendiculum erectus, quo po&longs;t integram prioris rotæ conver­
&longs;ionem dens unus &longs;ecundæ rotæ promoveatur.

Ex quo fiet tot
prioris rotæ conver&longs;iones requiri ad po&longs;teriorem &longs;emel convol­
vendam, quot in po&longs;teriore rotâ dentes numerantur.

Simili ra­
tione tertia, aut etiam, &longs;i opus fuerit, quarta rota denticulata pa­
retur, & ita pariter parallelæ di&longs;ponantur, ut paxillus &longs;ecundæ
rotæ tertiam, & tertiæ quartam convertat, paxillo videlicet den­
tium intervalla &longs;ubeunte po&longs;t integram &longs;uæ rotæ conver&longs;ionem.

Hinc ut innote&longs;cat, quoties trahendus, atque dimittendus &longs;it
funiculus, ut rotæ convertantur, attendendus e&longs;t in &longs;ingulis rotis
dentium numerus: tùm numerus primæ per numerum &longs;ecundæ
ducendus; & qui producitur indicans numerum tractionum fu­
niculi, ut &longs;ecunda rota &longs;emel convertatur, per numerum dentium
tertiæ rotæ e&longs;t multiplicandus, ut &longs;ciamus, quot funiculi tractio­
nibus tertia rota gyrum integrum perficiat.

Quod &longs;i hæc po&longs;tre­
ma non fuerit, &longs;ed & quarta rota adjiciatur, productus ex &longs;ecun­
dâ illâ multiplicatione numerus per numerum dentium quartæ
hujus rotæ multiplicabitur: ac demum innote&longs;cet, quoties funi­
culum trahere oporteat, ut quarta hæc rota totam circuli peri­
pheriam percurrat.

Quod &longs;i paxillis, de quibus dictum e&longs;t, uti non placuerit, &longs;ed po-
tiùs libeat &longs;ingulis rotis cra&longs;&longs;iu&longs;culos axes in&longs;erere, ex quibus dens
unus promineat, qui po&longs;t integram &longs;uæ rotæ conver&longs;ionem den­
tibus &longs;equentis rotæ implicetur; omnino licebit, & forta&longs;&longs;e &longs;uo
commodo non carebit.

Illud in rotarum collocatione intra &longs;uum
loculamentum e&longs;t diligenter animadvertendum, quod prioris ro­
tæ paxillus (aut axis dens) non ni&longs;i po&longs;t integram &longs;uæ rotæ con­
ver&longs;ionem incurrat in dentes po&longs;terioris; alioquin in errorem
non &longs;anè levem inducere nos po&longs;&longs;et index, qui extremitati axis
adnexus in exteriore loculamenti facie indicat &longs;ingularum ro­
tarum convolutiones.

Affigatur itaque po&longs;teriori rhedæ parti opportuno loco regula
circa axem ver&longs;atilis, cujus &longs;uperior extremitas conjunctum ha­
beat funiculi CS trahendi caput S, inferior autem extremitas oc­
currat paxillo, quem ab initio rotæ modiolo ad partem interiorem
infixi&longs;ti: &longs;ic enim fiet, ut paxillo regulam impellente funiculus
trahatur, atque ad &longs;ingulas rotæ currûs conver&longs;iones, &longs;inguli den­
tes rotulæ A funiculum trahentem &longs;equantur: ac propterea in
loculamenti facie index cum axe A convolutus indicabit, quoties
rota currûs conver&longs;a fuerit; & ab&longs;olutâ integrâ rotæ A conver&longs;io­
ne index &longs;equentis &longs;ecundæ rotulæ o&longs;tendet integras convolu­
tiones primæ; atque ita deinceps index tertiæ numerabit convo­
lutiones &longs;ecundæ, & index quartæ convolutiones tertiæ.

Hinc &longs;i
rotulæ &longs;ingulæ &longs;int in dentes decem di&longs;tributæ, numero, quem in­
dicat &longs;ecunda rotula, adde unicam cyphram 0, numero tertiæ ro­
tulæ adde duas cyphras 00, & numero à quarta rotula indicato
adde tres cyphras 000; &longs;tatímque manife&longs;tus fiet numerus con­
ver&longs;ionum rotæ currûs.

Quare &longs;i po&longs;teriores currûs rotæ habeant
diametrum quinque pedum, rotæ ambitus e&longs;t trium pa&longs;&longs;uum Geo­
metricorum (quod e&longs;t &longs;uper, negligitur, nam &longs;æpè rota &longs;olum mol­
liu&longs;culum penetrans extenuat diametrum) atque adeò, ut &longs;emel
prima rotula convertatur, currûs rota decies conver&longs;a percurrit &longs;pa­
tium pa&longs;&longs;uum 30; ut &longs;ecunda unicam conver&longs;ionem perficiat, rota
currûs centies volvitur, & conficit pa&longs;&longs;us 300; ut tertia gyrum ab­
&longs;olvat, rota currûs millies vertitur, & tria Italica milliaria percur­
rit.

Ideò numerus ab indice quartæ rotulæ &longs;ignificatus, indicans
tertiæ rotulæ integras convolutiones, triplicandus e&longs;t, ut peracti
itineris men&longs;ura Italicis milliaribus definiatur.

Ex quo fit quar­
tam rotulam in dentes decem di&longs;tributam &longs;ufficere ad numeran-
da milliaria Italica 30: quod &longs;i plura velis numerare unicâ hu­
jus rotæ conver&longs;ione, in plures dentes, quàm decem, quartam
rotulam di&longs;tingue: &longs;ed non e&longs;t opus, quia unâ convolutione
ab&longs;olutâ, milliaribus indicatis addi po&longs;&longs;unt milliaria 30.

Si ad navis cur&longs;um dimetiendum machinulam hanc eandem
traducere placeat, adjicienda e&longs;t ad navis latus rota, ex cujus con­
ver&longs;ione integrâ ob&longs;ervatum fuerit, quantùm navis promoveatur:
nam &longs;imiliter impellendo regulam, qua funiculus trahitur, rotæ
conver&longs;ionum numerus innote&longs;cet, atque adeò etiam itineris &longs;patium.

Cave tamen, ne in errorem incidas, qui facilè obrepere po&longs;&longs;et; cum
enim navis non &longs;emper æquè mergatur in aquâ (&longs;eu quia illa non
e&longs;t &longs;emper æquè onu&longs;ta, &longs;eu quia hæc non e&longs;t &longs;emper æquè cra&longs;&longs;a,
aut tenuis) etiam rota inæqualiter mergitur, ac proinde una rotæ
hujus conver&longs;io non &longs;emper æquali itineris &longs;patio re&longs;pondet.

Nec di&longs;&longs;imili ratione pede&longs;tria itinera metiri licebit, &longs;i parvu­
lam huju&longs;modi machinulam ita corpori alligaveris, ut funiculi
extremitas &longs;ub poplite adnectatur: nam ad &longs;ingulos pa&longs;&longs;us denti­
culus unus convertetur, & demum pa&longs;&longs;uum numerus innote&longs;cet.
PROPOSITIO III.
Objecti procul vi&longs;i p&longs;eudographam &longs;peciem deformare.

COntingit aliquando minùs attentos recti &longs;pecie decipi: pro­
pterea hac propo&longs;itione non inutile fuerit abu&longs;um quendam
rotæ dentatæ, quæ facilè fucum faciat imperitis, indicare: ne for­
tè &longs;ibi qua&longs;i de præclaro invento inaniter gratulentur.

Quadri­
laterum Pri&longs;ma AB eliga­
tur, cujus extremitas in te­
nuiorem cylindrum CD
de&longs;inat in&longs;erendum forami­
ni &longs;ubjecti plani cra&longs;&longs;ioris,
ita ut plano ad perpendicu­
lum in&longs;i&longs;tat pri&longs;ma, & &longs;er­
vatâ po&longs;itione perpendicu­
lari, facilè converti po&longs;&longs;it in
dexteram, & in &longs;ini&longs;tram.

Tum rotæ dentatæ &longs;emi&longs;&longs;is
MFN pri&longs;mati &longs;ecundùm
longitudinem excavato in&longs;eratur, atque circa axem A ductum per
pri&longs;ma & rotæ dentatæ centrum circumagi po&longs;&longs;it.

In eandem au­
tem pri&longs;matis fi&longs;&longs;uram infra rotæ dentatæ &longs;egmentum immitia­
tur regula HI &longs;uperiùs exa&longs;perata in crenas dentibus rotæ tan­
gentis congruentes, adeò ut ex rotæ conver&longs;ione regula HI ad­
ducatur, & reducatur: quæ in I calamum &longs;criptorium, aut lapi­
dem plumbarium habens (aut &longs;altem acutum &longs;tylum, quo certa
puncta lineis deinde jungenda notari valeant) in &longs;ubjecti char­
tâ lineas de&longs;cribit &longs;equens ductum radij optici per dioptram
MN excepti.

Quare quot lineas in objecto procul vi&longs;o percurrit
radius opticus, totidem lineæ à &longs;tylo I de&longs;cribuntur in chartâ.

Quando igitur magis altum, aut longiùs po&longs;itum objecti
punctum per dioptram a&longs;picitur, dioptræ extremitas oculo pro­
xima deprimitur, atque adeò rotæ dentatæ portio ita conver­
titur, ut versùs objectum promoveat regulam: contrà verò de­
pre&longs;&longs;ius, aut propius objecti punctum a&longs;piciens, proximam ocu­
lo extremitatem dioptræ elevat, & regulam ab objecto removet;
cuicumque tandem extremitati M, aut N oculum admoveas: Si
enim ex M a&longs;picias, deprimendo M propellis &longs;tylum I versùs pri&longs;­
ma, hoc e&longs;t versùs objectum; atque &longs;imiliter ex N a&longs;piciens, depri­
mendo N removes &longs;tylum I à pri&longs;mate, & versùs objectum im­
pellis.

At verò ubi tran&longs;ver&longs;um objecti latus a&longs;piciendum e&longs;t,
factâ circa cylindrulum CD conver&longs;ione, plurimum intere&longs;t,
utrùm ex M, an ex N a&longs;picias: Nam &longs;i oculus &longs;it in N, & radio
optico percurrat objecti latus à &longs;ini&longs;trâ in dexteram, etiam &longs;tylus I
à &longs;ini&longs;trâ in dextram movetur unâ cum extremitate M objectum
re&longs;piciente.

Sin autem oculus &longs;it in M, atque &longs;tylus I inter oculum
& pri&longs;ma, aut oculus inter &longs;tylum & pri&longs;ma interjectus &longs;it, con­
trariam po&longs;itionem habent puncta à &longs;tylo de&longs;cripta, & &longs;ini&longs;tra mi­
grant in dexteram, atque dextera in &longs;ini&longs;tram; &longs;tylus quippe ocu­
lum &longs;equitur, qui motum habet oppo&longs;itum motui alterius extre­
mitatis N objectum re&longs;picientis.

Quamobrem expedit oculum
dioptræ in N admovere, & in objectum &longs;tylum I obvertere, ut dextra
dextris, & &longs;ini&longs;tra &longs;ini&longs;tris re&longs;pondeant, prout &longs;ub a&longs;pectum cadunt.

Verùm, licèt objecti vi&longs;i &longs;peciem aliquam hoc artificio adum­
brare liceat, cavendum tamen, ne ip&longs;i nobis a&longs;&longs;entantes qua&longs;i exactam
Ichnographiam, & &longs;ubtilem, &longs;ervatis corporis partium Rationibus,
de&longs;criptionem nos compara&longs;&longs;e exi&longs;timemus: cuique &longs;cilicet rem
accuratè perpendenti manife&longs;tum e&longs;t, quandiu &longs;emicirculus in
eodem plano Verticali con&longs;i&longs;tit, & dioptra elevatur, &longs;ive deprimi­
tur, lineam objecti, quam radius opticus percurrit in plano hori­
zontali, re&longs;pondere differentiæ Tangentium angulorum, quos cum
perpendiculo AB con&longs;tituit radius opticus: At linea, quam &longs;ty­
lus I de&longs;cribit, re&longs;pondet quidem (&longs;altem proximè, & quatenus
&longs;en&longs;u in tantâ parvitate percipi pote&longs;t) differentiæ Tangentium
angulorum æquè differentium, quos cum perpendiculo eodem
AB con&longs;tituere intelligitur linea à centro A ad &longs;tylum I ducta.

Non tamen fieri pote&longs;t, ut deinde in omnibus po&longs;itionibus muta­
to Verticali eadem Ratio &longs;ervetur; quia linea à centro A ad &longs;ty­
lum I ducta, non e&longs;t parallela radio optico, &longs;ed angulum multo
minorem con&longs;tituit cum perpendiculo; ac proinde angulorum
minorum differentia, etiam&longs;i æqualis differentiæ angulorum ma­
jorum, non infert proportionalem differentiam Tangentium.

Sta­
tuatur ex.

gr. differentia angulorum duobus gradibus definita, &
in uno Verticali majores anguli à dioptrâ con&longs;tituti &longs;int gr.88. &
86, minores autem gr.58. & 56: in altero Verticali majores anguli
à dioptrâ con&longs;tituti &longs;int gr. 73. & 71, minores verò gr.43, & 41.
Quia idem e&longs;t Radius AB, quarum partium 1000 e&longs;t Radius, in
primo Verticali differentia majorum Tangentium e&longs;t 14336, &
differentia Tangentium minorum e&longs;t 118: in &longs;ecuado Vertica­
li differentiæ Tangentium &longs;unt 367 majorum, & 63 minorum
angulorum: inter hos autem terminos non intercedere propor­
tionem manife&longs;tum e&longs;t.

Quando verò, factâ circa cylindrum CD conver&longs;ione, fit tran­
&longs;itus ab uno plano Verticali ad aliud planum Verticale, linea,
quam radius opticus percurrit, & linea, quam &longs;tylus I de&longs;cribit,
&longs;ubtendunt quidem &longs;imiles arcus, opponuntur enim eidem an­
gulo Verticalium, &longs;ed &longs;unt in Ratione di&longs;tantiarum objecti vi&longs;i,
atque &longs;tyli à cylindrulo tanquam centro motûs.

Porrò ha&longs;ce li­
neas differentiis illis Tangentium non e&longs;&longs;e analogas per&longs;picuum
e&longs;t.

Quapropter de&longs;criptum &longs;chema non &longs;ervans objecti Ratio­
nes, cen&longs;endum e&longs;t p&longs;eudographum.

Oporteret plano immobili, cui infigitur pri&longs;ma, adnectere con­
gruis cardinibus aut fibulis, tabellam, quæ &longs;emper parallela diop­
træ cum hac pariter elevaretur & deprimeretur (non tamen cum
eâ convolveretur) ut in chartâ tabellæ affixâ &longs;pecies magis cum
objecto conveniens de&longs;criberetur: Qua autem methodo?

inge­
nio&longs;us lector di&longs;piciat.
MECHANICORUM LIBER SEXTUS.
De Trochlea.

NON &longs;emper commodum accidit Ergatâ, aut &longs;uc­
culâ, aut Tympano uti ad pondus aliquod moven­
dum: ut enim ex iis, quæ &longs;uperiore libro di&longs;puta­
ta &longs;unt, manife&longs;tum e&longs;t, &longs;i in altiorem locum eve­
hendum &longs;it pondus, ibi con&longs;truere oporteret peg­
ma, cui machina in&longs;i&longs;teret: &longs;æpè autem id fieri non po&longs;&longs;et &longs;ine
magna impen&longs;a, aut citrà incommodum &longs;ive propter loci an­
gu&longs;tias, &longs;ive propter temporis brevitatem pegmati con&longs;truendo
imparem.

Hinc alia Facultas excogitata e&longs;t, cui Throchleæ no­
men inditum e&longs;t; quippè quæ communiter ex rotulis circà
axem in &longs;uo loculamento ver&longs;atilibus coagmentatur, ií&longs;que cir­
cumducitur funis ductarius, quo trahitur pondus trochleæ ad­
nexum.

Trochleam autem, ut Vitruvius lib.
10 cap.2. te&longs;tatur
nonnulli Rechamum dicunt.

Ex orbiculorum numero nomen ducit machina; nam &longs;i uni­
cus &longs;it orbiculus, Trochlea &longs;implex, aut Mono&longs;patos vocatur;
&longs;i duo fuerint orbiculi, Di&longs;pa&longs;tos; &longs;i tres Tri&longs;pa&longs;tos; atque ita
deinceps.

In hac tamen nomenclaturâ ob&longs;ervandum e&longs;t, non
codem omnes vocabulo uti: aliqui enim cunctos orbiculos
utriu&longs;que loculamenti in unam &longs;ummam referunt, & ex eorum
numero vocabulum &longs;tatuunt; ut &longs;i alterius loculamenti duo &longs;int
orbiculi, alterius verò unicus, Tri&longs;pa&longs;ton appellant: Alij ta­
men nomen indunt ex orbiculis &longs;ingulorum loculamentorum;
nam &longs;i binos orbiculos &longs;ingula contineant, non Tetra&longs;pa&longs;ton,
&longs;ed Di&longs;pa&longs;ton vocant, quia communiter ambo loculamenta
æquali orbiculorum numero in&longs;truuntur, & ex alterius numero
reliqui, pariter numerus innote&longs;cit.

Neque omnino abs re alte-
rius tantummodo loculamenti orbiculos numerant, quia hujus
facultatis vires poti&longs;&longs;imùm habentur ex &longs;olis orbiculis locula­
menti, cui pondus trahendum adnectitur; reliquum &longs;cilicet lo­
culamentum cum &longs;uis rotulis proptereà adjicitur, ut funis ducta­
rius &longs;ingulos illius orbiculos complecti po&longs;&longs;it.

Ex quo fit, po&longs;ito
inæquali orbiculorum numero, modò Mono&longs;pa&longs;ton, modò Di&longs;­
pa&longs;ton dici, prout pondus adnectitur loculamento unum, aut
duos orbiculos habenti.

Cæterùm in vocabulis non e&longs;t hæren­
dum: Ego Trochleam voco loculamentum unum cum &longs;uis or­
biculis; & quando opus e&longs;t duplici loculamento uti, duplicem
Throchleam dico, atque orbiculos numero, ne ullus &longs;ube&longs;&longs;e
po&longs;&longs;it æquivocationi locus.

Quantum autem Facultas hæc &longs;it Axe, aut Vecte utilior, hinc
&longs;altem con&longs;tat, quod etiam&longs;i plures potentiæ diver&longs;is funis
ductarij partibus applicentur, æqualia tamen obtinent momen­
ta; id quod non contingit pluribus eundem Succulæ Radium,
aut eumdem Vectem urgentibus; neque enim æqualibus à mo­
tûs centro intervallis ab&longs;unt.
CAPUT I.
Trochlearum forma, & vires exponuntur.

ALiquando &longs;implicem orbiculum, cujus excavatæ orbitæ
funis ductarius in&longs;i&longs;tit, adhibemus, ut onera &longs;ur&longs;um attol­
lamus: & quidem communiter in &longs;uperiore loco firmatur locu­
lamentum cum orbiculo ver&longs;atili, & alteram funis extremita­
tem apprehendit Potentia, alteri adnectitur pondus &longs;ublevan­
dum, quod a&longs;cendendo &longs;patium percurrit æquale &longs;patio, per
quod Potentia de&longs;cendendo movetur.

Id quod eatenus excogi­
tatum e&longs;t, quatenus brachia deprimentibus in ponderis eleva­
tione in&longs;ita brachiorum gravitas vires addit, & minore lacerto­
rum contentione opus e&longs;t, quàm &longs;i pondus ip&longs;um &longs;ur&longs;um trahe­
remus brachia elevantes.

Factus e&longs;t autem orbiculus circa &longs;uum
axem ver&longs;atilis, ut vitetur difficultas, quæ cæteroqui con&longs;eque­
retur mutuum tritum funis cum &longs;ubjecto corpore, cui in&longs;i&longs;teret,
&longs;i illud non variaretur.

Quantus enim &longs;it huju&longs;modi funis cum
&longs;ubjecto corpore (&longs;i illud non convolvatur) conflictus, manife&longs;tum
e&longs;t in puteis, quibus ad hauriendam aquam non e&longs;t girgillus,
hoc e&longs;t, orbiculus ver&longs;atilis, adjectus, &longs;ed funis tran&longs;ver&longs;o fu&longs;ti
cylindrico, verùm immobili, in&longs;i&longs;tit; excavatur &longs;iquidem cylin­
der ille diuturno, & frequenti tritu funium.

Cæterum &longs;i non ad
perpendiculum attollendum &longs;it pondus, &longs;ed in plano horizonta­
li, aut inclinato (non tamen lubrico) raptandum, vix, aut ne
vix quidem, ullum compendium con&longs;equeris, &longs;i funem per or­
biculum tran&longs;euntem trahas in plagam oppo&longs;itam plagæ, ver­
sùs quam pondus dirigitur, ac &longs;i pondus idem arrepto fune ad te
directè rapias: eadem quippe e&longs;t brachiorum contentio, quo­
rum in&longs;ita gravitas non juvat potentiam, ni&longs;i quando hæc deor­
&longs;um tendit.

Adhiberi tamen huju&longs;modi orbiculus in planitie
poterit, &longs;i commodiùs Potentia con&longs;i&longs;tat in loco, ubi jacet pon­
dus, quàm ibi, quò illud adducendum e&longs;t.

Quamquam verò orbiculus &longs;tabili loculamento infixus non
&longs;it aptus ad augendas Potentiæ vires, prout ad Machinæ ratio­
nem pertinet; &longs;i tamen loculamentum ip­
&longs;um adnectatur ponderi, quod cum illo mo­
veatur, geminantur Potentiæ momenta, non
enim æqualis e&longs;t Potentiæ & Ponderis mo­
tus, &longs;ed illa duplo velociùs movetur.

Sit
pondus attollendum &longs;ivè raptandum A, cui
adnectatur loculamentum orbiculi B; funis
autem ductarius firmetur in C, & funis
extremitatem reliquam apprehendat Po­
tentia in D: utique Potentia ut adducat
orbiculum u&longs;que in C, tantumdem pro­
gredi debet ultra C, quantum orbiculus
B di&longs;tat à puncto C; oportet &longs;iquidem
totum funem DBC explicari.

Igitur po­
tentia ex D venit primùm in E, deinde
in F: e&longs;t autem di&longs;tantia DE æqualis in­
tervallo BC; &longs;ed tunc, cùm illa e&longs;t in
E, orbiculus &longs;olùm e&longs;t in I, & demum
hic e&longs;t in C, quando potentia e&longs;t in F.

Motus itaque potentiæ DF e&longs;t duplus mo­
tus orbiculi BC.

Porrò cum orbiculo pa­
riter trahitur pondus A adnexum; igitur
duplo velocior e&longs;t potentiæ motus præ motu ponderis.

Qua­
re potentia valens trahere motu &longs;ibi æquali pondus aliquod
&longs;ine orbiculo, hoc addito valebit trahere pondus duplo ma­
jore gravitate præditum.

Ex quibus manife&longs;tum e&longs;t, quantum inter&longs;it, utrùm ex­
tremitati funis adnectatur pondus, & orbiculi loculamen­
tum &longs;tabile &longs;it, an verò, funis extremitate manente atque
immotâ, ponderi adnectatur loculamentum, quod cum ip&longs;o
pondere moveatur, immò veriùs, cujus motum con&longs;equatur
motus ponderis: nam in &longs;ecundo hoc ca&longs;u potentiæ motus
duplus e&longs;t ad motum ponderis; in primâ autem po&longs;itione mo­
tus utriu&longs;que &longs;unt planè æquales.

Hinc ulteriùs con&longs;tat, quando duæ Trochleæ &longs;implici
orbiculo in&longs;tructæ adhibentur, ita ut altera fixa maneat, al­
tera cum pondere moveatur, nihil addi momenti Potentiæ
&longs;i funis extremitas alligetur trochleæ &longs;tabili, aut loco alicui
extra trochleas.

Nam &longs;i in G po&longs;ita &longs;it Trochlea manens
immota H, & altera funis extremitas illi jungatur in O,
&longs;eu extra illam clavo, aut paxillo in C, Potentia in L ap­
plicata æqualiter movetur cum puncto D: at punctum D
movetur duplo velocius, quàm Trochlea B; igitur Poten­
tia L movetur &longs;olum duplo velociùs quàm pondus, perinde
atque &longs;i non fui&longs;&longs;et addita trochlea H.

Eatenus igitur additur
Trochlea H, quatenus Potentiam & Pondus in oppo&longs;itas pla­
gas moveri oportet, aut potentia deor&longs;um conari debet, ut
pondus a&longs;cendat.

Sin autem extremitas funis alligetur Trochleæ mobili,
cui pariter adnectitur pondus, & primùm funis ab unco
trochleæ mobilis deducatus ad orbiculum trochleæ immotæ,
deinde ad orbiculum eju&longs;dem Trochleæ mobilis, jam Po­
tentia triplo velociùs movetur quàm Pondus; quia videli­
cet etiam ip&longs;a funis extremitas movetur trahentem &longs;equens
unâ cum pondere.

Concipe enim pondus A &longs;ejunctum à
Trochleâ B, quæ ita firmetur, ut immota maneat, pondus
verò intelligatur tran&longs;latum in G, atque Trochlea H jam
&longs;it mobilis: utique Potentia funem in L arreptum trahens
in motu progreditur ultra B, quanta e&longs;t longitudo funis ex­
plicati OBDH, quæ longitudo dupla e&longs;t intervalli OB:
igitur potentia L accedens ad B &longs;emel percurrit interval­
lum OB, & præterea adhuc duplum &longs;patium ultrà B,
dum punctum O venit ad B &longs;imul cum pondere ad­
nexo in G: triplo igitur velociùs movetur Potentia quàm
Pondus.

Simili omnino ratione ac de Trochleis &longs;implicibus phi­
lo&longs;ophamur, etiam ratiocinari oportet in Trochleis plures
orbiculos habentibus; &longs;i enim &longs;ingulæ duos habeant orbi­
culos, attendendum e&longs;t, an funis extremitas adnectatur
Trochleæ immotæ, an verò mobili: &longs;i immotæ, potentia
movetur quadruplo velociùs quàm pondus; &longs;in autem mo­
bili, movetur quintuplo velociùs.

Generatim igitur nume­
ra orbiculos trochleæ mobilis, cui &longs;cilicet jungitur pondus,
& pro &longs;ingulis orbiculis duplica potentiæ momenta.

Hinc &longs;i
tres fuerint orbiculi, momentum Potentiæ e&longs;t &longs;extuplum; &longs;i
quatuor, octuplum; & &longs;ic deinceps.

At &longs;i eidem Trochleæ
mobili adnectatur extremitas funis, adhuc adde unitatem,
& momentum erit &longs;eptuplum, aut noncuplum.

Funis &longs;iqui­
dem uni trochleæ alligatus primùm in&longs;i&longs;tit orbiculo primo
reliquæ trochleæ; inde flectitur ad orbiculum primum tro­
chleæ, cui adnectitur: po&longs;tmodum ad &longs;ecundum orbicu­
lum alterius trochleæ tran&longs;it, & rediens ad priorem tro­
chleam in&longs;i&longs;tit orbiculo ejus &longs;ecundo; atque ita deinceps, al­
terno ex trochleâ in trochleam excur&longs;u, donec orbiculis om­
nibus in&longs;i&longs;tat.

Quod &longs;i duabus Trochleis non in&longs;it æqualis
orbiculorum numerus, &longs;ed altera alteram unitate &longs;uperet,
nece&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t funem alligari trochleæ pauciorum orbiculorum
Quare attendendus pariter e&longs;t numerus orbiculorum trochleæ
mobilis, quæ &longs;i pauciores habeat orbiculos, utique illi ad­
nectitur extremitas funis; atque adeò duplicato ejus orbi­
culorum numero addenda e&longs;t unitas: ut, &longs;i duos habeat or­
biculos, motus Potentiæ e&longs;t quintuplus motus Ponderis.

At
&longs;i trochlea mobilis plures habeat orbiculos quàm trochlea im­
mota, duplicandus &longs;olùm e&longs;t illorum numerus, ut habeatur
denominatio momenti; ut, &longs;i tres fuerint orbiculi, motus po­
tentiæ ad ponderis motum e&longs;t &longs;extuplus.

In huju&longs;modi Trochleis plures rotulas habentibus ob&longs;er­
vandum e&longs;t interiores rotulas minores &longs;tatui, exteriores verò
majores: nam A & C minores &longs;unt, B & D majores, ne fu­
nium ductus &longs;e invicem intercipiant, ac mo­
tum mutuo tritu retardent, ni&longs;i etiam &longs;e&longs;e vici&longs;­
&longs;im atterentes funes di&longs;rumpantur.

Quare pro­
bare non po&longs;&longs;um Trochleas, quæ plures orbi­
culos parallelos uni & eidem axi infixos intra
congruum loculamentum habent; quamvis
enim Trochleis huju&longs;modi valde inter &longs;e di&longs;tan­
tibus non adeò appareat incommodum funium
&longs;e&longs;e perfricantium, ubi tamen illæ propiores
factæ fuerint, hoc manife&longs;tò apparet: præ­
terquam quod funis obliquè in&longs;i&longs;tens extremæ
ip&longs;arum rotularum orbitæ, quam contingit,
non adeò facilè movetur, ac &longs;i illis exactè con­
grueret, ut fit, quando &longs;ingulæ rotulæ &longs;uos ha­
bent axes.

Et quidem quod ad axes rotularum &longs;pectat,
quamvis nec admodum longi &longs;int, & rotula
&longs;uo loculamento proximè adhæreat, atque adeò
non &longs;int facilè obnoxij fractionis periculo, ca­
vendum tamen e&longs;t, ne nimis exiles &longs;int, aut
ex materia non &longs;atis &longs;olidâ; ne fortè ponderis
attollendi gravitas illos labefactet.

Verum qui­
dem e&longs;t non e&longs;&longs;e nece&longs;&longs;e &longs;ingulos axes &longs;tatuere
&longs;u&longs;tinendo oneri pares; cum enim plures &longs;int, adver&longs;us &longs;ingu­
los minor conatus ponderis exercetur.

Si verò illi exqui&longs;itè
læves atque politi fuerint, faciliorem fore rotularum iis infixa­
rum revolutionem apertiùs con&longs;tat, quàm ut moneri artificem
oporteat.

Prætereà rotularum facies optimè lævigatas velim, & lo­
culamentum ip&longs;um non placet ita amplum, ut maximam ro­
tularum partem includat: &longs;atis e&longs;t, &longs;i ità firmum ac &longs;olidum
&longs;it, ut axes contineat, & in extremitatibus validos uncos ha­
beat, quibus & funis, & onus alligari queant: Quò &longs;cilicet
minorem rotularum partem tangit, minus cum illis confligit,
adeóque facilior e&longs;t motus: neque enim leviora hæc compen­
dia omninò contemnenda &longs;unt.

Demum funis ductarij cra&longs;&longs;itudo &longs;tatuenda e&longs;t, quæ reti-
nendo ponderi re&longs;pondeat: &longs;ed quia plures &longs;unt funis à trochleâ
in trochleam ductus, ideò qua&longs;i plures funes reputantur, inter
quos quodammodo di&longs;tribuitur &longs;u&longs;tentatio ponderis, perinde
ferè, atque &longs;i ex pluribus illis ductibus funis unicus compone­
retur.

Hinc &longs;i pondus fuerit adnexum trochleæ I, &longs;u&longs;tinetur à
quatuor funibus; &longs;in autem trochlea I in &longs;uperiore loco firmata
fuerit, & pondus trochleæ H alligatum dependeat, &longs;u&longs;tinetur
à quinque funibus, nam etiam Potentia in O &longs;u&longs;tinet fune RO.

Ex funis autem cra&longs;&longs;itudine definitur rotularum altitudo, ut ni­
mirum orbitæ excavatæ in&longs;i&longs;tere po&longs;&longs;it funis, quin interiorem
loculamenti faciem contingat, ne perpetuo affrictu atteratur
cum di&longs;ruptionis periculo, & non levi celeritatis detrimento,
auctâ trahendi difficultate.

Porrò cùm excavatam dico rotu­
larum orbitam, nolim intelligas qua&longs;i crenam perimetro pro­
fundiùs inci&longs;am; &longs;ed &longs;atius fuerit orbitam ip&longs;am e&longs;&longs;e modicè
&longs;inuatam; hoc enim pacto facilius excurrit funis, etiam&longs;i paulò
cra&longs;&longs;ior aliquando adhibendus &longs;it, qui cæteroqui inter crenæ
inci&longs;æ labra depre&longs;&longs;us non &longs;ine labore ex illis angu&longs;tiis eximere­
tur in rotulæ conver&longs;ione.

Cum itaque ea &longs;it Trochlearum di&longs;po&longs;itio, ut pondus tardiùs
moveatur, potentia velocius (&longs;i videlicet alteri Trochlearum
non Potentia, &longs;ed Pondus adnectatur, alioquin &longs;i loca permu­
tarent, res contrario prorsùs modo &longs;e haberet) manife&longs;tum e&longs;t
re&longs;i&longs;tentiam ponderis minui ex tarditate; poterit igitur augeri
ex gravitate: &longs;æpiùs quippe dictum e&longs;t adæquatum re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ
momentum componi ex in&longs;ita gravitate, & ex di&longs;po&longs;itione ad
motûs velocitatem, aut tarditatem.

Potentia igitur valens &longs;u­
perare re&longs;i&longs;tentiam ponderis alicujus certæ gravitatis, &longs;i cum
illa æqualiter movendum &longs;it, poterit eodem impetu, atque co­
natu &longs;uperare re&longs;i&longs;tentiam majoris ponderis, &longs;i ex collocatione,
quatenus cum Potentiâ connectitur, ita minus velociter movea­
tur, ut quæ Ratio e&longs;t æqualis illius velocitatis ad minorem ve­
locitatem, eadem &longs;it Ratio majoris ponderis ad pondus illud
æquè velox cum potentiâ; e&longs;t enim omnino par re&longs;i&longs;tentia;
quia quantum addit major velocitas minori ponderi, tantum­
dem addit majus pondus minori velocitati.

Quamvis autem ponderis motus non &longs;it æquè velox ac motus
potentiæ, tamen ponderis motus entitativè acceptus æqualis e&longs;t
motui potentiæ, ac proindè mirum non e&longs;t, &longs;i potentia eadem
impetu eodem æqualem motum producat, atque efficiat.

Pone
enim in O gravitatem paulò majorem libris 100; utique &longs;i in S
&longs;tatuerentur libræ 100 gravitas O prævaleret, & gravitatem S
elevaret: igitur illa eadem gravitas O elevabit libras 400 in I
adnexas Trochleæ, nam I movetur quadruplo tardiùs quam
O, ex dictis, S autem movetur æqualiter ac O; ergo ratione
motûs tardioris quadruplo minùs re&longs;i&longs;tit pondus lib.400 in I,
licet ratione gravitatis quadruplo magis re&longs;i&longs;tat.

Si itaque li­
bræ 100 in S intra certum tempus percurrant unà cum Poten­
tia O &longs;patij pedes 40, eodem tempore &longs;ingulæ libræ 100 gra­
vitatis in I adnexæ percurrunt pedes 10: at &longs;unt libræ 400;
igitur &longs;unt quatuor motus pedum 10, & illarum omnium mo­
tus e&longs;t pedum 40. Quare potentia O idem planè efficit, ac &longs;i
moveret in S libras 100; id quod præ&longs;tare pote&longs;t ab&longs;que ulla
machina.

Et quidem &longs;i res attentè perpendatur, nec vulga­
ribus vocabulis notionem minus propriam &longs;ubjiciamus, non
e&longs;t dicendum manente eodem conatu, & eadem velocitate Po­
tentiæ augeri per Machinam potentiæ momenta, aut vires,
&longs;emper enim Potentia vincit æqualem re&longs;i&longs;tentiam &longs;ive adhibi­
tâ machinâ, &longs;ive ab&longs;que illâ, quamvis non &longs;emper vincat ean­
dem gravitatem.

Quemadmodum in libra nil refert, utrum
corpus expendendum habeat majorem gravitatem &longs;ecundum
&longs;peciem, &longs;ed molem minorem, an verò minorem gravitatem
&longs;pecificam &longs;ub mole majori, modò reciprocè &longs;it ut gravitas
&longs;pecifica ad &longs;pecificam gravitatem, ita moles ad molem; e&longs;t &longs;i­
quidem par gravitas ab&longs;oluta, quæ componitur ex gravitate &longs;pe­
cificâ & mole.

Ita pariter æqualis e&longs;t ab&longs;oluta ponderis re­
&longs;i&longs;tentia, quæ ex gravitate, & velocitate componitur, &longs;i fuerit
inter eas reciproca Ratio.
CAPUT II.
An Trochlea ad Vectem revocanda &longs;it.

UT Machinalis motûs cau&longs;a meliùs innote&longs;cat, neque opus
e&longs;&longs;e Facultates omnes ad Vectem revocare, ut non pauci
hactenus conati &longs;unt, & adhuc conantur, hìc poti&longs;&longs;imùm
quæ&longs;tionem huju&longs;modi examinare placuit in Trochleâ.

Aiunt
&longs;iquidem in &longs;implici orbiculo, quando ejus centrum immotum
manet, & alteram funis extremitatem potentia apprehendit, ex
alterâ dependet pondus, Vectem e&longs;&longs;e primi generis, cujus hy­
pomochlium e&longs;t in centro orbiculi, potentia & pondus in ex­
tremitatibus diametri; quæ cùm à centro æqualibus intervallis
ab&longs;int, vectis ille nil juvat potentiam.

Quando verò ponderi
adnectitur theca, cui orbiculus includitur, adeóque ejus cen­
trum unà cum pondere movetur, jam pondus re&longs;pondet orbicu­
li centro, & extremitatem alteram diametri obtinet potentia
trahens funem; quapropter hypomochlium cen&longs;endum e&longs;t in
oppo&longs;ita diametri extremitate.

Quapropter cùm pondus &longs;it in­
ter potentiam, & hypomochlium, vectis e&longs;t &longs;ecundi generis: &
quia pondus e&longs;t in vectis medio, potentiæ momentum duplum
e&longs;t momenti ponderis, &longs;i po&longs;itio ip&longs;a &longs;pectetur.

Sit orbiculus,
cujus centrum C, eju&longs;que loculamento
adnexum pondus re&longs;pondeat lineæ CB:
funis RSDTV &longs;it alligatus in R, & Poten­
tia &longs;it in V, quæ funem trahens intelligitur
con&longs;tituta in T, & oppo&longs;itum diametri
punctum S cen&longs;etur hypomochlium; at­
que adeò momentum Potentiæ ad momen­
tum Ponderis e&longs;t ut TS ad CS.

Ex quo fit,
&longs;i reciprocè vis potentiæ ad gravitatem
ponderis &longs;it ut CS ad TS, ab huju&longs;modi
potentiâ &longs;u&longs;tineri pondus, & potentia &longs;i augeatur, etiam mo­
veri, orbiculo circà &longs;uum centrum revoluto, & ver&longs;us poten-
tiam attracto.

In conver&longs;ione autem orbiculi, prout aliæ atque
aliæ &longs;unt diametri, quas contingunt funis ductus RS, & VT,
alios &longs;ubinde, atque alios vectes e&longs;&longs;e commini&longs;cuntur.

Verùm huju&longs;modi ratiocinationi nunquam aquie&longs;cere po­
tui; mihi enim per&longs;pectum e&longs;t, &longs;i orbiculus non fuerit ver&longs;atilis,
&longs;ed omnino fixus in &longs;uo loculamento, adhuc potentiam V faci­
liùs attollere pondus, quod in B intelligitur &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;um, quàm
illud directè, & immediatè attolleret; & tamen diameter ea­
dem TS &longs;emper maneret horizonti parallela (nam CB &longs;emper
e&longs;t in perpendiculo) nullumque haberet motum conver&longs;ionis
circà punctum, quod vocant, hypomochlij S, quo referret mo­
tum Vectis proprium.

Adde orbiculum in &longs;uo loculamento
fixum perinde e&longs;&longs;e, atque &longs;i annulus ponderi adnectatur, & fu­
nis alligatus in R in&longs;eratur annulo, atque potentia in V funem
trahat; potentia enim duplo velociùs movetur, quàm annulus
& pondus: hìc autem in annulo, quem nullatenus convolvi cer­
tum e&longs;t, quomodo Vectis ve&longs;tigium deprehendes?

Illud qui­
dem incommodi in annulo, & in orbiculo non ver&longs;atili, accide­
ret, quod funis ob &longs;uam a&longs;peritatem cum orbiculi orbitá, & cum
annulo confligeret; ex quo tritu non levis movendi difficultas
oriretur: propterea, ad vitandum huju&longs;modi incommodum
adhibentur orbiculi circa &longs;uum axem ver&longs;atiles; axis enim poli­
tus, aut etiam addito unguine lubricus, ferè nullam creat orbi­
culi rotationi difficultatem, funis verò non atterit eju&longs;dem or­
biculi orbitam, quâ revolutâ ille explicatur.

Cæterum quod ad
Rationem motuum potentiæ & ponderis &longs;pectat, eadem e&longs;t Ra­
tio dupla, &longs;ive orbiculus ver&longs;atilis &longs;it, &longs;ive fixus, &longs;ive annulus
ponderi adnectatur, &longs;ive etiam ponderi in&longs;eratur funis, ità ut
pondus ip&longs;um excurrere queat.

Hoc &longs;cilicet unicè pendet ex
ipsâ funis inflexione: nam &longs;i funis AB ita flectatur,
ut ad extremitatem extremitas accedat, & B veniat
in C propè A; utique non ni&longs;i media pars BE mo­
vetur; adeò ut, &longs;i annulus in&longs;eratur funi in B, & per
longitudinem funis, qui complicatur, excurrat, ve­
niat ex B in E interea, dum extremitas B, & poten­
tiam illam adducens, venit in C: quo in motu &longs;in­
gulæ funis particulæ inter B & E percurrunt &longs;pa­
tium duplum di&longs;tantiæ &longs;ingularum à medio, ante-
quam complicarentur: & &longs;i potentia ex C ulteriùs progredia­
tur, &longs;ingulæ funis particulæ inter medium & caput A inter­
ceptæ perficiunt &longs;patium duplum di&longs;tantiæ &longs;ingularum à capi­
te A, ubi funis religatur.

Jam verò &longs;tatue ampliorem aliquem, & &longs;atis gravem cylin­
drum DEFG, qui rotatu pro­
movendus &longs;it, aut in plano hori­
zontali, aut in &longs;uperiorem plani
inclinati locum: applicentur au­
tem homines in D & G, & quot­
quot nece&longs;&longs;arij fuerint juxta cylin­
dri longitudinem, qui illum im­
pellant.

Quæro, an ibi ulla Vectis
ratio intercedat, ita ut &longs;it qua&longs;i
vectis DE, hypomochlium in E,
& pondus in puncto I, quod
re&longs;pondet centro gravitatis, at­
què adeò in cylindri conver&longs;ione
&longs;ubinde mutetur vectis, & locus
tùm potentiæ, tùm hypomochlij,
prout aliis atque aliis perimetri punctis applicatur potentia im­
pellens, quibus ex diametro opponuntur alia atque alia puncta,
in quibus à &longs;ubjecto plano cylinder tangitur.

Vix, puto, au­
debis Vectem ibi agno&longs;cere, ubi demum Potentiam impellen­
tem, & Pondus, quod in centro gravitatis, &longs;cilicet in Axe cy­
lindri, con&longs;titutum intelligitur, æqualem motus lineam per­
curri&longs;&longs;e deprehenderis, ut manife&longs;tum e&longs;t in huju&longs;modi rotun­
dorum corporum revolutione, in qua æqualem lineam percur­
runt centrum, & punctum in peripheriâ notatum.

Igitur duo­
rum funium capita firmiter alliga in M & H, ipsó&longs;que funes
cylindro &longs;ubjice, & in &longs;uperiorem partem reductos ita di&longs;po­
ne, ut cylindrum complectantur, atque à duabus potentiis, quæ
priùs in D & G impellebant, trahantur capita L & P.

Certi&longs;&longs;i­
mo con&longs;tat experimento longè faciliùs cylindrum huju&longs;modi
funibus convolvi, quàm impul&longs;ione potentiarum illi proximè
applicitarum.

Si nulla Vectis Ratio agno&longs;cenda e&longs;t in diame­
tro DE, utique facilitas illa movendi non habetur à vecte, qui
nullus e&longs;t: Sin autem Vectem ibi e&longs;&longs;e con&longs;tanter affirmes, igi-
tur perindè e&longs;t &longs;i Potentia proximè, & immediatè applicetur
puncto D, aut H, ad impellendum, atque &longs;i medio fune MHL
applicetur puncto H trahens funis caput L: atqui longè majo­
ra momenta habet funem LH trahens, quàm impellens in H;
cum igitur utrobique idem Vectis; eadem &longs;cilicet cylindri dia­
meter, habeatur, &longs;ed non idem momentum, non ex rationibus
Vectis, &longs;ed aliundè petenda e&longs;t hæc momenti acce&longs;&longs;io: Quia
videlicet fune &longs;ic di&longs;po&longs;ito, potentia duplo velociùs movetur
quàm pondus, nullâ habitâ vectis ratione.

Finge jam funem
laxiorem circumplecti cylindrum, & in nodum colligi in X:
utique &longs;i in X adderetur pondus aliquod raptandum unà cum
cylindro promoto; facilius raptaretur cylindro huju&longs;modi fu­
nibus revoluto, quàm &longs;i cylindrus impul&longs;ione potentiæ proxi­
mè applicatæ promoveretur; & tamen major hæc facilitas ex
nullo vecte addito oriretur.

An non ergo cylindrus trochleæ
orbiculum refert, & funis X orbiculi loculamentum, cui pon­
dus adnectitur?

manife&longs;to igitur experimento habetur non ex
Vectis rationibus ducendam e&longs;&longs;e majorem movendi facilitatem,
quæ ex &longs;implici trochleâ habetur, quando illi adnectitur
pondus.

Sed præ&longs;tat examinare, quæ præterea dicuntur, quando ei­
dem &longs;implici Trochleæ, cui pondus M adnectitur, etiam funis
caput alligatur; tunc enim potentiæ momentum triplex e&longs;t,
adeò ut ad attollendum pondus M &longs;ufficiat potentia &longs;ubtripla
illius potentiæ, quæ ab&longs;que machinâ attol­
leret idem pondus.

Sic igitur ratiocinantur
apud P. Schott in Magia mechanica Syn­
tagm. 4. cap.
2. prop.5. Si fuerit Vectis DE,
in cujus medio C &longs;it pondus, fuerit autem
quædam potentia in C &longs;u&longs;tinens, & alia po­
tentia illi æqualis &longs;u&longs;tinens in E, hypomo­
chlium verò in D, unaquæque potentia e&longs;t
&longs;ubtripla ponderis &longs;u&longs;tentati.

Quia enim
potentia C di&longs;tat ab hypomochlio D æqua­
liter ac pondus in C con&longs;titutum, &longs;u&longs;tinet
pondus æquale &longs;uis viribus; potentia autem
E, quia e&longs;t in duplo majore di&longs;tantiâ quàm
Pondus C, &longs;u&longs;tinet pondus duplum &longs;uarum
virium.

Quoniam ergo Potentiæ ex hypothe&longs;i &longs;unt æquale,
& totius ponderis duæ partes &longs;u&longs;tinentur à Potentia E, & una
à Potentia C, illa autem e&longs;t &longs;ubdupla ponderis à &longs;e &longs;u&longs;tentati,
unaquæque e&longs;t eju&longs;dem totius ponderis &longs;ubtripla quo ad vires
&longs;u&longs;tentandi.

Cum igitur in propo&longs;itis Trochleis &longs;it potentia F
&longs;u&longs;tinens in medio, & potentia G in alterâ extremitate &longs;u&longs;ti­
nens, unaquæque e&longs;t &longs;ubtripla ponderis M &longs;u&longs;tinendi, ac
propterea Potentia G &longs;i &longs;it paulo major quàm &longs;ubtripla, erit
etiam apta ad movendum pondus.

His pariter a&longs;&longs;entiri nequeo, quæ de ponderis &longs;u&longs;tentatione
dicuntur; nec &longs;atis video, an Vecti &longs;ecundi generis congruant;
neque enim &longs;olùm Potentiæ in medio atque in altera extremita­
te applicatæ, verùm etiam hypomochlium ip&longs;um exercet vim
&longs;u&longs;tinendi: ex hoc &longs;iquidem quod addatur potentia in medio,
ubi e&longs;t pondus, non tollitur omnino pre&longs;&longs;io, quâ hypomo­
chlium à pondere urgetur.

Quare non tota vis &longs;u&longs;tentandi di­
videnda e&longs;t inter duas illas potentias, &longs;ed etiam admittendum
e&longs;t hypomochlij con&longs;ortium.
Dic autem, quænam e&longs;t potentia in F retinens pondus?

nonne &longs;tatim ac potentia in G remi&longs;&longs;iorem conatum adhibet,
etiam F cum pondere de&longs;cendit?

ip&longs;a quippe Potentia G dum
intentum funem FI retinet, &longs;u&longs;tinet etiam pondus; atque adeò
non duæ &longs;unt potentiæ &longs;u&longs;tinentes, &longs;ed unica.

Et quidem, &longs;i
res &longs;incerè exponatur, pondus &longs;u&longs;tinetur & à potentiâ G &longs;ur­
&longs;um conante, & à clavo S, cui &longs;uperior trochlea adnectitur,
mediis funibus HD, IF retinente, ità ut centrum gravitatis
ponderis &longs;it in lineâ Directionis tran&longs;eunte per ip&longs;um clavum S,
&longs;i funis GE &longs;it ad perpendiculum, nec in latus retrahat tro­
chleam C: eo autem ip&longs;o, quòd Potentia G &longs;uo conatu prohi­
bet, ne funis excurrat, retinet pondus ex eodem clavo S &longs;u&longs;­
pen&longs;um.

Quapropter eju&longs;dem potentiæ G e&longs;t vis illa, quæ &
in F, hoc e&longs;t in C & in E retinet.

Quandò verò &longs;ur&longs;um attolli­
tur pondus, eadem e&longs;t potentia G, quæ &longs;ur&longs;um trahit F, cui
non minùs applicatur medio fune IF, quàm applicetur ip&longs;i E
medio fune GE; neque enim in F e&longs;t alia potentia &longs;ponte &longs;ur­
&longs;um a&longs;cendens, & &longs;ecum rapiens pondus.

Sed quid fru&longs;trà confugiamus ad vim &longs;u&longs;tentandi pondus ex
trochleis dependens?

&longs;i pondus fuerit in plano horizontali tra-
hendum, nihil in trochleis reperitur, à quo &longs;u&longs;tineatur pon­
dus omnino incumbens &longs;ubjecto plano, & tamen potentia G
e&longs;t &longs;ubtripla potentiæ, quæ &longs;ine machinâ in eodem plano trahe­
ret idem pondus: ratione vectis ED &longs;olùm e&longs;&longs;e pote&longs;t &longs;ubdu­
pla; in F nulla e&longs;t potentia trahens; unde ergo ratione vectis
potentia ad trahendum pondus habet momenti incrementum?

Quod &longs;i dixeris eandem potentiam, quæ in G trahit, etiam tra­
here in F; igitur conatum non adhibet &longs;ubtriplum, &longs;ed &longs;ub&longs;e&longs;­
quialterum; nam conatur & in extremitate E, & in vectis me­
dio C, ut tu quidem ais, ita ut utrobique &longs;it &longs;ubtripla vis mo­
vendi: fatendum e&longs;t ergo potentiam trahentem conari ut (2/33)
cum tamen reip&longs;a adhibeat &longs;olum conatum ut 1/3.

Con&longs;ideremus demum Trochleas pluribus in &longs;tructas orbicu­
lis, & videamus, quid ex Vecte &longs;perari po&longs;&longs;it.

Statuunt Autho­
res cum eodem P. Schott ibid.

prop.7. &longs;i fuerint duo vectes
BA, & DC, ex quorum me­
dio E & F dependeat pondus G,
duas potentias æquales in B &
D con&longs;titutas, &longs;imúlque æqua­
liter in &longs;u&longs;tinendo pondere la­
borantes, &longs;ingulas e&longs;&longs;e &longs;ubqua­
druplas ponderis.

Nam &longs;i &longs;ola
potentia D &longs;u&longs;tineret, e&longs;&longs;et pon­
deris &longs;ubdupla, &longs;cilicet ut FC
ad DC; & &longs;i &longs;ola potentia B
&longs;u&longs;tineret, e&longs;&longs;et ip&longs;a pariter &longs;ub­
dupla, nimirum ut EA ad BA.

Cum igitur ambæ æquales &longs;int,
& æqualiter conentur, unicui­
que re&longs;pondebit &longs;ubduplum
&longs;ubdupli, hoc e&longs;t quarta pars
ponderis.

Atqui in Trochleis
binos orbiculos habentibus &longs;unt duo vectes HI, & PO in me­
dio &longs;u&longs;tinentes pondus, hypomochlia in I & O, atque Po­
tentiæ in H & P.

Igitur potentia &longs;u&longs;tinens e&longs;t ponderis &longs;ub­
quadrupla, & movens paulò major &longs;ubquadruplâ.

Quæ de duobus Vectibus DC & BA dicuntur, illa quidem
eatenus admitto, quatenus &longs;ingulas potentias D & B &longs;u&longs;tinen­
tes &longs;ubquadruplas e&longs;&longs;e ponderis definiunt; nam perinde &longs;e ha­
bent, atque &longs;i utraque potentia in unius, eju&longs;démque vectis ex­
tremitate &longs;imul &longs;u&longs;tinerent, unicámque potentiam, con&longs;titue­
rent, quæ &longs;ubdupla e&longs;t ponderis: & quia &longs;ingulæ potentiæ &longs;unt
ad totam & integram potentiam &longs;ubduplæ, &longs;ingulæ &longs;unt ponde­
ris &longs;ubquadruplæ.

Cæterum ex hoc quod ambæ potentiæ æqua­
les &longs;int, & &longs;ingulæ &longs;olitariæ e&longs;&longs;ent &longs;ubduplæ arguere, quod uni­
cuique re&longs;pondeat &longs;ubduplum &longs;ubdupli, materialiter quidem
verum e&longs;t, non autem formaliter ex modo argumentandi; alio­
quin &longs;i addatur tertius vectis, &longs;ervatâ eadem argumentandi for­
mâ, tres e&longs;&longs;ent potentiæ, & unicuique re&longs;pondebit &longs;ubduplum
&longs;ubdupli, hoc e&longs;t octava pars ponderis; id quod e&longs;t fal&longs;um.

Neque enim ex hoc quod potentia D &longs;u&longs;tineat pondus in F,
facit illud e&longs;&longs;e minùs grave, qua&longs;i transferatur in E factum
gravitatis &longs;ubduplæ, & potentia B &longs;ubduplam gravitatem pon­
deris &longs;u&longs;tineret &longs;ubduplo conatu, hoc e&longs;t &longs;ubquadruplo ejus,
qui requiritur ad &longs;u&longs;tinendum totum pondus; alioquin addito
tertio vecte in illius medium transferretur gravitas &longs;ubquadru­
pla ponderis, quæ &longs;u&longs;tineretur à potentiâ illius &longs;ubduplâ, ac
proinde &longs;uboctuplâ totius ponderis; cum tamen in tribus vecti­
bus &longs;ic di&longs;po&longs;itis tres potentiæ &longs;u&longs;tinentes &longs;ingulæ &longs;int &longs;olum
&longs;ub&longs;extuplæ.

Quod &longs;i pondus alligetur medio primi vectis in F,
tum extremitas D alligetur medio &longs;ecundi vectis in E, & dein­
ceps extremitas B alligetur medio tertij vectis, optimè con­
cluditur potentiam in F &longs;u&longs;tinere &longs;ubduplum &longs;ubdupli, & po­
tentiam applicatam tertio vecti &longs;u&longs;tinere &longs;ubduplum &longs;ubdupli
&longs;ubdupli, ac proinde illam e&longs;&longs;e &longs;ubquadruplam, hanc verò &longs;ub­
octuplam.

Sed hæc di&longs;po&longs;itio nil juvaret ad explicandum Tro­
chlearum momentum.

Verùm in Trochleâ duas illas potentias in H & P non vi­
deo; nam unica potentia in X medio fune XSH applicatur
quidem puncto H, &longs;uóque conatu prohibet ne pondus &longs;uâ gra­
vitate deor&longs;um trahat ip&longs;am Trochleam: at in P quænam alia
Potentia hoc idem efficit?

An non eadem Potentia X medio
fune XSHILMP applicatur vecti PO in P? igitur eadem
potentia exhibet conatum duarum potentiarum &longs;ubquadrupla­
rum: igitur Potentia non e&longs;t &longs;ubquadrupla, &longs;ed &longs;olum &longs;ubdu-
pla; quemadmodum &longs;i duos &longs;imul vectes in D & B idem &longs;u&longs;ti­
neret, utique tantumdem virium impenderet in utroque &longs;imul
&longs;u&longs;tinendo, quantum &longs;i unicus e&longs;&longs;et vectis.

Neque dixeris &longs;u&longs;tineri pondus à funibus inferiores orbicu­
los complectentibus: Hoc enim ad propo&longs;itam quæ&longs;tionem
nihil e&longs;t, tum quia nulla e&longs;t &longs;u&longs;tentatio, &longs;i pondus raptandum
&longs;it in plano horizontali, & tamen vis Trochleæ exercetur in
motu; tum quia ad pondus retinendum funes vim eandem
exercerent, &longs;i tam ampla e&longs;&longs;et unius orbiculi orbita, ut funem
utrumque caperet, vel unicus e&longs;&longs;et funis tam validus, ut utri­
que illi funi, quibus duo inferiores orbiculi in&longs;i&longs;tunt, æquiva­
leret; tum quia vero propius e&longs;t dicere, pondus &longs;u&longs;tineri à cla­
vo, ex quo &longs;uperior trochlea pendet, quàm à funibus, quemad­
modum ip&longs;a potentia &longs;u&longs;tinet; non autem vis &longs;u&longs;tinendi tribui­
tur funi illi, quem potentia arripit, & quo medio &longs;u&longs;tinet:
Clavus autem in huju&longs;modi trochleis, quando potentia trahens
proximè applicatur trochleæ clavo adnexæ, perinde &longs;u&longs;tinet
totam atque integram ponderis gravitatem, &longs;i plures fuerint or­
biculi, ac &longs;i unicus e&longs;&longs;et orbiculus; quamquam potentia minùs
reluctans in pluribus orbiculis, minore impetu conetur adver­
sùs pondus, ac proinde illa clavum minùs premat: quando verò
potentia proximè applicatur trochleæ inferiori, atque &longs;ur&longs;um
trahit, clavus nec urgetur ab impetu potentiæ, quem nullum
recipit, nec ip&longs;e &longs;u&longs;tinet totum pondus.

Quod &longs;i pondus traha­
tur in plano horizontali, &longs;ola potentia e&longs;t, quæ adversùs cla­
vum &longs;uam vim exercet &longs;uperando re&longs;i&longs;tentiam ponderis, quod
nihil agit adversùs clavum, &longs;ed &longs;uâ gravitate urget &longs;ubjectum
planum.

Ut autem manife&longs;tè deprehendas nihil e&longs;&longs;e Trochleis cum
Vecte commercij, duo ligna accipe, cuju&longs;cumque tandem fi­
guræ: &longs;ingulis tria in&longs;int foramina, quoad ejus fieri poterit, ex­
qui&longs;itè polita, ut minore conflictu funis excurrere po&longs;&longs;it: de­
inde funis alterno ab uno in alterum lignum ductu per forami­
na trajiciatur: Nam &longs;i alterum lignorum huju&longs;modi certo in lo­
co firmetur, alteri adnectatur pondus, tum funis extremitatem
arripiens trahas, idem planè præ&longs;tabis, quod adhibitis orbicu­
lis in communibus Trochleis: & tamen nullum hîc vectis ve&longs;ti­
gium apparet.

Certè in majoribus navigiis malus hinc & hinc
navis lateribus alligatur, ut rectam po&longs;itionem &longs;ervet: quia au­
tem rudentes aliquando remittuntur, ut in majore æ&longs;tu, illó&longs;­
que intendi oportet, propterea duo huju&longs;modi ligna in Ellip&longs;im
ferè deformata (vel potiùs in &longs;phæroides Hyperbolium factâ
conver&longs;ione non circa Axem, &longs;ed circa ordinatim Applicatam)
alterum navis lateri, alterum rudenti adnectunt nautæ, & fu­
nem non adeò cra&longs;&longs;um per foramina alterno ductu trajiciunt,
quem etiam axungiâ, aut aliâ pinguedine inficiunt, ut faciliùs
excurrat.

Cum autem remi&longs;&longs;ior factus fuerit rudens, funis illius
caput &longs;olvunt, & trahentes cogunt ligna illa fieri propiora, ex
quo rudens intenditur exiguo trahentis conatu, &longs;i animadver­
tas quàm opero&longs;um & incommodum e&longs;&longs;et alio artificio ruden­
tem remi&longs;&longs;um intendere.

Argumentum hoc, quod olim ante
annos vigintiquinque in Collegio Romano meis Auditoribus
in&longs;inuavi, conatus e&longs;t P. Schott ubi &longs;upra cap.3. eludere dicens
ligna illa nullo modo habere rationem trochlearum, quia malus, qui
e&longs;t re&longs;i&longs;titivum, & debet trahi versùs latera navis, e&longs;t appen&longs;us uni
extremo illorum mediante fune, & potentia trahens e&longs;t applicata
alteri extremo eorumdem, & nihil dependet intermedium.

Mirum
ergo non e&longs;t, &longs;i non habeat Vectis rationem.

Verùm, tanti viri pa­
ce dixerim, ligna illa ita habent rationem Trochlearum, ut &longs;i
illorum loco communes Trochleas &longs;ub&longs;tituas, idem planè &
eodem modo efficias, trochleâ alterâ adnexa navis alteri, alterâ
rudenti intendendo: Neque enim malus e&longs;t re&longs;i&longs;titivum, quod
ponderis loco &longs;uccedit, neque ille ad navis latus trahendus e&longs;t,
aut inclinandus, &longs;ed rudentis caput trahendum e&longs;t, ut malo
immoto ad navim accedat, adeóque intendatur: Quare rudens
ip&longs;e intendendus vicem &longs;ubit ponderis, quatenus intentioni
repugnat, & potentia e&longs;t applicata funi per lignorum foramina
trajecto, &longs;icut applicaretur funi ductario trochlearum orbiculos
complexo.

Quod &longs;i ligna illa non habent rationem Trochlea­
rum, & tamen trahendi facilitatem præ&longs;tant, ad quam Facul­
tatem Mechanicam &longs;pectant?

Non ad Vectem, ut ille quoquè
admittit; non ad Axem, neque ad Cuneum, neque ad Co­
chleam, ut manife&longs;tum e&longs;t, pertinent: igitur vel novam Facul­
tatem con&longs;tituunt, vel omnino Trochleæ &longs;unt.
CAPUT III.
An orbiculi magnitudo quicquam conferat.

QUamquam Trochleæ Vires haberi etiam &longs;inè orbiculis &longs;u­
periùs dictum &longs;it, communiter tamen rotulas &longs;uis thecis
inclu&longs;as, & ver&longs;atiles adhibemus.

Quæritur autem, an rotu­
larum huju&longs;modi magnitudo quicquam conferat ad faciliorem
motum: an verò indi&longs;criminatim rotulis &longs;ive majoribus, &longs;ive
minoribus uti po&longs;&longs;imus, citra virium notabile di&longs;pendium.
Quæ&longs;tioni huic locum fecit Ari&longs;toteles Mechan. quæ&longs;t.

9. ubi
inquirit, Cur ea, quæ per majores circulos tolluntur, & trahuntur,
faciliùs & citiùs moveri contingit, veluti majoribus trochleis, quam
minoribus? & re&longs;pondet, An quoniam quanto major fuerit illa, quæ
à centro e&longs;t, in æquali tempore majus movetur &longs;patium?

Quamobrem
æquali inexi&longs;tente onere idem faciet, quemadmodum diximus, &
majores libras minoribus exactiores e&longs;&longs;e; &longs;partum enim in illis cen­
trum e&longs;t.
Non de&longs;unt, qui negent faciliùs attolli pondus, ex.

gr.
&longs;itulam aquâ plenam è puteo, &longs;i funis in&longs;i&longs;tat orbiculo majo­
ri, quàm &longs;i minorem complectatur, ac proptereà ab Ari&longs;totele
fru&longs;trà quæri cau&longs;am facilitatis, quæ nulla &longs;it.

Si enim diame­
ter orbiculi &longs;umatur ut Vectis primi generis hypomochlium
habens in centro, potentia & pondus in diametri extremitati­
bus æqualiter di&longs;tant ab hypomochlio, ac proinde &longs;ive major
&longs;it, &longs;ive minor diameter, eadem &longs;emper manet Ratio æqualita­
tis momentorum, quatenus ex po&longs;itione pendent; adeóque
