ter de&longs;cendentium hactenus dicta &longs;unt, conjectura &longs;umenda e&longs;t
de reliquis percu&longs;&longs;ionibus, quæ motûs originem non à &longs;olâ gra­
vitate ducunt: nam in his pariter ex motûs velocitate, qua in­
dicatur inten&longs;io impetûs, oritur validior percu&longs;&longs;io: nam &longs;ive
conceptus à potentiâ vivente impetus, &longs;ive extrin&longs;ecùs im­
pre&longs;&longs;us (ni&longs;i novam offendat re&longs;i&longs;tentiam, quæ illum retundat
ac minuat) augetur novo impetu, quem potentia &longs;imiliter ap­
plicata, ii&longs;démque viribus prædita, nec ob&longs;taculo ullo aut reti­
naculo impedita, &longs;equentibus momentis efficere pote&longs;t: ideó­
que quò major e&longs;t potentiæ percutientis motus quoad &longs;patium,
cæteris paribus, validiùs percutit.

Cæteris, inquam, paribus;
nam &longs;i po&longs;terioribus momentis motûs, minor impetus addatur à
potentiâ movente, quàm deperdatur ex priore impetu impre&longs;­
&longs;o, quem natura repugnans excutit, langue&longs;cit motus, & mi­
nuitur impetus: aut &longs;i tantumdem acquiratur impetûs, quan­
tum deperditur, motus e&longs;t æquabilis, nec ad validiorem per­
cu&longs;&longs;ionem quicquam confert diuturna potentiæ moventis appli­
catio, cum eadem &longs;it impetûs inten&longs;io in fine horæ, atque in
primo momento.

Quia tamen frequentiùs (etiam &longs;i fortè ali­
quid antiquioris impetûs ex novâ re&longs;i&longs;tentiâ deteratur) plus ad­
ditur, velocitas incrementum &longs;umit, &longs;i potentia maneat diutiùs
applicata.

Hinc patet, cur, cum quis ho&longs;tem &longs;ari&longs;sâ confodere tentat,
aut po&longs;tes cra&longs;&longs;iore fu&longs;te arietare, brachium retrahat quantum
pote&longs;t; ut nimirum potentia diutiùs applicata maneat in motu,
&longs;empérque novum impetum gignens &longs;ari&longs;&longs;æ aut fu&longs;ti imprimat.

Sic duobus digladiantibus, &longs;i alter alteri &longs;ini&longs;trum latus obver­
tat, & tam longo en&longs;e utatur, ut protecto corpore po&longs;&longs;it manum
valde retrahere, hic validi&longs;&longs;imum ictum infliget extento dex­
tro brachio, tùm quia ex celerrimâ corporis totius conver&longs;ione
impetus aliquis brachio communicatur præter impetum, quem
conferunt mu&longs;culi movendo brachio de&longs;tinati, tùm quia diu­
tiùs movetur gladius à manu per majus &longs;patium.

Quod &longs;i eo
ictu, quem Itali Quartam vocamus, ho&longs;tem impetat, adhuc va-
dior erit ictus, quia longior motus; nam in conver&longs;ione corpo­
ris obvertitur ho&longs;ti dextrum latus præcisè ita, ut brachium to­
tum extendi queat; & præterea pars exterior manûs deor&longs;um
convertitur, ex quo propter conformationem juncturarum cubi­
ti & manus ictus evadit duos ferè digitos longior, quàm &longs;i non
fieret huju&longs;modi manûs conver&longs;io: demum cùm &longs;ini&longs;trum bra­
chium in po&longs;teriora projiciatur extentum, fit, ut corpori major
impetus in anteriora po&longs;&longs;it imprimi citrà periculum cadendi;
brachium &longs;iquidem eo pacto in po&longs;teriora projectum, tran&longs;lato
gravitatis, ut gravitationis, centro &longs;ervat totius corporis æqui­
librium.

Nec di&longs;&longs;imili ratione manife&longs;tum fit, cur pugnum validiùs
impingant, qui brachium magis contrahunt, ideóque validio­
res ictus ab iis proveniant, qui longiora habentes brachia ea
magis contrahunt; &longs;icut calce fortiùs impetunt, qui longiora
habent crura; quia videlicet diutiùs moventur, magi&longs;que im­
petum augent & velocitatem, antè ictum.

Sic vides ab equis
calcitronibus pedem in anteriora retrahi, & ab irato tauro col­
lum depre&longs;&longs;um in po&longs;teriora inflecti, corpore pariter curvato,
& qua&longs;i in po&longs;teriora retracto, ut longiore motu validiùs impe­
tant: hinc qui propior e&longs;t equo calcitranti, minùs læditur, quia
nondum tantum impetum concepit, quantum longiore motu
concepi&longs;&longs;et.

Huju&longs;modi percu&longs;&longs;ionibus à potentiâ vivente, quæ &longs;uos mo­
tus ex arbitrio temperat, provenientibus certam legem &longs;tatui
non po&longs;&longs;e nemo non videt, &longs;ive corpus percutiens impetu ex­
trin&longs;ecùs a&longs;&longs;umpto feratur naturâ omnino repugnante, &longs;ive im­
petus impre&longs;&longs;us cum impetu vi interiore acqui&longs;ito in eumdem
motum con&longs;pirent.

Hoc unum tanquam manife&longs;tò comper­
tum atque deprehen&longs;um tenemus, quod in longiore motu factâ
novi impetûs acce&longs;&longs;ione velocitas augetur, & vis percu&longs;&longs;ionis
e&longs;t major.

Hinc &longs;icut quando fi&longs;tucâ cadente pali in terram
adiguntur, initio illa modicum attollitur, quia exigua &longs;uperan­
da e&longs;t re&longs;i&longs;tentia, hac autem cre&longs;cente quò altiùs adacti fuerint,
magis illa attollitur; &longs;ic lignarios fabros clavum in tabulam in­
figentes, initio quidem breviore mallei motu uti videmus, quem
deinceps augent, donec demum totâ brachij exten&longs;ione con­
nitantur, prout re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ incrementa validiore percu&longs;&longs;ione
vinci oportet.

Sic ru&longs;ticos ligna findentes altiùs elevare &longs;ecu­
rim, aut tuditem, quo cuneum percutiant, ob&longs;ervamus, quò
major e&longs;t &longs;cindendi difficultas, ut auctus impetus velociorem
motum efficiat, quem percu&longs;&longs;io con&longs;equitur.

Cum itaque duæ velocitates inter &longs;e comparatæ conferri po&longs;­
&longs;int vel ratione temporis, vel ratione &longs;patij, ita ut vel æqualia
&longs;patia inæqualibus temporibus, vel inæqualia &longs;patia tempore
eodem conficiant; illa utique erit major velocitas, quando in
motu temporis brevitas, & &longs;patij amplitudo con&longs;en&longs;erint.

Hinc
percu&longs;&longs;io contingit validior à corpore, quod multum &longs;patij bre­
vi tempore decurrat, quàm à corpore conficiente minus &longs;patij
longiore tempore.

Propterea quæ de velocitate dicta &longs;unt, &
percu&longs;&longs;ionum viribus, &longs;pectatâ diuturnitate motûs, ita intelli­
genda &longs;unt, ut corpus percutiens vel eodem tempore plus &longs;pa­
tij, vel breviore tempore æquale &longs;patium, vel breviore tempore
plus &longs;patij decurrat: hoc enim ex majore impetûs inten&longs;ione
oritur.
CAPUT VIII.

An validior &longs;it ictus Mallei à &longs;itu Verticali ad
Horizontalem, an verò ab Horizontali ad
Verticalem de&longs;cendentis.

CErtum e&longs;t percu&longs;&longs;iones fieri validiores, quando cum impe­
tu ab extraneâ potentiâ impre&longs;&longs;o con&longs;entit vis intrin&longs;eca
ip&longs;ius corporis percutientis motu naturali de&longs;cendentis; ip&longs;um
enim &longs;uum pariter impetum concipit, quem addit impre&longs;&longs;o: &longs;ic
&longs;axum, quod ex editâ turri deor&longs;um rectâ projicis, validiùs per­
cutit, quàm &longs;i illud dimitteres &longs;ponte &longs;ua ca&longs;urum.

Hinc qui
malleo deor&longs;um percutit aliquod corpus, ad motum eundem,
cum percutientis impul&longs;u con&longs;pirantem invenit mallei gravita­
tem, & citrà omnem controver&longs;iam majorem ictum infligit,
quàm &longs;i &longs;ur&longs;um, aut in latus urgeret malleum, gravitate aut re­
pugnante, aut &longs;altem nihil juvante.

Porrò cùm circa juncturam brachij cum humero, tanquam
circa centrum, de&longs;cribatur &longs;emicirculus de&longs;cendens, in quo
&longs;unt duo Quadrantes, alter cùm brachium &longs;ummè elevatum in
perpendiculo exi&longs;tens de&longs;cendit, ut fiat horizonti parallelum,
alterùm brachium à po&longs;itione horizonti parallelâ ad imum de­
primitur, ut iterum in perpendiculo &longs;tatuatur; dubitari pote&longs;t,
an mallei ictus juxta duas ha&longs;ce po&longs;itiones &longs;int omnino æquales,
an verò inæquales; & hoc quidem non ex vi impul&longs;ionis exter­
næ, quam æquabilem ponimus, homine æqualiter connitente,
brachio æqualiter extento, & datâ eâdem manubrij longitudi­
ne, &longs;ed ratione ip&longs;ius gravitatis mallei naturaliter de&longs;cendentis.

Prioris motus, quo in circulo Verticali malleus deprimitur u&longs;­
que ad planum horizonti parallelum, in quo fit percu&longs;&longs;io, exem­
plum præbent tùm fabri ferrarij incudem tundentes, tùm ligna­
rij clavos a&longs;&longs;eribus in plano horizontali con&longs;titutis infigentes.

Po&longs;terioris autem motûs, quo malleum horizonti parallelum
u&longs;que eò deprimimus, ut fiat perpendicularis, &longs;pecimen habe­
mus, cum corpus in pavimento jacens, aut non procul ab illo,
ita percutimus, ut percu&longs;&longs;um moveatur horizonti ferè paralle­
lum; cuju&longs;modi e&longs;&longs;et, quando cuneum jacenti &longs;axo &longs;ubjicere
conamur, aut ligneam pilam ludentes malleo excutimus.

Ut autem dilucidè propo&longs;ita quæ&longs;tio exponatur, &longs;ecernendus
e&longs;t mallei motus naturalis ab
ea parte, quam externa im­
pul&longs;io addit; & perinde con­
&longs;iderandus e&longs;t malleus, atque
&longs;i manubrij extremitas axi in­
fixa e&longs;&longs;et circa eum ver&longs;atilis,
adeò ut &longs;ibi relictus malleus
arcum de&longs;cendendo de&longs;cri­
beret.

Sit malleus AB; &
manubrij extremitas A &longs;it
circa axem in A ver&longs;atilis;
centrum autem gravitatis
mallei intelligatur in B: quod
quandiu in perpendiculo im­
minet axi A, totam &longs;uam vim
in illum exerens &longs;u&longs;tinetur,
nec motum inchoat, ni&longs;i à perpendiculo BA removeatur; hoc
verò ubi tran&longs;gre&longs;&longs;us fuerit malleus, de&longs;cen&longs;um molitur: &longs;ed
quia rigido manubrio connectitur cum Axe A, cogitur in latus
&longs;ecedere, & de&longs;cribere arcum BC, cui motui re&longs;pondet &longs;olùm
de&longs;cen&longs;us BD Sinus Ver&longs;us anguli BAC; & de&longs;cripto integro
Quadrante BE, de&longs;cen&longs;um metitur Radius BA.

Verùm quamvis motus huju&longs;modi per arcum BE &longs;it con&longs;en­
taneus propen&longs;ioni gravitatis, quæ proinde &longs;ingulis momentis
novam impetûs particulam concipiens motum, quantum pote&longs;t,
accelerat, non tamen illa Ratio &longs;ervatur, de qua &longs;uperiori Capi­
te dictum e&longs;t, ut Ratio &longs;patiorum &longs;it in duplicatâ Ratione tem­
porum; neque enim hìc liberè de&longs;cendit malleus, &longs;ed in &longs;ingu­
lis punctis Quadrantis alia atque alia habet momenta de&longs;cen­
dendi, &longs;ingula minora momento, quod haberet idem malleus
nullo impedimento prohibitus; quod momentum integrum ille
obtinet tantummodo in Quadrantis extremitate E, ubi nullâ
ratione &longs;u&longs;tinetur aut retinetur ab axe A manubrium &longs;u&longs;tinen­
te, aut retinente.

E&longs;t autem momentum gravitatis in unoquo­
que arcûs puncto, qua&longs;i illa e&longs;&longs;et in plano ibi circulum tangen­
te, ac propterea inclinato: idcirco, ut lib.1. cap.13. dictum e&longs;t,
eju&longs;dem gravitatis momentum in plano inclinato, ad momen­
tum in lineâ perpendiculari eam Rationem habet, quam in
triangulo rectangulo, cujus angulus Verticalis &longs;it æqualis an­
gulo inclinationis plani, habet Perpendiculum ad Hypothe­
nu&longs;am.

Quare in puncto C malleus habet momentum, ac &longs;i e&longs;­
&longs;et in plano inclinato FC, & ad momentum liberum ita &longs;e ha­
bet, ut DF ad FC, hoc e&longs;t per 8.lib.6. ut DC ad CA, & &longs;i­
militer in puncto G ut IG ad GA.

Ex quo patet momentorum
incrementa analoga e&longs;&longs;e incrementis Sinuum Rectorum arcu­
bus &longs;ubinde majoribus convenientium.

At hìc, ubi de gravitatis momentis &longs;ermo in&longs;tituitur, caven­
dum e&longs;t, ne quem fortè in errorem inducat ambiguitas nomi­
nis.

Nam quando in C momentum dicimus e&longs;&longs;e ut DC, & in
G momentum e&longs;&longs;e ut IG, hoc intelligendum e&longs;t præcisè ra­
tione po&longs;itionis, quatenus in hoc aut illo puncto con&longs;tituta gra­
vitas concipitur, nullâ habitâ ratione antecedentis motûs aut
quietis: & &longs;ub voce momenti Gravitatis hæc &longs;ubjecta e&longs;t &longs;en­
tentia, ut gravitas mallei, quæ non impedita &longs;ingulis punctis
temporis conciperet novum impetum ut AC, AG &c.

quia à
rigido manubrio modò magis, modò minùs &longs;u&longs;tinetur, quando
e&longs;t in C, impeditur, ne concipiat impetum ni&longs;i ut DC, & in G
ut IG, atque ita de cæteris, donec in E concipiat impetum ut
AE.

Cæterùm quia in præcedentibus temporis punctis acqui­
&longs;itæ &longs;unt particulæ impetûs re&longs;pondentes.

Sinubus Rectis præ­
cedentium arcuum, ea fit impetûs inten&longs;io, ac proinde motûs
velocitas, quæ omnium illorum Sinuum aggregato ferè re&longs;pon­
deat: Et in fine Quadrantis in E vis e&longs;t complectens omnes
impetus, quibus additio facta e&longs;t &longs;emper non tamen æqualis pri­
mo impetui, qui valdè languidus fuit, &longs;ed &longs;emper major atque
major, prout Sinus Recti excreverunt.
Et hæc quidem de Superiore Quadrante.

Jam inferior Qua­
drans con&longs;iderandus e&longs;t, in quo Axis A retinet malleum, ne ex
E recto tramite de&longs;cendat, &longs;ed eum cogit deflectere, & arcum
ES de&longs;cribere, in cujus &longs;ingulis punctis momentum perinde e&longs;t
atque in plano inclinato.

Quare in L intelligitur de&longs;cendens
in plano inclinato KL, & ibi ejus momentum ad momentum
liberum e&longs;t ut RK ad KL, hoc e&longs;t ut ML, ad LK, hoc e&longs;t per
8. lib.6. ut MA ad AL, hoc e&longs;t ut Sinus Complementi arcûs
EL ad Radium.

Similiter in N e&longs;t ut PA ad AN; & &longs;ic de
cæteris.

E&longs;t autem manife&longs;tum huju&longs;modi Sinus Complemen­
torum eo&longs;dem planè e&longs;&longs;e cum Sinubus Rectis Superioris Qua­
drantis, &longs;ed ordine præpo&longs;tero acceptis, atque adeò horum ag­
gregatum e&longs;&longs;e illorum &longs;ummæ æquale.

Non tamen hinc &longs;tatim conficitur eandem e&longs;&longs;e in S vim mal­
lei de&longs;cendentis ex E, atque e&longs;t in E vis eju&longs;dem de&longs;cendentis
ex B.

Non inficior æqualem in utroque Quadrante produci
impetûs entitatem, &longs;i in &longs;ummam referantur omnes impetûs
particulæ, quæ momentis &longs;ingulis efficiuntur; &longs;ed an æqualem
demum conflent inten&longs;ionem, ex qua vis percu&longs;&longs;ionis oritur,
non omninò temerè, ut mihi quidem videor, &longs;ubdubito.

Cùm
enim acqui&longs;itus impetus interveniente re&longs;i&longs;tentiâ imminuatur,
ac debilitetur, & quidem eò magis, &longs;i à rectâ &longs;ecundùm natu­
ram lineâ magis declinare cogitur; utique in&longs;titutâ Superioris
cum Inferiori Quadrante comparatio o&longs;tendit in illo quidem
re&longs;i&longs;tentiam &longs;emper decre&longs;cere, in hoc &longs;emper augeri, ac proin­
de impetum prioribus momentis acqui&longs;itum, licèt aliquid in
con&longs;equentibus amittat, tamen hujus decrementi men&longs;urâ ma­
gis ac magis extenuatâ, non adeò in Superiore Quadrante lan­
gue&longs;cere, &longs;icut in inferiore, ubi re&longs;i&longs;tentia &longs;emper augetur, &
impetus magis ac magis deteritur.

Adde impetum de novo
productum in po&longs;terioribus momentis, in &longs;uperiore quidem
Quadrante e&longs;&longs;e majorem, in inferiore verò minorem.

Quare
cùm in po&longs;tremis motûs momentis in &longs;uperiore Quadrante
multus producatur impetus, & ferè nulla &longs;it re&longs;i&longs;tentia, in in­
feriore autem Quadrante multa inveniatur re&longs;i&longs;tentia, & valdè
exiguus impetus producatur, &longs;atis probabili conjecturâ ali­
quam &longs;tatuemus ictuum inæqualitatem, ita ut aliquanto vali­
dior &longs;it ex B in E, quàm ex E in S.

Neque ob&longs;tat, quod in E maximus producatur impetus, qui
deinde in L & N, atque con&longs;equentibus punctis additamen­
tum accipiat, licèt &longs;emper minus ac minus, quo ita augetur, ut
&longs;emper incitetur motus.

Hoc enim non facit, quin impetus in E
conceptus majoribus &longs;emper decrementis imminuatur u&longs;que
in S, & impetus in L conceptus &longs;imiliter magis langue&longs;cat, at­
que ita de cæteris.

Finge &longs;cilicet nullum impetum novum con­
cipi in L, aut nullum in N, adhuc impetus in E conceptus deor­
&longs;um tenderet, &longs;ed retinaculo illo debilitatus languidiùs adduce­
ret malleum in S: idem dic de quolibet impetu &longs;ingulis mo­
mentis concepto, qui cre&longs;cente re&longs;i&longs;tentiâ majoribus decre­
mentis imminueretur, & languidè veniret in S.

At quoniam
plurima &longs;unt momenta in brevi&longs;&longs;imi temporis particulâ, tot
&longs;unt reliqui impetus, ut &longs;imul con&longs;tituant notabilem inten­
&longs;ionem.

Quod autem re&longs;i&longs;tentia in &longs;uperiore Quadrante minuatur,
argumento non e&longs;t opus; manife&longs;tum quippe e&longs;t gravitatem in
arcu BE de&longs;cendentem &longs;ubinde transferri à plano magis incli­
nato in minùs inclinatum, & magis accedens ad perpendicu­
lare: quis autem neget de&longs;cendenti gravitati eò minùs ob&longs;tare
planum &longs;ubjectum, quò fuerit minùs inclinatum?

Atqui an­
gulus CAF minor e&longs;t angulo GAH, anguli autem ad C & G
&longs;unt recti; igitur angulus AFC major e&longs;t angulo AHG; at­
que propterea planum FC e&longs;t magis inclinatum, quàm pla­
num HG, & cætera plana con&longs;equentia u&longs;que ad planum per­
pendiculare in E.

Contra verò in inferiore Quadrante re&longs;i&longs;ten-
tiam &longs;emper augeri ex eo con&longs;tat, quòd à plano perpendicula­
ri ad inclinatum, immò ad &longs;emper magis atque magis inclina­
tum, fit tran&longs;itus, donec demum de&longs;cendens gravitas veniat ad
planum horizontale.

Angulus videlicet inclinationis plani e&longs;t
æqualis angulo, quem denotat arcus in inferiore Quadrante
decur&longs;us.

Nam in triangulo ALK, cujus in ba&longs;im AK cadit
perpendicularis LM, ex 8.lib.6. angulo KAL æqualis e&longs;t an­
gulus KLM, & propter paralleli&longs;mum linearum ML & KR,
angulo KLM æqualis e&longs;t alternus LKR angulus inclinationis
plani KL; igitur hic angulus inclinationis e&longs;t æqualis angulo,
quem denotat arcus EL.

Idem dic de angulo EAN & cæte­
ris, qui &longs;emper majores indicant gravitatem tran&longs;ire ad plana
magis & magis inclinata.
CAPUT IX.
Quomodo percu&longs;siones ex mole pendeant.

QUamvis ad validiorem ictum infligendum corporis percu­
tientis velocitas, impetûs inten&longs;ionem indicans, pluri­
mum conferat, ut dictum e&longs;t; non ad hanc tamen velut ad uni­
cam cau&longs;am referenda e&longs;t vis percu&longs;&longs;ionis; &longs;ed & corporis eju&longs;­
dem percutientis moles attendenda e&longs;t: videmus &longs;cilicet ex
mole ipsâ percu&longs;&longs;iones augeri, cæteris paribus; perinde enim
e&longs;t, atque &longs;i tot corpora percutientia e&longs;&longs;ent, quàm multiplex
e&longs;t moles major collata cum minore.

Nam &longs;i nota e&longs;t vis per­
cutiendi, quæ ine&longs;t globulo duarum unciarum cadenti ex cer­
tâ quadam altitudine utique probabilis conjectura & ratio &longs;ua­
det &longs;extuplam e&longs;&longs;e vim globi ex &longs;imili materiâ unciarum duo­
decim ex altitudine eâdem cadentis: gravitas &longs;iquidem &longs;exies
multiplicata etiam impetum efficere pote&longs;t &longs;extuplum, non qui­
dem inten&longs;ivè, &longs;ed entitativè; neque enim pro Ratione molis
augetur velocitas, quippe quæ requireret &longs;extuplam inten&longs;io­
nem.

Hanc tamen majorem vim Ratione molis ita intelligi
velim, ut medij re&longs;i&longs;tentia di&longs;&longs;imuletur: nam eo ip&longs;o, quod mo-
les eju&longs;dem &longs;ecundùm &longs;peciem gravitatis augetur, etiam &longs;uper­
ficiem augeri nece&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t, quæ non eâdem facilitate medium di­
vidit.

Sed quoniam ita augeri pote&longs;t moles, ut non &longs;imilem
&longs;ervet figuram, &longs;ed alias atque alias induat figuras manente
æquali gravitate, ac propterea valde incerta e&longs;t re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ
men&longs;ura, quæ ex medij divi&longs;ione oritur, prout hanc aut illam
faciem medio dividendo obvertit ip&longs;a moles; hinc e&longs;t, quod il­
lam re&longs;i&longs;tentiam tanti&longs;per di&longs;&longs;imulare licet, dum reliquas per­
cu&longs;&longs;ionis cau&longs;as ve&longs;tigamus.

Cæterùm illius quoque ratio e&longs;t
habenda, ut aliquid virium detractum intelligatur percu&longs;&longs;ioni,
ubi & moles & &longs;patium con&longs;ideratur; quatenus velocitas, auctâ
mole, hoc e&longs;t aucto ex medij re&longs;i&longs;tentia impedimento, aliquan­
tulum imminuitur, ita tamen ut pariter plures majoris molis
partes, collatis viribus medium urgentes, aliquid afferant faci­
litatis in dividendo medio, adeóque etiam velocitatis.

Ex his habetur percu&longs;&longs;ionis vires componi ex mole & ex ve­
locitate corporis percutientis: Moles &longs;iquidem determinat en­
titativè men&longs;uram impetûs &longs;ingulis momentis producti, veloci­
tas indicat inten&longs;ionem, hoc e&longs;t &longs;ummam impetuum in motu
acqui&longs;itorum, hoc e&longs;t eju&longs;dem impetûs gravitati, aut potentiæ
virtuti, primo momento re&longs;pondentis multiplicationem.

Qua­
re &longs;i duorum corporum ictus comparentur, percu&longs;&longs;ionum Ratio
erit compo&longs;ita ex Rationibus velocitatum, & gravitatum, &longs;eu
potentiarum, quibus vis movendi tribuitur.

Velocitatem au­
tem illam intelligo, quæ ratione impetus acqui&longs;iti conveniret
corpori eo momento, quo percutit, ni&longs;i inveniret re&longs;i&longs;tentiam:
Huju&longs;modi verò impetûs eo momento inten&longs;ionem indicat &longs;pa­
tium in antecedenti motu decur&longs;um, ex quo, prout dictum e&longs;t
cap.7. cogno&longs;citur Ratio temporum, quibus e&longs;t analoga inten­
&longs;io impetûs.

Hinc &longs;i cadat ex altitudine 100 palmorum globus
unciarum duarum, deinde ex altitudine decem palmorum glo­
bus unciarum 12, &longs;unt duæ Rationes, altera velocitatum, hoc e&longs;t
inten&longs;ionum impetûs in &longs;ubduplicatâ Ratione altitudinum, vi­
delicet ut 10 ad (3 16/100), altera gravitatum ut 1 ad 6; quæ compo&longs;i­
tæ dant Rationem ut 10 ad (18 96/100); ac proinde percu&longs;&longs;io globi
minoris e&longs;timari poterit proximè ut 10, majoris ut (18 96/100): Nam
duæ unciæ majoris de&longs;cendendo per decem palmos haberent
impetum ut (3 16/100): ergo &longs;exies duæ unciæ habent entitativè im­
petum ut (18 96/100). Quare &longs;i gravitates fuerint reciprocè ut velo­
citates, hoc e&longs;t impetûs inten&longs;iones, erunt æquales percu&longs;&longs;io­
nes, ut e&longs;t manife&longs;tum.

Hoc autem, quod de gravitate motu naturali de&longs;cendente
dictum e&longs;t, de potentiis pariter, &longs;ervatâ analogiâ, e&longs;t intelligen­
dum (a&longs;&longs;umendo &longs;cilicet loco gravitatis vim ip&longs;am potentiæ,
quæ &longs;imiliter conata per&longs;everet in motu antecedente percu&longs;&longs;io­
nem) &longs;i innote&longs;cat, quantum potentiæ inæqualiter conentur,
& per inæqualia &longs;patia moveant idem corpus, quo ictum infli­
gunt; nam ex Rationibus conatuum, & velocitatum componi­
tur Ratio percu&longs;&longs;ionum.

At &longs;i potentiæ duæ inæqualiter co­
nantes per inæqualia &longs;patia moveant inæqualia corpora, qui­
bus alteri corpori ictus infligatur, attendendum e&longs;t, an &longs;olùm
tam diuturnus &longs;it motus ictum præcedens, ut nihil impre&longs;&longs;i im­
petûs deteratur: nam &longs;i alternis quibu&longs;dam incrementis & de­
crementis modò augeatur, modò minuatur, non e&longs;t habenda
ratio totius temporis, aut &longs;patij, in quo factus e&longs;t motus: quis
enim exi&longs;timet aptè computari po&longs;&longs;e, utrùm navis percurrerit
&longs;ex, aut octo milliaria, ut ejus ictus, quo cymbam percutit,
cogno&longs;catur?

Quare &longs;atius erit in huju&longs;modi motibus ab impe­
tu extrin&longs;ecùs impre&longs;&longs;o provenientibus, qui ut plurimum re­
pugnantem habet ip&longs;ius corporis naturam, nec totus permanet
quemadmodum impetus acqui&longs;itus, ip&longs;am velocitatem con&longs;i­
derare, quatenus apparet non multo tempore antè ictum: tunc
enim, quia potentia movens eum impetum imprimit, qui &longs;atis
&longs;it ad molem illam movendam tantâ velocitate, ut impetus hu­
ju&longs;modi innote&longs;cat, & molis & velocitatis ratio habenda e&longs;t;
atque idcircò ad comparandas invicem percu&longs;&longs;iones compo­
nenda e&longs;t Ratio ex Rationibus molium, & velocitatum.

Hinc
&longs;i navis oneraria lentè moveatur velocitate ut duo, & navis alia
&longs;extuplo minor moveatur velocitate ut decem (quia videlicet
paulò antè ictum ob&longs;ervatum e&longs;t, quo tempore illa procedebat
duos pa&longs;&longs;us, hanc percurri&longs;&longs;e decem pa&longs;&longs;us) ictus majoris ad
ictum minoris erit ut 12 ad 10, compo&longs;itis &longs;cilicet Ratione mo­
lium 6 ad 1, & Ratione velocitatum 2 ad 10.

Hìc autem ubi Molis nomen u&longs;urpamus, cavendus e&longs;t in
vocabuli ambiguitate lap&longs;us: neque enim corporis tantummo­
do amplitudinem, quatenus &longs;ub Geometricam dimen&longs;ionem
cadens &longs;patium occupat, intelligere oportet, verùm etiam na­
turam ip&longs;am atque &longs;ub&longs;tantiam: ea &longs;cilicet, quæ minore &longs;ecun­
dùm &longs;peciem gravitate prædita &longs;unt, &longs;ub magnis dimen&longs;ionibus
parum habent &longs;ub&longs;tantiæ atque materiæ, ideóque & tenuem
movendi ac impetum producendi virtutem; neque propterea
quod molem magnam præ&longs;eferant, validiora in percutiendo
cen&longs;enda &longs;unt, qua&longs;i à globo ligneo librarum duarum, quia fe­
rè decuplo major e&longs;t globo plumbeo eju&longs;dem ponderis, expecta­
ri po&longs;&longs;et validior ictus, &longs;i ex eâdem altitudine dimittantur: nam
vis producendi impetum connata e&longs;t &longs;ub&longs;tantiæ, quâ &longs;ub&longs;tantia
talis e&longs;t, non quantitati, prout exten&longs;io e&longs;t.

Quare ubi molis
habendam e&longs;&longs;e rationem diximus, ut fiat Rationum Compo&longs;i­
tio, ex qua percu&longs;&longs;ionum incrementa aut decrementa inno­
te&longs;cant, ip&longs;am poti&longs;&longs;imùm &longs;ub&longs;tantiam intelligimus, quam, non
ni&longs;i intra idem genus corporis, exten&longs;io major aut minor con&longs;e­
qui &longs;olet: propterea &longs;i ferrei cylindri ictus, atque lignei, confer­
re invicem volueris, non ip&longs;os cylindros, quatenus cylindri &longs;unt
&longs;ub tantâ ba&longs;i & altitudine, dimetiri oportet, &longs;ed potiùs eorum
gravitatem, ut quanta &longs;it moles virtutis ip&longs;i naturæ atque &longs;ub­
&longs;tantiæ re&longs;pondens, ex gravitate inferatur.

Non tamen idcircò exten&longs;ionis atque figuræ animadver&longs;io
otio&longs;a e&longs;t, aut contemnenda, in percu&longs;&longs;ionibus; quinimmò non
o&longs;citanter con&longs;ideranda, ut deprehendatur, qua &longs;ui corporis
parte validi&longs;&longs;imum ictum infligat in&longs;trumentum percutiens.

Hoc autem tripliciter poti&longs;&longs;imùm movetur, videlicet, primò ad
perpendiculum de&longs;cendendo motu naturali; deinde horizonta­
liter, &longs;eu obliquè, cùm à dextrâ in &longs;ini&longs;tram, aut vici&longs;&longs;im à lævâ
in dexteram, aut in anteriora extrin&longs;ecùs motu recto impelli­
tur; demum in orbem, circuli arcum de&longs;cribendo.

Et quidem corpus &longs;ponte &longs;uâ de&longs;cendens, quodcumque tan­
dem illud &longs;it, &longs;uam habet Directionis lineam, per quam in mo­
tu Centrum gravitatis progreditur.

In infimâ igitur corporis
parte ip&longs;a Directionis linea definit punctum, in quo &longs;i fiat cor­
poris percutientis contactus, ille erit validi&longs;&longs;imus ictus, quem
huju&longs;modi corpus ex datâ altitudine de&longs;cendens infligere po­
te&longs;t, ibi quippe maximam reperit re&longs;i&longs;tentiam, cum æquales
vires hinc atque hinc con&longs;i&longs;tentes ibi con&longs;pirent, & obicem
motui directè oppo&longs;itum offendant, adeò ut neque in hanc,
neque in illam partem Centrum gravitatis dirigatur.

Quod &longs;i
punctum contactûs corporum colli&longs;orum non &longs;it in lineâ Di­
rectionis corporis cadentis, &longs;ed à latere; eò validior erit ictus,
quo minore intervallo punctum contactûs ab huju&longs;modi lineâ
Directionis aberit; magis videlicet opponitur motui directo,
quàm &longs;i ab eâ longiùs abe&longs;&longs;et: quando enim contactus procul
e&longs;t à lineâ Directionis, ab hac minùs deflectere cogitur cen­
trum gravitatis, quod multò magis repellendum e&longs;&longs;et à contactu
propiore.

Sic globus, cujus centrum gra­
vitatis &longs;it C, de&longs;cendens per lineam Di­
rectionis CD, &longs;i percutiat puncto D, om­
nium validi&longs;&longs;imum ictum infligit, quia
corpus percu&longs;&longs;um omninò opponitur mo­
tui CD, nec centro C relinquit locum
&longs;altem obliquè de&longs;cendendi: at verò &longs;i
contactus fiat in E, impeditur quidem
de&longs;cen&longs;us globi per rectam CD ulteriùs
productam, pote&longs;t tamen centrum gravitatis de&longs;cendere de&longs;cri­
bendo circa punctum E manens arcum CF; quapropter in E
minorem invenit re&longs;i&longs;tentiam quàm in D, ubi nihil de&longs;cende­
re pote&longs;t, &longs;i &longs;ubjectum corpus loco non cedat.

Similiter &longs;i con­
tactus fiat in G, adhuc impeditur motus directus per CD, atta­
men centrum gravitatis C pote&longs;t obliquè de&longs;cendere de&longs;cri­
bendo arcum CH.

Sed quoniam per arcum CF magis decli­
nat à perpendiculo, & minùs de&longs;cendit, quàm per arcum CH
(quamvis arcus illi æquales ponantur paribus ℞adiis EC, &
GC de&longs;cripti) propterea magis impeditur motus in contactu E
propiori lineæ Directionis, quàm in G remotiori.

Cum itaque
eò validiorem ictum infligant corpora percutientia, quò ma­
jorem inchoato motui re&longs;i&longs;tentiam offendunt, manife&longs;tum e&longs;t
in corporibus naturali motu de&longs;cendentibus validi&longs;&longs;imum e&longs;&longs;e
ictum in puncto, quod lineæ directionis motûs re&longs;pondet, &longs;em­
pérque imbecilliores e&longs;&longs;e ictus, quò magis puncta contactûs ab­
&longs;unt à lineâ Directionis.

Hoc idem, quod de lineâ Directionis gravium &longs;ponte &longs;uâ
de&longs;cendentium dictum e&longs;t, analogiâ &longs;ervatâ, traducendum e&longs;t
ad ea corpora, quæ externo impul&longs;u agitata motu recto &longs;ivè
Horizonti parallelo, &longs;ivè ad Horizontem aut obliquè, aut ad
perpendiculum, inclinato moventur.

Cum enim, ex hypo­
the&longs;i, partes omnes huju&longs;modi corporis impul&longs;i æquali veloci­
tate per æqualia &longs;patia moveantur, æqualem impetum &longs;ingulæ
recipiunt, à movente impre&longs;&longs;um.

Similiter igitur in corpore
illo concipiendum e&longs;t punctum, quod Centrum Impetûs vocari
pote&longs;t, quia illud æquales hinc & hinc Impetus circum&longs;tant,
quemadmodum Centrum Gravitatis dicitur, circa quod æqua­
lia gravitatis momenta di&longs;po&longs;ita intelliguntur.

Hinc &longs;i corpo­
ris particulæ fuerint omnino homogeneæ, adeóque æquè capa­
ces impetûs recipiendi, illud idem erit Centrum Impetûs, quod
e&longs;t centrum molis, &longs;eu magnitudinis; nam eadem plana, quæ
molem æqualiter dividunt, etiam æqualiter dividunt Impetum
per &longs;ingulas particulas æquabiliter diffu&longs;um.

At &longs;i non eju&longs;dem
generis fuerint partes corpus illud componentes, &longs;ed raræ aliæ,
aliæ den&longs;æ, hoc e&longs;t ex materiâ partim tenui, partim con&longs;tipatâ,
&longs;icut non e&longs;&longs;et idem Centrum Gravitatis, atque Centrum
Magnitudinis, ita neque idem e&longs;t cum Molis centro Centrum
Impetûs impre&longs;&longs;i; quia, ut ex Projectis con&longs;tat, ea quæ &longs;ecun­
dùm &longs;peciem leviora &longs;unt, cæteris paribus, minorem impetum
concipiunt (& globuli ex argillâ efficti, quos bali&longs;tæ evibrant,
majorem ictum infligunt, quàm pares globuli lignei, qui &longs;unt
argillâ leviores) ac proinde Centrum Impetûs impre&longs;&longs;i a&longs;&longs;umi
pote&longs;t idem, ac punctum illud, quod in motu naturali e&longs;&longs;et
Centrum gravitatis ip&longs;i corpori inexi&longs;tens.

Quare in motibus corporum externâ vi impul&longs;orum atten­
denda e&longs;t pariter linea, &longs;ecundùm quam dirigitur motus huju&longs;­
modi Centri Impetûs: & punctum illud in corporis percutien­
tis &longs;uperficie, quod linea directionis motûs à Centro Impetûs
ducta de&longs;ignat, ip&longs;um e&longs;t, in quo corpus percutiens vim &longs;uam
validi&longs;&longs;imè exercet.

Cum enim omnia plana per hanc Di­
rectionis motûs lineam tran&longs;euntia (quorum illa e&longs;t communis
&longs;ectio) dividant univer&longs;um Impetum in partes hinc & hinc
æquales, quippe quæ etiam per Centrum Impetûs tran&longs;eunt,
ita ex percu&longs;&longs;ione in puncto illo impeditur motus, ut neque ad
hanc, neque ad illam partem deflectere po&longs;&longs;it corpus impactum
in obicem, qui re&longs;i&longs;tit.

Quod &longs;i punctum contactûs fuerit ex-
tra lineam Directionis motûs, inæquales &longs;unt impetus, & majo­
re præpollente, corpus pergit in motu, quamvis ad latus in­
flectatur &longs;ivè magis, &longs;ivè minùs, prout majus aut minus fuerit
intervallum inter punctum contactûs, & lineam Directionis
motûs.

Sit corpus AB, quod tran&longs;latum à potentiâ impellente ha­
beat Centrum Impetûs C, & linea, per quam dirigitur motus,
&longs;it CD, cui parallelæ
&longs;unt lineæ à &longs;ingulis par­
tibus in motu de&longs;criptæ.

Si ergo in obicem incur­
rat punctum D, ita im­
peditur motus, ut ulte­
riùs promoveri nequeat
corpus, ni&longs;i obex loco cedat; quia nimirum impetus in DA
æqualis e&longs;t impetui in DB, ideò neutra pars æquali impetu af­
fecta promoveri pote&longs;t: e&longs;t igitur maxima re&longs;i&longs;tentia, & ictus
validi&longs;&longs;imus.
Sin autem non puncto.

D, &longs;ed puncto E fiat per­
cu&longs;&longs;io &longs;ecundùm eandem directionem GE, jam impetus &longs;unt
inæquales, & minor impetus e&longs;t in EA, quàm in EB; proin­
de pars EB validior pergens in motu inflectitur circa obicem
in puncto E, tanquam circa centrum, & re&longs;i&longs;tentia e&longs;t minor,
quàm ad punctum D.

Simile quid contingit, fi fiat percu&longs;&longs;o
in puncto F, multo enim major impetuum inæqualitas interce­
dit inter FA, & FB, quàm inter EA, & EB, atque faciliùs
fit conver&longs;io & inflexio motûs circa obicem in puncto F, quàm
in puncto E: arcus &longs;iquidem majore Radio FD de&longs;criptus mi­
nùs de&longs;ci&longs;cit à rectitudine lineæ, per quam dirigitur motus,
quàm arcus minore Radio ED de&longs;criptus.

Quò igitur magis
punctum contactûs in percu&longs;&longs;ione abe&longs;t à puncto D, eò infir
mior e&longs;t ictus, minorem quippe invenit re&longs;i&longs;tentiam.

At &longs;i corpus idem AB ita impellatur, ut linea directionis
motûs ducta ex C centro impetûs &longs;it CA, &longs;imiliter con&longs;tat va­
lidi&longs;&longs;imum ictum fieri in A, imbecilliorem verò in extremis an­
gulis eju&longs;dem &longs;uperficiei.

Hinc vides, cur ex vetere di&longs;ciplinâ
Poliorceticâ ad murorum, aut po&longs;tium expugnationem, arie­
tes, quibus concutiebantur, non planâ facie, &longs;ed convexâ com­
muniter, aut acutâ con&longs;truerentur: quia &longs;cilicet trabem ferro
in capite armatam funibus &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;am (ne &longs;u&longs;tinendi laborem
&longs;ubirent, &longs;ed vires omnes in motu impenderent) retro ducen­
tes, ac deinde propellentes, non planè horizontaliter, &longs;ed qua­
&longs;i circulariter movebant; planum autem &longs;i fui&longs;&longs;et trabis caput,
ictus inflictus fui&longs;&longs;et ab extremo illius &longs;uperficiei latere, non ve­
rò à partibus circa medium exi&longs;tentibus, à quibus multò vali­
dior ictus expectari potui&longs;&longs;et; quemadmodum certiùs contingit
facie convexâ, aut in apicem de&longs;inente.

Si demum linea directionis motûs e&longs;&longs;et CF, utique in F e&longs;­
&longs;et validi&longs;&longs;imus ictus, quia planum FH bifariam divideret
æqualiter univer&longs;um impetum, & impetus FAH æqualis e&longs;&longs;et
impetui FBH.

E&longs;&longs;et autem infirmior ictus, quem infligeret
punctum D, cujus directio DI parallela directioni Centri FH
inæqualiter divideret impetum, & pars impetûs DBI minor
e&longs;&longs;et parte DAHI; quapropter hæc circa obicem in D mo­
veri po&longs;&longs;et, & minorem inveniret re&longs;i&longs;tentiam quàm in F.

Ubi ob&longs;ervandum e&longs;t non aptè quæri, quonam in puncto va­
lidi&longs;&longs;imus fiat ictus, ni&longs;i pariter &longs;tatuatur, quænam &longs;it linea Di­
rectionis motûs: Nam in eodem puncto D validi&longs;&longs;imus e&longs;t ictus,
&longs;i directio fuerit CD, quia tunc e&longs;t maxima re&longs;i&longs;tentia; nullus
e&longs;t ictus in directione CA, quia nihil illi opponitur; imbecillis
e&longs;t ictus in Directione CF, quia mediocrem offendit re&longs;i&longs;ten­
tiam.

Præterea comparatis invicem Directionibus CD & CA,
validior e&longs;t ictus in A quàm in D; plures &longs;iquidem partes in
eandem longitudinis lineam directè con&longs;pirantes plus obtinent
virium, quàm pauciores in lineâ latitudinis: præterquam quod
partium ad latera adjacentium lineæ, quæ propiores &longs;unt lineæ
Directionis Centri Impetûs, qua&longs;i in unam Phy&longs;icè coale&longs;cunt;
id quod non contingit partibus notabili intervallo disjunctis ab
illâ Directionis lineâ: quæ eatenus &longs;olùm in percu&longs;&longs;ionem con­
&longs;entiunt, quatenus cum intermediis conjunctæ nexu non facilè
di&longs;&longs;olubili eas pariter juvant; nam &longs;i e&longs;&longs;et corpus percutiens in
plures partes, ceu virgulas, di&longs;&longs;ectum, iis, quæ obicem con­
tingerent, manentibus, reliquæ &longs;inè ictu excurrerent: propterea
etiam conjunctæ faciliùs à directâ po&longs;itione deflectentes corpo­
ris longitudinem inflectunt: ut in tenui & gracili ligno accide­
re pote&longs;t extremis partibus A & B, quæ ex impul&longs;u, quo pro­
moventur, po&longs;&longs;unt circa punctum D inflecti; ex quo infirmior
percu&longs;&longs;io, quàm cùm tanta e&longs;t corporis cra&longs;&longs;ities, ut pro longi­
tudine breviore non valeat flecti.

At &longs;i cum his directionibus
CD & CA, ad perpendiculum incidentibus in faciem corpo­
ris percutientis, comparetur Directionis linea CF obliquè in­
cidens, licèt longior &longs;it linea CF, quàm CD, non idcirco va­
lidior e&longs;t in F ictus Directionis CF, quàm in D ictus Directio­
nis CD: id quod oritur ex minore re&longs;i&longs;tentiâ ratione obliqui­
tatis; faciliùs quippe pote&longs;t ulteriùs excurrere corpus obliquè
percutiens, quàm &longs;i directè percuteret.

Porrò non levis error obreperet minùs accuratè perpenden­
tibus ea, quæ hactenus de Centro Impetûs di&longs;putata &longs;unt, &longs;i hoc
Centrum ab&longs;olutè in eo in&longs;trumento, quo ad percutiendum
utimur, quærendum e&longs;&longs;e exi&longs;timarent: non enim rarò etiam
ejus, à quo in&longs;trumentum impellitur, con&longs;iderandus e&longs;t impe­
tus & motus.

Sic quando duo lanceis concurrunt, non e&longs;t æ&longs;ti­
manda percu&longs;&longs;io ex &longs;olo impetu lanceæ impre&longs;&longs;o, verùm etiam
ex eo, quem militis corpori imprimit equus, cui currenti in&longs;i­
det, immò & ip&longs;ius equi impetus, quem virtute &longs;uâ animali
concipit: univer&longs;um quippe hunc impetum retundi oportet
ab eo, qui ictum recipit: hinc &longs;i miles minùs robu&longs;tus fuerit,
infirmior e&longs;t ictus, quia ip&longs;o ictûs momento ille cedit, & perin­
de e&longs;t, atque &longs;i lancea ip&longs;a cederet, aut flecteretur.

Non e&longs;t igi­
tur Centrum impetûs in lanceâ ipsâ, &longs;ed potiùs in corpore mili­
tis non procul ab equo; ac proinde inclinata lancea, ut, quam
minimùm fieri po&longs;&longs;it, recedat à po&longs;itione parallelâ lineæ Di­
rectionis motûs, & ab hac lineâ non longè ab&longs;it, validi&longs;&longs;imum
ictum infliget: hoc autem quia faciliùs obtinetur longiore lan­
ceâ, quàm breviore, ideò, cæteris paribus, præ&longs;tat longiore
lanceâ uti.

Res autem aliter &longs;e habet, quando percu&longs;&longs;io contingit in&longs;tru­
mento non ampliùs cohærente ip&longs;i cau&longs;æ, à qua impetum re­
cipit, &longs;ed jam ab eâ disjuncto; in eo enim præcisè e&longs;t Cen­
trum Impetûs, & attendenda e&longs;t linea Directionis motûs ab
huju&longs;modi centro ducta, ut vis percu&longs;&longs;ionis maxima innote&longs;cat.

At hìc quæris; &longs;i ha&longs;tam manu &longs;tringentes impetum illi im­
primimus, & brachium pariter impetum concipit, atque ex
utroque impetu æ&longs;timandus e&longs;t ictus; cur validiùs ha&longs;tam ean­
dem intorquemus jaculantes, quàm manu tenentes?

Sic anti-
quis, ad acriùs feriendum, placuit ha&longs;tis amentatis uti, ut po&longs;t
ejaculationem ha&longs;tam loris ligatam retraherent, iterúmque
evibrarent: E&longs;&longs;e autem validiorem ictum hinc cogno&longs;ces, quòd
ha&longs;tæ evibratæ mucro altiùs infigitur objectæ tabulæ, quàm
cùm illam manu retinentes &longs;imiliter tabulam cu&longs;pide percuti­
mus.
Ex multiplici causâ id petendum videtur.

Et primò qui­
dem, quia cùm ha&longs;tam manu &longs;tringimus, caro, quæ e&longs;t in volâ
manûs, illicò cedit, ac obicem ha&longs;tæ re&longs;i&longs;tentem offendit, ex
qua ce&longs;&longs;ione minuitur impetûs; qui & multo magis debilitatur,
&longs;i brachium pariter in po&longs;teriora modicè revocemus timentes,
ne ex præconcepto impetu, & corporis percu&longs;&longs;i re&longs;i&longs;tentiâ
oriatur nimia aliqua partium convul&longs;io, aut dolor: hoc autem
incommodum vitatur in ha&longs;tâ jam emi&longs;sâ.

Deinde quando ali­
quid jaculamur, ultimo momento, quo illud tenemus, bra­
chium validi&longs;&longs;imo conatu in anteriora movemus, &longs;tatímque re­
trahimus dimittentes mi&longs;&longs;ile, cui propterea plurimus impetus
imprimitur: con&longs;tat autem non po&longs;&longs;e à nobis ha&longs;tam retinenti­
bus (alia &longs;cilicet e&longs;t mu&longs;culorum contentio & motio) moveri
brachium motu adeò concitato.

Demum impetus brevi&longs;&longs;imo
illo motu tantâ vi productus in mi&longs;&longs;ili &longs;uam retinet directionem
(quicquid &longs;it, an gravitas in&longs;ita aliquid officiat) quæ in lon­
giore motu brachij &longs;i non dimittatur, aliquantulum labefacta­
tur, eo quod plures motus circa diver&longs;a centra, videlicet circa
os humeri, & os cubiti, mi&longs;ceantur; atque ex diver&longs;a illâ di­
rectione vis impetûs minuitur.

Cùm itaque ex omnibus hi&longs;ce
cau&longs;is major inveniatur impetus in ha&longs;tâ evibratâ, quo momen­
to illa percutit, majorem quoquè ictum ab eâ infligi con&longs;e­
quens e&longs;t.

Ad hoc percu&longs;&longs;ionum horizontalium genus &longs;pectat illa per­
cu&longs;&longs;io, qua in ludo minoris tudiculæ globus unus tudiculâ im­
pellente emi&longs;&longs;us alium globulum percutit.

Si enim in eâdem
directionis motûs lineâ reperiantur centra utriu&longs;que globi, per­
cutientis &longs;cilicet & percu&longs;&longs;i, maximus ictus infligitur, quia
maximam invenit re&longs;i&longs;tentiam, cum totus globulus percu&longs;&longs;us
toti percutienti opponatur, cujus &longs;ingularum partium lineæ di­
rectionis motûs &longs;i producantur, occurrunt globulo percu&longs;&longs;o
(æquales &longs;unt globuli ex hypothe&longs;i) quamvis &longs;ola linea directio­
nis Centri illum contingat.

Sin autem globus emi&longs;&longs;us ita alium
quie&longs;centem tangat, ut recta linea per contactûs punctum ducta
&longs;it utriu&longs;que globi Tangens; & lineæ directionis motûs paralle­
la, nullus e&longs;t ictus, quia nullum motui impedimentum infertur.

Demum &longs;i linea, per quam dirigitur centrum globuli emi&longs;&longs;i, non
occurrat centro globi percu&longs;&longs;i, ita tamen &longs;e habeat, ut lineæ
utrumque globulum Tangenti occurrat extra punctum con­
tactûs, tunc major aut minor erit ictus pro ratione impedimen­
ti & re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ, prout majori aut minori parti globuli percu­
tientis opponitur globulus percu&longs;&longs;us: Ex quo fit eò majorem
e&longs;&longs;e re&longs;i&longs;tentiam, quò linea directionis motûs Centri percu­
tientis propiùs ad punctum contactûs occurrit lineæ Tangenti.

Sit globus B emi&longs;&longs;us adversùs globum A quie&longs;centem, &
linea, per quam dirigitur motus
centri B, &longs;it BC occurrens
puncto contactûs C, atque adeò,
ut colligitur ex 12. lib.
3. etiam
centro A, &longs;i producta intelliga­
tur.

Hìc invenit maximam re­
&longs;i&longs;tentiam globus percutiens, ne­
que ad hanc, neque ad illam
partem deflectere pote&longs;t à priori
directione; linea &longs;iquidem Di­
rectionis BC ad angulos rectos
incidit in Tangentem DE, & omnes &longs;ingularum partium di­
rectiones occurrerent globulo A, &longs;i productæ intelligantur ex­
tra globulum B.

Quòd &longs;i linea directionis motûs fui&longs;&longs;et BF pa­
rallela Tangenti DE, nullum planè inferretur impedimentum
motui à globo quie&longs;cente A; nam partium globi impul&longs;i Di­
rectiones parallelæ lineæ BF, eæ e&longs;&longs;ent, ut earum nulla incur­
reret in globum A, ideóque nullus e&longs;&longs;et ictus, ubi nulla e&longs;t re­
&longs;i&longs;tentia.

At &longs;i globus B habeat Directionem BE, aut BG, &
quie&longs;centem globum tangeret in C, etiam&longs;i neque BE, neque
BG directiones centri incurrerent in globum A, tamen par­
tium aliquarum eju&longs;dem globi B Directiones parallelæ Directio­
ni BE, aut BG, &longs;i productæ intelligantur, incurrerent in glo­
bum A, atque invenirent ex eo impedimentum.

Sit enim Di­
rectio BE, & in globo B linea LO ip&longs;i BE paralella, quæ pro­
ducta contingeret in K globum A: utique omnes partes &longs;eg-
menti OLS habentes Directionem parallelam Directioni BE,
quæ e&longs;t directio Centri, inveniunt re&longs;i&longs;tentiam, cum earum di­
rectiones incurrant in oppo&longs;itum globum A.

Similiter &longs;i Di­
rectio Centri &longs;it BG, parallela Directio HI producta tangit
in P globum A, qui proinde opponitur Directionibus omnium
partium &longs;egmenti IHS.

Cùm autem &longs;egmentum IHS majus
&longs;it &longs;egmento OLS, etiam major e&longs;t ictus, quando Directio BG
ea e&longs;t, ut Tangenti lineæ DE occurrat in puncto G non ita
procul à contactu C, quàm &longs;i directio BE ea e&longs;&longs;et, quæ in
puncto E remotiore à contactu C occurreret eidem Tangenti
DE: Maximam &longs;iquidem habet veritatis &longs;peciem, in huju&longs;mo­
di ictibus impetum in globo percu&longs;&longs;o eâ inten&longs;ione imprimi,
quæ proportione re&longs;pondeat partibus, quæ directè &longs;ecundùm
illam Directionis lineam impediuntur.

Quoniam verò impe­
tus globo percu&longs;&longs;o impre&longs;&longs;us illum afficit æquabiliter, hinc e&longs;t,
quod ille non pote&longs;t à percu&longs;&longs;ione determinari, ni&longs;i ut moveatur
per lineam Directionis, quæ conjungat punctum contactûs C
cum centro A: quandoquidem æquales &longs;unt globi partes circa
centrum, adeóque & æquales impetus.

Ob&longs;erva hìc à me a&longs;&longs;umptos e&longs;&longs;e circulos pro globis, & lineas
vice planorum &longs;ecantium globos, ut res faciliùs explicaretur:
cæterùm quæ de lineis dicta &longs;unt, &longs;i de planis per lineas illas
tran&longs;euntibus intelligantur, rem &longs;imiliter ob oculos ponent, &longs;i
ip&longs;a parallela fuerint, aut inclinata, prout de lineis con&longs;tituta
e&longs;t hypothe&longs;is.

Supere&longs;t tertius percutientis motus, videlicet
in arcûs circularis &longs;peciem ductus, quando, altera extremitate
manente, corpus in gyrum movetur.

Experimentis autem do­
cemur validi&longs;&longs;imum ictum non &longs;emper fieri ab extremitate,
quamvis hæc veloci&longs;&longs;imè moveatur præ cæteris punctis alte­
ri extremitati manenti propioribus.

Ut igitur inveniatur
punctum, in quo corpus percutiens maximam habeat re­
&longs;i&longs;tentiam, ponendum e&longs;t illud e&longs;&longs;e æquabiliter ductum, &
ex materiâ homogeneâ æqualiter capaci impetûs; atque
ibi &longs;anè maxima erit re&longs;i&longs;tentia, ubi impetûs momenta
æqualiter dividuntur: id quod contingit in puncto ita re­
moto à motûs centro, ut cadat inter be&longs;&longs;em, & dodrantem
totius longitudinis, quæ habet rationem Radij, quo arcus
de&longs;cribitur.
Sit corporis percutientis longitudo AB.

Si motu naturali
&longs;ponte &longs;uâ de&longs;cenderet, &
in motu po&longs;itionem hori­
zonti parallelam &longs;ervaret,
utique validi&longs;&longs;imus e&longs;&longs;et
ictus in D puncto, quod
re&longs;pondet centro gravita­
tis C; e&longs;&longs;ent enim hinc atque hinc æquales gravitates, & æqua­
lia impetûs momenta, ut &longs;uperiùs dictum e&longs;t.

At manente ex­
tremitate A, tanquam centro motûs, & corpore ip&longs;o vi &longs;uæ gra­
vitatis de&longs;cendente, licèt &longs;ingulæ particulæ, utpote naturæ
eju&longs;dem, paribus viribus &longs;int præditæ, non tamen æquali mo­
mento feruntur; &longs;ed cum in A retineantur, quæ puncto A pro­
piores &longs;unt, magis detorquentur à directione naturalis gravita­
tis, adeóque plus momenti habent partes inter DB, quàm in­
ter AD con&longs;titutæ.

Porrò momenta &longs;unt in Ratione Di&longs;tan­
tiarum: Momentum &longs;iquidem e&longs;t Exce&longs;&longs;us virtutis moventis
&longs;upra re&longs;i&longs;tentiam, qua impedimentum prohibet, ne &longs;equatur
motus juxta naturalem propen&longs;ionem: quare &longs;ingularum par­
tium momenta ex earum motu digno&longs;cuntur: moventur autem
per circulorum arcus &longs;imiles, quorum etiam &longs;imiles &longs;unt Sinus
de&longs;cen&longs;um metientes, qui &longs;unt in Ratione Radiorum, hoc e&longs;t
di&longs;tantiarum ab A communi centro.

Sic momentum puncti
D e&longs;t ut AD, puncti G ut AG, puncti H ut AH, atque ita
de cæteris.

Hinc e&longs;t omnium momentorum &longs;ummam conflari
ex illorum aggregato, quà&longs;i ex aggregato arcuum quos de&longs;cri­
bunt, aut Sinuum arcubus &longs;imilibus re&longs;pondentium, quorum
Ratio eadem e&longs;t cum aggregato Radiorum, ex quibus de&longs;cri­
buntur arcus.

Cum autem univer&longs;a longitudo AB in particu­
las æquales divi&longs;a intelligatur, manife&longs;tum e&longs;t di&longs;tantias à cen­
tro A con&longs;tituere Progre&longs;&longs;ionem Arithmeticam juxta &longs;eriem
naturalem numerorum, ac proinde punctum, quod vocari po­
te&longs;t Centrum Momentorum Impetûs, illud e&longs;&longs;e, in quo momenta
illa bifariam æqualiter dividuntur.

Hoc verò punctum e&longs;&longs;e ultra be&longs;&longs;em totius longitudinis hinc
apparet, quòd, &longs;i longitudo AB in tres æquales partes di&longs;tincta
intelligatur, prima centro A proxima habet momentum ut 1, &longs;e­
cunda ut 2, tertia ut 3: igitur po&longs;t finem &longs;ecundæ, hoc e&longs;t in G,
videtur e&longs;&longs;e æqualitas momentorum; nam AG habet ut 3,
& GB item ut 3. Sed non e&longs;&longs;e in G momentorum æqualitatem
con&longs;tat, &longs;i adhuc plures in partes AB di&longs;tincta intelligatur, &
eadem &longs;it Ratio dupla AG ad GB.

Sit AB partium 6; AG
e&longs;t 4, GB 2: Momenta AG &longs;unt 10, GB 11; &longs;unt &longs;cilicet
ip&longs;ius AG momenta quatuor di&longs;tantiarum 1. 2. 3. 4. hoc e&longs;t 10,
GB verò momenta quintæ & &longs;extæ di&longs;tantiæ 5 & 6, hoc e&longs;t 11.
Quod &longs;i ponatur AB partium 9, & AG 6, GB 3; momenta
AG &longs;unt 21, GB &longs;unt 24. Similiter &longs;tatuamus longitudinem
AB partium 12, &longs;cilicet AG 8, GB 4, momenta AG &longs;unt 36,
GB 42. Item AB &longs;it partium 15; AG 10, GB 5: momenta
AG &longs;unt 55, GB 65. Demum AB &longs;it partium 18; AG 12,
GB 6: momenta AG &longs;unt 78, GB 93. Non igitur momen­
torum æqualitas e&longs;t præcisè in G ad be&longs;&longs;em longitudinis AB,
&longs;ed e&longs;t ultra G versùs B.

Verùm, &longs;i AH &longs;it dodrans longitudinis AB, non in H, &longs;ed
citrà H, inter G & H e&longs;t quæ&longs;itum punctum, in quo momen­
torum æqualitas invenitur.

Nam &longs;i AB &longs;it partium 4, atque
AH &longs;it 3, HB verò &longs;it 1; momenta AH &longs;unt 6, & HB 4:
Si AB &longs;it part.

8: & AH 6, HB 2; momenta AH &longs;unt 21,
HB 15; & &longs;ic de cæteris &longs;ervatâ eádem Ratione triplâ AH
ad HB.

Cum itaque momenta AG minora &longs;int quàm momen­
ta GB, contrà verò momenta AH majora &longs;int momentis HB,
con&longs;tat æqualitatem momentorum e&longs;&longs;e inter G & H, hoc e&longs;t
inter be&longs;&longs;em & dodrantem.

Ubi autem proximè &longs;it huju&longs;modi
punctum, deprehendes, &longs;i totam AB &longs;tatus partium 576,
& AI partium 407: Cum enim momenta omnia totius AB
&longs;int 166176, & momenta AI &longs;int 83028, remanent momen­
ta IB 83148, proximè æqualia momentis AI.

E&longs;t autem Ra­
tio 407 ad 576 minor Ratione 3 ad 4: & Ratio AI ad IB mi­
nor e&longs;t Ratione AH ad HB, hoc e&longs;t minor Ratione Dodran­
tis ad A&longs;&longs;em: item Ratio 407 ad 576 major e&longs;t Ratione 2 ad 3,
hoc e&longs;t Ratione Be&longs;&longs;is ad A&longs;&longs;em.

Quæ de lineâ AB hactenus
dicta &longs;unt, in reliquis pariter illi parallelis vera e&longs;&longs;e deprehen­
duntur &longs;imili ratiocinatione; ac propterea à linea IL omnes in
eâdem Ratione &longs;ecantur.

Maxima igitur percu&longs;&longs;io à corpore
AE circa lineam AF in gyrum acto fiet in lineâ IL; in qua
medium punctum K denotat locum validi&longs;&longs;imi ictûs; in eo &longs;ci-
licet omnia momenta impetûs æqualiter dividuntur tam jux­
ta longitudinem, quàm juxta latitudinem.

Sed quoniam rarò contingit corpus, quo percutimus, ita æqua­
bili ductu partes omnes di&longs;po&longs;itas habere, &longs;icut hactenus hypo­
the&longs;im in cylindro aut pri&longs;mate con&longs;tituimus, idcircò frequen­
ti&longs;&longs;imè centrum hoc momentorum Impetûs, ex quo ictus vehe­
mentia pendet, aut magis ad centrum motûs accedit, aut ab
hoc magis recedit, prout ad hanc aut illam extremitatem plu­
res &longs;unt partes majoris impetûs, aut majorum momentorum ca­
paces: fieri &longs;iquidem pote&longs;t, ut plures partes centro motûs pro­
ximæ tenuioribus momentis &longs;int præditæ, pauciores autem par­
tes ab huju&longs;modi motûs centro remotæ majora obtineant mo­
menta, adeò ut inæqualitas partium reciprocâ quadam inæqua­
litate momentorum compen&longs;etur; & fieri pote&longs;t, ut plures par­
tes cum majore di&longs;tantiâ componantur, adeò ut centrum mo­
mentorum impetûs proximum &longs;it extremitati, quæ veloci&longs;&longs;imè
movetur.

Hinc quia malleo & &longs;ecuri infligendus e&longs;t ictus, in
illorum manubriis &longs;tatuendis cavendum e&longs;t, ne nimis gravia
&longs;int, ne fortè extra malleum aut &longs;ecurim, quibus fit percu&longs;&longs;io, &longs;it
centrum momentorum impetûs.

Centrum hoc momentorum &longs;i
appellare libeat Centrum Percu&longs;&longs;ionis, per me licet; neque enim
hæreo in vocabulis.

Ut autem oblato quocumque corpore ad percutiendum apto,
quo utendum &longs;it motu circulari, cuju&longs;modi e&longs;t malleus, clava,
&longs;ecuris, & &longs;imilia, ejus centrum Momentorum impetûs Phy&longs;icè
& Mechanicè habeamus, hæc methodus forta&longs;&longs;e non inutilis
accidat.

Extremam illam partem, quæ manu apprehendi &longs;olet,
ex clavo immobili ita &longs;u&longs;pende, ut circa illum liberè moveri
valeat: tum &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;am clavam à perpendiculo remove, & in
hanc atque illam partem vibrari permitte.

Interim ex &longs;ubtili&longs;&longs;i­
mo filo æreus, aut plumbeus, globulus pendeat, qui pariter vi­
bretur: & hujus perpendiculi vibrationes cum clavæ &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;æ
vibrationibus compara, an videlicet &longs;ingulæ &longs;ingulis i&longs;ochronæ
&longs;int, hoc e&longs;t æqualis durationis, an verò inæqualis; &longs;i una per­
pendiculi vibratio diuturnior &longs;it, quàm una clavæ vibratio, de­
curtandum e&longs;t filum, &longs;i brevior, producendum u&longs;que eò, dum
perpendiculi vibrationes &longs;ingulæ &longs;ingulis clavæ vibrationibus
i&longs;ochronæ fuerint.

Hoc ubi con&longs;ecutus fueris, haud temerè
pronunciabis quæ&longs;itum Centrum momentorum Impetûs clavæ
tanto intervallo abe&longs;&longs;e à puncto &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;ionis, quanta e&longs;t per­
pendiculi longitudo, non quidem exacti&longs;&longs;imè & Geometricè,
&longs;ed quantum &longs;atis e&longs;t ad Phy&longs;icum opus.

Cur ita argumentari
liceat, &longs;i rationem repo&longs;cas, hæc &longs;atis probabilis afferri pote&longs;t;
quia &longs;cilicet Centrum momentorum Impetûs e&longs;t punctum illud,
in quo cum &longs;it æqualitas momentorum, omnes ip&longs;ius clavæ par­
tes &longs;uam vim exercent ad motum illius o&longs;cillationis; quemad­
modum in centro globuli ex filo pendentis (filum ex hypothe­
&longs;i nullum habet notabile momentum ad motum adnexi globuli
variandum) e&longs;t æqualitas momentorum eju&longs;dem de&longs;cendentis,
& ad po&longs;itionem perpendicularem &longs;e re&longs;tituentis.

E &longs;t igitur cla­
va qua&longs;i perpendiculum tantæ longitudinis, quantum e&longs;t inter­
vallum inter Centrum motûs atque Centrum momentorum Im­
petûs.

At perpendicula æqualis longitudinis &longs;unt i&longs;ochrona:
igitur invento perpendiculo i&longs;ochrono cum o&longs;cillationibus cla­
væ, nota erit ex hujus longitudine etiam longitudo rigidi illius
perpendiculi, quod concipitur in clavâ, videlicet di&longs;tantia Cen­
tri momentorum Impetûs à Centro motûs.

Hìc tamen animadvertas velim ex hac methodo non haberi
exactè punctum Centri momentorum in clavâ, &longs;ed illud adhuc
paulò longiùs abe&longs;&longs;e; quia nimirum perpendiculorum omnino
æqualium, præterquam in gravitate ponderis appen&longs;i, illud,
quod gravius e&longs;t, plures vibrationes eodem tempore perficit;
atque perpendiculorum omnino æqualium, præterquam in lon­
gitudine, illud, quod longius e&longs;t, paucioribus vibrationibus
eodem tempore agitatur.

Cum autem clava &longs;it perpendiculum
gravius globulo, qui ex filo pendet, po&longs;itâ æquali longitudine,
clava velociùs moveretur: Si igitur motus clavæ e&longs;t i&longs;ochronus
cum motu globuli ex filo &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;i, nece&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t longitudine gra­
vioris inferente vibrationum raritatem compen&longs;ari ejus gravita­
tem, quæ crebriores efficeret vibrationes.

Quare hoc certum
habebis, quæ&longs;itum Centrum Momentorum e&longs;&longs;e ultra punctum
illud inventum ex longitudine perpendiculi adhibiti.

Sed & illud præterea ob&longs;ervandum e&longs;t, motus i&longs;tos circula­
res corporum percutientium communiter non habere pro &longs;ui
motûs Centro alteram extremitatem, ni&longs;i fortè, quando ad &longs;olius
manûs motum moventur, cubito ac brachio immotis: cæterùm
pro centro motûs habent aut cubiti, aut humeri juncturam,
prout cubitus, vel totum brachium movetur: & tunc Centrum
momentorum transferri contingit, nec opus e&longs;t adeò longa e&longs;&longs;e
manubria; ut vides malleos, quibus ad contundendos libros
utuntur bibliopægi, brevioris e&longs;&longs;e manubrij, quia extento bra­
chio percutiunt, quod fungitur vice valde longi manubrij:
contra verò fabrorum ferrariorum mallei, bipennes, & cætera
in&longs;trumenta, quæ utrâque manu apprehen&longs;a tractamus, lon­
giora habent manubria, tunc enim brachium adeò extendere
nequimus.
CAPUT X.
Quid conferat re&longs;istentia corporis percu&longs;si.

EAtenus ictum corpori percu&longs;&longs;o infligi, quatenus hoc motui
corporis percutientis opponitur, illíque ob&longs;i&longs;tit, dictum e&longs;t
cap.6. eóque vehementiorem e&longs;&longs;e percu&longs;&longs;ionem, quò major e&longs;t
re&longs;i&longs;tentia.

Hæc autem re&longs;i&longs;tentia originem ducit ex ipsâ cor­
porum naturâ; omne &longs;iquidem corpus, quâ corpus e&longs;t, nulli
corpori penetrabile e&longs;t, neque fieri pote&longs;t, citrà Divinam vir­
tutem longiùs, quàm naturæ termini po&longs;tulant, excurrentem,
ut uno eodémque in &longs;patio duo corpora collocentur, quemad­
modum duæ &longs;ub&longs;tantiæ ab omni pror&longs;us &longs;en&longs;u disjunctæ, &longs;ed
quæ &longs;olâ ratione, & intelligentiâ comprehenduntur, &longs;e vici&longs;&longs;im
eodem in loco facilè patiuntur.

Corpus igitur percu&longs;&longs;um tùm
ex &longs;uâ con&longs;titutione, & temperie, tum ex recedendi difficulta­
te, tùm ex po&longs;itione, &longs;ecundùm quam ictum excipit, habet, ut
modum percu&longs;&longs;ioni &longs;tatuat; ex triplici enim hoc capite re&longs;i&longs;ten­
tiarum varietas petenda e&longs;t, qua corpus percu&longs;&longs;um reluctatur,
ne loco cedat.

Et ad primum quidem quod attinet, corpora dura magis re­
&longs;i&longs;tere, quàm mollia, manife&longs;tum e&longs;t ex ipsá Duri & Mollis
notione. E&longs;t autem Durum, ut ait Ari&longs;toteles lib.
4. Meteor.
&longs;umma 2. cap.
1. quod non cedit in &longs;eip&longs;um &longs;ecundùm &longs;uperficiem:
Molle autem, quod cedit, non circumob&longs;i&longs;tendo; aqua enim non Mol­
lis, non enim cedit compre&longs;&longs;ione &longs;uperficies in profundum, &longs;ed circum­
ob&longs;i&longs;tit: aqua &longs;cilicet, & humores urgenti quidem cedunt, at non
induendo &longs;uperficiem, quæ maneat, (ut ceræ ac luto accidit)
&longs;ed ita &longs;ecedendo, ut, urgente remoto, ad &longs;uperficiem antiquæ
&longs;uperficiei &longs;imilem confluant particulæ, quæ &longs;ece&longs;&longs;erant.

Qua­
propter ad mollium genus, in rem præ&longs;entem &longs;pectare cen&longs;en­
da &longs;unt, quæcumque &longs;e premi patiuntur, hoc e&longs;t, externo im­
pul&longs;u in &longs;e ip&longs;a coëunt, cùm in profundum &longs;uperficies permu­
tatur, nec dividitur; &longs;ivè imprimi & formari po&longs;&longs;int, pul&longs;u tan­
tùm, ut cera & argilla, aut percu&longs;&longs;ione, ut plumbum; &longs;ivè im­
pre&longs;&longs;ionem & formam rejiciant, ut lana, & &longs;pongiæ.

Ea autem,
quæ dura &longs;unt, &longs;ed ductilia, quia eâdem percußione po&longs;&longs;unt &longs;imulin
latus, & in profundum &longs;ecundùm &longs;uperficiem transferri &longs;ecundùm
partem, ut ferro candenti, alií&longs;que metallis &longs;ub fabri malleo
contingit, aliquatenus ad mollia pertinere videntur, &longs;altem
comparatè, quia videlicet cedunt percutienti, quod propterea
durius cen&longs;etur.

Sic in arce Antuerpien&longs;i memini me vidi&longs;&longs;e
ænea aliquot ingentia tormenta bellica, olim ex Sckenckianâ
munitione, cum in Hi&longs;panorum pote&longs;tatem venit, a&longs;portata,
in quorum tubis non mediocres contu&longs;ionum notæ ab ho&longs;tili­
bus globis impre&longs;&longs;æ apparebant.

Quæ verò corpora dura &longs;unt,
neque &longs;e ita comprimi patiuntur, ut &longs;uperficies depre&longs;&longs;a cra&longs;&longs;i­
tiem minuat, &longs;ed &longs;olùm, &longs;ervatâ longitudine, flexibilia &longs;unt eâ
ratione, ut à rectitudine ad curvitatem, aut vici&longs;&longs;im à curvitate
ad rectitudinem torqueantur, cedunt quidem, &longs;ed inter mollia,
ex hoc quidem capite, recen&longs;enda non &longs;unt.

Quod &longs;i vehe­
mentiore percu&longs;&longs;ione non &longs;olùm flectantur, &longs;ed etiam frangan­
tur (quemadmodum contingit cra&longs;&longs;iu&longs;culo baculo, cujus ex­
tremitates in acumen de&longs;inentes innituntur duobus vitreis cya­
this; qui circa medium valido fu&longs;te percu&longs;&longs;us flectitur, & in­
flexione declinans vitra, iis integris frangitur) in magnas par­
tes dividuntur, & &longs;eparantur: at &longs;i in partes plures di&longs;&longs;iliant ex
unicâ percu&longs;&longs;ione, friantur, ut vitrum, lapis, fictile; id quod ex
duritie oritur.

Hæc eadem corporis habitudo, quæ particularum compo­
nentium complexionem re&longs;picit, æquè in percutiente, ac in
percu&longs;&longs;o attendenda e&longs;t; quandoquidem &longs;i di&longs;par fuerit eorum
durities, fieri pote&longs;t, ut ex ictu labefactetur potiùs percutiens,
quàm percu&longs;&longs;um: &longs;ic globus plumbeus ex editâ turri decidens
in &longs;ubjectum &longs;ilicem ex ictu contunditur, rotundâ &longs;uperficie in
planam mutatâ, qua parte fuit contactus; & vitrum ad &longs;axa
alli&longs;um friatur; & follis lu&longs;orius in parietem impactus compri­
mitur.

Hinc tamen non fit, quò minus corpus illud, in quod
plumbeus globus, aut vitrum, aut follis incurrit, percu&longs;&longs;um di­
catur; ex ictu enim &longs;altem concutitur, & contremi&longs;cit.

Neque
tremorem huju&longs;modi temerè confictum &longs;u&longs;picabitur, qui&longs;quis
longi&longs;&longs;imæ trabis extremitati aurem admoverit, ut alterâ extre­
mitate quamvis levi&longs;&longs;imè digito percu&longs;sâ &longs;onitum audiat, aut
noctu &longs;crobiculo in terrâ facto aurem immi&longs;erit, ut adventan­
tis alicujus adhuc procul po&longs;iti pa&longs;&longs;us percipiat: nullum verò
&longs;onum fieri &longs;ine tremore & motu, extra controver&longs;iam po&longs;uit
experientia.

Porrò &longs;pectatâ corporum temperie, percu&longs;&longs;ionum vehemen­
tiâ æ&longs;timatur ex iis, quæ con&longs;equuntur re&longs;i&longs;tentiam ortam ex
corporum colli&longs;orum duritie &longs;eu mollitudine majori au minori,
tùm ab&longs;olutè, tùm comparatè.

Cum Ab&longs;olutè dico, alterutrius
&longs;olùm duritiem &longs;eu mollitudinem con&longs;idero ita, ut aut corpora
percu&longs;&longs;a inter &longs;e, aut corpora percutientia &longs;imiliter inter &longs;e
conferantur: Comparatè autem, quando percutiens cum per­
cu&longs;&longs;o comparatur, prout duritie &longs;e excedunt.

Si corpus percu­
tiens valdè durum ponatur, & corpus percu&longs;&longs;um molle fuerit,
hoc cedendo retundit ictum; ex levi enim illâ re&longs;i&longs;tentiâ tan­
diu durante, quandiu fit partium compre&longs;&longs;io, minuitur in per­
cutiente impetus, & quod corpori molli &longs;ubjectum e&longs;t corpus,
levi&longs;&longs;imam impre&longs;&longs;ionem ex ictu recipit.

Sic apud Sinas, ut in
Atlante Sinico pag.

127. In flumine, per quod ad Ienping navi­
gatur, Catadupæ aquarum multæ &longs;unt, & periculo&longs;i&longs;&longs;ima Syrtibus
loca, duo præ&longs;ertim propè Cinglieu, unus Kieulung, alter Changcung
dictus.

Cum naves tran&longs;eunt, ne cum aquâ decidentes fractionis in­
currant periculum, &longs;citè præmittunt aliquot &longs;traminis fa&longs;ces, ad quos
navis leviùs impingat, ac tran&longs;eat.

Sic ferreis tormentorum glo­
bis objecti &longs;acci lanâ aut terrâ repleti illorum vim elidunt, ne
diruant muros huju&longs;modi &longs;accis protecto: &longs;ic farti go&longs;&longs;ypio
thoraces non levi munimento &longs;unt digladiantibus.

Quò autem
mollius fuerit corpus percu&longs;&longs;um, quia magis cedit, minùs læ-
ditur à percutiente; & vici&longs;&longs;im quò durius illud fuerit, magis
ab eodem percutiente læditur, cujus impul&longs;um excipit.

Hinc vides cur ferreos militum thoraces, & galeas no&longs;tro
hoc ævo aliter temperare oporteat, ac antiquis temporibus,
quando gladiorum, ha&longs;tarum, &longs;agittarum ictus tantummodo
repellere opus erat; tunc enim durâ temperatione &longs;olidandum
erat ferrum, ne pror&longs;us cederet, huju&longs;modi armorum mucro­
nem admittendo: nunc verò ut innoxiè excipiantur ictus glo­
borum à Sclopis emi&longs;&longs;orum, ferrum molle e&longs;&longs;e expedit, ut con­
tu&longs;um flectatur, & aliquantulum cedens ita imminuat globi
ejaculati vires, ut penetrare ulteriùs non valeat.

Quod &longs;i in
chalybem temperatus e&longs;&longs;et thorax militaris, nec admodum
cra&longs;&longs;us e&longs;&longs;et, ne gravitate nimiâ incommodus, aut inutilis ac­
cideret, facilè chalybs ex globi ictu di&longs;&longs;iliret, & vulneri locum
aperiret.

Sed quia globi plumbei &longs;unt, & &longs;e comprimi patiun­
tur, ex huju&longs;modi percu&longs;&longs;ione compre&longs;&longs;io qua&longs;i di&longs;tribuitur in­
ter plumbeum globum explo&longs;um, atque ferreum thoracem, qui
multo magis contunderetur (aut fortè etiam perforaretur à glo­
bulo ferreo; globulus autem plumbeus, &longs;i thorax aut ip&longs;a galea
nihil cederet, magis comprimeretur, quemadmodum cùm in
marmor exploditur.

At ubi corpus percu&longs;&longs;um non cedit in &longs;eip&longs;um &longs;ecundùm &longs;u­
perficiem, flectitur tamen, adhuc minùs re&longs;i&longs;tit, quàm corpo­
ra rigida, nec flexioni notabili obnoxia.

Notabili, inquam, ne
in quæ&longs;tionem vocemus, utrùm flecti dicenda &longs;int illa corpora,
quæ ex ictu tremorem concipiunt, ut æri campano, cum pul&longs;a­
tur, accidit: nam vix excogitari pote&longs;t corpus aliquod, cui ex
vi percu&longs;&longs;ionis accidere nequeat tremor; cum & terram ip&longs;am
licèt altiùs defo&longs;&longs;am in cuniculis concuti & contremi&longs;cere
o&longs;tendant lapilli, & fabæ in tympani militaris planâ facie &longs;ub&longs;i­
lientes ex profundo illo ligonis ictu.

Certè, &longs;i Atlanti Sinico
pag.57. credimus, ubi in IV Provinciâ Xantung mentionem
facit de monte, cui nomen Mingxe, hoc e&longs;t Sonorum lapis;
in hujus montis vertice cippus erectus &longs;tat centum altus perticas
(Pertica apud Sinas e&longs;t decem cubitorum) qui vel leviter digito
percu&longs;&longs;us ad tympani modum &longs;onum edere dicitur, à quo monti nomen;
nullus autem &longs;onus ab&longs;que corporis &longs;onori tremore efficitur.

Quod &longs;i non ni&longs;i levi&longs;&longs;imè flecti queat corpus percu&longs;&longs;um, &longs;ed ci-
tra tremorem frangatur, aut frietur, indicium e&longs;t majoris re­
&longs;i&longs;tentiæ, ac proinde, cæteris paribus, vehementiorem futu­
ram percu&longs;&longs;ionem, quàm &longs;i con&longs;picuam flexionem admitteret.

Cæterùm re&longs;i&longs;tentia ferè maxima eorum corporum e&longs;t, quæ &
partes nexu ægrè di&longs;&longs;olubili copulatas habent, & congruá cra&longs;­
&longs;itudine prædita non ni&longs;i creberrimo & minuti&longs;&longs;imo tremore
concuti po&longs;&longs;unt, &longs;i percutiantur.

Nam omnium re&longs;i&longs;tentiarum
ab&longs;olutè maxima e&longs;t, cùm pror&longs;us immotum à percu&longs;&longs;ione ma­
net corpus.

Hinc &longs;i percu&longs;&longs;i corporis durities major fuerit, quàm percu­
tientis, fieri pote&longs;t, ut impetus qui corpori percu&longs;&longs;o imprimi
non pote&longs;t, disjiciat ip&longs;ius percutientis partes, aut in latus im­
pellat ita, ut vel contundatur, vel frangatur, vel frietur, sítque
percutientis conditio deterior, quàm percu&longs;&longs;i.

Huju&longs;modi e&longs;&longs;et
apud nos conditio gladij, quo marmor percuteremus; neque
enim no&longs;trates en&longs;es comparandi &longs;unt cum illo, de quo Atlas
Sinicus pag.159.in XV Provincia Junnam ad urbem Chinkiang,
ubi hæc habet. Ad urbis Borealem partem ad hæc u&longs;que tempora in­
gens con&longs;picitur lapis, ubi Mung Rex Sinulo alterius Regis legatos
excipiens, cum illi minimè &longs;atisfacerent, extracto gladio rapidens
ita percu&longs;&longs;it, ut ictus ad tres cubitos penetraret, verbis in&longs;uper mi­
nacibus legatos alloquens; Ite, & Regi ve&longs;tro renunciare, quales apud
me gladij &longs;int.

Altera re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ origo habetur ex difficultate recedendi;
quando videlicet corpus percu&longs;&longs;um &longs;ivè ratione figuræ, &longs;ivè ra­
tione molis & gravitatis, &longs;ivè ratione ob&longs;taculi alicujus, aut
retinaculi, &longs;ivè ratione motûs oppo&longs;iti, nequit ob&longs;ecundare
motui percutientis, &longs;ed potiùs illum aut cohibet, aut retardat,
aut reflectit; hæc enim tria accidere po&longs;&longs;unt motui percutientis
ex percu&longs;&longs;i re&longs;i&longs;tentiâ.

Primum &longs;iquidem &longs;i corpus percu&longs;&longs;um
volubile non fuerit, & in orbem incitari nequeat, &longs;ed planâ fa­
cie incumbat &longs;olo, præ&longs;ertim &longs;alebro&longs;o, quò ampliori facie fit
contactus, eò difficiliùs impelli pote&longs;t.

Deinde etiam&longs;i rotun­
dum fuerit corpus, & facilis motionis principium habeat &longs;pecta­
tâ figurâ, &longs;i tamen ingens fuerit globus marmoreus, aut æreus,
tanta e&longs;&longs;e pote&longs;t gravitas, ut vix, aut ne vix quidem, loco dimo­
veri queat.

Non tamen &longs;emper faciliùs moventur ex percu&longs;&longs;io­
ne, quæ leviora &longs;unt; nam &longs;i quis ex cupre&longs;&longs;u galbulum, aut
ex quercu gallam decerpat, & malleo percutiat, ob nimiam
galbuli, & gallæ levitatem multo infirmior erit ictus, quàm &longs;i
æqualem globulum eburneum percuteret.

Ad hæc, forma
quidem apta e&longs;&longs;e pote&longs;t, nec gravitas aut moles nimia, &longs;ed quia
corpus percu&longs;&longs;um nequit percutienti cedere, ni&longs;i corpus aliud
proximum repellatur, propterea augeri pote&longs;t re&longs;i&longs;tentia: &longs;ic
&longs;ublicas acuminatas in terram adigimus fi&longs;tucâ &longs;ivè directas ad
perpendiculum, &longs;ivè pronas; &longs;ed ea pote&longs;t e&longs;&longs;e telluris den&longs;itas
compre&longs;&longs;ionem re&longs;puens, ut &longs;æpiùs cadens fi&longs;tuca parum profi­
ciat.

Demum &longs;i corpus percu&longs;&longs;um antè ictum non quie&longs;cat, &longs;ed
oppo&longs;ito motu occurrat percutienti, quò velociùs movetur, &
directione magis oppo&longs;itâ, etiam magis re&longs;i&longs;tit, & utrumque
vici&longs;&longs;im e&longs;t percutiens & percu&longs;&longs;um; ni&longs;i quod percutientis vo­
cabulum validiori conceditur.

Contra verò languidior accidit
percu&longs;&longs;io, &longs;i corpus percutiens a&longs;&longs;equatur aliud, quod ad ea&longs;­
dem partes tardiùs movetur; eóque minor e&longs;t re&longs;i&longs;tentia, quò
minor e&longs;t in velocitate motuum differentia.

Sic decidentis ex
altitudine non modicâ lapidis ictum manu citrà læ&longs;ionem exci­
pimus, &longs;i illius motui, ubi manum attigerit, exiguo minoris
velocitatis di&longs;crimine ob&longs;ecundemus: hæc &longs;iquidem exigua re­
&longs;i&longs;tentia modicum quid impetûs deterit, & quia aliquot mo­
menta durat, ita &longs;en&longs;im extenuatur impetus, ut demum qui re­
liquus e&longs;t nocere non valeat.

Hoc artificio procul dubio utebatur quidam, qui ante ali­
quot annos, ut ex viro fide digno tanquam rem noti&longs;&longs;imam ac­
cepi, Mutinæ en&longs;em eâ dexteritate in altum projiciebat, ut per­
pendicularis recideret mucrone deor&longs;um conver&longs;o, quem ca­
dentem nuda manûs vola innoxiè excipiebat; &longs;ed cum aliquan­
do invitus cogeretur, ut id noctu experiretur in conclavi mul­
tis facibus illu&longs;trato, cùm (deficiente con&longs;tanti & clari&longs;&longs;imâ
diurnâ luce, quam æmulari non pote&longs;t tremula & incon&longs;tans
facium, quamvis multarum, flamma) non ita exactè a&longs;&longs;eque­
retur de&longs;cendentis gladij motum & velocitatem, finem fecit lu­
do manum trajectam referens.

Po&longs;tremum caput, ex quo re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ modus de&longs;umitur in
percu&longs;&longs;ionibus, e&longs;t ip&longs;a po&longs;itio corporis percu&longs;&longs;i, prout directè,
aut obliquè, ictum excipit, hoc e&longs;t quatenus linea directionis
motûs, quo fertur corpus percutiens, incurrit in corporis per-
cu&longs;&longs;i &longs;uperficiem ad angulos æquales, aut inæquales.

Si enim
ad angulos æquales opponatur Directioni motûs, cum ad neu­
tram partem corpus percutiens declinare po&longs;&longs;it, tota vis ictus
excipitur à corpore percu&longs;&longs;o.

Sin autem obliquè, & ad angu­
los inæquales, à corpore percu&longs;&longs;o excipiatur percutientis ictus,
quò major erit angulorum inæqualitas, eò languidior erit per­
cu&longs;&longs;io, minùs quippe motûs Directioni opponitur &longs;uperficies
percu&longs;&longs;a, quò fuerit angulus Incidentiæ magis acutus.

Ut au­
tem horum ictuum Ratio aliqua innote&longs;cat, nulla mihi con­
gruentior methodus occurrit, quàm &longs;i philo&longs;ophemur &longs;imili
planè ratiocinatione, ac cùm lib.
1. cap.
14. expendimus gravi­
tationem corporis in planum inclinatum; &longs;icut enim ibi gravi­
tatem cum &longs;uâ directione deor&longs;um ad centrum gravium con&longs;i­
deravimus, ita hìc in percu&longs;&longs;ione impetum corporis percutien­
tis, & ejus directionem accipere oportet: & quemadmodum in
plano inclinato gravia obtinent momenta de&longs;cendendi majora,
aut minora, prout angulus inclinationis plani cum perpendi­
culo minor e&longs;t, aut major; &longs;imiliter in percu&longs;&longs;ione momentum
progrediendi juxta conceptam aut impre&longs;&longs;am directionem mo­
tûs ii&longs;dem tenetur legibus, juxta plani percu&longs;&longs;i obliquitatem;
ac proinde minor invenitur re&longs;i&longs;tentia, ubi majus e&longs;t progre­
diendi momentum.

Quare hìc &longs;atis erit recolere, quæ dicta
&longs;unt lib.
1. cap.
13. & 14. de gravitatione in plano inclinato, &
in planum inclinatum, eáque percu&longs;&longs;ionibus &longs;ervatâ analogiâ
applicare.

Cum itaque in percutiente con&longs;ideranda &longs;it & moles, & mo­
tûs velocitas, & Directio motûs, & durities; in corpore autem
percu&longs;&longs;o & naturæ temperatio, & recedendi difficultas, & po­
&longs;itio, &longs;ecundùm quam excipitur ictus, &longs;pectanda &longs;it; mani­
fe&longs;tum e&longs;t ex his omnibus ictuum vim temperari; atque adeò &longs;i
duo ictus comparandi &longs;int, a&longs;&longs;umendæ &longs;unt in corporibus per­
cutientibus invicem comparatis Rationes omnes & molis ad
molem (hoc e&longs;t gravitatis ad gravitatem, aut virtutis moventis
ad virtutem moventem) & velocitatis ad velocitatem, & di­
rectionis ad directionem, & duritiei ad duritiem; & &longs;imiliter
in corporibus percu&longs;&longs;is Rationes eorum, quæ in illis con&longs;ide­
rantur: atque demum facta Rationum compo&longs;itio indicabit Ra­
tionem ictuum.

Hinc vides quàm multæ fieri po&longs;&longs;int huju&longs;modi
Rationum complexiones; quas &longs;i juxta earum varietatem in
Propo&longs;itiones digerere otium e&longs;&longs;et, in molem non exiguam hæc
&longs;criptio excre&longs;ceret, &longs;ed non majore fructu, quàm &longs;i tu ip&longs;e Ra­
tiones, ut indicatum e&longs;t, componas.
CAPUT XI.

Quomodo ex Percu&longs;sionibus determinentur
Reflexiones.

UT Percu&longs;&longs;ionis natura plenè perfectéque innote&longs;cat, di&longs;­
piciendum &longs;upere&longs;t, quomodo ex illâ determinetur Re­
flexio.

Motus &longs;iquidem, qui propriè e&longs;t reflexus, percu&longs;&longs;ionem
con&longs;equitur, quatenus id, quod motu directo ferebatur, inve­
nit obicem, ne ulteriùs juxta eandem Directionem progredia­
tur: &longs;ed quia adhuc acqui&longs;itus, &longs;eu impre&longs;&longs;us, impetus &longs;upere&longs;t,
aliam inire viam cogitur; eóque magis reflectitur, quò majo­
rem invenit re&longs;i&longs;tentiam ortam ex utriu&longs;que corporis impene­
trabilitate, atque duritie.

Quòd &longs;i utrique corpori, percutien­
ti videlicet atque percu&longs;&longs;o, &longs;umma durities ine&longs;&longs;e poneretur,
ita ut in neutro ex vi percu&longs;&longs;ionis ulla &longs;equeretur partium com­
pre&longs;&longs;io, aut depre&longs;&longs;io, aut attritio &longs;eu divi&longs;io, perfecta quoquè
intelligeretur reflexio, in qua corpus percutiens non ni&longs;i in
tran&longs;itu, citrà omnem vel brevi&longs;&longs;imam morulam, contingeret
corpus, à quo reflectitur; & nulla fieret impetûs acqui&longs;iti, &longs;ive
impre&longs;&longs;i, diminutio præter eam, quam &longs;ecum trahit nova re­
flectentis determinatio oppo&longs;ita lineæ directionis, &longs;ecundùm
quam priùs movebatur.

Nemini autem dubium e&longs;&longs;e debet, an
corpus reflexum pergat moveri ex vi impetûs adhuc re&longs;idui
po&longs;t motum directum: nam corpus reflectens pror&longs;us immo­
tum & quie&longs;cens non pote&longs;t impetum illi communicare; cum
perpetuis experimentis doceamur nihil moveri ab alio
quie&longs;cente.

Sæpiùs tamen contingit (&longs;i quis dixerit &longs;emper, quibus argu­
mentis eum coarguerem manife&longs;tæ fal&longs;itatis, me non habere
candidè profiteor) non fieri puram reflexionem ex merâ re­
&longs;i&longs;tentiâ; &longs;ed in alterutro &longs;altem corporum colli&longs;orum, ex per­
cu&longs;&longs;ione &longs;equitur aliqua partium violenta compre&longs;&longs;io, aut
di&longs;tractio; hanc autem naturæ repugnantem partium po&longs;itio­
nem excutere dum nititur, séque in pri&longs;tinum &longs;tatum re&longs;titue­
re, novum impetum concipit, quem & pote&longs;t reflectens re­
