vectis in I immittatur.
PROPOSITIO V.
Plures antlias duplices perpetuo ductu agitare.

UBi jumentorum operâ uti oportet ad agitandas antlias,
quibus aqua in &longs;uperiorem locum aut attrahitur, aut im­
pellitur, illa in gyrum agere nece&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t; id quod multo
tempore eget; neque enim circuitus illos currendo efficere
po&longs;&longs;unt: quapropter rotarum dentatarum complexionem
con&longs;truere &longs;olemus, ut, dum &longs;emel jumentum &longs;uam con­
ver&longs;ionem ab&longs;olvit, &longs;æpiùs antliæ agitentur.

Verùm minore
impendio ab&longs;que rotis idem forta&longs;&longs;e a&longs;&longs;equemur, &longs;i poti&longs;&longs;imùm
aqua in altum propellenda &longs;it.

Ad perpendiculum erigatur tignum, quod imo puteo in­
nitatur, &longs;ive &longs;olidiori tigno
AB putei lateribus infixo
in&longs;i&longs;tat brevius tignum
CD, ita tamen obliquè
con&longs;titutum, ut hujus an­
guli latera illius re&longs;piciant,
quatenus ha&longs;tulæ ex hoc
exeuntes, medio jugo,
nullum recipiant à &longs;ub­
jecto tigno AB impedi­
mentum.

Suprema pars
tigni CD ita &longs;ecetur, ut
circa axem in E infixum
liberè ver&longs;ati po&longs;&longs;it ju­
gum, cujus extremitatibus
adnexæ &longs;unt ha&longs;tulæ an­
tliarum embolos attollen­
tes atque deprimentes.

Paulò infra axem E ape­
riatur foramen F, cui pa­
riter immitti queat jugum
alterum ver&longs;atile circa
axem H infixum paulò
infrà crenam &longs;uperiori ju­
go &longs;ub&longs;ervientem.

Porrò utriu&longs;que jugi non eadem e&longs;t forma: Nam &longs;upe­
rius jugum axi E infixum rectum e&longs;t GI, additamento
ad K auctum, ut paulo depre&longs;&longs;ius &longs;it foramen K ad reci­
piendum axem, quàm &longs;int axes ad G & I, quibus jun­
guntur cum jugo ha&longs;tulæ ad embolorum motum perficien­
dum de&longs;tinatæ.

At verò jugum inferius non ni&longs;i extremi­
tates LM & NO rectas habet, cætera inflexum e&longs;t, &
ad mediam curvaturam habet in P foramen, quo innita­
tur axi in H infixo.

Quantam autem e&longs;&longs;e oporteat hu­
ju&longs;modi inflexionem MPN, ex hoc definies, quod ubi
jugum GI in &longs;uo axe con&longs;i&longs;tens horizonti parallelum fue­
rit, etiam inferioris jugi in &longs;uo axe H con&longs;i&longs;tentis extre-
mitates LM & NO in eodem horizontali plano cum GI
conveniant.

His paratis fru&longs;tum cylindricum diametri (&longs;i id quidem
commodè fieri po&longs;&longs;it) non multo minoris, quàm &longs;it jugi GI
intercapedo inter ha&longs;tularum axes, con&longs;truatur.

Quod &longs;i
tantæ cra&longs;&longs;itudinis lignum præ&longs;to non fuerit, plura aptè
compinge, atque ferreo circulo con&longs;tringe, ne di&longs;&longs;ilire va­
leant.

Tum de&longs;tinatæ embolorum depre&longs;&longs;ioni atque eleva­
tioni æqualis &longs;altem pars QS toreutæ operâ rotundetur;
deinde &longs;errâ obliquè &longs;ecetur, ut fiat ellip&longs;is QT: cujus
limbus ferreâ lamellâ exactè planâ & politâ muniatur tùm
ad perpetuitatem, ne lignum atteratur, tùm ad faciliorem
motum, ut minor &longs;it cum &longs;ubjectis ligneis jugis conflictus:
interiores autem ellip&longs;is partes &longs;calpro eximi po&longs;&longs;unt, ut factâ
cavitate nullum motui impedimentum afferant tigni CD &longs;u­
premi anguli.

Fru&longs;to huic cylindrico ad axem firmiter in&longs;eratur minor
cylindrus VR, cui immitti po&longs;&longs;it vectis XY à jumento in X
circumducendus.

Minor huju&longs;modi cylindrus methodo &longs;u­
periùs indicatâ &longs;ub finem prop.
4. &longs;u&longs;pendatur eâ lege, ut
jugo GI maximè inclinato conveniat ellip&longs;is diameter QT,
minori autem ellip&longs;is Axi conveniant extremitates LM &
NO inferioris jugi, quæ erunt horizonti parallelæ.

Hinc
fiet, ut conver&longs;o cylindro &longs;ubinde deveniant ad maximam
depre&longs;&longs;ionem, atque vici&longs;&longs;im ad maximam elevationem, &longs;in­
guli antliarum emboli.

Quod &longs;i liceret in puteo, ubi aqua &longs;caturit, aut in va&longs;e, in
quod aqua influit, in altum elevanda vi antliæ propellentis,
non quadratum tantùm, &longs;ed hexagonum aut octogonum pri&longs;­
ma erigere ad perpendiculum, & in oppo&longs;itis faciebus fora­
mina excavare, quibus immitterentur inflexa juga, eâ in­
flexione, quæ &longs;atis e&longs;&longs;et, ut demum omnium extremitates in
eodem horizontali plano convenirent, &longs;atis manife&longs;tum e&longs;t
tribus aut quatuor jugis po&longs;&longs;e deinceps &longs;ex aut octo antlias
agitari.
PROPOSITIO VI.
Alia ratione plures antlias componere.

EX iis, quæ hujus libri cap.
5. dicta &longs;unt, genus aliud ad
Cuneum pertinens excogitare po&longs;&longs;umus, quo &longs;imul plu­
res antlias agitare po&longs;&longs;it potentia, cui maximè virium copia
&longs;uppetat, & valde &longs;implex machina con&longs;truenda proponatur.

Ex &longs;olidis a&longs;&longs;eribus
compingatur cir­
culus: hic in octo
partes di&longs;tribuatur,
& duæ proximæ
confixum habeant
tigillum AB, cu­
jus extremitates ita
extra circulum pro­
mineant, ut inci&longs;is
crenis ha&longs;tulæ em­
bolo adnexæ circa
&longs;uum axem ver&longs;a­
tiles &longs;inè impedi­
mento moveri que­
ant.

Tres &longs;imiles
tigilli tran&longs;ver&longs;arij
affigantur CD, EF, GH extremitatibus &longs;imiliter prominenti­
bus extra circuli ambitum, & excavatis in crenas ha&longs;tularum
capaces.

Ha&longs;tularum verò formam &longs;uaderem, quæ prope em­
bolum e&longs;&longs;ent plicatiles in dextram atque &longs;ini&longs;tram, quemad­
modum in &longs;upremâ parte, ubi tran&longs;ver&longs;ariis cohærent, &longs;unt
circa axem flexiles in anteriorem atque in po&longs;teriorem partem:
ex hac enim flexibilitate in omnem partem facilior oritur mo­
tus.

Duos autem tigillos CD & EF exi&longs;timo apponendos e&longs;&longs;e
tran&longs;ver&longs;arios, ad majorem circuli firmitatem: quamquam &longs;uf­
ficeret ad propo&longs;itum finem breviores apponere ad CE & DF,
omnino &longs;imiles & æquales ip&longs;is AB & GH.

His paratis alius æqualis circulus &longs;uperponatur, firmitérque
cum inferiore cohæreat.

Tum validus &longs;tylus ferreus RT figu­
ræ primùm cylindricæ, deinde ad S &longs;phæricæ, demum in T
de&longs;inens in conum con&longs;truatur, & columnæ, cui univer&longs;a ma­
china inniti debet, ad perpendiculum infigatur.

Ad centrum
verò circuli inferioris foramen fiat, per quod facilè globus S
immitti po&longs;&longs;it, & in centro circuli &longs;uperioris aliud pariter fo­
ramen aperiatur, &longs;ed tantùm capax coni ST, adeò ut machi­
na &longs;u&longs;tineatur à globo S, & in quancumque partem facilè in­
clinari queat: id quod etiam faciliùs continget, &longs;i foramen il­
lud &longs;uperioris circuli, qua parte globum S contingit, annulo,
&longs;eu limbo ferreo muniatur.

Quod &longs;i circulus ille &longs;uperior cra&longs;­
&longs;ior fuerit, quàm ut facilè inclinari po&longs;&longs;it, ne &longs;uperior ora fo­
raminis incurrat in conum, abradi poterit, quantum &longs;atis fue­
rit, in calathoidem, ut magis pateat, atque liberam inclina­
tionem permittat.

Circulari hac compage impo&longs;itâ &longs;tylo RS, ha&longs;tulæ embolo­
rum &longs;uis axibus adnectantur extremitatibus tigillorum promi­
nentibus.

Tum ad conciliandum
motum machinæ, cylindrus IK
&longs;uo centro K innitatur apici &longs;ty­
li T, & in &longs;uperiore loco, axis I
congruo foramini immi&longs;&longs;us ier­
vet cylindri po&longs;itionem perpen­
dicularem.

Sit autem in cylin­
dri latere profundiùs excavata
crena, cui in&longs;eri po&longs;&longs;it triangu­
lum OPN obtu&longs;angulum ad P,
quod validum &longs;it, & cum cylin­
dro firmi&longs;&longs;imè cohæreat: &longs;ic enim fiet, ut trianguli extremi­
tas O tangens circulum, illum à po&longs;itione horizonti parallelâ
removeat, & in eam partem inclinet, atque ex adversâ elevet.

Potentia verò vecti VX applicata, & cylindrum volvens, alam
pariter NOP circumducet; quæ aliis atque aliis &longs;ubjecti circu­
li partibus &longs;ubinde applicata illas deprimet, & ex diametro op­
po&longs;itas elevabit: intermediæ autem aliæ deprimentur, ad quas
&longs;cilicet extremitas O accedit, aliæ elevabuntur, à quibus ea­
dem extremitas O recedit.

Quantum autem extremitas O infra ba&longs;im cylindri de&longs;cen-
dere oporteat, definiendum e&longs;t primò ex motu, quem embolus
elevatus atque depre&longs;&longs;us perficit; cujus motús medietas acci­
pienda e&longs;t: deinde attendenda e&longs;t di&longs;tantia ba&longs;is cylindri à pla­
no circuli, &longs;i hoc con&longs;titueretur horizonti parallelum; hæc ve­
rò di&longs;tantia addenda e&longs;t &longs;emi&longs;&longs;i motûs emboli, ut innote&longs;cat,
quantum oporteat extremitatem O deprimi infra ba&longs;im cylin­
dri.

Neque cuiquam dubium e&longs;&longs;e pote&longs;t; an &longs;ic definienda &longs;it
huju&longs;modi depre&longs;&longs;io extremitatis O; &longs;iquidem inclinato circu­
lo tantum extremitas altera diametri deprimitur infra planum
horizontale, quantum altera attollitur; hæc autem duplicata
differentia dat univer&longs;um motum emboli; igitur hujus motús
&longs;emi&longs;&longs;e definitur circuli depre&longs;&longs;io & inclinatio.

Quia autem ad
faciliorem motum, tùm ne cylindri cra&longs;&longs;ities plano circuli in­
clinato occurrat, tùm ne latus PO circulum tangat præter­
quam extremitate O, ad vitandum tritum atque conflictum
partium, præ&longs;tat cylindrum non proximè adhærere circulo;
propterea di&longs;tantia ba&longs;is cylindri à centro &longs;ubjecti circuli com­
putanda e&longs;t.

Porrò expedire extremitatem O munitam ferreâ laminâ
percurrere in &longs;ubjecto circulo laminam pariter ferream ex­
qui&longs;itè politam, non opus e&longs;t monere: &longs;atis quippe per &longs;e
patet.

Illud cavendum e&longs;t, ut modum &longs;erves in alæ NOP
amplitudine; nam &longs;i nimis exigua &longs;it, paulò difficiliùs mo­
vet, quia nimis di&longs;tat ab ha&longs;tulis embolorum: &longs;in autem
æquo amplior fuerit, cùm maximam re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ partem illa
&longs;u&longs;tineat, &longs;ubit periculum luxationis.

Cæterùm hoc pende­
bit ex circuli amplitudine, cujus diametrum con&longs;tituen­
dam e&longs;&longs;e habitâ ratione motûs embolo antliæ communican­
di, nemo ignorat; quemadmodum & in &longs;implici antliá ex
hoc eodem definitur di&longs;tantia ha&longs;tulæ à centro motûs.

Quo­
niam enim motus ille depre&longs;&longs;ionis & elevationis emboli con­
nectitur cum motu circulari &longs;emidiametri circuli, cui ha&longs;tu­
læ adnectuntur, eum Radium circulo tribuere oportet, ut
arcus ab extremo puncto de&longs;criptus quàm minimùm differat
à lineâ rectâ; &longs;ic enim faciliùs movetur embolus.

Quare ar­
cus eju&longs;modi de&longs;cribendus e&longs;t, ut illius medietas Sinum
Ver&longs;um habeat, quoad fieri poterit, minimum.

Ponamus
univer&longs;um emboli motum e&longs;&longs;e unciarum 4, ejus &longs;emi&longs;&longs;em
unciarum 2: Sit circuli Radius BD unciarum 8. Inveniatur
in Canone Sinuum arcus, cujus Si­
nus ad Radium &longs;it ut 2 ad 8, & e&longs;t
proximè gr. 14. 28′ 40″. E&longs;t igitur
arcus ab extremâ &longs;emidiametro D
de&longs;cribendus CE gr. 28. 57′.

20″:
quo bifariam divi&longs;o in D e&longs;t arcus
CD gr.14. 28′.

40″; cujus Sinus CI;
& Sinus Ver&longs;us ID e&longs;t totius Radij BD (3/100), hoc e&longs;t unius
unciæ 4/25; quæ deflexio arcûs CE à rectitudine non admodum
nocet.

Satis igitur fuerit, &longs;i circuli diameter &longs;it unc.14. & ti­
gilli hinc atque hinc aliquantulum præter unam unciam pro­
mineant, ubi illis ha&longs;tulæ embolorum adnectuntur; &longs;ic enim
fiet, ut ha&longs;tulæ &longs;atis commodè moveantur, maximè &longs;i lon­
giores fuerint.

Quod &longs;i ligneis tigillis uti nolueris, &longs;ed potius ferreis pri&longs;­
matibus inter utrumque ligneum circulum aptè con&longs;erendis,
adeò ut circuli plana &longs;ibi vici&longs;&longs;im adhæreant, non dubium,
quin multò firmior futura &longs;it machina: hoc te monitum volo,
quod circulos cra&longs;&longs;iu&longs;culos e&longs;&longs;e oportet, ut in illis opportunum
foramen excavetur, quo commodè machina in&longs;i&longs;tat &longs;tyli glo­
bulo, &, prout oportet, inclinetur.
MECHANICORUM LIBER OCTAVUS.
De Cochlea.

POSTREMO loco inter Mechanicas Facultates
numeratur Cochlea, non tamen po&longs;tremo loco
habenda, &longs;i ejus vires perpendantur; immò &longs;i
cum cæteris Facultatibus comparetur, omnium
efficaci&longs;&longs;ima cen&longs;enda erit, cæteris paribus, ut
ex iis, quæ hoc libro di&longs;putabuntur, mani­
fe&longs;tum fiet.

Cur de Cochleâ po&longs;tremus habeatur &longs;ermo, &longs;i
quis inquirat, non pauci ex iis, qui inter Mechanicas faculta­
tes cognationis nexus quo&longs;dam perve&longs;tigant, ideò po&longs;t Cu­
neum numerari Cochleam autumabunt, quia Cochlea longior
quidam Cuneus cylindro convolutus cen&longs;eri pote&longs;t, cujus
propterea vires ad Cuneum revocare contendunt.

Mihi tamen,
qui Facultates &longs;ingulas ita à reliquis ab&longs;olutas agno&longs;co, ut nul­
lo alio vinculo invicem copulentur, ni&longs;i quatenus omnes ab
uno eodémque principio ortum ducunt, ea tantummodo e&longs;&longs;e
videtur cau&longs;a, quod reliquæ Facultates &longs;implices &longs;int, ac faci­
liùs parabiles, quàm Cochlea, atque hæc &longs;i &longs;olitaria adhibea­
tur, nec cum ullâ reliquarum Facultatum componatur, licèt
validè urgeat, aut trahat, eâ tamen communiter non utamur
ad majores motus efficiendos, quos unâ aliquâ reliquarum Fa­
cultatum, minore operâ, con&longs;equimur.

Hùc autem non &longs;pectat Archimedea Cochlea ad aquam in
altum evehendam in&longs;tituta: e&longs;t enim tubus in &longs;piram convolu­
tus circa &longs;uperficiem conicam aut cylindricam, &longs;eu in cono ip&longs;o
aut cylindro ita excavatus, ut aquam continere valeat, quam
extremum tubi o&longs;culum ex &longs;ubjectâ profluente hau&longs;it: dum &longs;ci-
licet circa &longs;uum axem Conus aut Cylinder ad horizontem in­
clinatus convertitur, quæ ingre&longs;&longs;a fuerat aqua, per &longs;piras a&longs;cen­
dens ad alteram tubi extremitatem &longs;uperiorem demum effundi­
tur; atque hac ratione ad tantam altitudinem illa attollitur,
quantus e&longs;t Sinus anguli, quo ad horizontem inclinatur axis
eoni aut cylindri, po&longs;ito codem axe tanquam Radio.

Hic, in­
quam, motus aquæ in tubo huju&longs;modi &longs;pirali a&longs;cendentis, non
e&longs;t præ&longs;entis di&longs;putationis, aqua &longs;iquidem non trahitur &longs;ur&longs;um,
&longs;ed &longs;emel ingre&longs;&longs;a in tubo &longs;pirali convoluto &longs;ponte de&longs;cendit,
donec ad &longs;upremum o&longs;culum provehatur; haud &longs;ecus ac plum­
beus globulus in eundem tubum immi&longs;&longs;us, &longs;i volvatur cylin­
der, non valens con&longs;i&longs;tere in eâ &longs;piræ parte, quæ priùs infima
& horizonti proxima, modò in conver&longs;ione removetur ab ho­
rizonte & attollitur, &longs;uâ autem gravitate repugnans a&longs;cen&longs;ui,
&longs;ponte de&longs;cendit per tubum tanquam per planum inclinatum,
atque ita deinceps, quoad ex &longs;upremo tubi o&longs;culo erumpat.

Idem planè contingit aquæ in huju&longs;modi tubo &longs;pirali vi &longs;uæ
gravitatis &longs;ubinde fluenti ac de&longs;cendenti in &longs;ingulis &longs;piris &longs;ta­
tim, ac modicum quid elevata e&longs;t in conver&longs;ione.

Cochlea igitur, de qua hìc di&longs;putabitur, ea e&longs;t, quæ ad vim
gravitati inferendam, &longs;i repugnet, in&longs;tituta e&longs;t, adeò ut corpo­
ris vim pa&longs;&longs;i motus impul&longs;ui à Potentiâ per Cochleam commu­
nicato adæquatè tribuendus &longs;it; & &longs;i quid gravitas ip&longs;a confe­
rat, id planè contingens reputetur.

Nomen autem Cochleæ
inditum e&longs;t ex &longs;imili quadam convolutione in te&longs;tâ limacis,
quæ in &longs;piras contorquetur, &longs;icut & Cochlides dicuntur &longs;calæ,
per quas in gyrum a&longs;cenditur.
CAPUT I.
Cochleæ forma & virtus de&longs;cribitur.

COchlea, quam explicandam &longs;u&longs;cipimus, ex limacis te&longs;tâ
eatenus &longs;olùm &longs;imilitudinem ducit, quatenus in &longs;piras du­
citur, cæterùm animalis illius &longs;piræ inæquales &longs;unt, & major
&longs;pira minorem qua&longs;i complectitur, non quemadmodum helix
in plano de&longs;cripta, &longs;ed ferè &longs;icut &longs;pira in coni aut globi &longs;uper­
ficie deformata.

Spira autem conicè ducta, aut &longs;phæricè, pa­
rum utilis accideret Machinatoris in&longs;tituto; cum enim, ut fir­
metur, in&longs;erenda &longs;it foramini &longs;imiliter in &longs;piram excavato, ma­
jores coni, aut globi, &longs;piræ non congruerent minoribus &longs;piris
foraminis conici aut &longs;phærici in modum &longs;caphij, nec per eas
promoveri po&longs;&longs;ent; atque minores coni, aut globi, &longs;piræ in am­
plioribus &longs;piris foraminis firmari nequirent.

Oportet igitur &longs;pi­
ram omnino &longs;imilibus ductibus, atque æqualibus con&longs;tare; id
quod non ni&longs;i in cylindro obtinetur.

Quapropter Cochlea, de
qua hìc agimus, e&longs;t &longs;olida &longs;pira in &longs;uperficie excavati cylindri
efformata; quæ vitium Capreolos arboris ramum complexos
imitata vulgari vocabulo Vitis (& forta&longs;&longs;e aptiùs) nominatur.

Receptaculum verò concavum, cui cylindrus in helicem de­
formatus immittitur, habétque &longs;pirales cavitates &longs;olidæ cylin­
dri &longs;piræ congruentes, Matrix dicitur, alij Tylum, Cochlidium
alij, vocabulo ad hanc &longs;ignificationem detorto, vulgus Matrem
Vitis nuncupat.

Ut autem &longs;piram cylindro æqualibus atque &longs;imilibus gyris
circumductam intelligas, concipe triangulum rectangulum,
cujus perpendiculum æquale &longs;it dato lateri aut Axi cylindri
Recti, ba&longs;is verò trianguli toties contineat perimetrum ba&longs;is
cylindri, quoties &longs;pira cylindrum ip&longs;um complecti debet; nam
huju&longs;modi trianguli hypothenu&longs;a lineam &longs;piralem omnino &longs;i­
militer ductam in cylindri &longs;uperficie de&longs;cribet, &longs;i triangulum
cylindro circumvolvatur.

Sit cylindri altitudo AB, ejú&longs;que ba&longs;is circulari peripheriæ
&longs;it æqualis recta BC ad rectum an­
gulum CBA con&longs;tituta.

Oporteat
autem &longs;piram quatuor gyris com­
plecti cylindrum; idcirco recta BC
producatur, ut tota BF &longs;it ip&longs;ius BG
quadrupla: ducta enim hypothenu­
&longs;a FA, &longs;i triangulum cylindro cir­
cumplicetur quadruplici convolutio­
ne, de&longs;ignabit in cylindri &longs;uperficie quatuor &longs;piras omnino &longs;i­
miles & æquales.

Spirarum æqualitatem & &longs;imilitudinem fa-
cilè demon&longs;trabis, &longs;i trianguli ba&longs;im BF, & altitudinem BA,
utramque in quatuor æquales partes di&longs;tinxeris; deinde ex &longs;in­
gulis divi&longs;ionum punctis rectas CM, DL, EK altitudini BA
parallelas, & rectas GK, HL, IM parallelas ba&longs;i BF excita­
veris; &longs;ibi enim occurrentes in punctis K, L, M, divident hy­
pothenu&longs;am in quatuor æquales partes, ut patet ex 2. lib.
6: Ni­
mirum ut FE ad ED, ita FK ad KL; & ut FD ad DC, ita FL
ad LM; & ut FC ad CB, ita FM ad MA: &longs;unt autem FE &
ED ex hypothe&longs;i æquales, igitur etiam FK & KL æquales:
FD po&longs;ita e&longs;t ip&longs;ius DC dupla, ergo FL ip&longs;ius LM dupla;
ergo LM æqualis e&longs;t ip&longs;i KL, aut FK: Demum FC ex con­
&longs;tructione e&longs;t ip&longs;ius CB tripla; igitur etiam FM e&longs;t tripla
ip&longs;ius MA; quare MA æqualis e&longs;t &longs;ingulis reliquis partibus
FK, KL, LM; & tota hypothenu&longs;a divifa e&longs;t in quatuor
æquales partes.

Item in parallelogrammo KD, per 34. lib.
1.
æqualia &longs;unt oppo&longs;ita latera KN & ED, atque in parallelo­
grammo LC æqualia &longs;unt LO & DC, quemadmodum & in
parallelogrammo MB æqualia &longs;unt MI & CB: Sicut igitur
rectæ FE, ED, DC, CB ex hypothe&longs;i &longs;unt æquales, etiam
FE, KN, LO, MI &longs;unt inter &longs;e æquales.

Similiter o&longs;tendes
&longs;icut æquales &longs;unt ex con&longs;tructione BG, GH, HI, IA, ita
æquales inter &longs;e e&longs;&longs;e EK, NL, OM, IA.

Cum itaque trian­
gula FEK, KNL, LOM, MIA habeant tria latera &longs;ingula
&longs;ingulis æqualia, & &longs;imiliter po&longs;ita, ip&longs;a &longs;unt quoque æquian­
gula, ac proinde &longs;imiliter inclinatæ &longs;unt &longs;ingulæ &longs;piræ FK, KL,
LM, MA, quæ pariter demon&longs;tratæ &longs;unt æquales.

Quam &longs;i­
milem inclinationem o&longs;tendit æqualitas angulorum ad F, K,
L, M, propter linearum paralleli&longs;mum.

Triangulum igitur
ABF &longs;uâ hypothenusâ FA de&longs;ignat in cylindri &longs;uperficie qua­
tuor &longs;imiles & æquales &longs;piras.

Verùm quid juvaret in exteriore cylindri &longs;uperficie &longs;piralem
lineam exqui&longs;itè de&longs;crip&longs;i&longs;&longs;e, ni&longs;i corpus ip&longs;um cylindricum in
&longs;olidam &longs;piram deformaretur?

Quapropter nece&longs;&longs;ariò cylin­
drum circumplectuntur duæ &longs;piræ, cava altera & depre&longs;&longs;a, al­
tera convexa & prominens, quibus &longs;imiliter atque æqualiter
depre&longs;&longs;æ & prominentes duæ &longs;piræ in receptaculi &longs;eu Matricis
foramine cylindricè excavato requiruntur ita illis re&longs;ponden­
tes, ut depre&longs;&longs;am receptaculi &longs;piram &longs;ubeat prominens cylindri
&longs;pira, & vici&longs;&longs;im prominentem receptaculi &longs;piram excipiat de­
pre&longs;&longs;a cylindri &longs;pira.

Ex quo fit, ut convolutus circa &longs;uum
axem cylindrus attollatur aut deprimatur, adducatur aut redu­
catur, prout opus fuerit, atque cum eo corpus ba&longs;i illius proxi­
mum, &longs;eu adnexum urgeatur, aut trahatur, elevetur, aut pie­
matur.

Vulgati&longs;&longs;imus autem & frequenti&longs;&longs;imus e&longs;t hujus Facultatis
u&longs;us, ubi poti&longs;&longs;imùm opus e&longs;t validâ pre&longs;&longs;ione, ut in prælis vi­
nariis ad exprimendum ex uvæ jam pre&longs;&longs;æ reliquiis tortivum
mu&longs;tum, apud typographos ad imprimendos &longs;ubjectæ chartæ
ex typis characteres, apud bibliopægos ad comprimendos li­
bros, jam compactos, apud fabros ferrarios ad firmandas fer­
reas laminas limâ expoliendas, atque apud alios artifices.

Quamquam & &longs;æpi&longs;&longs;imè clavorum loco, quibus ligna, aut me­
tallicæ laminæ configuntur citrà mallei percu&longs;&longs;ionem, cochleis
utimur, & quidem ad validiorem atque perennem firmitatem;
neque enim revelli pote&longs;t cochlea, aut excuti, quemadmodum
clavus.

Sed tunc huju&longs;modi cochleæ non exercent vim facul­
tatis Mechanicæ; eatenus &longs;cilicet validiùs, quàm clavi, duo
corpora, quæ compinguntur, connectunt, quatenus multipli­
ces in cylindruli facie &longs;olidarum &longs;pirarum ductus pluribus cavis
foraminum &longs;piris implicantur ex cylindruli convolutione; qui
propterea eximi non pote&longs;t, ni&longs;i in contrarium revolvatur;
quandiu quidem incorruptum permanet lignum neque ex hu­
more putre&longs;cens, neque vermiculo erodente cario&longs;um, neque
calore nimio ita di&longs;cedens atque dehi&longs;cens, ut laxato foramine
jam non ampliùs &longs;olida cylindruli &longs;pira congruentibus &longs;triis
coërceatur.

Hinc e&longs;t in &longs;u&longs;tentando pondere ex cochleâ &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;o pro­
priè non exerceri vim Mechanicam; nihil enim ampliùs co­
nante Potentiâ (quemadmodum in Vecte, aut Axe in Peritro­
chio, aut fune Trochlearum retinendo opus e&longs;t, quæ pondus
elevavit convoluto cylindro in cochleam deformato, &longs;ola &longs;pira­
rum cavæ atque convexæ complexio efficit, ut cylindrus cum
adnexo pondere retineatur, ne recidat, quatenus à &longs;ubjectâ lo­
culamenti &longs;pirâ &longs;olidâ &longs;u&longs;tinetur: quemadmodum & &longs;ub&longs;cudi­
bus compagem cohibentibus accidit, quatenus &longs;ecuricla ex mi­
nore in majorem amplitudinem explicata decre&longs;centis recepta-
culi angu&longs;tiis coërcetur, ne excurrat; adeóque confixum hu­
ju&longs;imodi &longs;ub&longs;cude corpus grave inferius retinetur, ne à &longs;uperio­
re disjungatur, & cadat.

Tota igitur vis Machinalis à Cochleâ exercetur in motu,
quem à potentiâ illam circumagente recipit.

Et &longs;anè &longs;i poten­
tiæ cylindrum ver&longs;antis motum comparemus cum motu ponde­
ris, quod à cochleâ urgetur, aut trahitur; &longs;tatim apparebit po­
tentiam quidem circulum de&longs;cribere circa convoluti cylindri
axem, pondus verò recta moveri, prout promovetur, aut retra­
hitur cylindrus.

Cum itaque in &longs;ingulis cylindri conver&longs;ioni­
bus ejus motum definiat &longs;piræ à &longs;pirâ intervallum; &longs;i hoc cum
circulari peripheriâ conferatur, innote&longs;cet motuum Ratio, &
Potentiæ momentum, quæ eò minorem in pondere re&longs;i&longs;ten­
tiam invenit, quò tardiùs hoc movetur.

Hinc &longs;i cylindri alti­
tudo ad eju&longs;dem diametrum &longs;it ut 20 ad 1, numeratá&longs;que &longs;piras
cylindrum complectentes inveneris e&longs;&longs;e 35, rectè definies con­
volutionibus 35 re&longs;pondere totum cylindri motum, atque adeò
&longs;piræ à &longs;pirà intervallum e&longs;&longs;e ad cylindri diametrum ut 4. ad 7:
ex quo infertur circuli peripheriam ad &longs;pirarum di&longs;tantiam,
hoc e&longs;t potentiæ motum ad motum ponderis, e&longs;&longs;e proximè
ut 22 ad 4, atque potentiæ conatum ut 4. vincere po&longs;&longs;e quam­
libet re&longs;i&longs;tentiam minorem quàm ut 22, &longs;pectatâ Ratione, quam
infert cylindri cra&longs;&longs;ities, & &longs;pirarum obliquitas.

Verùm quia non ni&longs;i parvulis cochleis, aut ubi levis conatus
requiritur, ita applicatur potentia, ut cylindri &longs;uperficiei ap­
plicata intelligatur, complanatâ &longs;cilicet eju&longs;dem cylindri extre­
mitate, quam &longs;ummis digitis apprehendere valeas, communi­
ter adhuc majus e&longs;t momentum Potentiæ, quàm ut ex circuli
peripheriâ ba&longs;im cylindri ambiente circum&longs;cribatur; additur
enim aut Radius cylindri Capiti quadrato infixus, aut aliquid
manubrij rationem habens, adeò ut potentia longè majorem
circulum de&longs;cribat, quàm &longs;it cylindri in &longs;piram deformati ba&longs;is:
ac proinde non ex cylindri cra&longs;&longs;itie, &longs;ed ex di&longs;tantiâ potentiæ
ab axe cylindri definiendus e&longs;t eju&longs;dem potentiæ circulum per­
ficientis motus, atque cum &longs;pirarum intervallo motum ponde­
ris metiente comparandus.

Hinc ad imprimendas metallicæ laminæ ex argento, aut
auro, aut cupro imagines citrà percu&longs;&longs;ionem, &longs;uper &longs;olido pla-
no erectis atque infixis ad perpendiculum duobus ferreis pedi­
bus ferreo pariter tran&longs;ver&longs;ario firmatis, in quo excavata co­
chleæ congruens Matrix, typus inter laminam & cylindrum
interjectus validè urgetur ex cylindri convolutione, & imagi­
nem exprimit: quia videlicet &longs;uperiori cylindri Capiti quadra­
to in&longs;eritur longior ferreus vectis hinc atque hinc productus,
ut duplici ejus extremitati duplex potentia, &longs;i opus fuerit, ap­
plicetur.

Quapropter ab axe cylindri ad vectis huju&longs;modi ex­
tremitatem ducta linea e&longs;t Radius circuli potentiæ motum de­
terminantis; atque &longs;i huju&longs;modi Radij longitudo ad &longs;pirarum
intervallum fuerit ut 50 ad 1, circuli diameter e&longs;t 100, eju&longs;que
peripheria major quàm 314; & potentiæ motus ad motum typi
laminam prementis e&longs;t ut 314 ad 1: idcirco &longs;i in vectis extremi­
tatibus &longs;int &longs;inguli homines perinde conantes, ac &longs;i libras 50
&longs;inguli moverent, premitur typus vi hujus cochleæ qua&longs;i à
pondere librarum 31400.

Quod autem de pre&longs;&longs;ione dicitur, &longs;imili ratione intelligen­
dum e&longs;t de ponderis elevatione, &longs;i fortè aut inferiori cylindri
ba&longs;i adnexum fuerit, aut ejus capiti impo&longs;itum; &longs;icut enim cor­
pus prementi re&longs;i&longs;tit ratione particularum con&longs;tipatarum, ita
elevanti repugnat ratione &longs;uæ gravitatis: utrobique igitur &longs;imi­
lem virtutem habet potentia ad vincendam re&longs;i&longs;tentiam, quan­
do utrobique eadem invenitur Ratio motuum atque momento­
rum.

Propterea in huju&longs;modi cochleis, quæ infixo Radio con­
volvuntur, non e&longs;t admodum anxiè procuranda cylindri cra&longs;­
&longs;ities, modò &longs;atis &longs;olidus &longs;it, nec fragilis: eadem quippe e&longs;t cir­
culi à potentiæ motu de&longs;cripti peripheria, &longs;ivè major &longs;it, &longs;ivè
minor cylindri cra&longs;&longs;itudo, quando eadem e&longs;t potentiæ di&longs;tan­
tia à cylindri axe, ac proinde idem e&longs;t momentum.

Illud quidem ad rem facit maximè, quam obliquè inclinatus
&longs;it &longs;pirarum ductus; hinc enim oritur intervalli Ratio inter pro­
ximos &longs;pirarum circuitus, qui frequenti&longs;&longs;imi &longs;unt, ac brevi in­
tervallo disjuncti, &longs;i linea &longs;piralis &longs;it maximè inclinata, rari au­
tem atque notabiliter &longs;ejuncti, &longs;i illa fuerit ad majorem angu­
lum (acutum tamen) erecta: E&longs;t nimirum huju&longs;modi interval­
lum æquale Tangenti anguli inclinationis, po&longs;ito Radio am­
bitu ba&longs;is cylindri; ip&longs;a autem &longs;pira e&longs;t eju&longs;dem anguli Secans.

Quare datâ cylindri diametro, invenitur peripheria ba&longs;is; &
dato &longs;pirarum intervallo, invenitur angulus huic intervallo tan­
quam Tangenti oppo&longs;itus, &longs;cilicet inclinatio &longs;piræ, & hypo­
thenu&longs;a tanquam eju&longs;dem anguli Secans dat ip&longs;ius lineæ &longs;pira­
lis longitudinem.

Quod &longs;i totius lineæ &longs;piralis univer&longs;um cylindrum com­
plectentis lineam de&longs;ideras, toties peripheriam ba&longs;is multipli­
ca, quot &longs;unt &longs;pirarum circuitus, & habebis Radium; cylindri
altitudo dabit Tangentem, cui re&longs;pondens Secans indicabit to­
tius &longs;piræ integram longitudinem.
Sit ex.

gr. cylindri altitudo
ped. 3. hoc e&longs;t unciarum 36. ejus diameter unciarum 7; ergo
ba&longs;is perimeter unc.

22: Spirarum circuitus &longs;int 25: igitur
ductâ perimetro 22 in 25, habetur 550 tanquam Radius, & 36
tanquam Tangens: igitur ut unciæ 550 ad uncias 36, ita Ra­
dius 100000 ad 6545 Tangentem gr. 3. m.

45. cui re&longs;pondet
Secans 100214: Quare ut 100000 ad 100214, ita unciæ 550
ad uncias (551 177/1000) longitudinem totius lineæ &longs;piralis; quam, &longs;i
careas Canone Trigonometrico, etiam habebis ex 47. lib.
1.
addendo quadrata numerorum 550 & 36, erit enim horum
&longs;umma quadratum, cujus Radix dabit eandem quæ&longs;itam &longs;piræ
longitudinem.

Cum autem hæc &longs;piræ longitudo, &longs;ive univer&longs;a, &longs;ive parti­
culatim a&longs;&longs;umatur, &longs;emper longior &longs;it, &longs;ivè multiplici, &longs;ivè &longs;in­
gulari perimetro circuli, qui e&longs;t ba&longs;is cylindri, utique motus
potentiæ, ejú&longs;que momentum, non ex hac &longs;pirali lineâ de&longs;u­
mendum e&longs;t; neque enim ip&longs;a e&longs;&longs;e pote&longs;t men&longs;ura motûs po­
tentiæ cylindro applicatæ ad ejus diametri extremitatem.

Hinc
e&longs;t mihi non arridere eorum &longs;ententiam, qui cochleæ vires re­
ferunt ad planum inclinatum, quod ab ipsâ lineâ &longs;pirali repræ­
&longs;entetur.

In plano &longs;iquidem inclinato momentum gravitatis,
ad eju&longs;dem gravitatis momentum in perpendiculo, &longs;e habet re­
ciprocè ut perpendiculum ad ip&longs;am lineam inclinatam; ac pro­
pterea eandem Rationem &longs;ervant conatus Potentiæ moventis
pondus aut in perpendiculo, aut in plano inclinato.

At hìc po­
tentia non movetur juxta lineæ inclinatæ longitudinem, &longs;ed
breviore motu juxta ba&longs;im trianguli rectanguli, cujus hypothe­
nu&longs;a e&longs;t ip&longs;a linea inclinata: Igitur potentiæ momentum ali­
quanto minus cen&longs;endum e&longs;t, quam pro Ratione plani inclina­
ti.

Adde momenta gravitatis ponderis alicujus tunc &longs;olùm
fieri minora in plano inclinato, quando illi in&longs;i&longs;tit, & deor&longs;um
nititur premendo ip&longs;um planum: at &longs;i pondus idem incumbat
plano horizontali, verum quidem e&longs;t planum verticale, quod
adversùs pondus moveatur non &longs;ecundùm directionem, quæ
recta occurrat centro gravitatis eju&longs;dem ponderis, &longs;ed obliquè,
minus invenire re&longs;i&longs;tentiæ: &longs;ed pondus illud propriè non mo­
vetur &longs;uper plano, licèt ab eo obliquè repellatur; & potiùs pla­
num movetur juxta pondus: hìc verò &longs;i pondus in plano hori­
zontali jacens &longs;it adnexum cochleæ trahenti, aut oppo&longs;itum
cochleæ repellenti & urgenti, non movetur obliquè, &longs;ed motu
directo: non igitur movetur &longs;uper planum inclinatum.

Porrò unum e&longs;t in Cochleâ quodammodo &longs;ingulare, quod
in nullam aliam Facultatem æquè convenire deprehenditur:
Cum enim requiratur & cylindrus in helicem inflexus, & Ma­
trix illi congruens, ita ut alteri quies, alteri motus debeatur;
perinde e&longs;t &longs;i matrice immotâ cylindrus convertatur, atque &longs;i
manente cylindro matrix ip&longs;a convolvatur, modò Potentia
æquali Radio utatur, &longs;ivè cylindri capiti, &longs;ivè Matrici infixo:
eadem &longs;iquidem &longs;unt potentiæ momenta, & æqualis motus pon­
deris; æqualiter enim promovetur matrix in cylindro &longs;tabili, at­
que cylindrus in Matrice immotâ.

Id quod maxime locum
habet, ubi opus e&longs;t compre&longs;&longs;ione, & vulgati&longs;&longs;imus e&longs;t apud va­
rios artifices u&longs;us.

Jam verò quod ad diuturnitatem &longs;pectat, diffitendum non e&longs;t
cochleam frequenti u&longs;u atteri, e&longs;t enim perpetuus illius cum
&longs;uâ Matrice conflictus, quamvis plurimùm juvet, &longs;i &longs;megmate,
aut pingui aliquo humore inungatur, quo lubrica fiat, ut faci­
liùs convolvatur, minú&longs;que atteratur.

Deinde quamvis unica
&longs;pira matrici &longs;ufficiat, ut vel ip&longs;a, vel cylindrus promoveatur,
aut retrahatur, nihilominus faciliùs labem patitur, quàm &longs;i plu­
res in &longs;piras fuerit excavata: cum enim aut à gravitate ponde­
ris &longs;u&longs;tollendi, aut à partium con&longs;tipatione repugnantium com­
pre&longs;&longs;ioni, ip&longs;a unica re&longs;i&longs;tentiam inveniat, utique vel ponderis
gravitas ip&longs;i uni innititur, vel potentiæ conatus, reluctante cor­
pore comprimendo aut trahendo, in illam &longs;olam effunditur.

Propterea expedit alteram &longs;altem, aut tertiam &longs;piram addere,
ut divi&longs;o in plures conatu firmitati con&longs;ulatur.

Eandem ob cau&longs;am aliquando cylindrum complectitur non
unica &longs;pirarum &longs;eries, &longs;ed & alia illi parallela additur (nec quic­
quam prohibet, quin & plures duabus &longs;int huju&longs;modi paralle­
larum &longs;pirarum &longs;eries) ut multo validior ac firmior &longs;it cochlea,
ne facilè &longs;pira aliqua di&longs;&longs;ipetur, aut &longs;i qua labefactetur, nullum
&longs;equatur incommodum, alterâ &longs;pirâ parallelâ ejus vices &longs;up­
plente.

Sic &longs;piræ ABCDEF paral­
lela &longs;tatuitur altera ab I incipiens, &
per KLMNOP &longs;imili lap&longs;u &longs;erpens.

Ex hac tamen multiplici &longs;pirâ non au­
getur momentum potentiæ applicatæ
Radio VS; neque enim circulus à po­
tentiâ in S applicatâ de&longs;criptus com­
parandus e&longs;t cum AK, &longs;ed cum AC;
unicâ &longs;iquidem cylindri convolutione
promovetur cylindrus non ex A in K,
&longs;ed ex A in C.

Propterea oblato cy­
lyndro in Cochleam deformato dili­
genter attendendum e&longs;t, utrum plures &longs;int &longs;pirarum &longs;eries, an
unica; ne fortè ex brevi inter proximas &longs;piras intervallo perpe­
ram conjicias lineam &longs;piralem magis inclinatam, quàm reip&longs;a
&longs;it; prius enim dijudicandum e&longs;t, an illæ proximæ &longs;piræ ad ean­
dem Helicem &longs;pectent; attenditur &longs;cilicet intervallum &longs;pirarum
ad eandem &longs;eriem continuo ductu pertinentium.
CAPUT II.
An utilis &longs;it Cochlea duplex contraria.

QUamvis ad &longs;uperandam modico labore re&longs;i&longs;tentiam non
modicam corporis, quod Cochlea urget, aut trahit, hu­
ju&longs;modi Facultas &longs;it poti&longs;&longs;imùm excogitata, &longs;æpi&longs;&longs;imè tamen
cochleam adhibemus non ad vincendam re&longs;i&longs;tentiam, quæ ali­
quando tenui&longs;&longs;ima e&longs;t, &longs;ed unicè ad motum ita temperandum,
ut pro opportunitate exiguus &longs;it; neque enim mu&longs;culorum mo­
tum ita attenuare pro arbitrio pote&longs;t homo, ut &longs;emper quàm
minimus contingat: propterea deformato in cochleam cylin­
dro utimur, ut majori potentiæ motui minor motus in corpore
movendo re&longs;pondeat.

Sic ad excipiendas objectorum corpo­
rum &longs;pecies opticas aut lumen, cum non eadem &longs;emper tu­
bo&longs;pecilli longitudo opportuna &longs;it pro variâ tum objecti di&longs;tan­
tiâ, tum oculi conformatione, prudenter ab aliquibus extre­
mus tubulus, cui lens ocularis in&longs;eritur, in &longs;piram contorque­
tur, ut faciliùs & citiùs ju&longs;tam longitudinem a&longs;&longs;equantur: id
quod ægrè obtinerent, &longs;i rectà tubulum illum adducerent, aut
reducerent, ut &longs;atis experientiâ con&longs;tat.

Hinc aliquando contingit oppo&longs;itos motus conciliandos e&longs;&longs;e
duobus corporibus ita, ut aut ad &longs;e mutuò accedant, aut ma­
gis invicem disjungantur, &longs;ive illa motui valde repugnent, &longs;ive
&longs;ola motûs tarditas requiratur.

Propterea eju&longs;dem cylindri lon­
gitudo in duas helices di&longs;tinguitur, quæ &longs;imili quidem ductu
cylindrum circumplectuntur, &longs;ed illis in diver&longs;a abeuntibus,
unius &longs;piræ non &longs;unt alterius &longs;piris parallelæ; quæ eatenus con­
trariæ vocari po&longs;&longs;unt, quatenus oppo&longs;itos motus efficiunt, ne­
que eæ &longs;unt, quæ in unam continuam &longs;piram coale&longs;cere queant.
Ex cylindri AB medio puncto C exeant duæ &longs;piræ ad ea&longs;dem
partes inclinatæ, hinc CD versùs extremitatem A procedens,
hinc verò CE versùs extremitatem B; utraque enim &longs;uam ma­
tricem habens, cui in&longs;eratur, dum convolvitur cylindrus, ma­
tricem longiùs à medio promovet, aut ad medium attrahit; at­
que cum matrice adnexa corpora &longs;imili & æquali motu moven­
tur.

Hinc &longs;i utraque matrix proxima &longs;it medio puncto C, ex
primâ convolutione cylindri altera per CD removetur u&longs;que
in F, altera per CE in G; atque adeò &longs;icut matrices moven­
tur per CF, & CG, ita eadem men&longs;ura corporum adnexorum
motum metitur, quæ invicem removentur intervallo FG; &
ita deinceps in cæteris cylindri convolutionibus.

Quod &longs;i movendorum in oppo&longs;itas partes corporum re&longs;i&longs;ten­
tia exigua &longs;it, &longs;atis fuerit extremitatibus cylindri an&longs;ulas appo­
nere, quibus circumactis cylindrus ip&longs;e in cochleas deforma­
tus convertatur.

Sic antè annos ferè quadraginta (cum non ar­
rideret vulgaris tunc apud artifices circinorum forma, qui in­
terjecto elatere crura divaricant; &longs;ed inflexam in arcum co­
chleam alteri crurum infixam, & per alterum trajectam, de­
currente matrice exteriùs appo&longs;itâ, dilatationem moderatur ar­
tifex) ju&longs;&longs;i mihi parari ab&longs;que ullo elatere circinum, quem ip&longs;e
dilatarem atque contraherem pro arbitrio, cochleam huju&longs;mo­
di duplicem in hanc atque in illam partem convertens.

Ad
trientem totius longitudinis à nodo, &longs;ingula crura cylindricum
foramen habent, ut &longs;ingulis in&longs;erantur cylindruli congruentes
exqui&longs;itè politi, quorum &longs;uperiori extremitati &longs;unt adnexæ co­
chlearum matrices, inferior extremitas extra circini &longs;oliditatem
exiens in helicem de&longs;init, ut appo&longs;itâ matrice cylindrulus in­
tra foramen contineatur.

Huju&longs;modi e&longs;t cylindrulus IS cra&longs;­
&longs;itiei circini re&longs;pondens, &longs;uperior pars e&longs;t matrix R, infima ex­
tra circini &longs;oliditatem in helicem deformata e&longs;t SV, cui addita
matrix X continet cylindrulum intrà foramen, cui inditus e&longs;t,
ita tamen, ut cylindruli ip&longs;ius opportunam convolutionem non
impediat.

Duæ igitur matrices, cuju&longs;modi e&longs;t R, coaptantur
duplici cochleæ cujus deinde extremitatibus, ad facilem
conver&longs;ionem, an&longs;ulæ adduntur, adeò ut illæ matrices non
&longs;int exemptiles.

Quare utrique crurum circini foramini,
utriu&longs;que matricis cylindrulus IS in&longs;eratur, & inferius ma­
trice X firmetur: Nam convertendo cylindrum in dupli­
cem cochleam deformatum, circini crura divaricabis, aut
adduces, ut libuerit.

Neque quicquam officiet cylindri
rectitudo, quia matricum cylindruli IS pro opportunitate
volvuntur.

Hinc circino eodem uti poteris ab&longs;que cochleâ,
deduci enim hæc pote&longs;t, exemptis matricibus è foramine,
cui in&longs;eruntur.

At verò &longs;i validiore conatu opus fuerit, ad medium cy­
lindrum, ubi cochlearum &longs;piræ incipiunt, oportebit forami­
na excavare, quibus immitti queat vectis, ut potentiæ mo-
tus ad ponderum motum habeat majorem Rationem.

Sic
duplici cochleâ cylindro circumductâ ad medium E &longs;int fora­
mina, quibus vectis BC &longs;ubinde inferri po&longs;&longs;it: duo autem
membra FD, & MN ex materiâ &longs;atis &longs;olidâ, qua extremita­
te re&longs;piciunt vectem, matricem habeant cochleæ congruen­
tem, ut ex vectis & cochleæ conver&longs;ione aut ad &longs;e invicem
accedant, aut &longs;ejungantur: reliqua extremitas exterior D
& N cava &longs;it, ut corpus repellendum comprehendatur, re­
flectatur verò qua&longs;i in uncos K & R, ut &longs;i duo corpora attra­
henda fuerint, iis apprehendantur, &longs;ivè proximè & immedia­
tè, &longs;ivè funibus adnexa.

Quanta &longs;it hujus in&longs;trumenti vis, etiam ad frangenda aut
dilatanda ferrea clathra, hinc patet, quòd, longiore vecte ad­
dito, potentiæ momenta notabiliter augentur; quia potentia
percurrit peripheriam circuli, cujus Radius à cylindri centro
ad vectis extremitatem producitur, pondera verò non ni&longs;i pro
&longs;pirarum intervallo moventur.

Ubi tamen advertendum e&longs;t,
utrum cylindrus ita &longs;it alicui loculamento in&longs;ertus, ut ejus
medium DE nec ad dexteram, nec ad &longs;ini&longs;tram declinare
queat, an verò liber omninó &longs;it.

Si enim interjectum mo­
vendis corporibus in&longs;trumentum omnino liberum &longs;it, pon­
dera verò movenda inæqualiter re&longs;i&longs;tant comparatis, aut eo­
rum gravitatibus, aut momentis ratione planorum non uno
modo inclinatorum, aut ex di&longs;parili &longs;uperficierum a&longs;perita­
te, non &longs;equitur æqualis eorum motus, &longs;ed qua parte ma­
jor invenitur re&longs;i&longs;tentia, minor quoque e&longs;t motus; quamvis
utrumque æqualiter di&longs;ter à medio cylindri, quod repellitur
quodammodo ad eam partem, ubi levior e&longs;t re&longs;i&longs;tentia.

Si
enim ad N &longs;it aliquid ob&longs;tans motui, ut paries, aut firmi-
ter infixus paxillus, ad D verò corpus aliquod repellendum;
utique ex vectis BC conver&longs;ione etiam cochlea convolvitur,
& corpus in D po&longs;itum tantumdem promovetur, quanto in­
tervallo ab&longs;unt F & M ex cochleæ conver&longs;ione; nam propter
impedimentum in N exi&longs;tens, nullo pacto ip&longs;um M move­
tur.

Sin autem corpus in N non omnino reluctetur motui,
&longs;ed tamen re&longs;i&longs;tat magis, quàm corpus in D, illud quidem
aliquantulum repellitur, &longs;ed multò magis repellitur corpus,
quod e&longs;t in D; & in hoc motu medium cylindri punctum E
ad eas partes accedit, ad quas movetur corpus in D repul­
&longs;um.

Quod &longs;i medium E ita e&longs;&longs;et loculamento aliquo con­
clu&longs;um, ut po&longs;itionem mutare nequeat, &longs;ed &longs;olùm convolvi
po&longs;&longs;it, tunc utrumque corpus æqualiter repellitur, quia &longs;pi­
rarum intervalla in utráque cochleâ æqualia &longs;unt.

Hinc pa­
tet po&longs;&longs;e fieri motus inæquales, &longs;i &longs;pirarum inclinationes non
fuerint æquales; minùs enim movetur illud, quod &longs;piris &longs;pi&longs;­
&longs;ioribus urgetur.

Quamvis autem huju&longs;modi duplex cochlea ad duo corpo­
ra disjungenda aut attrahenda &longs;æpè utilis &longs;it, ubi tamen exi­
guus motus requiritur, &longs;ivè ad augenda potentiæ momenta,
&longs;ive ad affectandam tarditatem, præ&longs;tabit &longs;implicem co­
chleam adhibere.

Nam in duplicis cochleæ conver&longs;ione
disjunguntur, aut ad &longs;e invicem accedunt matrices (ac pro­
inde & corpora, quæ moventur) quantum e&longs;t duplex inter­
vallum, quo &longs;pira abe&longs;t à &longs;pira; &longs;ingulis nimirum cochleis
&longs;uum re&longs;pondet intervallum: at in &longs;implicis cochleæ con­
ver&longs;ione motus re&longs;pondet &longs;implici duarum proximarum &longs;pi­
rarum intervallo; ad quod idem potentiæ motus majorem
habet Rationem, quàm ad duplex intervallum.

Quare fa­
tis e&longs;t, &longs;i alterutrum membrum cochleam includens longius
&longs;it, & matricem habeat; reliquum membrum, ut MN,
brevius e&longs;&longs;e pote&longs;t, quantum opus fuerit ad recipiendum
cylindri caput extenuatum in minorem cylindrum, intrà
foramen cylindricum exqui&longs;itè politum, ut facillimè con­
verti po&longs;&longs;it: ita verò caput illud muniatur, ut ex locula­
mento extrahi nequeat, quando utendum fuerit in&longs;tru­
mento ad corpora attrahenda: nam ad illa disjungenda cùm
adhibetur, &longs;atis reluctatur major diameter cylindri in co-
chleam deformati, ne intrà foramen ulteriùs excurrat.

Simili planè ratione ad divaricanda aut contrahenda cir­
cini crura, uti
poteram unicâ &
&longs;implici cochleâ
RS: cylindri il­
lius extremitas
extenuetur in mi­
norem cylindrum
exqui&longs;itè lævigatum, qui prominentis capitis O foramini
cylindrico pariter polito in&longs;eratur, & exteriore an&longs;ula V
converti pro arbitrio po&longs;&longs;it.

Alterius clavi TX caput T
matricem habeat cochleæ congruentem: nam conver&longs;a an­
&longs;ula V adducet clavum T, & cum eo crus circini, ad O,
aut ab hoc illum removebit, & crura divaricabit: & qui­
dem faciliùs licebit minutam in accipiendis punctorum di­
&longs;tantiis &longs;ubtilitatem per&longs;equi; quandoquidem uni integræ
conver&longs;ioni cylindri re&longs;pondet unicum &longs;pirarum intervallum,
non autem duo intervalla huju&longs;modi, quemadmodum cùm
duplex e&longs;t cochlea.

Quæ verò hì dicta &longs;unt, in pluribus aliis locum habe­
re po&longs;&longs;unt, in quibus pro opportunitate modò &longs;implicem,
modò duplicem cochleam prudens Machinator adhibebit:
Et quidem &longs;i duplex futura &longs;it cochlea, neque æquali mo­
tu movenda &longs;int in oppo&longs;itas partes corpora, cochleas ip&longs;as
non &longs;imili, &longs;ed inæquali, &longs;pirarum inclinatione formari ju­
bebit.

Cochleam autem ip&longs;am opportuno loco &longs;tatuet: &
&longs;i fortè corporum ip&longs;orum motus paulò velocior aut major
requiratur, quàm ferat ip&longs;a cochleæ convolutio, duobus
vectibus decu&longs;&longs;atis, & circa axem in decu&longs;&longs;atione ver&longs;ati­
libus uti poterit, atque cochleam cum &longs;uis clavis & matri­
cibus (ut &longs;uperiùs de circino dictum e&longs;t) non procul à de­
cu&longs;&longs;atione collocabit; nam modica illius convolutio non
exiguum motum tribuet corporibus in vectium illorum ex­
tremitate po&longs;itis, quippe quæ à decu&longs;&longs;atione magis di&longs;tant,
quàm cochlea.

At, inquies, hoc idem Ergatâ præ&longs;tari poterit: &longs;i enim
funes breviorum brachiorum extremitatibus C & E adnexi
connectantur cum Ergatæ cylindro, ex hujus conver&longs;ione ac­
cedent ad &longs;e invicem ex­
tremitates C & E, ac pro­
pterea etiam velociùs cor­
pora in F & D movebun­
tur.

Ita planè: non diffi­
teor: &longs;ed &longs;i extremitates C
& E proximas disjungere
oporteat, adeóne promptus
erit Ergatæ u&longs;us, quin alio artificio opus &longs;it, ut hujus ope
disjungantur?

Præterquam, quod &longs;æpè multum &longs;patij ad col­
locandam Ergatam requiritur; &longs;i maximè opus &longs;it illi pegma
con&longs;truere.

Quid verò &longs;i vectes ip&longs;i promovendi &longs;int, non
retrahendi, ut in rebus &longs;cenicis contingere pote&longs;t?

Quid &longs;i in
&longs;ublimiore loco res perficienda &longs;it?

quàm incommodè opportu­
na Ergata &longs;atis longo vecte in&longs;tructa ibi parabitur?

Sed illud
poti&longs;&longs;imum attendendum e&longs;t, quod vis cochleæ longè major
e&longs;t; nam in Ergatâ Ratio motûs potentiæ ad motum ponderis
e&longs;t eadem cum Ratione peripheriæ ab extremitate vectis de­
&longs;criptæ ad cylindri ambitum, hoc e&longs;t longitudinis vectis u&longs;que
ad axem cylindri, ad ip&longs;ius cylindri &longs;emidiametrum: at in co­
chleâ peripheria ab extremo vecte de&longs;cripta non comparatur
cum ip&longs;ius cylindri perimetro, &longs;ed cum proximarum &longs;pirarum
intervallo, quod &longs;æpi&longs;&longs;imè minus e&longs;t (&longs;altem pote&longs;t e&longs;&longs;e minus,
&longs;i magis inclinatæ & &longs;pi&longs;&longs;æ &longs;int &longs;piræ) quàm cylindri diameter,
aut ejus perimeter: ac proinde major e&longs;t Ratio motûs potentiæ
ad motum ponderis.
CAPUT III.
Cochlea cum Vecte, atque cum Axe componitur.

COntingere pote&longs;t aliquando onus Vecte elevandum e&longs;&longs;e,
tantam verò illius gravitatem deprehendi, ut &longs;ufficiens
Vectis longitudo non &longs;uppetat pro ratione operarum, quas
adhibere po&longs;&longs;umus, aut &longs;altem eæ &longs;int loci angu&longs;tiæ, ut neque
huju&longs;modi Vectis longitudinem, neque operarum multitudi­
nem capiat: plures autem Vectes componere omnino incom­
modum &longs;it, quia, ut in loco dictum e&longs;t, minimus fieret oneris
elevandi motus.

Præ&longs;tabit igitur Cochleam Vecti addere, ubi
maximè frequens futura &longs;it huju&longs;modi ponderum elevatio,
quemadmodum propè telonia, ubi ingentes mercium &longs;arcinæ
attollendæ &longs;unt, ut plau&longs;tris avehendæ imponantur, aut ad­
vectæ ex iis deponantur.

Erigatur tignum AB ad perpendiculum firmiter infixum
plano &longs;ubjecto, tanta verò &longs;it cra&longs;&longs;ities tigni, ut in eo excavari
po&longs;&longs;it crena CD, per quam tignum aliud EF immitti facilè
valeat adeò &longs;olidum, ut Vectis munere fungatur, ubi extremo
unco G funibus adnexum fuerit onus.

Ut igitur facillimè one­
ris elevatio perficiatur, cochlea HI pri&longs;mati HL infixa (&longs;a­
tiùs fuerit, &longs;i eju&longs;dem ligni pars in pri&longs;ma, pars in cochleam
deformetur) ad perpendiculum erigatur in&longs;erta matrici NM:
&longs;it autem ita &longs;olida matrix, ut illi adnecti queat tignum EF
clavo E, circa quem facilè ver&longs;ari po&longs;&longs;it tignum ip&longs;um, quan­
do attollitur aut deprimitur.

Demum &longs;ubjecto pri&longs;mati HL
non &longs;olùm in quatuor faciebus in&longs;int foramina, quibus immit­
tatur Radius KO, verùm etiam in infimâ ba&longs;is parte, qua
re&longs;pondet axi cylindri in cochleam deformati, &longs;it polus, circa
quem convolvi po&longs;&longs;it: Hic tamen (ut &longs;atis manife&longs;tum e&longs;t) in­
trà ferream laminam ritè applumbatam lapidi in terrâ firmi&longs;&longs;i­
mè defixo, aut certè adeò gravi, ut longè omnem elevandarum
&longs;arcinarum gravitatem vincat, ita contineri debet, ut indè nul­
lo pacto eximi valeat, neque à pri&longs;mate avelli.

Quod &longs;i non fuerit inter pavimentum & laqueare interval­
lum enorme, faciliùs erit congruam trabis partem in cochleam
deformare, illámque ba&longs;i imponere (cujus altitudo commodam
Radij KO conver&longs;ionem præ&longs;tet) atque circa duos polos, al­
terum eidem &longs;ubjectæ ba&longs;i, alterum lacunari infixum, convol­
vere.

Aut &longs;altem proximo parieti infigatur tignum horizonta­
le, quod prominens excipiat &longs;uperiorem polum, atque prohi­
beat, ne vi ponderis ex unco G dependentis, in altum abripia­
tur cochlea.

Hìc vides compo&longs;itam cum Vecte Cochleam, quæ Vectis vi­
res notabili incremento auget.

E&longs;t autem vectis hypomochlium
in eâ inci&longs;æ aut in&longs;culptæ crenæ parte, quæ cochleam re&longs;picit,
quando pondus attollitur, & vectis caput F &longs;upra lineam hori­
zontalem elevatur; &longs;ecùs verò, quando deprimitur vectis infra
lineam horizontalem, tunc enim hypomochlium e&longs;t in D.

Sit
igitur hypomochlium ad totius longitudinis EF be&longs;&longs;em; ac
proinde Ratio motûs potentiæ in E, ad motum ponderis in F,
e&longs;t dupla.

Ponamus Radij KO extremitatem O ab axe cylin­
dri di&longs;tare intervallo &longs;altem decuplo intervalli &longs;pirarum co­
chleæ HV: ergo potentia de&longs;cribens peripheriam circuli, cu­
jus diameter e&longs;t 20, habet motum, qui e&longs;t, ut minimum, ut 62
ad motum HV, hoc e&longs;t ad motum extremitatis E: hujus autem
motus e&longs;t duplus motûs ponderis in F: igitur motus potentiæ e&longs;t
ad motum ponderis ut 124 ad 1. Quare ut major &longs;it motus pon­
deris, poterit hypomochlium minùs abe&longs;&longs;e ab extremitate E;
vix enim tales &longs;unt &longs;arcinæ, quæ ut moveantur, citrà laborem
&longs;u&longs;tentandi, indigeant 60 hominibus.

At &longs;i loci ratio ferat, &longs;uaderem potiùs Vectem &longs;ecundi gene­
ris, ita ut altera vectis extremitas in&longs;i&longs;teret tigno AB, & pon­
dus inter tignum & cochleam interciperetur: &longs;ic enim quò
pondus e&longs;&longs;et propius cochleæ, ad majorem altitudinem attolle­
retur, licèt majore conatu; &longs;ed cochleæ vis abundare videtur,
& Vectis &longs;ecundi generis &longs;emper auget momenta.

Nec di&longs;&longs;imili ratione Vectem manu tractabilem ita cochleâ
in&longs;truere po&longs;&longs;umus, ut ad ingentia pondera movenda &longs;atis &longs;it.

Finge &longs;iquidem re­
vellendas &longs;uis è car­
dinibus ingentes a­
licujus ba&longs;ilicæ val­
vas, ut reficiantur;
ferreus vectis AB
paretur extremita­
te A &longs;ubjiciendus
ponderi, & altera
extremitas B in ma­
tricem cochleæ ex­
cavetur: in hanc
immittatur cochlea CD, manubrium habens CE: atque ut
cochlea faciliùs convertatur, neque pavimentum atterat, pa­
ratam habeto ferream laminam H, quæ illi &longs;ubjiciatur.

Nam
&longs;i ponderi &longs;upponatur vectis ex.

gr. in F ad totius longitudinis
&longs;extantem, manubrij autem longitudo CE &longs;it &longs;altem decupla
intervalli &longs;pirarum cochleæ, utique peripheria de&longs;cripta à po­
tentiâ in E, ad elevationem extremitatis B, e&longs;t &longs;altem ut 62
ad 1: elevatio autem ip&longs;ius B, ad elevationem ponderis in F,
e&longs;t ut 6 ad 1: igitur motus potentiæ ad motum ponderis e&longs;t ut
372 ad 1. Quapropter, et&longs;i initio parùm attollantur fores, &
&longs;ubjecto cuneo, ne recidant, atque revolutâ cochleâ deprimen­
dus, ac promovendus &longs;it vectis, ut pondus &longs;it in I, puta ad to­
tius longitudinis quadrantem aut trientem, adhuc potentiæ
momenta erunt ut 248, aut 186 ad 1: quæ &longs;anè exigua non &longs;unt
pro &longs;implici huju&longs;modi machinulâ.

Huc pariter &longs;pectat præli genus in meâ patriâ vulgare (in lo­
cis poti&longs;&longs;imùm montanis, ubi faciliùs ingentes lapides non pro­
cul advehendi &longs;uppetunt) quo ex uvæ jam calcatæ reliquiis
tortivum mu&longs;tum exprimitur.

Roboris, quoad fieri pote&longs;t, lon­
gi&longs;&longs;imum truncum unâ cum imo caudice a&longs;&longs;umunt, & ita ramis
omnibus &longs;poliant, ut tamen bifurcum relinquant, quatenus
bifidæ illi extremitati inniti, atque connecti valeat matrix co­
chleæ, quæ convertatur circa polum ingenti &longs;ubjecto lapidi in­
&longs;i&longs;tentem, &longs;ed eâ ratione, ut demum etiam lapis attolli queat.

Truncum verò illum, qui præli munere fungi debet, præter
extremum caudicem cra&longs;&longs;i&longs;&longs;imum, dedolant, ut inter bina tigna
hinc atque hinc in alvei lateribus ad perpendiculum erecta in­
terjectum prælum attolli ac deprimi po&longs;&longs;it citrà impedimentum,
quod alioqui ip&longs;a rudis a&longs;peritas pareret.

Porrò tigna illa bina
erecta, aut ex adver&longs;o rotundis aliquot foraminibus perforant,
quibus immitti po&longs;&longs;it cra&longs;&longs;iu&longs;culus cylindrus, &longs;eu ferreus vectis,
aut illa incidunt patente crenâ, cui in&longs;eri valeat repagulum; eo
con&longs;ilio, ut alterutra præli extremitas pro opportunitate prohi­
beatur, ne a&longs;cendat, aut de&longs;cendat.

Quare convoluta cochlea
attollit matricem, & oppo&longs;ita præli extremitas amotis omnibus
&longs;ubjectis repagulis &longs;en&longs;im de&longs;cendit: ubi autem eò venerit, ut
non ab&longs;it ab altitudine eorum, quæ in torculari calcanda &longs;unt,
immittitur &longs;uperiùs repagulum, ne amplius attolli valeat; Tum
revoluta in contrarium cochleâ matricem cum præli extremita­
te deor&longs;um trahit: & quoniam reliqua extremitas attolli nequit
ob&longs;tante repagulo, premuntur uvæ, & in Lacum defluit
mu&longs;tum.

Ubi demum adeò compre&longs;&longs;a fuerint vinacea, ut fa­
cilius &longs;it lapidem cochleæ adnexum attollere, quàm illa magis
comprimere, ex cochleæ conver&longs;ione attollitur lapis; quem ad
mediocrem altitudinem elevatum pendere diutiùs permittunt,
ut, lapidis gravitate deor&longs;um conante, à prælo exprimatur,
quantulumcumque mu&longs;ti adhuc vinaceis ine&longs;t.

Duplex igitur
hìc con&longs;ideranda e&longs;t pre&longs;&longs;io: altera quidem vi potentiæ co­
chleam volventis; & hìc cochlea cum vecte &longs;ecundi generis
componitur; e&longs;t enim prælum vectis, cujus hypomochlium e&longs;t
in eâ extremitate, quæ repagulo prohibetur, ne attollatur; po­
tentiæ autem vectem huju&longs;modi deprimentis vices obit cochlea
claviculatim &longs;triata; quæ tamen motûs originem non habens
&longs;ibi in&longs;itam, potentiæ munus & nomen relinquit vectiariis il­
lam ver&longs;antibus.

Altera pre&longs;&longs;io fit, ce&longs;&longs;ante convolutione co­
chleæ, vi gravitatis lapidis &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;i; & tunc non ni&longs;i Ratio
vectis intervenit, atque Potentia e&longs;t ip&longs;a gravitas.

Sed quoniam non ubique reperiuntur aut tam ingentes lapi­
des, aut tam longæ arbores, communiter univer&longs;us premendi
labor vectiariis incumbit cochleam unam, aut alteram ver&longs;an­
tibus.

Si duæ &longs;int cochleæ ad oppo&longs;ita torcularis latera con&longs;ti­
tutæ, matricem habent in ip&longs;o prælo excavatam, quod &longs;uá con­
ver&longs;ione deor&longs;um trahunt, ut ex &longs;ubjectis vinaceis exprimatur
mu&longs;tum: & tunc nihil e&longs;t, quod Vectis momenta exerceat,
&longs;ed &longs;ola vis Cochleæ habetur.

At &longs;i unica fuerit cochlea
(quemadmodum & in typographorum torculis) præli non e&longs;t
u&longs;us; &longs;ed tran&longs;ver&longs;æ trabi &longs;uperiori immotæ in&longs;eritur per exca­
vatas congruentes &longs;trias cochlea, quæ in conver&longs;ione depre&longs;&longs;a
calcat impo&longs;itum vinaceis planum ex &longs;olidis a&longs;&longs;eribus.

Verùm
contingere pote&longs;t ut non &longs;it vectiario &longs;patium expeditum,
quando, po&longs;t modicam & faciliorem compre&longs;&longs;ionem breviore
vecte peractam, adhuc longiore Radio utendum e&longs;&longs;et ad con­
torquendam cochleam.

Propterea ab Axe in Peritrochio &longs;ub­
&longs;idium facile peti pote&longs;t; &longs;i videlicet extra torcularis alveum
ligneus cylindrus ad perpendiculum erigatur circa &longs;uos polos,
alterum &longs;ubjecto plano, alterum exporrectæ è proximo pariete
trabi, infixos ver&longs;atilis: huic funem adnecte, qui extremo un­
co apprehendat annulum Radij, quo cochlea ver&longs;atur: cylin­
dro enim infixus Radius dum illum volvit, & funem illi cir­
cumducit, cochleæ vectem ad &longs;e rapit, & vehementiùs premi­
tur &longs;ubjectum cochleæ planum, quàm &longs;i eadem cochlea duplo
longiore vecte convolveretur.

Unum tamen hìc ob&longs;ervandum, videlicet in huju&longs;modi con­
ver&longs;ione non eadem e&longs;&longs;e momenta, quandoquidem funis exten­
tus non eundem &longs;emper cum cochleæ vecte angulum con&longs;ti­
tuit; eò autem minora &longs;unt momenta, quò magis hic ab an­
gulo recto recedit, ut ex iis con&longs;tat, quæ lib.4. cap.7. dicta &longs;unt.

Quapropter expedit cylindrum illum ver&longs;atilem non longiùs à
torculari abe&longs;&longs;e, ut funis minùs acutum angulum cum vecte
con&longs;tituat, quando vectis extremitas incipit &longs;uæ peripheriæ ar­
cum de&longs;cribere: atque adeò ita &longs;tatuendus videtur cylindrus,
ut quando funis angulum rectum con&longs;tituet cum cochleæ vecte,
hic jam percurrerit arcum non majorem &longs;emirecto angulo, re&longs;­
pondentem gradibus 45: &longs;ic enim fiet, non nimis acutum e&longs;&longs;e
angulum initio tractionis, & progrediendo augeri, donec fiat
rectus: deinde, licèt momenta decre&longs;cant angulo in obtu&longs;um
tran&longs;eunte, ubi nimis obliquus factus fuerit angulus, poterit in
aliud foramen immitti Radius, laxato priùs fune ex cylindri
revolutione.

Quapropter ut potentiæ cylindrum volventis mo­
menta ad calculos revoces, maximum momentum e&longs;t fune ad
cochleæ Radium perpendiculari: quamvis autem non &longs;emper
progrediente motu con&longs;tituat angulum rectum, tunc tamen
perinde computandum e&longs;t momentum, atque &longs;i eandem po&longs;i­
tionem ad angulum rectum &longs;ervatura e&longs;&longs;et potentia per funem
Radio applicata; præterita &longs;iquidem atque futura applicatio
nihil minuit præ&longs;entis applicationis virtutem.

In eâ verò appli­
catione perpendiculari, momenti Ratio de&longs;umenda e&longs;t ex circu­
li à Radio de&longs;cripti peripheriâ, atque ex intervallo &longs;pirarum co­
chleæ: quæ Ratio componenda e&longs;t cum Ratione Radij cylin­
drum volventis ad eju&longs;dem cylindri &longs;emidiametrum.

Sed ut habeantur momenta aliarum po&longs;itionum, inquiren­
dus e&longs;t angulus applicationis funis ad eundem cochleæ vectem.

Habetur itaque ex huju&longs;modi applicatione ad

cum momento applicationis ad angulum rectum CBA: e&longs;t

4. cap.7. ut Sinus anguli acuti ad Radium.

Fiat igitur ut Radius ad Sinum anguli AFC, ita peripheria

cum directione CF.

Componenda deinde e&longs;t hæc Ratio cum

Tertiò.

Ex puncto C ad A ducatur recta CA: & cum in

AFC.

in F & I æqualia &longs;unt momenta.

Antequam verò praxim hanc exemplo illu&longs;trem, ut &longs;ub­

pere pote&longs;t error notabilis.

Cæterùm &longs;i funem extentum con­
&longs;ideremus &longs;emper qua&longs;i lineam tangentem cylindri periphe­

quando po&longs;itio vectis fiat AI.

Verùm quia exiguum e&longs;t huju&longs;­
modi di&longs;crimen, propterea unum idémque punctum C a&longs;­
&longs;umptum e&longs;t, cum non &longs;equatur phy&longs;icè ullum incommodum
ex hoc Geometricæ accurationis contemptu.

Ex quo vides intra eo&longs;dem terminos æqualium mo­
